songs.lyrics:
1

I give myself to Thee,
Thine utterly and only
And evermore to be.

And all I have and am, Lord,
Shall henceforth be Thine own!

3

Oh, make my heart Thy throne;
It shall be Thine, dear Savior,
It shall be Thine alone.

4

Rule over everything!
And keep me always loyal,
And true to Thee, my King.

songs.title: If I was a butterfly
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]If I was a butterfly,
I’d [G]thank You, Lord, for giving me wings,
And [D]if I was a robin in a tree,
I’d [G]thank You, Lord, that I could sing,
And [D]if I was a fish in the sea,
I’d [G]wiggle my tail and I’d giggle with glee,
But [D]I just thank You, [A]Father,
For making me “[D]me”.

  For You gave me a heart,
  []For You gave me a smile,
  You [G]gave me Mum and Dad,
  And You [Em]made me their child,
  And [D]I just thank You, [A]Father,
  for making “[D]me”.

2
If I was an elephant,
I’d thank You, Lord, for my big trunk,
And if I was a kangaroo,
You know I’d hop right up to you,
And if I was an octopus,
I’d thank You Lord, for my fine looks.
But I just thank You, Father,
For making me “me”.

3
If I was a wiggly worm,
I’d thank You, Lord, that I could squirm.
And if I was a billy goat,
I’d thank You, Lord, for my strong throat.
And if I was a fuzzy wuzzy bear,
I’d thank You, Lord, for my fuzzy wuzzy hair,
But I just thank You, Father,
For making me “me”.

That s[Em]hines every night a[Am]bove;

songs.title: A certain man was going down
songs.lyrics:
#Part 1:
1
A certain [Em]man was [D]going down
[Em]From Jerusalem to Jeri[D]cho,
[Em]Getting farther a[D]way from God;
[Em]To this p[D]lace of curse he'd [Em]go.

2
And as he went among the robbers he fell,
Who stripped and beat him 'til he bled,
And having taken everything that he owned,
They left him lying there half dead.

3
A certain priest was also going down
On that same road to Jericho.
He saw him and passed on the
opposite side.
A Levite did the same also.

  [Am]You know this man who was [Em]going down,
  [Am]This man is me; this man is [Em]you,
  Who [Am]living in our fallen life
  a[Em]way from God
  []Were beaten sore and
  [D]bled from many [Em]wounds.

4
We were stripped of all that we should have:
Our virtue, honour, righteousness.
We could not stand upright nor hold onto life.
Toward God: no boldness nor access.

5
Religious ones observing our poor estate,
Being the same could be no help.
They passed us by, not daring to
come close.
We only heard we'd go to hell.

  [Am]As sinners under the l[Em]aw condemned,
  [Am]Which left us beaten and disg[Em]raced,
  We a[Am]ll were robbed and dying from so
  [Em]many hurts,
  []From small transgressions
  [D]to our sins so [Dsus2]great.

#Interlude: Dsus2 - A - Asus2 - D7

#Part 2:
  [G]But a certain [Dsus4]Good Sa[D]marit[G]an,
  Despised, of whom they [Dsus4]said,
  "Don't [D]give me [C]Jesus!"
  [G]Bound up all our [D]wounds,
  [Em]Pouring oil and [C]wine upon them,
  [G]Brought us to the [D]inn and said,
  "Take [C]care of [G]him."

6
[G]He had to take a [D]journey
to [C]come down just to [G]reach us.
Though [Em]God, He was so [C]willing
to bec[D]ome a human babe.
He [G]came through human [D]living,
Ob[C]served our dire con[G]dition,
Then, [Em]moved with deep com[C]passion,
He [G]died and [D]rose to s[G]ave![D]

7
He came and bound our wounds up;
He healed these damaged persons.
He poured in oil and wine—
His Spirit and His life divine.
He placed us on His donkey
to carry us so lowly,
And brought us to the church life
With blessing for our care.

8
We love this dear Man-Savior,
Divine One, fully human,
Whose tender care, so merciful
And bountiful to save
Condemned and dying sinners,
Reveals the highest standard
Of His morality seen in
His precious, saving grace.

#(Chorus twice, then last line: )
  "Take [C]care... and whatev[Am]er you spend
  in add[D]ition on him
  When I re[D7]turn, I will re[G]pay you."

songs.title: O Lord, You are the gentle One
songs.lyrics:
1
O [C]Lord, You are the [G]gentle One. 
[F]To You hearts [C]open [G]wide. 
Your [C]living water [G]gently flows 
[F]To heal and [C]sa[G]tis[C]fy.

  When [F]all I see is [G]outward sin, 
  [F]You see the [Dm]thirst with[G]in. 
  If [F]I must speak to [G]hearts in need, 
  [Am]Lord, gently [G]flow through [F]me.

2
When I failed You so miserably, 
You never scolded me. 
Restoring me so patiently, 
You gently watered me.

  How could I still self-righteous be, 
  Despite my history? 
  How could I without mercy be, 
  When You’ve forgiven me?

3
O Lord, You are the gentle One. 
To You hearts open wide. 
Your living water gently flows 
To heal and satisfy.

songs.title: How can a flower know?
songs.lyrics:
[C]How can a flower[Am] know
[F]The ways of life wit[G]hin?
[C]When life will blossom[Am] forth?
[F]When things will dost ap[G]pear?

Why pressured am I so?
To know the 'whys' of life?
When life within just flows,
Why grieved or striving be?

These things I wish to know
Won't help me, thus, to grow.
This guilt and shame and sin,
Is not what He sees now.

"How", "what", "when", "where", and "why"?
Are empty before Your sight.
"Dear one, just trust in me,
I promised I'll be your all, your all."

#Capo 3

And that really, Jesus, You're alive!

songs.title: What a Christ we have
songs.lyrics:
1
What a [D]Christ we have,
the [G]all-inclusive [D]One.[G]
Our al[D]lotted portion,
[G]set apart in [A]light.
In the [G]kingdom of the [D]Son of God, the [G]Son of God's [D]love.
Here He [G]rules us in the [A]light of his [D]love.

2
Lift your eyes up and look from where you are.
When you see the Christ, our all-inclusive land,
Then we walk in this blessed land, enjoying all we see,
Getting saved eating milk and honey.

3
See the wheat, the restricted Jesus Christ.
Incarnation was restriction in the flesh.
Limited outwardly, by God's power set free,
Resurrected as unlimited barley.

4
See the vine trees, the sacrificing Christ.
He produced wine thus cheering God and man.
When we drink this new wine, we are so energized,
For the Lord to be a living sacrifice.

5
See the fig trees, Christ's sweetness our supply.
To progress in the joy of all our faith,
Be a channel of supply so others experience Christ.
And be happy in the bountiful supply.

6
See the pomegranates fulness of His life.
The abundance and the beauty of this life.
As the olive tree the Spirit fills to honor God and man.
Bearing fruit as branches grafted into Christ.

7
See our portion so available to take.
To be walked in and experienced in full.
Apprehending the unsearchable extent of this good land,
When we corporately enjoy Him with the saints.

Christ, of kings the King!

In the heav'n above.
We would sing Thee fairest
Here in hymns of love.

2

Were a wintry sea;
Heav'n itself without Thee
Dark as night would be.
Lamb of God! Thy glory
Is the light above.
Lamb of God! Thy glory
Is the life of love.

3
Life is death, if severed
From Thy throbbing heart.
Death with life abundant
At Thy touch would start.
Worlds and men and angels
All consist in Thee,
Yet Thou camest to us
In humility.

4

Rise and end in Thee;
Brightness of God's glory
Thou, eternally.
Favored beyond measure
They Thy face who see;
May we, gracious Savior,
Share this ecstasy.

songs.title: Paul
songs.lyrics:
### original tune
#Capo 4
[A2 = Asus2]

1
[Em]Paul the apostle wasn’t [A2]always [Am]Paul,
[A2]his name [Am]used [A2]to be S[Em]aul;
raised in Judaism in the [A2]strictest [Am]sect,
a [A2]Pharisee,[Am] zealous [A2]for G[Em]od.
  A [C]Hebrew born of H[Em]ebrews, of the [C]tribe of Benja[Em]min.
  Ac[C]cording to religious [Em]eyes of men: A [B]man of righteousness[-B7].

2
A “sect of Nazarenes” began to proclaim:
Jesus is Christ and Lord.
Stephen, our brother, in doing so,
was cast out of the city and stoned.
  Their garments laid at the feet of Saul- the approver of his death.
  House after house, Saul dragged those out and bound them in prison.

3
Saul, still breathing murder against
the disciples of the Lord,
started on the road to Damascus
with authority to bind more.
  Heavenly light flashed around him, he fell and heard a voice:
  “Why are you persecuting Me?” He answered: “Who are You, Lord?”

4
“I am Jesus, whom you persecute.
Stand on your feet, rise up.
I have appeared to appoint you as
a minster and witness of:
  The things in which you’ve seen Me and the things in which I’ll appear.
  To open their eyes, turn them from darkness to light, from the authority of Satan to God."

5
The glory of the light left our brother blind;
he only could search his mind.
Prophecies, scriptures, foretelling Christ-
in his memory: Seen, realized.
  But Jesus said “persecuting Me”, not “..the church” or “..them”.
  The church is the Body of Christ; therefore, Saul persecuted Him.

6
Saul: Now a member of the Body, too:
the increase of Christ on earth.
His ministry began: Teaching, shepherding;
ravager to slave he turned!
  Epistles written and churches raised, perfected saints some more.
  Degradation came along, but God, through Paul, restored.

7
Paul: A pattern for us to learn-
count all things loss for Christ;
knowing, gaining, being found in Him,
forgetting the things behind!
  Pursue toward the goal, for the kingdom prize!
  God has called us upward; stretch forth; lay hold of Christ! [E]



# Acts 13:9, 26:5, 22:3; Phil 3:5-6; Acts 24:5, 2:36, 7:58-59, 8:3, 9:1-2, 26:12, 9:3-5, 26:16-18, 22:11; Eph 1:22-23; Matt 25:40; Eph 5:30, 4:11; Acts 9:21; Rom 1:1; 2 Cor 13:11; Phil 3:17, 8-10, 13-14, 12

  Their garments laid at the feet of Saul- the approver of his death.

"[E]I am Jesus, whom you [Am7]perse[A2]cute.
[Am7]Stand on your [A2]feet, [Am7]rise u[E]p.

a [Am7]minster and [A2]witn[Am7]ess o[E]f:

5
The glory of the light left our brother blind;
he only could search his mind.
Prophecies, scriptures, foretelling Christ-
in his memory: Seen, realized.
  But Jesus said “persecuting Me”, not “..the church” or “..them”.

6

the increase of Christ on earth.
His ministry began: Teaching, shepherding;
ravager to slave he turned!
  Epistles written and churches raised, perfected saints some more.

7
Paul: A pattern for us to learn-
count all things loss for Christ;
knowing, gaining, being found in Him,
forgetting the things behind!

  God has called us upward; stretch forth; lay hold of Christ! [E]

songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord You're altogether [A]lovely, 
[G]You're fairer than the [A]morning 
[D]You're matchless, sweet, un[Bm]rivaled 
You're [Em]far beyond [A]compare.

2
Lord, You sought me and pursued me.

With love eternal ever new. 
Lord my eyes see only You 
Joy unspeakable fills my being 
Perfect love has captured me. 
Now together we abide 
I am Yours, and You are mine. 

3

songs.title: A loving light shined on my face
songs.lyrics:
A [D]loving light shined [Bm]on my face,
As [G]I woke up to[A]day.
Re[D]minding me, "Need [Bm]grace, need grace."
To [G]be saved from [A]darkness to[D]day.

Save me from the haste, the haste, the haste,
As I go about the day.
Remind me, O Lord, to take your grace
Instead of my path today.

My will may be strong, but such a waste,
As I'm treading the wrong way.
My compass, carriage, friend is grace,
Wherever it takes me today.

I fear to forget such grace, such grace,
Whatever I do today.
My joys, my sorrows, need such grace.
There's just no other way.

I'm under this grace, to be under grace.
From grace to grace I stay.
The powerless ones abound by grace,
The weak ones trust all day.

songs.title: I always knew deep down in me
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]I always knew deep down in me
There was a longing to be [Em]free,
A kind of hunger deep in[A7]side—
To fill it [G]up, I tried and [D]tried.
There were a lot of things I had;
Some things were good,
Some things were b[Em]ad.
But all those things of mine befor[A7]e
Don’t satisf[G]y me any[D]more.

  Now life affords a real re[Em]ward,
  When[A7]ever [G]I just call, “O [D]Lord!”
  The Triune God the Spirit [Em]is,
  And [A7]He can [G]fill mine up with [D]His.

2
Thank You, Lord Jesus, for the wine
That I enjoy as life divine.
I thank You, Lord, for mercy all
That opened me to heed Your call.
O Lord, now make Your home my heart
And fully saturate each part.
O Lord, my words just can’t express
The way You’ve filled my emptiness!

  O Lord, I know that you will grow
  And from my spirit overflow.
  Lord, saturate me through and through.
  O Lord Jesus, I love You.

3
I always knew deep down in me
There was a longing to be free,
A kind of hunger deep inside—
But now it can be satisfied.
Christ in my heart—the only way
To spread within me day by day.
Lord Jesus! Lord, I have to say
You’re home in me and home to stay!

songs.title: Shepherd, receive man
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Shepherd, rec[A]eive man,

2
Spirit, dear Spirit,
Where is the one lost coin?
Yes, You have the nine,
But the one You must find.
Dear Spirit, You’re sweeping
All over the earth.

3
Father, dear Father,
Have mercy on mankind!
He’s fallen to the pigs’ pen
When will he return?
Dear Father, just kiss them,
Your sons coming home.

4
Father of mercy,
Clothe him with the best robe
And kill the fatted calf
And eat and be merry—
He was lost, but found,
Was dead, but now he lives.

songs.title: But you, beloved, building up
songs.lyrics:

The [D]all-inclusive Christ is

[A]be so full of [D]Christ.

(Christ is the first [A]and [Bm]last [G]and 
[D]every[A7]thing be[D]tween!)

2
Christ is the centrality, 
the center of all things,
When we give Him preeminence 
our heart rejoicing sings;
Circumference of our living, universality,
Is Christ involved in everything 
in God’s economy.

(Christ is the fullness and 
the mystery of God)

3
Christ our life and hope of glory 
dwells within our being,
He’s Lord in our experience, 
a hope that we are seeing;
He’s dwelling in our spirit 
and spreading to our soul,
He’s building up His Body

(We can shout, Hallelujah! 
All-inclusive Christ!)

songs.title: Father, I know that all my life
songs.lyrics:
1
Fat[D]her, I [DM7]know that [Em]all my l[A]ife
Is [D]portioned [Bm]out for [Em]me,[A7]
And the [Em]changes that are [F#m]sure to [G]come
I [Gm]do not [A]fear to [D]see[DM7];
But I [Em]ask Thee [A]for a [F#m]present [Bm]mind
Int[Em]ent on [A]pleasing [D]Thee.

2
I ask Thee for a thoughtful love,
Through constant watching wise,
To meet the glad with joyful smiles,
And to wipe the weeping eyes;
And a heart at leisure from itself,
To soothe and sympathize.

3
I would not have the restless will
That hurries to and fro,
Seeking for some great thing to do
Or secret thing to know;
I would be treated as a child,
And guided where I go.

4
Wherever in the world I am,
In whatso’er estate,
I have a fellowship with hearts
To keep and cultivate;
And a work of lowly love to do
For the Lord whom I wait.

5
So I ask Thee for the daily strength,
To none that ask denied.
And a mind to blend with outward life
While keeping at Thy side;
Content to fill a little space,
If Thou be glorified.

6
There are briers besetting every path
That call for patient care;
There is a cross in every slot,
And an earnest need for prayer;
But a lowly heart that leans on Thee
Is happy anywhere.

7
And if some things I do ask in
My cup of blessing be,
I would have my spirit filled the more
With grateful love to Thee.
More careful, not to serve Thee much,
But to please Thee perfectly.

8
In a service which Thy will appoints
There are no bonds for me;
For my inmost heart is taught “the truth”
That makes Thy children “free”
And a life of self-renounced love
Is a life of liberty.

songs.title: Holy, Holy, Holy, Lord God Almighty
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Holy, Holy, [A]Holy, L[G]ord God Alm[D]ighty!
[A]Unto everl[D]asting days our s[E]ong shall rise to T[A]hee;
[D]Holy, Holy, [A]Holy, M[G]erciful and M[D]ighty!
God in Three P[G]ers[Em]ons, bl[A]essed Tr[A7]init[D]y!

2
Holy, Holy, Holy! All the saints adore Thee;
Heaven's elders cast their crowns down by the glassy sea;
Cherubim and seraphim worship too before Thee,
Who wert, and art, and evermore shalt be.

3
Holy, Holy, Holy! Though the darkness hide Thee,
Though the eye of sinful man Thy glory may not see,
Only Thou art holy, there is none beside Thee
Perfect in power, in love, and purity.

songs.title: In Christ Alone
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]In Christ alone my [G]hope is [A]found,
[D]He is my [G]light, my [A]strength, my [D]song;
[D]This Cornerstone, this solid [A]Ground,
[D]Firm through the [G]fiercest [A]drought and [D]storm.
What heights of [G]love, what [Bm]depths of [A]peace,
When fears are [G]stilled, when [Bm]strivings [A]cease!
My Comfor[D]ter, my [G]All in [A]All,
[D]Here in the [G]love of [A]Christ I [D]stand.

2
In Christ alone!—who took on flesh,
Fullness of God in helpless babe.
This gift of love and righteousness,
Scorned by the ones He came to save:
'Til on that cross as Jesus died,
The wrath of God was satisfied—
For every sin on Him was laid;
Here in the death of Christ I live.

3
There in the ground His body lay,
Light of the world by darkness slain:
Then bursting forth in glorious day
Up from the grave He rose, again!
And as He stands in victory
Sin's curse has lost its grip on me,
For I am His and He is mine—
Bought with the precious blood of Christ.

4
No guilt in life, no fear in death,
This is the power of Christ in me;
From life's first cry to final breath,
Jesus commands my destiny.
No power of hell, no scheme of man,
Can ever pluck me from His hand:
Till He returns or calls me home,
Here in the power of Christ I'll stand.

songs.title: O Jesus, Lord, 'tis joy to know
songs.lyrics:
1
O Jesus, Lord, 'tis joy to know
Thy path is o'er of shame and woe,
By Thee so meekly trod.
All finished is Thy work of toil,
Thou reapest now the fruit and spoil,
Exalted by our God.

2
Thy holy head, once bound with thorns,
The crown of glory now adorns;
Thy seat, the Father's throne.
O Lord, e'en now we sing Thy praise,
Ours the eternal song to raise,
Worthy the Lord alone!

3
We triumph in Thy triumphs, Lord,
Thy joys our deepest joys afford,
The fruit of love divine.
While sorrowing, suff'ring, toiling here,
How does the thought our spirits cheer,
The throne of glory's Thine!

songs.title: Lord, loving You is all that we desire
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord, Your virtues of [G]faith, peace, life, [A]light, and most of [F#m]all Your [Bm]love
Have [G]opened up our [A]hearts;
[D]Lord, every moment we [G]long for the [A]growth wit[F#m]hin al[Bm]ways,
So [G]come and fill us [A]all our [D]days.[D7]


   [G]Lord, loving [A]You is [D]all that [A]we de[Bm]sire,
   [G]It's all we [A]live, breathe [D]for;[D7]
   [G]Our constant [A]joy is to [F#m]be in Your em[Bm]brace
   And [G]waiting for Your [A]coming [D]day.

2
Keep our hearts ever fresh, soft, pure, unreserved for only You,
Pervade in all our lives;
Lord, it's our yearning for You to make home within our hearts,
Do saturate us every part.

3
'Tis Your mercy and grace as Your lovers we're preserved in Your
Recovery today;
Lord, keep us faithful to You to the end to run the race,
Until we see You face to face.

songs.lyrics:
I love my [D]Master,
[F#m]And I will not g[Bm]o out free,
[Bm7]For He has d[G]ied for me,[Em]
The highest [D]price He has paid for [A7]me.

  From You I will[F#m] never leave[Bm].
  You are my [Em]liberty[Gm]
  And my joy com[A]plete.[A7]
  I love my [D]Master,
  [F#m]And I will not g[Bm]o out free.[B]

O Jesus Master,

O Jesus Master,

songs.title: Lord, I open to Your light
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Lord, I [G]open [Dm]to Your [C]light
[F]That I’d [G]vanquished [C]be.
[G]Mend with [Am]balm anoint[Em]ing [Am]life;
[F]Build Your[G]self in [Am]me,
[F]And a[G]dorn my [C]being.

2
I would walk as if one blind,

3
Sun of revelation, rise!
Gush, O vital stream!

Fully one with Thee.

4

5

Just take Christ in as life,
Come again to the altar
For the Lord's cleansing blood

5
How do you want to spend your days?
In God's house that's the way,
Let's make wants reality,
To gain Christ corporately.

songs.lyrics:
1
[A]It’s time to t[E]ouch our spirit,
[A]It’s time to s[E]ay Amen!
[A]It’s time to c[D]all Lord Jesus!
He’s so [A]wonderful, Amen![E]

2
[A]It’s time to t[E]ouch the Spirit,
[A]Let’s all start p[E]raising Him,
[A]Let’s all start t[D]urning to Him,
And a[A]way from [E]our old [A]man[A7].

3
Oh [D]we are really [A]happy
To [D]call on Him a[A]gain (O Lord!)
Get [D]out of our old [A]Adam,
And [B7]turn to Him a[E]gain.[E7]

4
[A]It’s time to c[E]all Lord Jesus,

[A]Then you will g[D]et the life-flow of the
[A]Marvesational,
[E7]Inspirational,
[F#m]Dispensational,

songs.title: Our times are in Thy hand
songs.lyrics:
1
Our times are in Thy hand;
O God, we wish them there;
Our lives, our souls, our all, we leave
Entirely to Thy care.

2
Our times are in Thy hand:
Whatever they may be;
Pleasing or painful, dark or bright,
As best may seem to Thee.

3
Our times are in Thy hand;
Why should we doubt or fear?
A father's hand will never cause
His child a needless tear.

4
Our times are in Thy hand;
Jesus, the Crucified,
Whose hand our many sins have pierced,
Is now our guard and guide.

5
Our times are in Thy hand;
We'll always trust in Thee,
Till we possess the promised crown,
And all Thy glory see.

songs.title: When I survey life's varied scene
songs.lyrics:
1
When I survey life's varied scene,
Amid the darkest hours
Sweet rays of comfort shine between
And thorns are mixed with flowers.

2
Lord, teach me to adore Thy hand,
From whence my comforts flow,
And let me in this desert land
A glimpse of glory know.

3
Father, whate'er of earthly bliss
Thy sovereign hand denies,
Accepted at Thy throne of grace,
Let this petition rise:

4
Give me a calm, a thankful heart,
From every murmur free;
The blessings of Thy grace impart,
And let me live to Thee.

5
Let the sweet hope that Thou art mine
My life and death attend,
Thy presence through my journey shine,
And crown my journey's end.

# Capo 2

songs.title: There are three kinds of life in our
songs.lyrics:
1
There are [C]three kinds of life in our
[]Existence today:
There is [F]bios, the [C]physical, and
[D7]Soul-life, psu[G7]che;
Now the [C]third life is God’s life
And it’s called [F]zoe;
And we all have to [C]choose what life
We’ll [G7]live by t[C]oday.

  Oh, it’s [C]God in Christ Jesus,
  []Through the Spirit today,
  []Who is flowing within us,
  Flowing [D7]through us this [G7]way.
  We don’t [C]care for the bios;
  We don’t want psu[F]che;
  All we want is God’s [C]zoe life
  To [G7]fill us to[C]day.

2
We don’t care for the bios,
We don’t care for the soul.
We don’t care for the cares of life,
World’s pleasures, and show.
We don’t care for the pride of life,
The flesh and sin—
We say, “No!” to the soul-life;
We’ll take God’s life within.

3
Do you know what God’s life is?
Well, just listen to this:
It is God in Christ Jesus
Through the Spirit—no less!
He is flowing within us;
He is flowing through—
Hallelujah! He’s moving
To make everything new.

4
We have this life within us,
in our spirit today;
To our spirit we turn, O Lord,
and take You this way.
We can overcome bios
and the psuche too;
Hallelujah, the Spirit of the
Lord takes us through.

songs.title: Lord, may Thy Wind of heaven blow
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, may Thy Wind of heaven blow
Upon us here today!
With stirring and reviving might,
To us Thy pow'r display.

  Oh, mighty Lord, on us descend,
  Oh, may Thy Spirit blow!
  With power cause us to transcend,
  Grant us the living flow!

2
With Thy empow'ring Spirit blow
And all the barriers break;.
With Thy life-giving Spirit breathe,
That we of Thee partake.

3
Thy Spirit is of sevenfold wealth,
For us to share of Thee;
Grant us the full experience of
The God in persons Three.

songs.lyrics:
1
[C]That which for long the prophets sought,

  All [F]those who believed the [C]promise
  Are [G]perfected [G7]now in [C]us.

2
Oh, blessed are our eyes that see,
Our ears, how blessed to hear;
Things angels ne'er could look into
Are now to us made clear.

3
Our sense is corporate, bold and strong,
His grace, how free to take;
Encouraging the others on,
Run for the kingdom's sake.

4
We're weary not this race to run,
It makes our joy complete;
For this we know, around the bend,
The Lord we'll surely meet.

songs.title: O Lamb of God, You shed Your blood for us
songs.lyrics:
# SSOT14—Triune God
# Capo 1
# D-G-Bm-A

1
O Lamb of God, You shed Your blood for us
To take away our sins, so we can be saved.
Released us from the devil’s grasp.
Now we are free to be filled with Christ 
when we pray.

  So now we say Amen (Amen, Amen)
  We have the Triune God (Triune God)
  He is wrecking us for His eternal purpose,
  The New Jerusalem.

2
Satan divided and separated us.
But You nailed our differences to the cross,
Redeeming us back to oneness.
Fill and saturate us with Your divine life when we pray.

  So now we praise the Lord (Hallelujah)
  We have the Triune God (Triune God)
  He is wrecking us for His eternal purpose,
  The New Jerusalem.

3
Jesus Lord You are the grain of wheat,
Broke open Your divine life was released,
When we believe and call on You
We will become Your own expression when we pray.

  So now we call on His name (Oh Lord, oh Lord)
  We have the Triune God (Triune God)
  He is wrecking us for His eternal purpose,
  The New Jerusalem.

songs.title: The King of love my Shepherd is
songs.lyrics:
# Psalms 23
1
The King of love my Shepherd is,
Whose goodness faileth never;
I nothing lack if I am His,
And He is mine forever.

2
Where streams of living water flow
My ransomed soul He leadeth,
And, where the verdant pastures grow,
With food celestial feedeth.

3
Perverse and foolish oft I strayed,
But yet in love He sought me,
And on His shoulder gently laid,
And home rejoicing brought me.

4
In death's dark vale I fear no ill
With Thee, dear Lord, beside me;
Thy rod and staff my comfort still,
Thy Cross before to guide me.

5
Thou spread'st a table in my sight;
Thy unction grace bestoweth;
And oh, what transport of delight
From Thy pure chalice floweth!

6
And so through all the length of days
Thy goodness faileth never;
Good Shepherd, may I sing Thy praise
Within Thy house forever.

songs.title: As the living Father has sent Me (John 6:57)
songs.lyrics:
[D]As the living [G]Father has [A]sent [D]Me,

songs.title: The Lord's my Shepherd, I'll not want
songs.lyrics:
# Psalms 23
1
The Lord's my Shepherd, I'll not want;
He make me down to lie
In pastures green; He leadeth me
The quiet waters by.

2
My soul He doth restore again,
And me to walk doth make
Within the paths of righteousness,
E'en for His own name's sake.

3
Yea, though I walk in death's dark vale,
Yet will I fear no ill;
For Thou art with me, and Thy rod
And staff me comfort still.

4
My table Thou hast furnished
In presence of my foes;
My head Thou dost with oil anoint,
And my cup overflows.

5
Goodness and mercy all my life
Shall surely follow me,
And in God's house forevermore
My dwelling-place shall be.

songs.title: Lord, deeper make Thy home in me
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, [D]deeper [G]make Thy [A]home in [D]me
’Til ev’ry [G]room be[D]long to [A]Thee,
That [D]Thou might fully [A]make me Thee
And [D]so full [G]rest Thou [A]have in [D]me.

2
So also deeper into Thee
I’d make my home, my rest in Thee;
A pillar in Thy temple be
And stay in Thee eternally.

3
Thy precious blood was shed that we
Could closer, closer, closest be;
In resurrection brought to Thee
That we might be as one as Thee.

4
My lovely Lord, my dear Bridegroom,
In trust I open ev’ry room;
This mind, emotion, will be Thine;
When Thou hast rest, that rest is mine.

5
Oh mystery of mysteries—
Lord, Thou in me and I in Thee!
The church, Thy tabernacle, we;
Our temple, Thou eternally.

6
Lord, make Thy home more ev’ry day,
’Til one with Thee in ev’ry way,
’Til on me write Thy holy name,
’Til on me write Thy city’s name.

7
Lord, Thou art me and I am Thee,
As lovers coinhering, we;
Soon then shall come eternity
When God and man dwell mutually.

songs.title: God holds the key to all unknown
songs.lyrics:
1
God holds the key to all unknown,
And I am glad;
If other hands should hold the key,
Or if He trusted it to me,
I might be sad.

2
What if tomorrow's cares were here,
Without its rest?
I'd rather He unlocked the day,
And, as the hours swing open, say,
My will is best.

3
The very dimness of my sight
Makes me secure;
For, groping in my misty way,
I feel His hand; I hear Him say,
My help is sure.

4
I cannot read His future plans;
But this I know:
I have the smiling of His face,
And all the refuge of His grace
While here below.

5
Enough; this covers all my wants;
And so I rest;
For what I cannot, He can see,
And in His care I saved shall be,
Forever blest.

songs.title: Lord, teach us how to pray
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
L[D]ord, teach us h[A]ow to [D]pray,
Not as the nations [G]do in [A]vain,
But t[G]urn us from our [D]way,
And c[G]ause us, Lord, to call on You each [D]day—
L[G]ord Jesus, [A]grow [A7]in [D-G-D]us.

2
Lord, You're the seed of life;
You've sown Yourself into our heart,
And now You have a start;
So day by day more life to us impart—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

3
Lord Jesus, soften us;
You know the source from which we came.
By calling on Your name,
Lord, let no earth unturned nor rocks remain—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

4
Lord, how Your light makes clear
That we could not but e'er fail You;
Yet there's a message true,
The seed of life within us will break through—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

5
Make us in spirit poor;
Lord, take whate'er we think we know.
We'll open to life's flow,
And thus take in the life that makes us grow—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

6
Lord, make us pure in heart;
For we'll be not content until
You all our being fill,
O Lord, renew our mind, emotion, will—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

7
Yes, Lord, impress our heart,
That we must take You in each day;
The seed will have its way;
Your growing brings the kingdom here to stay—
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

8
Amen—The growth in life!
There's nothing that Your life can't do;
Our every part renew.
We'll make it, we'll make it just by You.
Lord Jesus, grow in us.
Lord Jesus, grow in us.

songs.title: "With one accord" within an upper room
songs.lyrics:
1
"With one accord" within an upper room
The faithful followers of Jesus met:
One was the hope of every waiting soul,
And on one object great each heart was set.

2
"With one accord," until the mighty gift
Of Pentecostal power was outpoured;
Then forth as witnesses possessed of God,
To preach the resurrection of the Lord!

3
"With one accord" within the house of God
A hallelujah song is daily raised,
As with the voice of one, from vocal hearts
Christ Jesus' name is glorified and praised.

4
Pour down Thy Spirit once again, dear Lord;
Our cry goes up to Thee for "latter rain";
Unite Thy people as the "heart of one,"
And Pentecostal days shall come again!

1

songs.title: What a blessing, what a priv'lege
songs.lyrics:
1
What a blessing, what a priv'lege!
Called of God a royal priest,
That this glorious, holy office
I should bear, though last and least.

  All the building of the Body
  On the priesthood doth depend;
  Ever praying in the spirit
  I this office would attend.

2
If I keep this royal calling
Under Thine authority,
Priestly duty thus fulfilling,
Then the church will builded be.

3
Now the church is but the priesthood;
Thus the priesthood formed we need;
When the priests are knit together,
Then the church is built indeed.

4
Through the church's degradation,
Saints this office desolate;
Through the weakness of their spirits
Preaching doth predominate.

5
Most are leaning on the message
And the preaching emphasize,
Yet neglect the priestly praying
And their spirits' exercise.

6
Deal with me and make me balanced,
As in preaching, so in prayer;
Leading others oft in praying,
As Thy Word I too declare.

7
Only serving by our praying
Will our spirits mingled be;
Stressing prayer as much as preaching—
Thus the church is built for Thee.

songs.title: Precious precious blood of Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Precious, precious blood of Jesus,
Shed on Calva[G]ry;
[C]Shed for rebels, shed for sin[F]ners,
[C]Shed [G7]for [C]thee.

  [C]’Tis [G]for [C]thee.

2

Let it make thee whole;

O’er thy soul.

3

Deep in scarlet glow,

4

All the price is paid;
Perfect pardon now is offered,

In the fiercest fight,
Sin and Satan overcoming
By its might.

7

Makes us nigh to God;
Precious blood, our way of glory,
Praise and laud.

# Capo 3

That Thou might fulfill His purpose

3

songs.title: God You are now rearranging my way

#Capo 3

1
[D]God, You are [D7]now rearr[G]anging my [D]way.
All I have [Bm]built You’re des[E7]troying [A]today.
[D]Those serving [D7]faithfully [G]daily decrease.
Dis[D]honesty, misunder[A]standings in[D]crease.

  [D]My eyes are [D7]teary; I [G]can’t see You [Gm]clearly,
  As [D]though all Your [Bm]words aren’t as [E7]real as be[A]fore.
  [D]You make me [D7]decrease, that [G]You might thus [Gm]increase,
  To [D]make Your will [Bm]sweeter than [Em]e’er  [A]be[D]fore.

2
For Your hand stopping I’d almost implore,
When I feel I cannot take any more.
Yet You are God! Oh, how can You give way?
Please, Lord, do not give in; wait ’till I obey.

3
If Your good pleasure and will should decree
That I must take suff’ring’s yoke upon me,
Then may my heart’s deepest joy be this thing—
Obeying Your will to take the suffering.

4
It seems the price that’s required for Your joy
Is that I’m hindered and knocked down by You;
Therefore I’d welcome Your hindering pull,
If thus I could cause Your heart to be joyful.

5
You’ve given chariots to others instead.
You have made them thus to ride o’er my head.
You stretch Your hand out my all now to take,
Yet please leave Your stripping hand here for my sake.

songs.title: God's Kingdom today is a real exercise
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]God's Kingdom [C-G]today is a [C]real exer[G]cise,
But when [D]Christ comes to [Em]reign it will [A7]be a great [D7]prize;
It is [G]wisdom di[C]vine that we [A7]now may be [D]trained
That His [G7]plan be ful[C]filled and His [D]justice [D7]main[G]tained.

2
God's children, we're born to be kings with His Son,
And we need to be trained that we may overcome
And to know how to rule in His kingdom as kings,
That His kingship thru us be expressed o'er all things.

3
Today we must learn to submit to His throne,
How to have a strict life and His government own;
His authority then we'll be able to share,
O'er the nations to rule with God's Son as the heir.

4
With a life strict to self we must righteousness hold,
Kind to others in peace, and with God joyful, bold;
In the Kingdom's reality e'er to remain,
For its manifestation prepared thus to reign.

5
Then Christ when He comes with the kingdom from God
Will to us grant His kingship to share as reward;
Thus the Lord will His righteousness thru us maintain
And His wisdom to heavenly powers make plain.

6
For this the Apostle pressed on at all cost,
For the Kingdom assured that he would not be lost;
'Tis for this he charged others, Be true to the Lord,
That the Kingdom might be unto them a reward.

7
O Lord, give us grace for Thy Kingdom to live,
To be trained that Thou may the reward to us give;
Make the Kingdom's reality our exercise,
That its manifestation may be our great prize.

songs.title: We have an inner life
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 2)

1
[D]We have an inner life;
[G]That’s for our daily life;
[D]That’s for the [Bm]meeting life—just C[A]hrist! [A7]
[D]We’ll live the inner life;
[G]We’ll have the daily life;
[D]We’ll see the [Bm]meeting life—
That’s [A]just the [D]church.

2
Christ is our inner life;
He’s in our spirit now;
Not far away from us—He’s right inside!
And as we turn to Him
And take Him as our all
He will become in us our inner life.

3
Out from our inner life
Will come our daily life,
And all our living be filled up with Christ.
Then as we live by Him,
He lives His life in us,
And He becomes to us our daily life.

4
The real experience of Christ in daily life,
Will fill the meeting life with Christ Himself.
Not empty forms and such,
But Christ will be so much;
And we will see Him here as
The meeting life.

5
Without the inner life there is no daily life,
There is no meeting life, there is no church!
Christ as our inner life,
Christ in our daily life
Will make the meeting life new and glorious!

songs.title: I hunger and I thirst
songs.lyrics:
1

Jesus, my manna be;
Ye living waters, burst

My lifelong wants supply;
As living souls are fed,
O feed me, or I die.

3
Thou true life-giving Vine,
Let me Thy sweetness prove;
Renew my life with Thine,
Refresh my soul with love.

4
For still the desert lies
My thirsting soul before;
O living waters, rise
Within me evermore.

Victorious resurrection
His divine life released
You and I were all born there

songs.title: Christ is the complete God
songs.lyrics:
Christ is the complete God
Manifested in the flesh
God infinite,
Man finite
Christ is the Word who was God becoming flesh
Conceived with the Spirit's divine essence.
For the union, mingling, and incorporation of the Triune God with the tripartite man.

  God's eternal economy is to make man the same as he is
  In life, expression, nature, and function
  Thus to be enlarged, expanded,
  That His divine attributes may be expressed in human virtues
  Issuing the universal divine human incorporation
  To consummate the New Jerusalem

His name the mighty God
Eternal Father
He’s Jehovah
Our Saviour
And He was called God with us, Emmanuel
In Him dwells the fullness of the Godhead
He is the great I Am
The mystery of God
The only begotten Son
Who declares God

  God's eternal economy is to make man the same as he is
  In life, expression, nature, and function
  Thus to be enlarged, expanded,
  That His divine attributes may be expressed in human virtues
  Issuing the universal divine human incorporation
  To consummate the New Jerusalem

  Oh can you see
  His living Body
  Lord show me more each day
  I cannot live without the Body

  My prayer today
  Is to love You
  Lord, make my love fresh and new
  May love prevail, and build Your church today

# (Based on Matthew 25: 14-30)

1

2

It [F#m]groans unutt'ra[Bm]bly!
I [G]know You’ve put it [A]there;
A [G]sober fear, a [A]prayer,
I [G]long to hear You [A]say
[G]Face to face one [A]day…

  Well [D]done! Well [A]done! 
  Thou [G]good and faithful [A]slave.
  Well [D]done!  Well [A]done! 
  Thou [G]good and faithful [A]slave.
  You were [G]faithful o’er a [D]few things,
  Many [G]things I'll set you [A]o'er.
  Enter [G]now into the [D]joy
  Of your [G]Master, of your [A]Lord.
  Well [D]done!

3
I turn back to You,  yet again
I'm answering Your call

4

You've promised to restore

1

  So I [D]would gladly [Em]bear the cross
  And [A]follow to the [D]end.

2

This blessed Christ to gain;
Now life or death is no concern—
What else can me restrain?

  My dear ones, wealth ambition, fame—
  What can they offer me?
  My gracious Lord for me was poor;
  For Him I poor would be.

3
My precious Savior now I love,
Him only would I please.
For Him all gain a loss becomes,
And comfort holds no ease.

  Thou art my comfort, gracious Lord!
  I’ve none in heav’n but Thee.
  And who but Thee is there on earth
  With whom I love to be?

4
Though loneliness and trials come,
My griefs I’d rise above.
This only would I ask Thee, Lord:
Surround me with Thy love!

  O gracious Lord, I now beseech,
  Guide me through every stage;
  Stand by and strengthen me to go
  Through this dark, evil age.

5
The world, the flesh, and Satan too,
Do tempt my soul apace;
Without Thy love and strength’ning power
I may Thy name disgrace.

  The time, dear Lord, is running short;
  From earth my soul set free.
  When Thou dost come, I’ll sing with joy,
  Hallelujah to Thee!

Into death it must be sown.

Many grains to birth to bring,
Many grains to birth to bring!

4
Lamb of God—our sin's redemption,
Brazen serpent—Satan's end,
Grain of wheat - life's reproduction,
Now with many grains we blend.
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
What an all-inclusive death,
What an all-inclusive death!

songs.title: More about Jesus would I know
songs.lyrics:
1

songs.title: Let us contemplate the grape vine
songs.lyrics:
1
Let us contemplate the grape vine,
From its life now let us learn,
How its growth is fraught with suff'ring,
Midst environment so stern;
How unlike the untamed flowers
Growing in the wilderness
In a maze of wild confusion,
Making patterns numberless.

2
But the blossoms of the grape vine
Without glory are and small;
Though they do have some expression,
They are hardly seen withal.
But a day since they have flowered
Into fruit the blooms have grown;
Never may they wave corollas
With luxuriant beauty shown.

3
To a post the vine is fastened;
Thus it cannot freely grow;
When its branches are extended,
To the trellis tied they go.
To the stony soil committed,
Drawing thence its food supply;
It can never choose its own way,
Or from difficulty fly.

4
Oh, how beautiful its verdure,
Which in spring spread o'er the field.
From life's energy and fulness
Growth abundant doth it yield.
Till it's full of tender branches
Twining freely everywhere,
Stretching 'gainst the sky's deep azure
Tasting sweetly of the air.

5
But the master of the vineyard
Not in lenience doth abide,
But with knife and pruning scissors
Then would strip it of its pride.
Caring not the vine is tender,
But with deep, precision stroke
All the pretty, excess branches
From the vine are neatly broke.

6
In this time of loss and ruin,
Dare the vine self-pity show?
Nay, it gives itself more fully
To the one who wounds it so,
To the hand that strips its branches,
Till of beauty destitute,
That its life may not be wasted,
But preserved for bearing fruit.

7
Into hard wood slowly hardens
Every stump of bleeding shoot,
Each remaining branch becoming
Clusters of abundant fruit.
Then, beneath the scorching sunshine,
Leaves are dried and from it drop;
Thus the fruit more richly ripens
Till the harvest of the crop.

8
Bowed beneath its fruitful burden,
Loaded branches are brought low—
Labor of its growth thru suff'ring
Many a purposed, cutting blow.
Now its fruit is fully ripened,
Comforted the vine would be;
But the harvest soon is coming,
And its days of comfort flee.

9
Hands will pick and feet will trample
All the riches of the vine,
Till from out the reddened wine-press
Flows a river full of wine.
All the day its flow continues,
Bloody-red, without alloy,
Gushing freely, richly, sweetly,
Filling all the earth with joy.

10
In appearance now the grape vine
Barren is and pitiful;
Having given all, it enters
Into night inscrutable.
No one offers to repay it
For the cheering wine that's drunk,
But 'tis stripped and cut e'en further
To a bare and branchless trunk

11
Yet its wine throughout the winter
Warmth and sweetness ever bears
Unto those in coldness shiv'ring,
Pressed with sorrow, pain, and cares.
Yet without, alone, the grape vine
Midst the ice and snow doth stand,
Steadfastly its lot enduring,
Though 'tis hard to understand.

12
Winter o'er, the vine prepareth
Fruit again itself to bear;
Budding forth and growing branches,
Beauteous green again to wear;
Never murmuring or complaining
For the winter's sore abuse,
Or for all its loss desiring
Its fresh off'ring to reduce.

13
Breathing air, untainted, heavenly,
As it lifts its arms on high,
Earth's impure, defiled affections
Ne'er the vine may occupy.
Facing sacrifice, yet smiling,
And while love doth prune once more,
Strokes it bears as if it never
Suffered loss and pain before.

14
From the branches of the grape vine
Sap and blood and wine doth flow.
Does the vine, for all it suffered,
Lost, and yielded, poorer grow?
Drunkards of the earth and wanderers,
From it drink and merry make,
From their pleasure and enjoyment
Do they richer thereby wake?

15
Not by gain our life is measured,
But by what we've lost 'tis scored;
'Tis not how much wine is drunken,
But how much has been outpoured.
For the strength of love e'er standeth
In the sacrifice we bear;
He who has the greatest suff'ring
Ever has the most to share.

16
He who treats himself severely
Is the best for God to gain;
He who hurts himself most dearly
Most can comfort those in pain.
He who suffering never beareth
Is but empty "sounding brass";
He who self-life never spareth
Has the joys which all surpass.

songs.title: Come, ye disconsolate, where'er ye languish
songs.lyrics:
1
Come, ye disconsolate, where'er ye languish;
Come to the mercy-seat, fervently kneel;
Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish,
Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot heal.

2
Joy of the comfortless, light of the straying,
Hope of the penitent, fadeless and pure;
Here speaks the Comforter, tenderly saying—
Earth has no sorrow that heaven cannot cure.

3
Here see the Bread of Life; see water flowing
Forth from the throne of God, pure from above;
Come to the feast of love; come, ever knowing
Earth has no sorrow but heaven can remove.

your F[Am7]riend,

songs.lyrics:

songs.title: Many crowd the Saviour's kingdom
songs.lyrics:
1

songs.lyrics:

1

Though the path may be holding
Much joy or much pain,

I would gain,
Regardless what happens,

'Cause I'm made to be filled with the Lord.

songs.title: How can I tell it all, Dear Lord
songs.lyrics:
How can I [C]tell it all, Dear [G]Lord —
I cannot [C]speak, I cannot [G]pen, 
I cannot [F]comprehend it [Am]all —
Your Person’s [G]rich! [C]Amen! 

Oh, how I long to touch You more! 
The goodness of Your inner being,
The light and life You ever flow, 
The greatness of my King!

Oh, dearest Lord! There’s so much more. 
Much more of life, and light, and love
Much more that I have yet to taste, 
Your riches, more to prove!

From out of Your great treasury, 
Your giving is without reserve, 
Dispensing gifts of righteousness
And grace, in life preserve. 

How good! You give and give again. 
Without regard to what we are;
Your grace, so rich, is freely giv’n 
Your mercy reaches far!

Much more, You’re saving us in life
In great abundance, grace afford.
Redeeming us in righteousness,
The blood of God outpoured. 

As Spirit now indwelling me
You’re spreading, filling every part,
Transforming everything I am
To match Your loving heart.

Oh dearest Lord I love You so!
Your Person is so rich, so sweet. 
Oh, let me linger here fore’er, 
Enjoying all You are!

1

[Em]Draw me, Lord, [D]from where I [G]am[D].

  My [C]love, you're [D7]so beauti[G]ful.
  We're the [C]same in [C7]life and in [F]nature,
  U[C]nited in l[G7]ove forev[C]er.

2
I partake of Your nature divine,
I enjoy Your divine life to shine.
Renewed in submission sweet,
Rise up with You to meet.

3
Viewing You like a dove uniquely,
Trusting You singly as a lily.
Transformed and built up to be
Your rest and joy wholly.

4
Let us go to the fields, my Beloved,
Working here with You, Lord, in love.
Your queen longs to be matured,
And hopes to be raptured.

5
Set me as a seal on Your heart,
In Your love, keep me—ne'er apart.
Lord, make haste, I long for Your coming,
Come quickly, Beloved, we're waiting!

songs.title: Lord, sometimes I feel
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, sometimes I [G]feel
I get out of [Bm]touch with you,
The [Am]things around keep crowding out Your
[D]Out Your view.
But [B7]You keep coming back and attr[Em]acting me
from [A7]all my emptiness and [D]vanity. [D7]

  Jesus, [G]You are really all I [Em]want,
  [Am]You are really all I [D]need!
  Lord, [G]strengthen me now [Bm]deep with[Em]in
  To take [F]You, Jesus,[D7] as my every[G]thing!

2
No wonder my life never seems just so right

There's so much strife!
I turn my heart to You completely,

3
Today I choose You,
I want to experience
You as my 'best love' and enjoyment!

songs.title: Lord, You are my only goal
songs.lyrics:
[C]Lord, You [E7]are my only [Am]goal!
You’re [F]my only [G]hope!
I only [C]care [Em]for [Am]You!
[F]I never could re[G]place You,

[F]I have everyt[G]hing, Lord—

Lord, I only live for You—
Not anything else!
In everything You’re my source;
No more good intentions,
No more right or wrong.
I don’t want a “good” life—
I want You!

songs.title: He’s my Lord! He’s my Lord
songs.lyrics:
[G]He’s my [D7]Lord! He’s my [G]Lord!
[]He has risen from the dead
And He’s my [D]Lord![D7]
Every [G]knee shall [G7]bow,
Every [C]tongue conf[Am]ess,

songs.title: Once a living void of meaning
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2


1
[G]Once a l[C]iving void of m[Em]eaning [D]
Full of d[G]eath, d[C]arkness, and [Em]sin   [D]
[G]But as the S[C]pirit He c[Em]ame!
Worked in my h[D]eart- I’m not the s[G]ame,
His l[C]ove now I t[Em]aste  [D]

2
Lord, how Your words are so living!
Open my ears that I may hear
You spoke, “from darkness light shall shine”
Now gone are days in which I pine
What speaking filled with light!

3
Now within there is a shining-
It’s Christ, the living word of God.
As light, the darkness He dispels
And where He is, darkness can’t dwell
Light comes; darkness flees

4
Then separated did He make them,
The light to be set apart from dark.
I used to live a life of nights
Dark with clouds, no stars in sight
But days now I see!

5
Now the expanse He provides-
The dividing work of the cross.

songs.title: Do you know what you were made for?
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Do you [A]know what you were [D]made for;
Do you [Em]ever wonder [A]why?
What’s the [D]purpose for your being;
What’s the [Em]reason you’re a[A]live?
[D]Do you know God [Em]wants to be your life?
He [A]wants to be your life, He [D]wants to be your life.
You were made with [Em]something deep within,
A [A]vessel to contain just [D]Him.

2
Deep within you is your spirit,
Even deeper than your “heart”;
Many other things can fill you—
Only Jesus can fill this part.
You have been so empty all these years;
In spite of all you’ve tried, you’re still not satisfied.
Don’t you feel a longing deep within
To open up and take Christ in?

3
Doesn’t matter how you see things,
For in God’s eyes “all have sinned”;
Jesus shed His blood to cleanse you
For the purpose of getting in.
He’s done everything there is to do,
And He’s the Spirit now so He can get in you.
Makes no difference what your past has been;
The living Christ will still come in.

4
Just as you are in your body,
Perfectly contained therein,
God wants you for His container,
All you need to do is let Him in.
Would you open up from deep within
To let the Lord come in and fill you to the brim.
Why not open up from deep within
And call upon the name of Him.

[]right!)

songs.title: When I’ve run the race before me
songs.lyrics:
1
When I’ve run the race before me
And have fought to victory,
I’ll be raptured to the glory of the Lord;
When I’ve kept the faith at any cost,
The Holy City then
I’ll receive as my reward.
 
  I’ll be raptured into glory,
  In the Holy City dwell—
  New Jerusalem, New Jerusalem;
  With the overcomers shouting,
  How our praises then will swell,
  In the New Jerusalem.

2
As a pilgrim here I wander;
While afflicted, I rejoice,
For a better land I soon expect to see;
Though all others seek for earthly gain,
The Holy City e’er
Will my aspiration be.

3
Though my feet are often wearied
On the rough and rugged path,
Just by thinking of that city, I’m restored;
Though my eyes be filled with tears,
My heart will evermore be fixed
On that City, my reward.

4
With strong purpose I now wrestle,
And I run toward the goal;
I pursue the prize, God’s highest to obtain;
Pressing forward toward the mark,
I run forgetting all behind,
Thus the Holy City gain.
 
  By His love and through His grace I’ll
  In the Holy City live—
  New Jerusalem, New Jerusalem;
  All saints leaping, singing, shouting,
  To the Lord their praises give,
  In the New Jerusalem.

songs.title: Not I, but Christ be honored, loved, exalted
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Not I, but [A]Christ be [D]honored, loved, ex[A]alted,
[D]Not I, but [Bm]Christ be [G]seen, be known and [A]heard;
[D]Not I, but [A]Christ in [D]every look and [A]action,
[D]Not I, but [Bm]Christ in [Em]every [A]thought and [D]word.

  [Bm]Oh, to be saved from my[A]self, dear [Bm]Lord,
  [D]Oh, to be lost in [A]Thee,
  [G]Oh, that it may be no more I,
  But [D]Christ that [A7]lives in [D]me.

2
Not I, but Christ to gently soothe in sorrow,
Not I, but Christ to wipe the falling tear;
Not I, but Christ to lift the weary burden,
Not I, but Christ to hush away all fear.

3
Christ, only Christ, no idle word e'er falling,
Christ, only Christ, no needless bustling sound;
Christ, only Christ, no self-important bearing,
Christ, only Christ, no trace of I be found.

4
Not I, but Christ my every need supplying,
Not I, but Christ my strength and health to be;
Christ, only Christ, for spirit, soul, and body,
Christ, only Christ, live then Thy life in me.

5
Christ, only Christ, ere long will fill my vision,
Glory excelling soon, full soon I'll see;
Christ, only Christ, my every wish fulfilling,
Christ, only Christ, my all in all to be.

songs.title: Christ to me is so subjective
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Christ to me is [A]so sub[D]jective,
In my spirit [Bm]dwelleth [A]He;
[A7]Christ to [D]me is all-inc[G]lusive,
As the [D]Spirit [A7]one with [D]me.

  So subjective is my [A]Christ to [D]me!
  Real in [A]me, and [D]rich and s[A]weet!
  [D]All-inclusive is my [G]Christ to [D]me!
  All my needs He [A]fully [D]meets.

2
Christ to me is so subjective,
Life imparting all the way;
As the Spirit He revives me
And refreshes day by day.

3
Christ to me is so subjective,
All my being He transforms;
By the mind and will renewing
To His image He conforms.

4
Christ to me is so subjective,
Liberating pow’r is He,
By the law of life and power
As the Spirit setting free.

5
Christ to me is so subjective,
Regulating all the day;
He corrects and rules and guides me,
And adjusts in every way.

6
Christ to me is so subjective,
All my thirst He satisfies;
With His riches He supplies me,
Thus God’s fulness testifies.

songs.title: Abba, Father, how sweet it is
songs.lyrics:
[D]Abba, [G]Father!
  [D]How sweet it [A]is to call on Your [D]name!
  Abba, [G]Father!
  [D]We [A]love [D]You!

1
[G]Is it just us or i[D]s it Him?
[G]The Spirit of the S[D]on You sent us?
[G]From deep within this m[D]ingled cry,
[G]“Ab[A]ba, Fa[D]ther!”

2
Here at the table with the saints
Your sons enjoy the life You gave us.
Led by Your firstborn Son we cry,
“Abba, Father!”

3
He leads the many sons to sing
The praises of our holy Father.
In life we understand this name:
Abba, Father!

4
Amidst the church He leads the praise;
He’s not ashamed to call us brothers,
For just like Him we are of You,
Born sons of God!

  Abba, Father!
  How sweet it is to call on Your name!
  Abba, Father!
  We’re Your Sons!

songs.lyrics:
#2010 Winter - Crystallisation-Study of Isaiah (2) Banner 2

We must [Bm]deal with our [G]flesh by the [D]Spirit
of [A]life, we must [Bm]deal with our [G]flesh by

songs.title: All thy griefs by Him are ordered
songs.lyrics:
1
All thy griefs by Him are ordered,
Needful is each one for thee;
All thy tears by Him are counted,
One too much there cannot be;
And if while they fall so quickly
Thou canst own His way is right,
Then each bitter tear of anguish
Precious is in Jesus' sight.

2
Far too well thy Savior loves thee
To allow thy life to be
One long, calm, unbroken summer—
One unruffled, stormless sea;
He would have thee fondly nestling
Closer to His loving breast,
He would have that day seem brighter
When alone is perfect rest.

songs.title: Behold, how good, how pleasant 'tis
songs.lyrics:
1
Behold, how good, how pleasant 'tis
When brethren dwell in one!
'Tis like the oil on Aaron's head,
Which to his skirts did run;
As dew of Hermon that descends
On Zion's mountains o'er;
The Lord His blessing there commands,
E'en life forevermore.

songs.title: Day 1, You came to me
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Day 1, You [G]came to me,
[F]Brooding so t[C]enderly.
[F]You spoke a w[C]ord to me,
[Dm]And light did s[G]hine.
[F]My darkness Y[C]ou effaced,
[F]My emptin[C]ess replaced;
[F]The gospel's l[Em]ight er[Am]ased
[Dm]My h[G]ist'ry v[C]ain.

2
Day 2, did come and go,
But one thing I did know:
Things earthly lost their glow;
They're dead to me.
The atmosphere– expanse
Lifted my circumstance,
That life may thus advance
For growth in me.

3
Day 3, the land so dry
Emerged from waters high.
Grass, herbs, and trees did rise;
Your life had sprung.
My death You now recede.
As life do rise in me;
Rise more 'til there's no sea
Within my being.

4
Day 4, the sun did shine
With wings of healing light.
The moon was shining, too,
The church, my home.
The saints as stars with light
Shine midst this dark'ning night,
Setting my feet aright
To walk Your way.

5
Day 5, the fish arrived
Against the worldly tide.
Death waters they survived,
With life empow'red.
From fish to bird I soar
By waiting on You, Lord.
Your grace to me affords
Strength o'er all things.

6
Day 6, from air to ground,
Cattle and beasts around,
Then all creation crowned
With man– like You.
Through growth expressing Thee
With Your authority,
I'd reach maturity,
Your purpose gained.

songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
If my [Bm]pathway [G]seems not [A]clear,
Then be my [Bm]sight that [G]leads to [A]life.

  Save [Bm]me from [G]death, turn [D]me to [A]life.
  Chase [Bm]all the s[G]hades of [D]night aw[A]ay;
  Chase [Bm]all dark [G]thoughts of [D]sin aw[A]ay.
  Since [Bm]through Your w[G]ord I [D]gain more l[A]ife,

songs.lyrics:
[G]Christ is a [Em]genuine [C-D]man,

songs.title: On the cross You gave Your life for me
songs.lyrics:
1
On the [G]cross You gave Your l[G7]ife for me,

2

3
Lord, I really love You,

songs.lyrics:
1
[A]Years I spent in sorrow ‘round [D]the [A]cross,
[E]Still repenting over [A]sins [D]and [A]dross.
Then at last the river I [D]did [A]cross,

  [D]Mercy now is flowing, [A]oh, the grace—
  [E]That I find of Him to [A]run the [A7]race!
  [D]Boldly now I come a[A]gain to taste
  My [E7]glorious [A-D-A]Lord.

2
In my Christian life I’d daily fall,

3

Hallelujah! All the work is done—
The veil is gone!

4
Now within the veil, enjoying God,
Manna, law of life, and budding rod;
Christ Himself, the ark, is our abode—
Hallelujah!

songs.title: Breathing in the Lord is how we live today
songs.lyrics:
[G]Breathing in the Lord is how we live to[C]day.
[Am]Not by thinking [D]do we live,
But [D7]breathing is the [G]way.
[]We just call, “O Lord!”
From very deep with[C]in,

  []Breathe Him in today!
  [C]He’s our very [G]life supply,
  So [A7]breathe Him right a[D]way!
  [G]Breathe in Christ, breathe in life,
  []Breathe Him in today!
  [C]He’s our very [G]life supply,
  So b[D]reathe Him right a[G]way.

He’s so wonderful, the Breath of life is He.
Once He simply was a man,
But now He’s breath to me.
He has changed His form;
The Spirit now is He;

  Everywhere, everywhere,
  Christ is life to me;
  I just call upon His name,
  And breath comes into me.

songs.title: Lord, Thou art with me
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, Thou art with me!
Whom shall I fear?
Who then can harm me
While Thou art near?
Under Thy shadow
Is my retreat;
There to my taste,
Lord, Thy fruit is sweet.

2
Lord, Thou art with me,
And Thou dost give
Strength for the journey,
Grace now to live.
Mercies each morning
Thou dost renew;
And for my prospect,
Thy rest in view.

3
Lord, Thou art with me;
Onward I move;
Each day I'm proving
More of Thy love.
Now Thou art training,
Setting me free
From all that hinders,
To dwell with Thee.

songs.title: It is not a message that I’ve heard
songs.lyrics:
It is [C]not a message t[Em]hat I’ve heard,
[Dm]Not some points t[G]hat I’ve learned,
[C]Not a song or v[Am]erse I know by h[Dm]eart,[G]
That can [C]meet your need or [Em]wash your feet,
[Dm]Touch your heart or f[G]ill the void,
But it’s [C]Christ, [Am]just the Christ
[Dm]That [G]I’ve enj[C]oyed.

It is nothing good inside myself,
Nothing of my natural life,
Not the best of fruit from the knowledge tree,
That could touch your life, or turn your heart,
Refresh you in your deepest part,
But it’s Christ, just the Christ
Lived out through me.

songs.title: It is Jehovah's lovingkindness that we are not consumed (Lam. 3:22-25)
songs.lyrics:
#Lam. 3:22-25

[C]It is Jehovah's [G]lovingkindness[F] that we are[Fm] not consumed,

[F]Jehovah [G]is good to [Em]those who wait on [Am]Him,
[Dm]To the [G]soul that [C]seeks Him.

songs.title: Lord, I pursue, forgetting the things behind
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 2)

1
Lord, [G]I pursue, for[C]getting the things be[G]hind,

For I’ve been [C]kissed with the kisses of Your
[G]mouth,

Our Triune [G]God!

songs.title: Lord, I have been running so long
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord, I have been [G]running so long.
[A]Now, Lord, I ad[G]mit I was [D]wrong.
[A]Oh [Bm]Lord, finally my [Em]heart has been won

1

Our wishes all above,

4

songs.title: Now the Lord our soul has fed

songs.title: It’s morning time (The Morning Watch)
songs.lyrics:
# Tune to Hymn #958 - Since long ago at Bethany we parted


1
It's morning time, arise, awake my glory!
Stretch forward now to gain the Christ of God
I to the holy inner sanctuary
Approach with boldness in His precious blood.
I love You, Lord! To You I've been betrothed.
My Husband dear, on You I must rely.
Save me today from living independently.
Wake me, I'll take You in, and we are joined thereby.

2
The saints of old who truly were so useful,
Early they rose to meet Jehovah then.
Oh, that my Christian life would not be wasted,
But patterned after all of those God-men.
I will precede the dawn in touching You Lord,
Thus practicing to greet You that Day near,
(Not caught off guard nor put to shame at that time)
Expecting, hastening the longed-for Morning Star.

3
With heart prepared I'm ready to have fellowship.
I cannot wait for morning to arrive
When Christ the High Priest comes with golden instruments
And golden oil my lamp then to supply.
He trims away the charred wick of my natural life.
As Son of Man this High Priest cherishes,
And I am made so happy, pleasant, comfortable,
Since He is touched with feelings of my weaknesses.

4
The day's first part we freely offer to the Lord,
Not entangled with this life's daily tread,
(His mercies and compassions guaranteed new)
To have experience of Christ as heavn'ly bread.
Such times alone, beholding Jesus' countenance,
Confessing sins, inquiring of His will,
Consecrating, opening to the Holy Word,
Getting supplied, infused, with Spirit bountiful. 

5
Incorporation, we saints with our Triune God,
Results from eating and digesting Him
As daily manna gathered every morning, 
Preserved for'ere in a golden pot, hidden.
Thus, having seen the goal, New Jerusalem,
And realizing what makes it to the close,

To get the gold, the pearl, and the precious stone?

6

I am not asking much for You to do:
Only wishing to be in Your sweet presence,
A priceless time that You and I commune.
It's not a regulation nor some ordinance, 
But the response from crazy lovers free,
Who have been captivated by Your romance
And drawn by fragrance of divine humanity.

Let us meet in resurrection,
From all dead religion free.

2

All religious things were through;
Christ is now our living temple,
Christ is all our offerings too.

Hallelujah, we're released!
Pity all the old religion—
All our meetings are a feast!

3

In our blood is hiding out;
God must give us revelation,
All that unseen monster rout.
Lord, we still are too religious—
Down with our religious soul!
We would all release our spirit,

On the mountain, at the shore,

He is here—what want we more?
Bury all the old religion,
Even Christianity—
Jesus, Jesus, we have Jesus,
He is our reality!

songs.title: I have come into My garden
Surely God is good to Israel (Psalm 73)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 6
#Psalms chapter 73

#Part 1:
1
[Am]Surely God is good to [Em]Israel;
[Dm]to those who are pure in he[Am-Asus2]art.
[Dm]But me- my feet were nearly [Am]turned aside;
[Em]my steps had almost slip[Am-Asus4]ped.

2
I was env’ious of the arrogant,
(the) wicked in prosperity saw.
For they have no pangs in their death, no pangs, 
their body nourished well.

3
They do not endure hardships of men,
nor are they plagued like them.
Therefore their pride is a necklace for them;
violence, like garments, cov’ring.

4
Their eyes bulging out from their fatness;
(their) heart’s imaginations o’erflow.
They wickedly mock, speak of oppression;
they speak loftily.

5
They set their mouth against the heavens,
(their) tongue walks about on the earth.
Therefore His people return here, and
by them- waters drained.

6
  [B7] And they say, “How [Em]does God know?”
  [B7] “Is there knowledge with [Em]the Most High?”
  [C/G] Behold, these are the [Em]wicked;
  [C/G] Always at ease, they heap up [Em]riches.

7
   Surely I’ve purified my heart in vain,
   I have washed my hands in innocence.
   For I’ve been plagued all day long
   and been chastened every morning.

8
   If I had said, I will speak thus;
   I’d have betrayed Your progeny.
   Consid’ring this to understand it:
   troublesome a task in my sight...
#(Interlude / speeds up)
[E7 F G-F-]
#Part 2:
9
[E]Until I went into the [F]sanctuary-
[G]the sanctu[F]ary of Go[E]d; 
indeed I went into the [F]sanctuary
[G]then I perce[F]ived their en[E]d.
  [C/G]Surely You do [D/F#]set them in s[E]lippery places;
  [C/G]casting them [D/F#]down to [E]ruins.
  [C/G]How they are made [D/F#]desolate [E]in a moment!
  [C/G]Utterly con[D/F#]sumed by t[E]errors.

10
Like from a dream, when one awakes, O Lord,
You will arise. 
Upon arising, You will see, and, Lord-
their image You'll despise.
  When my heart was bitter, and pricked on the inside,
  I was brutish, knew nothing; 
  When my heart was bitter, and pricked on the inside,
  'fore You I was like a beast.

11
Nevertheless I am continua'lly
with You, O Lord;
You've taken hold of my own right hand;
and by it, me- You'll guide.
  By it You will guide me, Lord, with Your counsel, 
  afterward You will receive- 
  afterward receive me into Your glory;
  Into glory guide and lead.

12
Whom do I have in heaven but You, Lord?
And there is none on earth.
Besides You there is nothing I desire;
nothing but You, O Lord.
  My flesh and my heart will fail over and o'er but
  God is the strength of my heart;
  He is both my portion right now and forever-
  God! My very God!

13
For behold all those who are far from You 
will perish, true.
You destroy all of those who go about,
as harlots gone from You.
  Drawing near to God, as for me, is so good;
  good; so good for me;
  I have made Jehovah the Lord my refuge,
  that I may declare His works.
#End of scripture

14
We, like the psalmist, see the wicked win,
and often wonder, "Why?"
"Why have our only aim and goal in God?"
We start to turn aside...
  Outwardly their living's a sight to see but-
  Inwardly its all empty.
  Turn to sanctuary within your spirit;
  go to where the God-men meet.

15
Then we will see who's in a slippery place;
soon to be desolate.
We realize we had an embittered heart-
know-nothing beasts so blind.
  Vision back, our right hand He holds, and guides us;
  now with Him continua'lly.
  Realizing we need Him and need no other;
  none in heav'n nor earth but He.

16
Our nat'ral flesh and heart, we realize, fail;
on His strength we rely.
Never too far when we depart from Him;
so we draw near again!
  Now aware that drawing near to our God is
  good and it's all we need,
  daily He's replacing our vain distractions,
  'till one day He's all we seek.

  Daily He's replacing my vain distractions,
  'till one day He's all I seek.

1
The [A]risen Christ my S[D]hepherd is.

2

3

4
Incredible the thought beside—

5

1

1

#Capo 3
1

songs.title: How much can we do for our Savior?
songs.lyrics:
1
How much can we do for our Savior?
How much for our dear fellow man?
The way to do more than we're able
Is Jesus within to enable;
Thus we can do more than we can.

2
How much can we be for our Savior
In life with its brief, fleeting span?
If Jesus within us is dwelling
Our life and our actions infilling,
We all can do more than we can.

3
How much can we bear for our Savior?
How much for our dear fellow man?
If in us His love is constraining,
If 'neath us His arms are sustaining,
We all can do more that we can.

4
How much can we give for our Savior?
To succor our dear fellow man?
If from us His love is o'erflowing,
Our life will be every outgoing;
We'll always do more than we can.

It holds the fainting spirit up;
It cheers with hope the gloomy day,
And sweetens every bitter cup.

4

The measure and the pledge of love,
The sinner's refuge here below,
The angels' theme in heav'n above.

#Chorus last 2 lines:
  In resurrection as
  God’s new creation, eternally.

3
We love living a life every day conformed
To the death of Christ,
For the reality of the Body of Christ.
We love living a life
In the Lord Jesus, pursuing to die,
By the subjective experience of the cross.

#Chorus last 2 lines:
  Conformed to Your image
  For Your expression, eternally.

4
We love living a life by the grace received
from God in Christ,
In an organic union with the Triune God.
We love living a life
Fellowshipping in the spiritual realm,
Mingling in the Spirit’s reconstituting flow.

  O Lord consummate this age;
  Many God-men to live You again.
  O Lord consummate this age;
  We are willing to live such a way.
  In the flow of life divine,
  All Your riches now are mine,
  That corporately, (that corporately)
  We all may be (we all may be)
  Consummated as the
  New Jerusalem, eternally.

songs.title: How sweet is the story of Christ's boundless love
songs.lyrics:
1
How sweet is the story of Christ's boundless love,
That brought Him to suffer from glory above!
He died in our stead upon Calvary's tree,
Obtaining redemption that we might be free.

  Sound His praise! Sound His praise!
  All the work has been done;
  Praise His name! Praise His name!
  Jesus, God's blessed Son.
  We give Him the glory, our Savior and Friend;
  Our song is of Jesus and never will end.

2
How wondrous the story! the law's holy claims
Were met by the blood which redemption proclaims.
The judgment of sin has been borne by the Son,
Who glorified God in the work He has done.

3
How brilliant the glory where Christ is enthroned
How rightly His name above others is owned!
Yes, Jesus, the Savior, the glory-crowned Lord,
Is worthy by all to be ever adored.

songs.title: Lord, I take You as my sin offering
songs.lyrics:
# Lev. 1:4 footnote 4

1
[D]Lord, I take You as my sin offer[G]ing
for what I [D]am,
But [D]Lord, I take You as my burnt offe[G]ring
for [A]what I’m [D]not.
I’m not [D]loving, sub[G]missive,
patient, kind, or [A]meek,
I’m not [D]single in [G]view, Lord,
nor is it God I [A]seek.
But d[D]earest Lord, You’re [G]all these t[D]hings,
all virtue’s in [A]You,
So [D]Lord I lay my [G]hands on [D]You in [A]all I [D]do.

2
Lord, in me is all self-love, envy, anxiety
Lord, in me is only pride and no humility.
I’m not pure, Lord, or trusting,
neither absolute
For Your purpose, I waver—
I’m not resolute!
But dearest Lord, You’re all these things,
all virtue’s in You,
So Lord I lay my hands on You in all I do.

3
Such a laying on of hands is not for
substitution;
When we lay our hands on Christ,
it brings in a union.
By our laying our hands on Christ,
we are joined to Him.
We become one—no longer two—
we become Him!
In such a union all our weaknesses,
wounds, and scars
Are taken on by Him and
His virtues become ours.

4
Such a union requires exercise through
proper prayer
We open our failures, defects
for our Lord to bear.
As we pray in this way, Christ—
the One with no such sin
E’en the life-giving Spirit
immediately works within
To live in us a life,
a repetition of Christ our King,
The One who lived on earth
the life of the burnt offering.

5
Lord, You’re balanced, fine and pure
and loving through and through
You welcome the leprous ones,
blind, lame all come to You.
You have eyes of a dove, Lord—
blemish free are You.
No mixed motives, self-glory,
what the Father says You do!
Your humility’s unsurpassed—
obedient e’en unto death.
Trusting in the Father’s will,
living by Him breath by breath!

6
Thus, I open up to You each failure,
blemish, and spot.
I want You to know me, Lord,
and know all that I’m not.
You’re my Husband, my strong One,
I am just Your wife.
Bear my burdens, my loved One,
give me Your wonderful life!
I take up this exchange,
God Himself is what I’ve got.
You can bear all that I am,
You can be all that I’m not!
You can bear all that I am,
You can be all that I’m not!

All I know is I just want to see You.

All I know is Lord, I never want to leave.

Even [D]though you’ve tried

The [G]more you try,

2

You came to earth and sold all You had

Oh, this is not an outward activity!
A meaningful life,
One day all men will see—
Oh Lord, stir our hearts to never depart,
To give all we are—
For Christ and the church.

songs.title: Glory be to Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
Glory be to Jesus,
Who in bitter pains
Poured for me the life-blood
From His sacred veins.

2
Grace and life eternal
In that Blood I find;
Blest be His compassion,
Infinitely kind.

3
Blest through endless ages
Be the precious stream,
Which from endless torments
Did the world redeem.

4
Abel's blood for vengeance
Pleaded to the skies;
But the blood of Jesus
For our pardon cries.

5
It the conscience sprinkles,
Frees our guilty hearts;
Satan in confusion
Terror-struck departs.

6
Oft as earth exulting
Wafts its praise on high,
Angel-hosts rejoicing
Make their glad reply.

7
Lift ye then your voices;
Swell the mighty flood;
Louder still and louder
Praise the precious blood.

songs.title: Jesus, Savior, pilot me
songs.lyrics:
1
Jesus, Savior, pilot me
Over life's tempestuous sea;
Unknown waves before me roll,
Hiding rock and treach'rous shoal;
Chart and compass come from Thee;
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.

2
As a mother stills her child,
Thou canst hush the ocean wild;
Boist'rous waves obey Thy will
When Thou say'st to them, "Be still."
Wondrous Sov'reign of the sea,
Jesus, Savior, pilot me.

3
Though death's valley I may pass,
Still Thy grace will fear surpass;
In Thy presence I will rest,
And, while leaning on Thy breast,
I will hear Thee say to me,
"Fear not, I will pilot thee."

Once raised by the might of Thy power,
When numbered along with the dead.

3
We think of the glory that chose us,
'Twas Thine, blessed Father, the Source;
The glory of love that redeemed us
Through Jesus, the Man of Thy choice.

4
As marked out beforehand for sonship,
We praise now the glory of grace
And bow in Thy presence and worship,
As conscious, in Christ, of our place.

songs.title: Loving You Lord’s all I’m living for
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Loving You Lord’s [Em]all I’m living [Am]for.
[F]Loving You Lord [G]to the utter[C]most.
[Em]Lord, forgive me[Am] if I’ve left my first [F]love,
That’s the [Dm]bridal love for [G]You.
[C]You are more than [Em]anyone I [Am]love.
[F]You are more than [G]anything I [C]have,
[Em]Even my dear [Am]self.
Nothing can com[F]pare to my [Dm]beloved
Brideg[G]room.

  I give [Am]You the [G]first place
  [F]in all things by [C]faith.
  Let [Dm]nothing take Your [F]place
  in all my [G]heart.
  Infuse [F]me with [G]Yourself [Am]abundant[F]ly
  Till we [C]meet, dear [Am]Lord,[F]
  I’ll love You [G]with my best [C]love.

2
You’ve the right to take all that I love,
But replace it with Yourself much more.
You are what I need.
Give Yourself to me,
Do not give all that I want.
Everything is sure to pass away.
Everyone is going their own way.
But I still have You and You have me too,
Loving one another’s sweet.

3
I treasure my time alone with You,
Just to gain the best love You long for.
My dearest Husband,
Draw me with Yourself
Into Your chambers right now.
Be the first in all my work and life,
Be the first in all my service too.
In relationships You must be the first—
Have preeminence in me.

songs.title: Of all the gifts Thy love bestows
songs.lyrics:
1
Of [F]all the gifts Thy [B]love be[F]stows,
Thou [F]Giver [G7]of all [C]good!
E'en [Bb]heav'n it[Gm]self no [Bb]richer [C]knows
Than [F]Jesus [Bb]and [C7]His [F]blood.

2
Faith, too, that trusts in Him through grace,
From that same love we gain;
Else, sweetly as it suits our case,
The gift had been in vain.

3
We praise Thee, and would praise Thee more,
To Thee our all we owe:
The precious Savior, and the power
That makes Him precious too.

songs.title: O gracious God, Thy pleasure
songs.lyrics:
1
O [C]gracious [F]God, Thy [C]pleasure
Is [F]in Thy Christ made [G]known,
And [C]tells the [F]boundless [C]measure
Of [G]blessing [D]for Thine [G]own.
He [C]has Thy presence [F]entered,
As [D]Man in heav'n is [G]known;
In [C]Him Thy glory's [F]centered,
In [C]Him Thy [G]purpose [C]shown.

2
And O what love is beaming
Refulgent in that face!
What blessed light is streaming
From that most glorious place!
Both love and light proclaiming
What Thou, the Father, art,
And wondrous grace revealing,
With Thine own Son, our part.

3
Thou source of every blessing!
Thou spring of all delight!
Thy Name with joy confessing
Let all the saints unite!
Each heart its praise outpouring
To Thee all praise above,
Each voice in strains adoring
Re-echoes—"God is love."

songs.title: Gracious God, we worship Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
[F]Gracious God, we worship [C]Thee,
Rev'rently we [C7]bow the [F]knee;
[F]Jesus [D7]Christ, our [Gm]only [Bb]plea:
[F]Father, we a[C7]dore [F]Thee.

2
Vast Thy love, how deep, how wide,
In the gift of Him who died;
Righteous claims all satisfied:
Father, we adore Thee.

3
Low we bow before Thy face,
Sons of God, O wondrous place;
Great the riches of Thy grace:
Father, we adore Thee.

4
By Thy Spirit grant that we
Worshipers in truth may be;
Praise, as incense sweet to Thee:
Father, we adore Thee.

5
Yet again our song we raise,
Note of deep adoring praise;
Now, and soon through endless days:
Father, we adore Thee.

songs.title: Jesus, Name of matchless splendor
songs.lyrics:
1
Jesus, Name of matchless splendor!
Name all other names above!
Glorious Son of God incarnate,
King of kings, and Lord of love!

2
Name that to our hearts is nearest,
Here the stricken soul doth hide;
Name that to our hearts is dearest,
As in Jesus we confide.

3
"Call Him Jesus!" He shall save us
From the tyranny of sin;
From its condemnation save us,
From iniquity within.

4
Thanks we give, and adoration,
Every day and every hour,
For an uttermost salvation,
Freedom from sin's guilt and power.

5
Jesus! Sweetest note of any
In the lowly pilgrim's song;
Jesus! The triumphant music
Of the bright angelic throng.

6
Earth to Him her face upraises,
Knows Him as the great I AM!
Heaven resounds with Jesus' praises,
Glory to the bleeding Lamb!

songs.title: He grew up like a tender plant
songs.lyrics:
#Isaiah 53:2-6, 11
Capo 4-G

#Intro:
[G]For He grew up like a [D]tender plant [C]before Him, 
And like a [G]root out of dry [D]ground.
No [G]attractive form that [D]we should look upon [C]Him
Nor [Em]appearance—that we [G]should...desire [D]Him

#Verse:
Like one from [C]whom men [D]hide their [Em]faces
He was [C]despised; and [D]we did not [Em]esteem Him.
Smitten of [C]God [D]and [Em]afflicted.
And by His [C]stripes we [D]have been [G]healed.

#Countermelody:
We all like sheep have gone astray
Each one has turned to his own way
But He will see the fruit of resurrection
And He will be satisfied

songs.title: There is a name to Jesus given
songs.lyrics:
1
There is a name to Jesus given,
His matchless love its accents tell;
For it declares: He is my Brother,
And this His name—Emmanuel!
The Lord, by angels worshiped yonder,
Has stooped to earth with men to dwell,
Incarnate God, and man forever—
Our own beloved Emmanuel.

2
There is a name that's still more precious,
That stirs our hearts with fondest love:
It is the charming name of Jesus,
The name all other names above.
It tells me that He is my Savior
From sin and sickness and the grave.
I love the precious name of Jesus,
For I am one He came to save!

3
Though dear to us the name of Jesus,
The name of Christ is higher still!
It tells of Him who dwells within us,
Our old heart to renew and fill.
It tells me of the Spirit's fullness,
It brings the pow'r of Pentecost.
O blessed Christ, anoint me also,
And fill me with the Holy Ghost!

songs.title: O come, all ye faithful! Joyfully triumphant
In the Name of Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
In the Name of Jesus
Every knee shall bow,
Every tongue confess Him
King of glory now;
