songs.title: Jesus, our Lord, with what joy we adore Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Jesus, our Lord, with what [A7]joy we a[D]dore Thee,      
[G]Chanting our [D]praise to Thy[E7]self on the [A7]throne!      
[D]Blest in Thy presence, we [A7]worship be[D]fore Thee,      
[G]Own Thou art [D]worthy, and [A7]worthy a[D]lone.      

  [A]Lord, Thou art [A7]worthy: [D]Lord, Thou art worthy;      
  [E7]Lord, Thou art worthy, and [A]wor[E7]thy a[A7]lone!      
  [D]Blest in Thy presence, we [A7]worship be[D]fore Thee,      
  [G]Own Thou art [D]worthy, and [A7]worthy a[D]lone! 

2
Verily God, yet become truly human,
Lower than angels to die in our stead;
How has that long promised "Seed of the woman"
Trod on the serpent and bruised his head!

3
How didst Thou humble Thyself to be taken,
Led by Thy creatures and nailed to the cross,
Hated of men, and of God too forsaken,
Shunning not darkness, the curse, and the loss.

4
How hast Thou triumphed, and triumphed
with glory,
Battled death's forces, rolled back every wave!
Can we refrain then from telling the story?
Lord, Thou art Victor o'er death and the grave.

songs.title: I have a God who hides Himself
songs.lyrics:
#Tune: “He loved them to the uttermost” (without chorus)
#Isa. 45:15; Rom. 8:28; Phil. 2:13; 2 Sam. 7:25b, 28a; Luke 18:1-8; Matt. 6:6

1
I [G]have a God who [G7]hides Himself;
This [C]One, I know, is the [Am]King.
In [D]secret, He is [D7]sovereignly
Ar[C]ranging [D]every[G]thing.
This my responsi[G7]bility—
To [C]say amen to [Am]God in me.
He’s [C]living and He’s [D]acting in my [G]being.[C G]

2
I trust the God who hides Himself,
For what He’s spoken He’ll do.
He’s taking care of His elect;
He’s helping me and you.
Although it seems, apparently,
That God’s not doing anything,
He’s faithful to His Word—
His Word is true.

3
I serve the God who hides Himself;
He doesn’t like a display.
Today, He’s working ceaselessly,
But in a secret way.
No ostentation—He’s concealed.
I must know Him as He’s revealed—
Omnipotent and mighty, hidden still.

4
I love the God who hides Himself;
We meet in secret to pray.
It seems He’s absent, leaving me
A widow in this age.
Compelled to cry out day and night,
I’d always pray, that soon He might
Come find persistent faith on earth in me.

5
Lord, may I know You as the One
Who's present, loving, and real,
Yet hidden as Your work is done.
Yourself to me reveal
That I would watch and not lose heart
But open wide in every part,
Cooperating with You, Lord, today.

songs.title: Lamb of God, our dear Redeeming One is Christ (I Want to Follow Him)
songs.lyrics:
1
Lamb of [C]God—our dear [G]Redeeming One is Christ!
For our [Am]sins He paid the [Em]highest price

Who were [Dm]lost and fallen far from [G]God.
As the [C]Lamb, He had no [G]blemish;
He was [Am]meek, even sub[Em]missive.
How can [F]we like Him o[C]bedient be
Unto [Dm]death, that [G]even of the [C]cross?
 	
  I want to [F]follow Him,[G]
  Rest from all my [Em]wandering, [A7]
  End all my en[Dm]deavoring; [G]
  Even though I [C]know not where or
  [Gm]How—I [C7]know He [F]cares!
  I know He’ll [G]never err;
  I [E]know He’ll lead me [Am]well.
  I know His [F]voice; this now my [G]choice—
  Follow where the [C]Lamb would lead.

2
When He came, though many followed in the way,
Few remained who knew Him and His ways.
Lamb of God—He took the narrow gate;
The constricted way to life He traced;
Sacrificed, though men denied Him;
Gave His life, though men forsook Him.
How can we t’ward Him still hardened be
When to us He gave all selflessly?

3
Lord we pray, preserve us faithful in the way
All our days, never to fall away.
By Your grace, keep us pursuing You,
Taking up the cross to follow You.
Consecrate we unreservedly,
Absolute for You entirely.
In our hearts, Lord, let the highways be
Unto Zion single-heartedly.
 
  Now we will follow Him!
  To His call we’re answering,
  All we are we’re offering.
  New Jerusalem we see
  Come down from heav’n to earth!
  God and man mingled now,
  Our oneness we avow
  Eternally, O gloriously!
  This is where the Lamb would lead!

Come, in telling Jesus all.

5
It is the breath of God as strength to man,
Power divine to man it doth transmit,
Strength'ning the weak, empowering the faint,
Enabling man God's purpose full to fit.

6
It is the breath of God for us to breathe,
That as our portion God we may enjoy;
Receiving it by spirits exercised,
Our need is met, His wealth we may employ.

songs.title: God the Lord has spoken, God has been unveiled
songs.lyrics:
1
God the Lord has spoken, God has been unveiled;
All His character and persons are expressed;
Unto Adam's sons His mystery is revealed,
Fully illustrated and made manifest.

2
God the Lord has spoken, and His heart disclosed,
That His Son should have pre-eminence in all,
That in His dear Son He might be glorified
Midst all His creation, either great or small.

3
God the Lord has spoken, Christ has been revealed;
He is very God and yet is truly man;
He is all in all, in Him all things subsist,
Center and circumference of th' eternal plan.

4
God the Lord has spoken, and His mystery shown,
Christ and His expression has His counsel willed:
Christ with all God's fulness as the glorious Head,
And the Church His Body, with His riches filled.

5
God the Lord has spoken, and from heaven shown
The triune God would blend with creature-man:
Father in the Son, the Son the Spirit is,
Dwelling in the Body to fulfill His plan.

6
God the Lord has spoken, revelation giv'n
Of His vast creation and His lowly birth,
Of His great redemption and salvation full;
May His adoration ever fill the earth.

songs.lyrics:
1

songs.title: Complete in Thee! No work of mine
songs.lyrics:
1
[A]Complete in Th[D]ee! No work of m[Em]ine
May take, dear L[A]ord, the pl[A7]ace of Th[D]ine;
Thy bl[G]ood hath p[D]ardon b[D7]ought for m[G]e,
And [Em]I am n[D]ow compl[A7]ete in Th[D]ee.

  Yea, j[G]ustif[D]ied! O blessed th[A]ought!
  And sanctif[A7]ied! Salvation wr[D]ought!
  Thy blood hath p[G]ardon b[D7]ought for m[G]e,
  And gl[E]orif[D]ied, I t[A7]oo, shall b[D]e!

2
Complete in Thee—no more shall sin,
Thy grace hath conquered, reign within;
Thy voice shall bid the tempter flee,
And I shall stand complete in Thee.

3
Complete in Thee—each want supplied,
And no good thing to me denied;
Since Thou my portion, Lord, wilt be,
I ask no more, complete in Thee.

4
Dear Savior! When before Thy bar
All tribes and tongues assembled are,
Among Thy chosen will I be,
At Thy right hand—complete in Thee.

songs.title: Take, drink this cup, His blood
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Take, drink this cup, His bl[D]ood,      
Red[Em]emption [D]of our G[G]od.      
The peace which Christ has m[D]ade,      
Is [Em]in this c[D]up displ[G]ayed.      
We fellowship now w[C]ith the Son:      
On C[D]alvary the w[Em]ork was done:      
The w[C]ay is clear, now [D7]all can c[G-C-G]ome!

2
Take, drink this cup, each one,
His death show till He come.
Eat, drink, display this feast:
God in the Lamb released!
Around the table, sup and dine;
We eat the bread and drink the wine.
All blessing in this cup we find.

3
No blood of cow or goat
Could give us any hope.
Our sins would all remain
Still year by year the same.
A God-man, sinless, He must find—
No other offering of His kind,
A spotless lamb for all mankind.

4
Come! Now enjoy His blood.
What access this to God!
Here wondrous cleansing power
Flows to us, hour by hour.
One sacrifice for all was made,
And peace our conscience does pervade.
Redemption's price is fully paid!

5
Redeemer! Savior! King!
Of Thy dear blood we sing,
For in it now we see
Thy mercy, boundless, free.
This cup, our portion blessed of God,
Is of the cov'nant in Thy blood—
Dear, precious, precious, priceless blood!

songs.title: I've been redeemed!
songs.lyrics:
I've been re[D]deemed by the blood of the Lamb 
I've been re[A]deemed by the blood of the [D-D7]Lamb 
I've been re[G]deemed by the blood of the Lamb,
Filled with the [D]Holy Spirit I [Bm]am!

But that's not all - there's more besides.

songs.title: Kiss the Son, kiss the One
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3 
  Kiss the [G]Son, kiss the [Em]One
  Who for [C]love to me has [D]come,
  Cheering [G]me, charming [Em]me,
  And has [C]died upon the [D]tree,
  He died for [G]me, saving [Em]me,
  Now His [C]Spirit joins to [D]me,
  I’ve kissed the [G]Son!

1
[C(+9)] Serving in my mingled [D]spirit
[C(+9)] In the gospel of His So[G]n,
[Em] First receiving Christ the [C]Spirit;
[Am] He’s the processed Triune [D]One.

2
Jesus Christ in our experience
Is the worship God desires;
This true worshipping in spirit
Is the service God requires.

3
Serving Christ, just let Him kiss you,
Living with Him all the day,
Worshipping God by our living
Is the gospel-serving way.

4
In the Body let us serve Him,
Nothing natural, there, can be;

songs.title: In the church the sound of life upon our ear is falling
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]In the church the sound of life u[D7]pon our ear is f[G]alling,
[C]Then we see the [G]joy of Christ ex[A7]pressed on every [D7]hand;
[G]Babylon and things of earth in v[D7]ain to us are c[G]alling.
[C]We are home for[G]ever in Ch[D]rist [D7]our [G]land.

  We're churching in the Spirit
  On the ch[D]urch's local ground;
  We're ch[D7]urching with our b[G]rothers,
  Our f[A7]amily we have f[D]ound.
  Oh, yes, we're ch[G]urching with the ch[G7]urches,
  and we'll m[C]ake the earth re[G]sound
  With hallelujahs for Ch[D]rist our l[G]and!

2
Far away our background seems with all its gifts and teaching,
Farther still, the worldly things with all their foul demand;
As the love of Jesus Christ our inmost heart is reaching,
Not a thing can move us from Christ our land.

3
"I will build My church upon this rock," said the Lord Jesus,
And we see the building of His purpose and His plan;
Setting members in the Body as Himself it pleases,
Building us together in Christ our land.

4
Now the Lord's recovery is everywhere proceeding,
All the churches join in one to give the Lord command:
"Speed the day when all the earth will echo with pray-reading
And with hallelujahs for Christ our land."

songs.title: Dear Lord, Thou art so much to us
songs.lyrics:
1
Dear Lord, Thou art so much to us
Thou art our all in all;
What Thou art fully meets our needs,
Though they be great or small.
Our hearts appreciate what Thou art,
Our spirits worship Thee;
Our grateful praise to Thee we give
As we Thy riches see.

2
Thou art the Prophet raised by God,
With pow'r for God to speak;
Like Moses, Thou God's plan hast shown,
That we God's will may seek.
Thou art like Jonah sent by God,
To enter death and live,
That by this sign of death and life,
We may in Thee believe.

3
Thou art the Prophet raised from men,
To speak with pow'r and light;
Thou, like Elisha, filled with love,
Thy miracles in might.
Thou, like Isaiah, full of grace,
God's Christ dost e'er reveal,
That we may share this Christ of all
As life both rich and real.

4
Thou art the Priest from us to God,
The holy Priest for us,
Like Aaron called of God from men,
For us Thou servest thus.
In love Thou bearest us to God,
The great High Priest to serve;
With love Thou intercedest there
And dost with strength preserve.

5
Thou art the Priest from God to us,
The royal Priest of God;
Like Salem's King, Melchisedec,
The minister of God.
With bread and wine Thou cam'st from God
To us in time of need;
Thou cam'st with God that we in Him
Might fully share indeed.

6
Thou art the King as David was,
And God's desire dost seek;
The battle fought, the foe subdued,
God's heart Thou dost bespeak.
Thou art empowered on the throne,
Not with a human rod,
But with authority divine
To reign for us and God.

7
Thou art the King like Solomon,
Whose rule with peace was filled;
With wisdom Thou dost reign in pow'r
And Thou God's house dost build.
As King unseen Thou reignest now
Among Thy saints with love;
One day, when Thou shalt reign with us,
Thou wilt Thy kingship prove.

8
As King and Priest and Prophet too,
How precious, Lord, art Thou;
Thy worth to God, Thy worth to us,
We all with love avow.
O how we treasure what Thou art,
Our hearts are drawn by Thee;
To Thee we'll give our thanks and praise
Throughout eternity.

songs.title: Every today that we have is truly the Lord's grace
songs.lyrics:
Capo 2

1
[A]Every "today" that we h[D]ave
is t[E]ruly the Lord's gr[A]ace;
As long as we have tod[D]ay,
and as l[E]ong as we still have br[A]eath,

As an enc[E]ouragement

2

is t[E]ruly the Lord's gr[A]ace;

and as l[E]ong as we still have br[A]eath,

Lord, we pray You'd come back tod[D]ay

songs.title: Lord, You are beloved, Fairest of the fair
songs.lyrics:
1
[A]Lord, You are be[F#m]loved, [D]Fairest of the [E]fair;
[A]Altogether l[F#m]ovely, un[D]rivaled beaut[E]y;
[D]It’s You! Your [A]presence, I [D]long for and [A]seek.
[E]You’re the One [F#m]in whom my [D]heart delights,
So, [E]I just love to tell You:

  [A]Jesus, I [D]love You,
  My t[A]reasure, You [D]are.
  [F#m]How could I choose a[E]nything
  [A]less than [D]You?
  Dear [A]Lord, my in[F#m]most heart
  You’ve [E]captured and [A-D-A]won.

2
Dead I was in sin, Lord,
So lost without You.
Helpless, wounded, weary,
Rebellious, too.
But Lord, You came!
You would not let me go.
The blood and water flowed from Your side,
Constraining me to tell You:

3
Thank You Lord, You opened
My blind eyes to see.
I was lame, but now I can walk.
You healed me!
My leprosy, Lord, You cleansed all away.
My ears were opened to hear Your voice,
And now I follow You ‘cause:

4
Sometimes Lord, I’m drawn off
By my selfish cares.
And the world it draws me
With glitter and glare.
O Lord, You’ve trapped me.
Don’t let me go.
Kiss me and woo me, and win my heart,
So, I will always tell You:

5
Keep my heart so soft,
Lord, so open to You;
It would be the good ground
to bear fruit for You.
Capture my friends, Lord, and
Build us, I pray,
Your Bride, we’d match You in every way,
And, corporately we tell You:

  Jesus, come quickly,
  We’re waiting for You.
  We’re the virgins to You,
  So single and true.
  Forever and ever Your counterpart true.

songs.title: In nothing be anxious, but in everything (Phil 4:6-7)

1
[C]Is it raining, [F]little [C]flower?
Oh, be glad of [G]rain!

songs.title: The steadfast love of the Lord
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

  I’m hurting! I’m dy[F#m]ing! Does an[A]yone care?  [Bm]
  I have an urgen[F#m]t need!  [Bm]
  But sadly it seem[F#m]s that no on[A]e is aware.[D]

2
Wait, a priest I see!
Descending like me. My case he’ll claim!
He passes by me,
Then comes a Levite and does the same.

  I thought they would help me!
  They seemed to serve God and to honor His name.
  Religion is empty!
  It cannot heal me. All my wounds still remain.

3
A Samaritan
Comes upon me and observes my plight.
Moved with compassion
He treats my wounds, binding them just right.

  Lord Jesus You found me!
  You poured oil and wine on my wounds, them to heal!
  You put me on Your beast!
  At last! Here is kindness and tenderness real.

4
Now I’m in the inn,
The church, with all those under Your care.
And now I begin
To find some others still in despair.

  Lord, bring in more wounded!
  Those without the Spirit and the life divine.
  That they could be added,
  And at Your return, the same care You would find.

songs.title: I have learned the wondrous secret

For my ways His ceaseless presence

Of my heart, He is the portion,
Of my joy the boundless spring;
Savior, Sanctifier, Healer,
Glorious Lord, and coming King.

songs.lyrics:
1

2

3

4

songs.title: Onward Christian soldiers
songs.lyrics:
1
Onward Christian soldiers!
Marching as to war,

Going on before.
Christ, the royal Master,
Leads against the foe;
Forward into battle,
See, His banner go!

  Marching as to war,
  With the cross of Jesus
  Going on before.

Satan's host doth flee;

On to victory!
Hell's foundations quiver
At the shout of praise:
Brothers, lift your voices,
Loud your anthems raise!

3
Like a mighty army
Moves the Church of God:
Brothers, we are treading
Where the saints have trod;
We are not divided,
All one Body we—
One in faith and Spirit,
One eternally.

Kingdoms rise and wane;
But the Church of Jesus
Constant will remain.
Gates of hell can never

We have Christ's own promise,
Which can never fail.

Onward, then, ye people!
Join our happy throng;
Blend with ours your voices
In the triumph song.
Glory, laud and honor
Unto Christ, the King;
This through countless ages
Men and angels sing.

songs.title: Thou art God's testimony, Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
Thou art God's testimony, Lord,
Much better than the law;
The law in letter was engraved,
In it Thy type men saw.
A definition was the law,
God's picture to provide;
But Thou art God's reality,
In Thee doth God abide.

2
The ark of testimony too
Was but a type of Thee;
In it the law of God was placed,
But God in Thee we see.
The ark, in type, was made of wood
And. overlaid with gold;
It typifies Thee as a man,
Who God in full doth hold.

3
Thou art the tabernacle too,
God's holy dwelling place;
Incarnate in the flesh Thou art,
And full of truth and grace.
God's glory we behold in Thee,
Thou art the Word divine;
Thy words and deeds of love and light
Do God in life define.

4
The temple was a type of Thee;
The house of God Thou art;
God dwells in Thee, Himself to show,
His fulness to impart.
Though Thou by Satan wast destroyed
And numbered with the dead,
In resurrection Thou dost build
A larger one instead.

5
The city shows Thy fulness true,
A figure of Thy Bride,
The increase of Thyself in full,
In whom Thou dost abide.
In Thee is God, the light divine,
The lamp in her art Thou;
With Thee God shines thru her on all,
His glory to avow.

6
The tabernacle and the ark,
The law within them stored,
The temple and the city too,
Are all Thyself, dear Lord.
Thou art the hub, Thou art the rim,
The all in all Thou art!
In Thee we see both God and man,
How precious to our heart!

  Lord, I [F]come to[C] You,
  Lord, I [G]answer [Em]You;
  Lord, just [F]keep me here so [C]close.
  Not an [G]empty [Am]prayer, but [Em]all for [Dm]You--

songs.title: The Triune God- a mystery (Lord, I want to understand)
songs.lyrics:
#capo 4
[~ = CM13/G]                       [All Cs = C/G]
#(Indented stanzas are sung differently)


1
  The [C]Triune [CM7]God- a [~]myste[CM7]ry.
  [C]God is [CM7]one; He’s[~] also [CM7]three.
  My [Dm7]finite mind can’t comprehend.
  [G]Lord, I [Gadd11]want to [G]under[Gadd11-G]stand!

2
In the beginning we can see:
God put man in a garden to eat.
God didn’t teach, or give doctrine;
He just wanted man to take Him in, (but)

3
Satan came into man instead.
Brought into man his sin and death. 
The right to the tree of life: cut off.
Man no longer could take in God!

4
God didn’t give up or restart, (but)
Sin’s in the way, keeping us apart.
Who though, could bear our sins for us? (The)
Father God gave His only Son!

5
Jesus: His name- a perfect man, (with the)
Likeness of the flesh of sin,
Bore our sins, crucified on the cross;
Sin is condemned, we are dead to the law!

6
By Jesus’ death we’re justified, (but)
Where is the life of God inside?
In resurrection Christ became
A Spirit Who is life-giving.

7
The Spirit was there since eternity past, (but)
Now He can mingle with man at last!
Jesus was with the disciples and He
Breathed His Spirit into them!

8
  The Triune God- a mystery,
  It's starting to be revealed to me.
  God is three for His eternal plan;
  The processed God now dwells in man!

9
Jesus had made their spirit His home, (and)
Before He ascended to the throne;
He told the disciples, at that hour, 
“From on high you’ll put on power” (so)

10
Praying steadfastly in the upper room
The Spirit, upon them, was outpoured; (an)
Outward filling- the empowering: (for)
God’s move on earth economically!

11
The Spirit of power’s been outpoured, (so)
Whenever you need divine support…
The Lord is rich to all who call!
Call His name! The One above all!

12
  Jesus Christ, Lord Jesus Christ,
  Fill me with Your life divine!
  Jesus Christ, Lord Jesus Christ,
  O Lord Jesus, Jesus Christ!

13
The Triune God- revealed to me!
Understanding is not my need!
Why limit God to your feeble mind? (you can)
Use your spirit- eat the tree of life!

14
I want to eat the tree of life!
Christ Himself- my life supply!
The tree of knowledge runs me dry;
God in my spirit satisfies!

15
  Oh Lord Jesus, Jesus Christ,
  You're the One who satisfies.
  Remind me to wash my robe all the time
  That I’d have right to the tree of life!

16
  Jesus Christ, Lord Jesus Christ!
  I want to abide where Your presence shines.
  Jesus Christ, Lord Jesus Christ!
  Oh Lord Jesus! Jesus Christ!



#1 Tim 2:5; Matt 28:19; Gen 2:8-9, 16, 3:6, 4:7, 22, 24; John 3:16; Rom 8:3; 1 Pet 2:24; Rom 7:4; Rom 5:18; 1 Cor 15:45; Heb 9:14; Psa 90:2; John 20:22; Eph 3:11; 2 Cor 3:15; Rom 8:10, 16; Luke 24:49; Acts 1:13-14; 2:2-4, 16-18, 21; Rom 10:12; Eph 1:20-21; Job 32:8; Rev 22:14

songs.title: 'Tis only a little branch
songs.lyrics:
#John 15:5
'Tis [G]only a little [Em]branch, [Am]
A [Am7]thing so [D7]fragile and [G]weak,
But that little branch hath a [Em]message [Am]true
To [Am7]give, could it [D7]only [G]speak.

  I'm [Em]only a little [C]branch,
  I [G]live by a life not [D]mine,
  For the [Bm]sap that ﬂows through my 
  [Em]tendrils [C]small
  Is the [G]life-blood [D]of the [G]Vine.

No power indeed have I
The fruit of myself to bear,
But since I'm part of the living Vine,
It's fruitfulness I share.

  Dost thou ask how I abide?
  How this life I can maintain? —
  I am bound to the Vine by life’s strong 
  band,
  And I only need remain.

Where first my life was given,
In the spot where I am set,
Upborne and upheld as the days go by,
By the stem which bears me yet.

  I fear not the days to come,
  I dwell not upon the past,
  As moment by moment I draw a life,
  Which for evermore shall last.

I bask in the sun’s bright beams,
Which with sweetness fills my fruit,
Yet I own not the clusters hanging there,
For they all come from the root.

  A life which is not my own,
  But another’s life in me:
  This is the message the branch would 
  speak,
  A message to thee and me.

Oh, struggle not to “abide,”
Nor labor to “bring forth fruit,”
But let Jesus unite thee to Himself,
As the Vine branch to the root.

  So simple, so deep, so strong
  That union with Him shall be:
  His life shall forever replace thine own,
  And His love shall flow through thee.

For His Spirit’s fruit is love,
And love shall thy life become,
And for evermore on His heart of love
Thy spirit shall have her home.

  While here in loving remembrance

Brought forth in measureless grace;
Thou art our cover and glory,

songs.lyrics:

1

3

4

5

6

Flow through me, Lord, till naught in earth or heaven,

[D]But he suffered loss[G] and affliction ac[Bm]cording to God’s plan. [A]
[D]Job thought that this[G] was unfair, so [Bm]he and God had a chat. [A]
[D]What was hidden deep[G] in God’s heart, and w[Bm]hy would God let him go[A] through that? [A7]
2
[D]The mystery hidden in God’[G]s heart is God’[Bm]s eternal eco[A]nomy.
[D]His heart’s desire’s to dis[G]pense Himself[Bm] into all of His cho[A]sen people
[D]To be our life and na[G]ture that we[Bm] might be the same[A] as He is,
[D]His duplication, an or[G]ganism, the Bod[Bm]y for God’s full[A]ness—His expres[D]sion.[D7]
3
[G]See God has a pur[A]pose in br[F#m]inging His loved ones through [Bm]suffering;
[G]His goal is that we’d be [A]emptied and our heart[D] would be wide [D7]open to gain Him.
[G]So when you’re suf[A]fering just s[F#m]eek God to gain in you [Bm]what He’s after,
[G]Then the life of Christ[A] comes in. [D]

songs.title: God our Father, we adore Thee, for the sake of righteousness
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]God our Father, [G]we ad[A]ore T[D]hee,
[G]For the sake of [E7]righteousn[A]ess;
[D]Thou in Christ hast j[G]ustif[A]ied [D]us,
[G]Who our conscience [E7]can depr[A]ess?
[A]Thou art righteous, and art faithful,
[D]On Thy righteous[E7]ness we st[A]and;
[D]No unrighteousn[G]ess is [D]in Thee,
[A]None can t[D]urn Thy r[A]ight[A7]eous h[D]and.

2
Thou hast laid our sins on Jesus,
By Thy justice He was killed;
All Thy holy law's requirements
For Thy justice He fulfilled.
Recompense from Him receiving,
Thou art fully satisfied;
How couldst Thou, O God most righteous,
Claim it once more from our side?

3
Father God, Thou hast accepted
Jesus as our Substitute;
Judged the Just One for the unjust,
Couldst Thou change Thy attitude?
As a proof of perfect justice,
At Thine own right hand He sits;
He, as Thy full satisfaction,
Righteously Thy need befits.

4
Father, through the blood of Jesus
We possess Thy righteousness;
By Thy righteousness protected,
None can shake our steadfastness.
Righteousness of Thine Thou mad'st us,
None can ever us condemn;
We'll forever testify this
In the new Jerusalem.

songs.title: And a Man will Be
songs.lyrics:
#Isaiah 32:2
[C]And a man will [Am]be 
Like a [F]refuge from the [C]wind
And a [Am]covering from the [Em]tempest[F],
Like [G]streams of water[C]
In a [Am]dry place,
[F]Like the shadow [G]of a [C]massive [Am]rock
[F]In a wasted [G]land.

songs.title: Grant us a vision clear to see
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
[G]Grant us a vision c[Am]lear to [D]see
We need a [D7]new hu[G]manity;
F[B]rom all our [Em]nature, [B]we must be f[Em]ree;
[A]Eating of Jesus [A7]is the [D7]key!

  Br[G]eathing this man with[Am]in the W[D]ord,
  Calling with th[D7]em who [G]call "O Lord";
  [G]Eating this m[G7]an in [C]one acc[A7]ord—
  Bre[G]athe, [D7]call and e[C]at! [G]

2
Our flesh for building is no good;
God's house must have acacia wood!
Christ's human life is balanced and fine,
And it's adorned with gold divine.

  We want to stand as boards so strong,
  Held by the bars where we belong;
  To be the church for which You long—
  One full-grown man!

3
Satan's one aim: to ruin man,
Man, who's the center of God's plan!
But man will rule the earth utterly,
Conquering every enemy.

  Each time we turn and eat this man
  We put an end to Satan's plan.
  Jesus through His humanity
  Has conquered all!

songs.title: It's so easy to love the Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]It's so [D]easy to [Em]love the [D]Lord.
[G]It's so [D]easy to [C]love th[G]e Lord.
It's so [D]easy to [Em]love the [D]Lord.
[G]It's so [D]easy to [C]love the [G]Lord.

  It's so easy, it's so easy—A[D-G]men.
  It's so [D]easy, it's so easy—[G]love Him.
  It's so [C]easy, it's so [Am]easy—A[C]me[D]n.
  It's so [Em]easy, it's so[C] easy—[D]love [A]Him.
  [G]It's so [D]easy to [C]love the [G]Lord.

2
When we call on Him we see,
Just how beautiful is He.
Just one look—it is enough,
For us all to fall in love.

3
Nothing else I need to do,
Just to "stop" and look anew.
Swells my heart with love divine,
When His Spirit flows in mine.

4
There's no need to dwell on sin,
In His blood we've entered in.
Now in spirit we are free,
To enjoy reality!

5
Crazy love is filling me!
I don't care what I will be!
Only one thing matters still,
Lord e'en more my spirit fill!

songs.title: The Epistle to Titus is the conclusion
songs.lyrics:
1
The Epistle to [D]Titus is the conc[A]lusion
of the three [A7]books,
1st and 2nd Timothy and [D]Titus,
and it conc[D7]ludes with the wonderful f[G]aith[Em]
and the [D]super-[A]excellent l[D]ove[D7].

2
This implies that, [G]in the current of
the church’s [D]degradation,
in o[A]rder to be a[A7]ble
to ef[D]fectively stand [D7]firm
and overc[G]ome the downward trend
and factor [D]in the [Bm]church,
this wonderful [A]faith
and this super-excellent [A7]love

3
[D]We should not walk by sight
[A]or care for the outward situation.
[A7]Rather, in this wonderful faith

[D7]which is the Triune God,
[G]to whom we have been joined

[]and all those who belong to Him.
[A]Only in this way can we become,
in the [D]current of the church’s degra[D7]dation,

songs.title: Laboring on Jesus, the good land so real
songs.lyrics:
1
[F]Laboring on [C]Jesus, the [Bb]good land so [F]real,
[C]Plowing and [Dm]planting and [G]watering the [C]field[C7].
[F]He yields the [C]produce of [Bb]reali[A]ty,
[Gm]God reaps [G]a [F]harves[Dm]t of [F]Jesus [C7]in m[F]e.

  O Jesus! [C7]You're God's [F]good land
  For [Gm]me to [D7]labor [Gm]on!
  I'll [C]bit by [C7]bit pos[F]sess You
  Un[G7]til the whole is [C7]won!
  With [F]Canaan [C7]is God's [F]purpose,
  The [F7]labor He will [Bb]bless;
  Lord Jesus, here I [F]gain Your[D7]self,
  Your [Gm]Person [C7]to pos[F]sess.

2
Laboring on Jesus! My heart has been set,
Labor's begun, and I have no regret,
For with my labor God's sending the rain,
And all my labor on Christ yields much gain.

3
Laboring on Jesus this practical way—
Praying His Word in the spirit each day,
Foll'wing His living anointing within,
Built up with others, the church life to win.

4
Laboring on Jesus yields reality,
Meetings of fullness for all men to see;
There God and man are indeed satisfied,
And there God's presence cannot be denied.

5
Labor on Jesus to have Him increased!
Then seek God's dwelling and come to the feast!
There bring and offer your surplus to God,
There eat the riches, rejoice in the Lord!

songs.title: Breath by breath we breathe the Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
Breath by breath we breathe the Lord. 
Amen! Amen!
Breath by breath He quickens us. 
Amen! Amen!
Yes, He breathes out and we breathe in,
And deeply flows His life within,
For we’ve all learned how to
deeply breathe the Lord.

2
John 3:8  speaks of the air
without, without;
The wind blows where it wills, it wills,
without, without.
We cannot tell from where it comes,
We cannot tell to where it runs —
So is everyone who’s of the Spirit born.

3
John 20:22  speaks of
the Air within.
Jesus breathed the Breath of Life
from Him, from Him!
He only asks us to receive —
’Tis not to think but only breathe —
And it’s by this breath that we experience life!

4
Now wherever we may be
there’s Air, there’s Air!
It surrounds, envelops us —
it’s everywhere!
Available, so rich and free
That we might live abundantly —
So brothers, sisters, breathe the breath of life.

5
Just by calling on His name:
O Lord! O Lord!
Christ becomes the breath to us:
O Lord! O Lord!
We breathe His name from deep within
And breathe until we’re filled with Him,
And what a breath this Jesus is to us!

songs.title: Jesus, Thou Joy of loving hearts
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Jesus, Thou Joy of [A]loving hearts,
T[A7]hou Fount of l[D]ife, Thou [E7]Light of m[A]en,
Fr[A]om the best bl[D]iss that earth imp[G]arts,
We turn unfilled to [A7]Thee ag[D]ain.

2
Thy truth unchanged hath ever stood;
Thou savest those that on Thee call;
To them that seek Thee, Thou art good,
To them that find Thee, all in all!

3
We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,
And long to feast upon Thee still;
We drink of Thee, the Fountain-head,
And thirst our souls from Thee to fill!

4
Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,
Where'er our changeful lot is cast;
Glad when Thy gracious smile we see,
Blest, when our faith can hold Thee fast.

5
O Lord, be Thou our strength and stay!
Make all our moments calm and bright,
Chase all dark thoughts of sin away,
Shed o'er us here Thy holy light.

songs.title: I heard the voice of the Lord
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

1
I [G]heard the voice of the Lord
Saying [C]whom shall I [D]send?
I [C]heard the [D]voice of the [Em]Lord
Saying [C]who will [D]go for [G]Us?

  And I said I'm here send me [C]Lord
  I [G]pour out the cost of my [D]life
  My [G]future is vain
  My [C]destiny's Christ
  [G]Christ is [D]everyth[G]ing

2
The people who know their God
Will rise up and show strength
People who thus know their God
Will take action and move

  We will spread You Lord through the earth
  Lord make us faithful to the end
  Our life and our all
  Be utterly spent
  Spent for the church

3
Who'll bring Your kingdom to come?
These whose hearts are burned with fire
Who will fight the spiritual war?
They descend as mighty ones

  O Lord Jesus capture our hearts
  Lord make Your desire our desire
  Your worth's nothing less 
  than all of our life
  Our life's to bring You back

songs.title: Sitting beside a well
songs.lyrics:
[C G F C repeat]Sitting beside a well
Jesus saw her, a Samaritan
Drawing near, seeking water there.

How He was moved for her,
Empty woman—so dissatisfied.
He spoke a word just to open her.

"I've living water here
That can fill your deepest longing, dear.
Ask of Me, I will give it thee."

  Sir, how Your funny words
  Draw me in the heat of day
  I'm not really seeking
  But You started speaking
  And I cannot turn away

  Now You mention it, Lord,
  I'm really very hot and dry
  Something tells me
  Out of everything I tried
  That You can satisfy

Ah, living water, Lord!
See it running over evermore
Into my wearied, thirsting heart!

Ah, living water, Lord!
Now a Fountain, gushing evermore
Out of my full and bursting heart!

  How drinking living water
  Does generate a spring!
  Keeps running through me
  Now it's coming to me
  Why I cannot help but sing!

  Then to add to it all
  You tell me it's forevermore!
  Don't know how I ever lived before
  But now I want more water Lord!

songs.title: Our Christ is so enjoyable
songs.lyrics:
Our Christ [D]is so enjoyable
His life is [G]so applicable;
He lives in [D]us to cause the [Bm]flow
To reach the [Em]world, His life to sho[A]w.
Don't just sit [D]here and be id[D7]le;
Rise up! Your[G] gift don't belittle,
Let's eat and [D]drink [A]of this sweet [D]Christ.

  Let's enjoy [A]Christ to reach the goal,
  Partake of [D]Him to beat the foe;
  All His vast [A]riches we ext[A7]ol,
  Yes, we are [D]freed from every woe[D7].
  We may not [D]know a lot of things,
  But we are [G]kept from Satan's stings[Em],
  By eating[D] Christ, [A]and Christ al[D]one.

We all can do so many things
But first of all to Christ we'll cling;
Enjoy Him first, blessings He'll bring,
His life supply means everything!
Enjoy Him—grace He will bestow
And we'll be led to join the flow;
Yes, we will do all things in Him.

songs.title: Your Name to Me's a Kiss
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]Your name to me’s a [DM7]kiss to my [Em]ears, I love to [A7]hear.
Your [D]name to me’s the [DM7]bliss that’s so [Em]dear and, yes, so [A7]near.

  Your [D]name, I love to [D7]call, Je[G]sus! Je[Gm]sus!
  Ah, [D]dear Lord[A7] Je[D]sus!

2
Your name to me’s the balm in my pain and when I faint.
Your name to me’s the calm in my chains and in my strains.

3
Your name to me’s the air that I take when I intake.
Your name to me’s the pray’r that I make when I awake.

songs.title: Looking at You, Lord, You’re All I Need
songs.lyrics:
1
Wh[G]ere I am, there You a[Am]re.
In the da[D]rkness[D7], my Morning St[G]ar.
When in si[Em]ckness, You are my hea[C]lth.
When I’m p[Am7]oor, Lord, You’re my [D]wealth.

   [D7]Looking at Y[G]ou Lord, You’re all I n[Am]eed.
   As You fl[D]ow life[D7] to me so fr[G]ee,
   Jesus f[Em]ill me, with grace each [C]day.
   How to go [Am]on, [D7]You are the w[G-C-G]ay.

2
When alone, You’re my song.
In my weakness, Lord, You are strong.
When there’s doubt then, as faith You come.
Now I have hope, You’re the One.

3
In the storms, You’re the calm.
In my pain, Lord, You are the balm.
In self-pity, as light You’ll shine,
Filling me with love divine.

4
Praising You, is my joy.
You’re the pure One, without alloy,
Showing me, Lord, Your wondrous love,
When You came down, from above.

5
Now in me, all in all,
For this living, Your Name I’ll call.

  [Em]Lord, [Dm]You [C]know

songs.title: Like a river, glorious
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[D]Like a [A]river, [D-D7]glorious
[G]Is God's [A]perfect [D]peace,
[D]Over [A]all vic[D]torious
[A]In its [E7]bright in[A]crease;

[Em]Fuller [D]every [A]day,
[D]Perfect, [A]yet it [Bm-E]groweth
[D]Deeper [A]all the [D]way.

  [D]Stayed upon Christ [G]Je[D]sus,
  [Em]Hearts are [D]fully [A]blest;

  [D]Perfect [A]peace and [D]rest.

2
Hidden in the hollow

3

songs.title: Lord Jesus! When we think of Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord Jesus! When we think of Thee,
Of all Thy love and grace,
Our spirits long and fain would see
Thy beauty face to face.

2
And though the wilderness we tread,
A barren, thirsty ground,
With thorns and briars overspread,
Where foes and snares abound;

3
Yet in Thy love such depths we see,
Our hearts o'erflow with praise—
Content ourselves, while, Lord to Thee
A joyful song we raise.

4
Our Lord, our Life, our Rest, our Shield,
Our Rock, our Food, our Light;
Each thought of Thee doth constant yield
Unchanging, fresh delight.

5
Blest Savior, keep our spirit stayed,
Hard following after Thee,
Till we, in victory displayed,
Thy face in glory see.

songs.title: Are you burdened? (I Can't Make, Take, or Fake It)
songs.lyrics:
Are you [G]burdened?
Are you [Em]toiling?
To such [C]ones the Lord says, Come to [D]Me.

Lord, I'm coming.
I'm returning.
Casting all anxieties at Your feet.
 
  I can't [G]make it,
  I can't [Em]take it,
  I can't [C]fake it, Lord, so I need [D]You.
  To be the [G]One in me,
  Always [Em]living, 
  Lord, right [C]now I [D]take You as my [G]life.

Your yoke is easy.
The load, not heavy.
Just come and learn - for You said, "I am meek".

Lord, You're living,
And I'm resting,
I just let You win and do everything in me.

# Matt 11:28-30

songs.title: In the Beginning, God (John 1:1-5)
songs.lyrics:
[C]In the be[G]ginning[Am] was the [F]Word,[C]
And the [G]Word was with [Am]God,
[F]And the Word was [C]God.

[C]He was [G]in the beginning with [Am]God[F] {and}

[F]And [G-Am]apart from [Em]Him not [F]one thing
came [C]into being[F] which has [G]come into [C]being.[C7-F]

In [G]Him was [C]life,[Am]
And the [F]life was the [G]light of [C]men.[C7-F]

songs.title: Savior, I by faith am touching
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Savior, [Dm]I by faith am [G]touching
Thee, the [Dm]source of [G]every [C]good;

  Touching [G7]Thee, new life is [C]glowing
  By Thy [G]Spirit's burning [C]flame;[C7]
  Cleansing, [F]purging, Spirit [C]filling,

2
Touching Thee in faith, I take Thee
In Thy riches full and free;

3

4

songs.title: After breakfast on the seashore
songs.lyrics:
1
After [C]breakfast [G]on the [C]seashore,
Jesus [Dm7]set ab[C]out to [G]restore
Peter's [Dm7]love, that [C]he would [G]henceforth
Not trust himself,[G7]
He com[C]mitted [G]some big [C]failures,
Three times [Dm7]deny[C]ing the [G]Savior,
Then lea[Dm7]ding oth[C]ers to [G]waver,
Yet Jesus said...[G7]

  Do you [Am]love Me?[F] Feed My [C]lam[G]bs,
  Do you [Am]love Me?[F] Shepherd M[C]y [G]sheep,
  [F]Do [E7]you [Am]love [F]Me?

2
We, like Peter, all have stumbled,

In these moments the Lord comes in,

  Lord I love You! I'll shepherd Your sheep,

songs.title: For I Make Known
songs.lyrics:
[C]For I make kno[Em]wn to you, brothers, conc[Am]erning the g[Dm]ospel 
[C]Announced by[Em] me, that it is not ac[Am]cording to ma[F]n

For neither did I receive it from man, nor was I taught it
But I received it through a revelation by Jesus Christ

But when it pleased God, who set me apart from my mother’s womb
Who called me through His grace

To reveal His Son in me that I might announce Him 
as the gospel among the Gentiles

And they glorified God because of me

#Galatians 1:11,12,15,16,24

songs.title: Christ Has Proclaimed the Jubilee
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

My whole being would be outpoured

Shepherding every part
Of my soul, gain me in full
Let every move be toward Your goal

  So I could see
  Where You stand
  From where I am
  So I'd recieve
  The reality
  Then from there, lead me
  Into Your peace

Lord, You are so wonderful
Mighty One, so powerful
Comforter, counselor
All You are, to You I turn

A sinner saved by grace,
When thy sweet message came.

3
My hardened heart was touched;
Thy pard'ning voice I heard;
And joy and peace came in
While list'ning to Thy word.

4
So let me sing Thy praise,
So let me call Thee mine.
I cannot doubt Thy word,
I know that I am Thine.

songs.title: Of Him whence grace and truth did spring
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2
1
Of [C]Him whence grace and truth did spring,
We're [F]at the [G]fountain [C]drinking;
This [C]Christ we'll ever praise and sing,
Here [F]in the [G]church, His [C]home!

  [C]Glo[F]ry to [C]God! We're [F]at the [G]fountain [C]drinking!
  [C]Glo[F]ry to [C]God! We're [F]in the [G]church, our [C]home!

2
Ask but His grace, and lo, 'tis giv'n,
We're at the fountain drinking;
Seek but Himself, the heaven of heaven,
And find Him here at home!

3
Though Satan fights with all his power,
We're at the fountain drinking;
He'll not prevail, not one short hour,
Against the church, our home!

4
Athirst we to this spring do fly,
We're at the fountain drinking;
Drink deep, this well will not run dry!
It's in the church, our home!

songs.title: Days grew dark, oh God
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

1
[C]Days grew dark, oh God
Cords of Sheol sur[Em]rounded me
The [Dm]snares of death came [G]forth
Destruction had as[C]sailed on me
And [Am]in my deep distress
I called u[C]pon His name
He [Dm]heard my voice, de[G]scended d[G7]own
And saved me [C]by His hand

  [Am]I will call on [C]You
  For [F]You will answer [C]me
  [Dm]God hears me, s[G]peak to [G7]Thee
  My refuge’s [C]in Your love

2
God is my retreat
I’m the pupil of His eye
My crag, my rock, my shield
My strength is God, in Him I lie
The shadow of His wings
Is now the place I hide
His presence here, my comfort here
All by one simple word

3
God I know one thing
You’re the song within my heart
You are a boundless stream
You flow in me to my delight
Oh just fill me now
Satisfaction’s in Your life
I want to stay, here with You
Salvation’s in Your name

songs.title: On that same night, Lord Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
On that same night, Lord Jesus,
When all around Thee joined
To cast its darkest shadow
Across Thy holy mind,
We hear Thy voice, blest Savior,
"This do, remember me",
With grateful hearts responding,
We do remember Thee.

2
The depth of all Thy suffering
No heart could e'er conceive,
The cup of wrath o'erflowing
For us Thou didst receive;
And, oh, of God forsaken
On the accursed tree;
With grateful hearts, Lord Jesus,
We now remember Thee.

3
We think of all the darkness
Which round Thy spirit pressed,
Of all those waves and billows,
Which rolled across Thy breast.
Oh, there Thy grace unbounded
And perfect love we see;
With joy and sorrow mingling,
We would remember Thee.

4
We know Thee now as risen,
The Firstborn from the dead;
We see Thee now ascended,
The Church's glorious Head.
In Thee by grace accepted,
The heart and mind set free
To think of all Thy sorrow,
And thus remember Thee.

5
Till Thou shalt come in glory,
And call us hence away,
To rest in all the brightness
Of that unclouded day,
We show Thy death, Lord Jesus,
And here would seek to be
More to Thy death conformed,
While we remember Thee.

songs.title: Lord, I give my heart to You, Surrender myself unto Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Lord, I [Am]give my [F]heart to [Am]You,
Sur[F]render [G]myself unto [Am-G]Thee;
[C]Love [Am]pours from the [F]depths of my [Am]being;
My [F]King, my [G]Husband, my [G]Lord.

  [C]Your soft [Em]voice, [Am]Your loving[Em]kindness
  [F]Draws me [C]closer to [G]You.
  [C]Your love con[Em]strains me; [Am]caught in Your [Em]beauty.
  Lord, [F]there’s none more [G]worthy than [C]You.

2
Together, one united,
The Bridegroom and His bride;
Lord, I want to be Your companion
The way that You’ve become mine.

songs.title: Eat This Scroll (Ezekiel 3:1-3)
songs.lyrics:
#Ezekiel 3:1-3
#Capo 3

[Bm]Then He said to [C]me,
Son of [G]man, eat what you [D]find[Bm]
Eat this [C]scroll, Son of [G]man,

And [Em]go! Go [C]speak!

  And He [C]gave me that [G]scroll to [D]eat[Em]
  And I [C]ate it, just [G]like ho[D]ney[Em]
  In my [C]mouth, like [G]honey, [D]so s[G]weet!

songs.title: Lord, we thank Thee for the table
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
L[D]ord, we thank Thee [Bm]for the t[Em]able,      
W[D]ith the br[G]ead and w[A7]ith the w[D]ine;      
At this table [Bm]we enj[Em]oy Thee      
[D]As the f[A7]east of love div[D]ine.      
[A]We part[A7]ake the br[D]ead, the emblem      
[A]Of Thy b[A7]ody g[D]iv'n for us;      
[D]And we share the w[G]ine, the s[D]ymbol      
[G]Of Thy bl[D]ood Thou sh[A7]edd'st for [D]us.      

  [D]Lo, the holy tabl[A]e!      
  [A7]With the sacred s[D]ymbols;      
  Its signific[G]ance in [Em]figure       
  [D]Is uns[A7]earchabl[D]e! 

2
By the death of Thy redemption,
That Thy life Thou may impart,
E'en Thyself to us Thou gavest
That we share in all Thou art.
By the bread and wine partaking,
We Thy death display and prove;
Eating, drinking of Thyself, Lord,
We remember Thee with love.

3
By this bread which signifieth
Thy one body mystical,
We commune with all Thy members
In one bond identical.
By this holy cup of blessing,
Cup of wine which now we bless,
Of Thy blood we have communion
With all those who faith possess.

4
Thou art our eternal portion,
Here we take a sweet foretaste;
We are waiting for Thy kingdom,
And Thy coming now we haste.
At Thy coming, in Thy kingdom,
With all saints that overcome,

And Thy loving Bride become.

songs.title: To the lost world minister Christ
songs.lyrics:
1
To the lost [C]world [F]minister [C]Christ,
Not just by [G]word, but by [C]life,
Imparting Christ by [C7]living [F]deeds
To the poor [C]souls [G7]living in [C]strife.

  To the lost world [F]minister [C]Christ,
  By daily [G]walk [G7]making Him [C]known;
  Imparting Christ [C7]by whom we [F]live,
  Share with all [G]men [G7]what you [C]own.

2
To the lost world minister Christ,
The precious One you possess,
Imparting Christ to those you love
As all their gain and success.

3
To the lost world minister Christ,
The very Christ you enjoy,
Imparting Christ to all your friends
As all their boast and their joy.

4
To the lost world minister Christ,
Who is your life and your all,
Imparting Christ to all you meet,
All fallen ones, great or small.

songs.title: Lord, I want to Know You
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Lord, I want to know You
In a [D/F#]deep subjective way,
[Am]Inwardly, in [C]spirit. Save me [D]from this godless age.    
[G]Knowing You by seeing 
Not just [D/F#]hearing of the ear
[Am]Gaining You, re[C]ceiving, feeding
[D]On Your Word so [D7]dear
Til' You ap[C]pe[Em]ar, Til You ap[D]pear.
O Lord ap[C]pe[Em]ar, O Lord ap[D]pear!

  I want to [C]see [Em]You and en[G]joy You [D/F#]Lord
  Partake of [Am]Your divine [C]nature, 
  every[G]da[-  D/F#m]y
  So consti[Am]tute me with [C]Christ
  Fill me with [G]Spirit, [B7]love, and 
  [Em]light,
  To ex[Am]press You  [- D]
  On earth tod[G]ay.

2
It is God's good pleasure
The desire of His heart
That we would express Him by the life that He imparts
You are my Creator
You're the sovereign One - I AM
Triune God dispensing Your divine life into man
Carry out Your plan - carry out Your plan.
Your eternal plan - Your eternal plan.

songs.title: This little light of mine
songs.lyrics:
1
This little light of mine,
I'm going to let it shine!
Oh, this little light of mine,
I'm going to let it shine!
This little light of mine,
I'm going to let it shine!
Let it shine, let it shine, let it shine!

2
All around the neighborhood,
I'm going to let it shine!
All around the neighborhood,
I'm going to let it shine!
All around the neighborhood,
I'm going to let it shine,
Let it shine, let it shine, let it shine!

3
Hide it under a bushel? No!
I'm going to let it shine
Hide it under a bushel? No!
I'm going to let it shine
Hide it under a bushel? No!
I'm going to let it shine
Let it shine, let it shine, let it shine!

4
Don't let Satan blow it out!
I'm going to let it shine
Don't let Satan blow it out!
I'm going to let it shine
Don't let Satan blow it out!
I'm going to let it shine
Let it shine, let it shine, let it shine!

songs.title: Jesus, Lord Jesus! Lord, You're rich to all
songs.lyrics:
1
[F#m]Jesu[Bm]s, Lord [F#m]Jesu[Bm]s!   [G]
Lord, You’re rich to [D]all,[G]
Unto those who [D]call
Your highest [Em7]name above [A]all.
[F#m]Jesu[Bm]s, Lord [F#m]Jesu[Bm]s!   [G]
Oh, Your name most [D]precious![G]
Lord, You are so [D]glorious!
Lord, You’re so [Em7]mar[A]vel[D]ous!

  [Bm]Highest [F#m]name a[G]bove all [D]names!
  [Em]Call on Him and [E7]He will [A]save.
  [G]Jesus, Lord [D]Jesus,
  Oh [G]most [A]precious [D]name!

2
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
Why would Christians feel ashamed
And not call Your precious name?
That is the devil’s scheme.
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
All my friends they tell me
I have changed completely.
You satisfy me thoroughly.

3
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
Calling Your dear Person,
Once I was opposing,
But now I am enjoying.
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
Let me call You all day long.
To the world that’s something wrong.
Your precious name, the sweetest song.

4
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
Oh, the devil’s trembling!
When we all start calling
The enemy we’re crushing!
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
Lord, You’re not a doctrine
In the mind for thinking
But Your dear name’s so refreshing!

5
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
How I love to touch You!
It’s by calling on You!
No other One will do!
Jesus, Lord Jesus!
As I call, I’m drinking,
Triune God partaking.
Lord, You’re my cup of salvation!

songs.title: The Mind Set On The Spirit
songs.lyrics:
1
For the mind set on the flesh is death, is death,
But the mind set on the spirit is life and peace
For the mind set on the flesh is death, to us,
But the mind set on the spirit is life and peace.

Chorus:
Lord we set our mind on the Spirit,
To enjoy a fresh supply of life.
No more in turmoil because of our flesh,
But an inward sense of life and peace.

2
Praise You, Lord we’re freed from sin to
be sanctified by God.
We give You the ground to move in us
Which results in the spreading;
As You spread in us You saturate
Your life throughout our being.
Lord, we thank You for this gift of life
That’s Yours, as ours, forever!

3
When we feel far away from Him
Then we must be reminded
That if God is for us,
Then who can against us?
If the Maker of the universe
Is interceding for us
We can forward come with boldness,
Find grace for timely help.

songs.title: Your Kingdom Come, Your Will Be Done
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[C]By life, You [Am]are my [F]Father [C]now.
[C]In heaven, [Am]You ad[F]minis[G]trate;
[C]Oh, may Your [Am]name be [F]sancti[C]fied.
[F]In all the [C]earth, be [G]glori[C]fied.

2
In heaven, all Your will is done,
On earth, You need a channel now.
So I would pray, Your kingdom come.
Your will, not mine, alone be done.

Chorus:
  [F]Thank You, [C]Father [G]for Your [Am]will
  [F]May it [C]be ful[G]filled—
  [C]May Your [G]need be [Am]met on [F]earth,
  That [C]all would [G]know Your [C]worth.

3
What a great will You have, my God.
Your heart’s desire to fulfill!
Because of Your great will exist
All things and for Your will, persist.

4
I have a little need, You know,
But You have need that’s greater still.
So may our hearts be intertwined—
One will, one aim, one thought, one mind.


5
Teach me to pray for what You need,
That Your need be addressed at first
(Your purpose I would not impede),
And then to pray for what I need.

6
How strong You are! How weak I am!
I sin, and how the world pulls!
So cleanse me and deliver me;
Forgive me my iniquity.


7
Come, too, as grace to fill my being,
To be what I could never be
To do what I could never do—
To love Your household, born of You.

8
Deliver me into Your rest,
Your habitation here on earth,
Your kingdom where You rule and reign,
Where all the glory You obtain.


9
Yours is the kingdom and the pow’r.
Yours is the strength, and Yours the might.
Yours is the glory, majesty
From now, into eternity.

#Chorus is sung every 2 verses

songs.title: This common faith of mine
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]This common faith of mine,
I'm gonna let it [G7]shine
The [C]Bible is God-breathed,
Second Tim[G]othy.
[]God is one and three,
[B7]Triune God is H[Em]e!
We bel[Am7]ieve, we bel[D]ieve, we bel[G-C-G]ieve!

2
He became a man,
Jesus is His name!
Christ died on the cross,
For all of our sins.
According to the Word,
The tomb couldn't keep Him in;
He arose, He arose, He arose!

3
He was lifted up,
Now He's on the throne.
Repent and believe,
Then you shall receive.
The Lord is coming back,
Coming back for us.
We believe, we believe, common faith!

songs.title: A Separated One
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]A separ[Am]ated [F]one I long to [G]be
[C]A freewill [Am]offer[F]ing to [G]You
[C]A volun[Am]teer to [F]serve You faithful[G]ly,
[C]To linger [Am]in Your [F]presence, [G]Lord
And [Am]feed [F]upon Your [G]living [C]Word.

  [C]My [F]Lord, You [G]are the [C]richest 
  [Am]grace
  The [F]sweetest [G]love,
  My [C]strength and [C7]song.
  I [F]long to [G]live be[C]fore Your [Am]face—
  A [F]life above—All [G]my life [C]long.

2
Lord, separate me now from everything
Related to the world’s joy.
I would abstain from every earthly joy
Not sourced in You. You are my joy!
Cleanse now my heart from all alloy.

3
You are the Head with all authority.
I’d follow You and serve You too,
Obeying and awaiting Your commands,
Submitting to Your word, all still.
Subdue me now, make Yours my will.

4
I long for life to flow within my being,
So I would separate from death
And its contamination all around.
I would be swallowed up by life,
Preserved and free from deathly strife.

5
I take this vow: I give myself to You.
I volunteer myself for You
To use—How great Your need!—I offer all,
And offer to You solemnly.
I count the cost—paid willingly.

songs.title: God be with you till we meet again
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[G]God be with you till we meet [D]a[ G]gain;
[C]By His counsels guide, uphold [G]you,
[D]With His sheep in [D7]love en[G]fold you;
[G]God be with you [C]till we [G]meet [D]a[ G]gain.

  Till we [G]meet, till we [C]meet,
  Till we [G]meet at Jesus' [D-D7]feet;
  Till we [G]meet, till we [C]meet,
  God be [G]with you till we [D7]meet a[G]gain.

2
God be with you till we meet again!
'Neath His wings protecting hide you,
Daily manna still provide you;
God be with you till we meet again!

3
God be with you till we meet again!
When life's perils thick confound you,
Put His arms unfailing round you;
God be with you till we meet again!

4
God be with you till we meet again!
Keep love's banner floating o'er you,
Smite death's threatening wave before you;
God be with you till we meet again!

songs.title: Lord, I open to You (Lord no matter the cost I'll follow You)
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Lord, I open to [D]You;
[Em]Align my [C]view with You.
[G]Transcend me from [D]earthly ties
That [Em]keeps me from seeing [C]You.

Lord, I open my heart
Make Your home my inward parts.
Keep flowing in me as grace;
I'll rest now in Your warm embrace.

  [G]Lord no matter the [D]cost I'll follow [Em]You,
  For I've [C]seen how precious You are.
  [G]When I call on Your [D]name You fill me [Em]up
  With Your [C]life and peace and love!
  [G]Fairest of the [D]fair,
  [Em]Keep attracting [C]me.
  [G]Not I but Your [D]grace, love, and [Em]mercy—
  [C]Lord, I am [G]here.

2
Lord, I lean onto You.
I cannot live without You.
You are the air that I breathe,
Your words are my everything.

Lord, I look unto You
You are wonderful, beautiful!
Be enthroned in my heart as King;
Reigning in all my inmost being!

  Lord no matter the cost I'll just love You,
  For I've known how worthy You are.
  When I pour out to You, You fill me up
  With all the riches of Christ!
  O King of kings,
  Keep gaining me.
  Not I but Your grace, love, and mercy—
  Lord, keep me here.

3
Lord, I give You my heart.
Every beat is for You my love.
Keep drawing me day by day;
Abiding in Your love all the way.

Lord, I just love You,
I give my all to You.
Keep me faithful in what I've seen
Oh kiss away all doubts and fear!

  Lord no matter the cost I will love You,
  For You've kissed me with unrivaled love.
  When I say, "I love You," You fill me up
  With more of Your cheering love!
  My Song of Songs,
  I'm Yours alone.
  Not I but Your grace, love, and mercy—
  Lord, I love You.

songs.title: Praise Him! Praise Him! Christ is Victor
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Praise Him! Praise Him! Christ is Victor!
[C]He has [G]won the [D7]victor[G]y!
[G]Sin is judged, old Adam fi[B7]nished,
[Em-B7-Em]Full redemption [A]now we [D]see!
[D]Vanquished all the [G]evil [C]powers
[Am]Through the Cross tri[D]umphant[G]ly!

2
Praise Him! Christ is resurrected!
God hath raised Him from the dead!
All the pow’r of death is swallowed,
Man from death to life is led!
Broken through are hell and darkness
And His pow’r exhibited!

3
Praise Him! Christ hath now ascended!
God hath raised Him to the throne!
Far above all rule and power,
He the highest Name doth own!
All authority receiving
Till His foe is overthrown!

4
Hallelujah, Christ the Victor
Triumphed on Mt. Calvary!
Hallelujah, resurrected,
He displays His victory!
Hallelujah, now ascended,
He shall reign eternally!

songs.title: It Was Love
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
It was l[D]ove that made Him st[G]oop down
Leave His h[D]eav’nly throne ab[A]ove
Come to s[D]ave the foremost s[G]inners,
Our Emm[D]anuel, f[A]ull of l[D]ove

  In a p[D]erfect human l[A]iving
  Full of gr[Em]ace, re[A7]alit[D]y
  ’Twas our G[Bm7]od, coming to w[G]oo us,
  Mingled w[D]ith hum[A]anit[D]y

2
It was love brought Him to suffer
For my sins nailed to the cross
My redemption freely purchased
Through my Savior’s pain and loss

  Then salvation like a river
  Richest grace full as a flood
  On the cross the Lord of glory
  Shed for us His precious blood

3
It is love makes Him to seek me 
Though I wander far away
Day by day, He draws me closer
Till there dawns the perfect day

  When His love has gained God’s dwelling
  We in God, and God in us
  We two one will be forever
  Love’s expression glorious

songs.title: Soldiers of Christ arise
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[D]Soldiers of [Bm]Christ a[G]rise,
And [D]put your [G]ar[D]mor [A]on,
Strong [D]in the [Bm]strength which [E]God sup[A]plies,
[D]Through [A]His e[E]ternal [A-A7]Son;
Strong [D]in the Lord of [G]Hosts,
And [E]in His mighty [A-A7]pow'r,
Who [D]in the [G]strength of [A]Jesus [D]trusts
Is [G]more [D]than [A]conque[D]ror.

2
Stand then in His great might,
With all His strength endued;
And take, to arm you for the fight,
The panoply of God,
That, having all things done,
And all your conflicts past,
Ye may o'ercome through Christ alone,
And stand complete at last.

3
Leave no unguarded place,
No weakness of the soul,
Take every virtue, every grace,
And fortify the whole.
To keep your armor bright
Attend with constant care,
Still walking in your Captain's sight
And watching unto prayer.

4
Pray, without ceasing pray,
Your Captain gives the word;
His summons cheerfully obey,
And call upon the Lord:
To God your every want
In instant prayer display;
Pray always; pray, and never faint;
Pray, without ceasing pray.

5
From strength to strength go on;
Wrestle, and fight, and pray;
Tread all the powers of darkness down
And win the well-fought day:
Still let the Spirit cry
In all His soldiers, "Come!"
Till Christ the Lord descend from high,
And take the conquerors home.

songs.title: Lord You Love Me Still
songs.lyrics:
#Psalm 139

1
Lord, Y[C]ou have searched me, [Em]and my deepest th[F]oughts, You know them [G]all.
You kn[C]ow when I sit d[Am]own, when I rise [F]up, and wh[G]en I f[C]all.
You [Am]understand my th[F]oughts before they [C]even cross my m[Am]ind.
You kn[F]ow my ways; each l[G]onging sense, that [Am]in my heart You f[F]ind.

  O Lord, You kn[C]ow m[- G]e.
  You know my h[Am]eart, You know my w[F]ill,
  And yet---You l[C]ove me[- G - Am]---
  Most incr[F]edibly,
  O L[C]ord, You l[G]ove me st[C]ill.

2
O Lord, You laid Your hand on me; Your right hand held me fast.
You forordained all of my days, my future and my past.
You wove me in my mother’s womb. I’m wonderfully made!
How precious are Your thoughts toward me, Your great, great love displayed.

  O Lord, do gain me.
  I’m Your domain, Come rule and reign,
  In all my heart now—
  Lord, gain me somehow,
  Your goal in me attain.

3
Search me, O God, and know my heart, the anxious thoughts within.
Lord, now I open up my heart for You to enter in.
Lord, keep my eyes set on the place where You sit on the throne.
And lead me in the way of life. Lord, make in me Your home.

  O Lord, now fill me.
  Your home my heart, Your will my will,
  O Lord, You’re reigning
  And all my being
  Is here for You to fill.

songs.title: Indeed the former things
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

#Isaiah 42:9
1
[G]Indeed the [C]former things have [D]come to [Em]pass,

songs.title: Christ You Are
songs.lyrics:
[C]Let our God a[F]rise
[C]And let all evil [G]things,
[C]His enemies, be [Am]scattered now,
[F]Let them [G]flee [C]away.

[C]Bless us, keep us, [F]too
[C]And make Your face to [G]shine.
[C]Lift up your [Am]countenance on us—
[F]Our blessing, [G]only [C]You.

Lord make us Your [Am]captives! [-F]
[C]Never let us win— [F]defeat us all the [C]time.
Load us with [Am]good!
[F]You are the only [G]good thing Lord!
[C]Christ You [Am]are the [F]meaning [G]of our [C]life!

We love our Triune God
We face His dwelling place
His presence is our everything
As we run this race.

Form Your people, Lord,
An army’s ranks to fill—
A group on earth to follow You,
Fighting for Your will.

Lord make us Your army!
The Body of Christ— a corporate warrior.
Come into us!
Spread all You are into every part!
Christ You are the meaning of our life!

Fill us, Lord, with faith
To rise and take the land
We are well able now to fight,
Walking in the light.

God return to us,
As we return to You;
In sweetest love and richest grace,
Give ourselves to You.

Lord make us Your bride!
You are the Captain— The Land we will enter.
What a romance!
Love strong as death has captured us Lord!
Christ You are the meaning of our life!

songs.title: Lord Your Life Within Is Medicine
songs.lyrics:
*Capo 2*

[G]Lord, Your [C]life within is [G]medicine[D],
[G]A soothing [C]balm to [G]all my soul[D].
[G]Where'er I [C]go, what[G]e'er I do[D],
[G]Nourish [C]me and [G]make [D]me [G]whole.

Your shepherding is precious, Lord!
You lead to pastures rich and green.
Such tender, all-inclusive care!
Your riches full I've not yet seen.

You are the Good, Chief Shepherd, Lord.
You oversee my hungry soul.
You cherish me and nourish me
With all You are, abundantly.

You bear upon Your shoulders strong
Me back into the wondrous fold
And listen to my anxious cares.
Within Your hand, my life You hold.

Your care for me, indeed, is great!
So rich and full Your life divine!
An ointment to all injury,
So tender, human, sweet, and fine.

Shepherd me through all my days,
I look to You to care for me.
No other could so richly care
For all His sheep so wondrously.

songs.title: Son Of Man Anoint My Eyes
songs.lyrics:
*Capo 4*


[G]Son of [C]Man, a[G]noint my [D]eyes—
[G]All the [C]Words you [G]speak to [D]me
[G]Are salve to [C]heal my [Em]darkling [D]eyes,
Touch my [C]sight, [D]make me [G]see.

Oh God come in the flesh,
Take my hand and lead me out.
My sight is lost, how blind I am!
How weak my heart with doubt.

Sweet light! But men as trees—
Their form blurred, their face obscured.
I need another Word to see.
Speak ‘til my sight is cured.

I heard Your voice just now
Inquiring if I could see.
Your heart is good, Your leading sweet—
So patient, Lord, with me.

Son of Man, Oh, speak once more!
Speak until my sight is clear
How gentle is Your speaking, Lord,
Your words so dear to hear.

Savior, touch my eyes again.
Clarify the light I have
And purify my blurry eyes—
Apply again the salve.

I would see more, dear Lord
All You are, I want to see
I want to see all You would do.
Reveal Your heart to me.

Enlighten my whole being,
Burn my veils, through ev’ry layer.
Though blind I am, I trust in You,
Your kind and tender care.

I would be full of sight—
Search and burn, Oh, Holy Fire.
I’d serve You, full of light, and care
For only Your desire.

songs.title: Arise, my soul, arise!
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Arise, my soul, a[D]rise!
Shake [Em]off thy [D]guilty [G]fears;
The bleeding Sacri[D]fice

[D]You have longed for sweet peace, 
[]And for faith to increase,
And have e[G]arnestly, [A]fervently [D]prayed; [A]
But you c[D]annot have rest, or be perfectly blest,
Until [G]all on the [A]altar is [G]laid.[D]

  Is your [G]all on the altar of [D]sacrifice laid?
  Your he[G]art, does the Sp[E7]irit con[A]trol? [A7]
  You can [D]only be blest 
  And have pe[]ace and sweet rest,
  As you yi[G]eld Him your [A]body and so[G]ul. [D]

2
Would you walk with the Lord 
In the light of His Word,
And have peace and contentment alway;
You must do His sweet will 
To be free from all ill;
On the altar your all you must lay.

3
Oh, we never can know 
What the Lord will bestow
Of the blessings for which we have prayed,
Till our body and soul 
He doth fully control,
And our all on the altar is laid.

4
Who can tell all the love 
He will send from above!
Oh, how happy our heart will be made!
Oh, what fellowship sweet
We shall share at His feet,
When our all on the altar is laid!

songs.title: Hear me O Lord (come away)
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Hear me O Lord [A]when I [Bm]cry,
My [G]heart [A]is so [D]cold, [D7]
All things a[G]round [A]me [F#m]cloud my [Bm]sight,
But [Em]then I hear you [A]say:

  Come [G]away from [A]where you [D]are, [D7]
  Come [G]away, [A]turn your [D]heart, [D7]
  I [G]hear You [A]say 
  "I [F#]am your [Bm]way,
  [G]Come a[A]way to [D]Me."

2
As I call upon your name,
You wipe my tears away,
Turning to you I begin to praise,
All sorrow fades away.

3
How I need to learn to stay,
In your presence, dear Lord
Draw my heart with Your hands of love,
And call me day by day,

4
When I see You face to face,
Your countenance captivates,
You transfuse me, I'm filled with grace,
It's here I long to stay.

songs.title: 'Tis the local church proclaiming
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]'Tis the [G]local church procl[A]aiming,
[G]Je[A7]sus is L[D-G-D]ord!
All the sa[G]ints with joy are n[A]aming
[G]Je[A7]sus as Lo[D-G-D]rd.
[G]All His work He has completed,
Satan and his h[A]osts def[A7]eated;
[D]On the thr[G]one of glory s[A]eated,
[G]Je[A7]sus is L[D-G-D]ord!

2
Jesus is the living Spirit,
Jesus is Lord!
He is here, all people, hear it:
Jesus is Lord!
Be no more a poor lamenter;
Call on Him, and He will enter
And become your glorious center—
Jesus is Lord!

3
He will transform all your living,
Jesus, the Lord!
All His riches to you giving,
Jesus, the Lord!
He'll forever satisfy you,
Everyday real life supply you,
And with God will unify you,
Jesus the Lord!

4
In His mercy He received us,
Jesus, the Lord!
He will never, never leave us,
Jesus, the Lord!
All the fullness of His being
In His Body we are seeing,
And the enemy is fleeing—
Jesus is Lord!

songs.title: In the morning He wakes me
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[D]In the [A]morning He [D]wakes me.
He awak[A]ens my [D]ear.
He longs to [A]sustain the [D]weary,
Thus, I rise [A]Him to [D]hear.

  Yet [G]ere I [D]speak to the [A]weary,
  The [G]Lord must [D]first be [A]heard,
  He [G]fills me a[D]new so I’m [A]able [Bm]to,
  Sus[G]tain them [A]with a [D]word.

2
Open my ear this morning.
I want to hear Your voice.
From everything else I’m turning,
You only are my choice.

  Lord Jesus, I long to be filled!
  Spring up from within me!
  That others could know Your life-giving flow,
  And no more be thirsty.

3
Oh Lord, care for the weary,
These sheep with no Shepherd.
Dear Lord I pray You could use me,
Make me a good steward.

  Lord, here I am! Fill me freshly!
  I long for Your supply,
  If I’m filled today, You will have a way,
  These ones to satisfy.

  This is the reason I’m living,
  To feed the weary ones.
  This is my true bliss.  I would still do this,
  Until my Master comes.

songs.title: God said it is not good
songs.lyrics:
#CRSC 2021-22
#Gen 2:18, 22, Rev 19:7
God said it is not good
For the man to be alone
I will make a helper
As His counterpart

And Jehovah God built the rib
Which He had taken from the man
Into a woman and brought her to Him

Let us rejoice and exalt for the marriage of the Lamb has come (x2)

For she has made herself
She has made herself
She has made herself ready

songs.title: O now I see the cleansing wave
songs.lyrics:
1
O [D]now I see the [G]cleansing wave!
The [D]fountain deep and [A]wide;
Je[D]sus, my Lord, migh[G]ty to save,
Points [D]to His [A7]wounded [D]side.

  I [A]plunge, and O it [D]cleanseth me!
  O [G]praise the Lord it [D]cleanseth me!
  It [A]cleanseth me, [A7]yes, [D]cleanseth me.

2
I see the dear Redeemer raised,
I hear the speaking blood;
It speaks! My spirit is amazed!
And quickened by its flood.

3
I rise to walk in God's own light
Above the world and sin,
With heart renewed and garments white
And Christ enthroned within.

songs.title: But God commends His own love to us
songs.lyrics:
# Rom. 5:8-10

But [C]God com[G]mends His own [Am]love to [F]us
In [C]that while we were yet [Am]sinners,
[F]Christ [Dm7]died for [G]us.

Much [C]more, much [Am-F]more,

[F]We shall be [G7]saved in His [C]life.

songs.title: As the Days Go By
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]As the days go [Em7]by, and [Fmaj7]months turn to [Bb]years,
So much [C]time I’ve [Em7]lost, a [F]slave to my [G]fears.
Je[Dm7]sus! Dear [G]Lord, to [C]You I would [Am7]pray;
When the [Dm7]morning comes, let me [G]not waste this [C]day.

2
When I walk with You, my spirit is bright,
And I’m covered in Your radiant light.
Remind me Lord, just to look on Your face,
If I turn away, bring me back to Your grace.

3
While I’m waiting for the sun in my sky,
I will call on You, to be my supply.
Jesus! Dear Lord, though life takes its toll,
I just ask of You, be forever my goal.


#hymnal.net/en/hymn/ns/818

songs.title: How good to sing You love songs, Lord
songs.lyrics:
# All verses can be sung with both tunes

1
[D]How good to [A]sing You [Bm]love songs, [G]Lord
[D]To call Your [A]name through[Bm]out my [G]day.
[D]To love and [A]walk with[Bm]in Your [G]light
And praise You, [D]Lord, in [A]every [D]way.

2
[G]How good to [D]give my[A]self to [Bm]You
[G]And lay down [D]everything I [A]do
[G]For You to [D]use how[A]e'er You [Bm]chose
To fix my [G]eyes on You [A]alone.

3
How good to say I love You, Lord.
To be nourished by Your holy word.
To partake, ingest Yourself divine
To abide fore'er in Christ, The Vine.

4

songs.title: To live a life in the Holy of Holies
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]To live a [Dm]lif[-]e [G]
In the Holy of [C]Holies,
We must [Dm]become a cap[G]tive of [C]Chri[C7]st.
Many [F]times, rea[G]lity is that
[C]Christ is [Em]captive [Am]to us,
This [Dm]becomes our own flesh[G]ly Victo[C]ry.

2
Conquer me,
Subdue me,
That I’d no longer be Your enemy.
Defeat me at any cost
That my own will would be lost.
Your desires make my own.
Never let me win.

3
I’m willing,
Defeat me.
Put the world and sins beneath my feet.
Within me is rebellion
Defeat it, conquer and subdue it.

4
Today,
There’s a need
For us to become captives.
We will see

So become a little captive,

  But [F]thanks be to [G]God
  Who [C]always [Em]leads [Am]us
  [Dm]In the t[G]riumph
  In the [C]Christ.

songs.title: Jesus Lord I love You, there's no one above You
songs.lyrics:
[G]Jesus Lord I love You.
[Bm]There's no one above You.
[C]More than anything,

songs.title: Jesus loves you, we also love you
songs.lyrics:
Jesus [G]loves you.

#(Repeat)

songs.title: You heard there was a God above (Hallelujah)
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
[G]You heard there was a [Em]God above
Named [G]Jesus Christ who [Em]shed His blood
But [C]you don’t really [D]care for those things, [G]do you? [D]

You’re [G]on your own; do [C]what you [D]like. 
If [Em]there’s a God, why [C]does He hide?
You [D]scorn and you des[B7]pise, the halle[Em]lujah…

	Halle[C]lujah! Halle[Em]lujah! 
	Halle[C]lujah! Halle[G]l-u[D]-j[G]ah! 

2
You fill your head with higher things
The spiritual philosophies, 
And yet you know they’ll never satisfy you.

No! Words like these cannot define 
the meaning of your human life. 
No rest, no peace, no not one “hallelujah” 

	Hallelujah! Hallelujah! 
	Hallelujah! Hallel-u-jah! 

3
Finally, you see the Book
And something says to take a look. 
You open up the Bible someone gave you.

And then you see in shining light 
That Jesus came to be your life!
You cry with tears in spirit, “Hallelujah!”

	Hallelujah! Hallelujah! 
	Hallelujah! Hallel-u-jah! 

4
Day by day, God grows in you!
With all the saints you now pursue
A Person who is real, alive, and human!

Be found in Him, the self deny
Resurrection, power supplied!  
Eternally we’ll cry out, “Hallelujah!”

	Hallelujah! Hallelujah! 
	Hallelujah! Hallel-u-jah!

songs.title: Exercise the spirit, human thought reject
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Exercise the spirit!
Human t[D]hought re[G]ject;
[C]Meet with one a[F]nother,
[C]Body [G]life res[C]pect.

2
Exercise the spirit!
All the forms forsake;
Share with one another,
Each of Christ partake.

3
Exercise the spirit!
Natural sense renounce;
Serve with one another,
Christ the Lord announce.

4
Exercise the spirit!
Soulish life deny;
Helping one another,
On the Lord rely.

5
Freed within the spirit
From self-righteousness,
From self-condemnation
And self-consciousness.

6
Freed within the spirit
From self-will and pride,
From self-love and glory,
All to override.

7
Exercise the spirit,
Victory to claim
By the blood which cleanses
And the mighty Name.

8
Exercise the spirit
Thus to touch the Lord;
Ever by the spirit
Take Him thru His Word.

9
It is by the spirit
Christ is testified;
It is by the spirit
Man is satisfied.

10
Exercise the spirit!
This is what we need!
Exercise the spirit!
May the Lord so lead!

songs.title: Thou art lovely, my Beloved
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3

1
[Bm]Thou art [Em]lovely, my Be[D]loved.[Bm]
Wilt Thou [Em]kiss me [A]with Thy [D]mouth?[DM7-D7] (S.S. 1:2)
Thy name [Em]bears a [A]pleasant [D]fragrance.[Bm] (1:3)
Draw me [Em]we will [A]run to [D]Thee. (1:4)

2
Thou art lovely, my Beloved, (1:16)
To Thy chambers now I run. (1:4)
Though the sun has looked upon me, (1:6)
I'm still lovely in Thy sight. (1:5)

3
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
Like a mare this present day. (1:9)
Soon wilt thou be with adornment (1:10-11)
Gold and silver, string of jewels.

4
Thou art lovely, O My lover, (1:10)
And thy eyes are like the doves. (1:15)
As a lily, trusting wholly, (2:1)
Thou dost dwell among the thorns. (2:2)

5
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
As the apple tree of trees. (2:3)
In Thy shade have I delighted
And Thy fruit is sweet to me.

6
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Thou hast brought me to Thy feast. (2:4)
Thou dost hold me, and sustain me, (2:6, 5)
How I am now sick with love. (2:5)

7
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
Rise and come away with Me. (2:10, 13)
I am skipping, I am leaping. (2:9)
Winter flees before the spring. (2:11)

8
Thou art lovely, O My lover, (2:14)
Hidden in the cleft of rock.
Let Me hear thy voice of sweetness
And behold thy pleasant face.

9
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Thou art mine and I am Thine. (2:16)
I will hold Thee, n'er release Thee, (3:4)
'Til I bring Thee home with me.

10
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
As the fragrant piers of smoke, (3:6)
As a bed for Me to rest on, (3:7)
Palanquin, and royal crown. (3:9-11)

11
Thou art lovely, O My lover, (4:3)
Eyes like doves behind thy veil. (4:1)
Smile radiant, lips of scarlet, (4:2-3)
Neck subdued as David's tower. (4:4)

12
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
Come from Lebanon with Me. (4:8)
At thy glance My heart is ravished, (4:9)  
Oh My sister and My bride! (4:10)

13
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
Full of milk and honey, sweet, (4:11)
As a garden rich in fragrance, (4:12)
And a fountain sealed for Me.

14
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Come into Thy garden sweet. (4:16)
Breathe my spices as the wind blows
And enjoy Thy choicest fruit.

15
Art Thou knocking, my Beloved? (5:2)
At Thy voice my soul doth fail. (5:6)
When I'm ready, I will open. (5:3)
How I long for Thee within! (5:4)

16
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Please do not withdraw from me.
Though I seek Thee, calling for Thee, (5:6)
Not one answer I receive. 

17
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Full of life and dazzl’ng white. (5:10)
None compare with Thee, Beloved, (5:9)
As Thy lips move myrrh doth flow. (5:13)

18
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
And Thy works are all divine, (5:14)
Yet so full of tender feelings
Wrought through suff'ring death for me.

19
Thou art lovely, O My lover, (6:4)
As the city, elegant,
And as fearsome as an army (6:10)
To defeat our enemies.

20
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
Turn thine eyes away from Me. (6:5)
Thou alone art perfect to Me. (6:9)
How I love Thee, Shulammite. (6:13)

21
Thou art lovely, O His lover,
O how beaute’ous are thy steps. (7:1)
Molded by a skillful artist, 
It's no wonder He is bound. (7:5)

22
Thou art lovely, O My lover,
How thy stature has matured. (7:7)
Well equipped for feeding others (7:8)
With the clusters of the vine.

23
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Let us go forth to the fields. (7:11)
Let us see if vines have blossomed (7:12)
And enjoy our bridal love. (7:13)

24
Thou art lovely, O His lover,
Coming from the wilderness, (8:5)
Leaning on Him, so dependent,
Longing for Him to return. 

25
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Set me on Thee as a seal, (8:6)
On Thy heart of love, unshaken,
And upon Thine arm of strength.

26
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
And Thy love is strong as death. (8:6)
Jealousy as cruel as Sheol,
Thou consuming all between.

27
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Floods can never quench Thy love. (8:7)
All the riches one could offer
For Thy love would be disdained.

28
Thou art lovely, my Beloved
For my sister, I'm concerned (8:8)
Let us build her up with silver (8:9)
And enclose with cedar wood.

29
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
For Thy labor I give all. (8:12)
Speaking with Thee, always list'ning, (8:13)
To maintain communion sweet.

30
Thou art lovely, my Beloved,
Like a hart upon the mount (8:14)
How I yearn to see Thee daily.
Do make haste to quickly come!



# Can be shortened to sing by chapter of Song of Songs, combination of chapters, or topic (stages of transformation, progressive steps of the believer's experience, etc.):

#- ch. 7, stanzas 21-23; 
#- ch. 8, stanzas 24-30.

Than we've [D]ever had bef[D7]ore.
[G]We want more of Christ as life:
Rich and glori[C]ous!

#Capo 3

1
[G]We want more of Jesus,
More and m[D]ore and m[G]ore! (boom! boom! boom!)
[G]We want more of Jesus
Than we’ve [A]ever had bef[D]ore. (boom! boom! boom!)
[G]We want more of Christ as life,
R[G7]ich and glori[C]ous.
We want more of [G]Jesus,
[Em]So we’ll [Am]give Him [D7]more of [G]us!

We want more of Jesus,
More and more and more. (yum! yum! yum!)

So we’ll eat Him all the time.

songs.title: Lord Jesus, thank You for this very day
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[D]Lord Jesus, thank You for this [G]very day,
[A]I do believe in You; I [F#m]do love You.
[Bm]Thank You that I can know what’s[Em] in Your heart:
[G]You want to mak[Em]e me one with You.
[A]I open my entire [G]inner being,
[A]My every inward part is ju[F#m]st for You.
[Bm]Is there a part You have not[Em] entered yet?

'Tis a sure foundation laid.

But, Lord, with Thy precious blood,
Which Thy love doth e'er unfold.

3

Which for us has fully met
All the righteous claims of God.
Thou has washed us from our sins

And our conscience purged by it,

4

5

We will have the victory.

7

We commune with all the saints;
Under its full covering,
Our freed spirit never faints.
How can we exhaust, in word,
The account of Thy dear blood;
We will need eternity
To declare its boundless good.
