songs.title: How Deep The Father's Love For Us
songs.lyrics:
How [D]deep the Father's [Em]love [D]for [G]us,
How [D]vast beyond all [Bm]meas[A]ure,
That [D]He should give His[Em] onl[D]y S[G]on
To [D]make a wretch His [A]treas[D]ure.
How great the pain of [Em]seari[D]ng l[G]oss 
The [D]Father turns His [Bm]face a[A]way,
As [D]wounds which mar the [Em]Chos[D]en [G]One 
Bring [D]many sons to [A]glo[D]ry.

Behold the man upon a cross,
My sin upon His shoulders;
Ashamed, I hear my mocking voice
Call out among the scoffers.
It was my sin that held Him there
Until it was accomplished;
His dying breath has brought me life 
I know that it is finished.

I will not boast in anything,
No gifts, no power, no wisdom;
But I will boast in Jesus Christ,
His death and resurrection.
Why should I gain from His reward?
I cannot give an answer;
But this I know with all my heart 
His wounds have paid my ransom.

# Capo 1

songs.title: Come Behold the Wondrous Mystery
songs.lyrics:
1
Come [D]behold the wondrous [G]mystery,

How unwavering our hope

songs.lyrics:

1

Daniel prayed to his God and lived by Him constantly.

Now as His living Body of the life tree we'll eat.

songs.lyrics:
1

songs.title: Lord, my eyes are seeing
songs.lyrics:
# Matthew 13:3-8, 15, 18-23

1
[G]Lord, my eyes are seeing,
[G]Lord, my ears are hearing,
[C]All that You've been speaking,
My[D] heart's understanding, [G]too.
[C]Finally, I am turning,
Wi[D]lling to be healed by [G]You.
Th[D]ank You for Your waiting,
Arr[C]anging everything I'd [G]do.

  Now Lord, my h[D]eart
  Cries [Em]out for Your l[C]oving hand.
  And L[G]ord, A[D]men,
  I'd be to[C]uched by Y[D]ou.

2
Lord, I've been so hardened,
Caught in worldly traffic,
Drowning out Your words that
Fell upon my wayward heart.
Somehow, still You got in,
Soft'ning up my tender parts.
How could I refuse You?
You bore me on Your wounded heart.

3

Shallowly receiving,

Burying my shameful side.

Bare without Your presence,

4

Tried to choke the life away.
Lifelessly I drifted,
Couldn't tell the night from day.
Then a ray of light came,
Shining through a man of clay.

5
Oh, the time I wasted,
Trying to be better.
All along You waited,
Just for me to reach my end.
Now I simply open,
Trusting in my truest Friend.
Hold me by Your mercy,
Bear fruit in me until the end.

  Now Lord, my heart
  Overflows with a praising song!
  For Lord, I know,
  I've been touched by You.
  By Y[G]ou.

songs.title: How could a country girl like me
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3
1

2

[Bm]To be like You in [F#]this romance,

3

#(Chorus 1)

5

  For I've been kissed by Thee.

7

Lord, be with me so intimate,

#(Chorus 2)

songs.title: I choose to love my Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]My outward s[C]tate has [D]left me de[G]feated;

  “I choose to [G]love my L[Em]ord,
  Regardless o[C]f my outward s[D]ight!
  I choose to [G]love my L[Em]ord,
  With all my h[C]eart, with all my m[D]ight![D7]
  I love my L[G]ord!”

2
When I come face to face with temptations,

3
But even then, the guilt comes to haunt me:

  Regardless of my outward sight!

songs.title: I need a new heart
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]I need a new h[A]eart

songs.title: I know You're there, Lord (Lord Remind Me)
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]I know You’re [Em]there, Lord,[-A7]
I need to [D]turn anew.[-Bm]
Don’t let a[Em]nother moment [A7]pass,
Without my [D]mind on [F#m7]You.

[A7]I would go on [D]loving [D7]You!

  Lord re[G]mind me,[-Em]
  O, to [D]turn to You.[-F#m7]
  Lord re[G]mind me,[-Em]
  Just to [D]call on You.[-F#m7]
  You’re so [G]precious,[-Gm7]
  O, I [F#m7]just love [Bm-Em]You!

songs.title: As the world rushes on
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[D]As the world rushes [Bm]on,
I’m re[A]minded of [D]Thee.
Though time [G]passes a[D]way,

2

Limited in quantity.

Lord, I just want to spend
My time with only Thee,
For Thou art worthy Lord.
I’d every moment seize,

3
How can I spend my time

Thousand-fold multiplied,
Ever our memorial?

I’d rather spend a day,
With Thee and with Thy saints,
Than thousand days away.
One thing, that do I seek,
To dwell within Thy house
Beholding Thee always.

4
New beginning I ask.
All my heart, capture more;
All my time, spent with Thee;
All my days, on Thee outpoured.

The time, may I redeem,
From many wasted days,
From wand’ring aimlessly.
More time I cannot waste;
Thou long didst wait for me,
To turn my being to Thee.

songs.lyrics:
1
[G]For the bread and [D7]for the [G]wine,

8

songs.lyrics:
1

3

[G]Of [A]the [Bm]One [G]who gave His [D]life [A]for [D]me.

Joel 2:12a

songs.title: Thou art coming, O my Savior
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Thou art coming, [F]O my [C]Savior,
Thou art coming, [Am]O my [G]King,
[C]In Thy beauty all resplendent,
[E]In thy [Am]glory all transcendent;

2

3

songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
[G]O Lord, as we con[C]sider Thee,
We [D]worship [D7]Thee for all Thou [G]art;

  Let me pour the ointment pure,

  On You, most precious One,
  Because You love me.

4
Let my love from my being wash Your feet.
Let my glory without wipe them too.
Let me kiss them where the nails would pierce.
All my love, Lord, and glory,
I'll waste on You.

  I love You! Jesus, I love You!
  All my glory and love
  I pour and waste on You.
  Receive my ointment, Lord.
  It’s all I have, dear Lord
  For You, most precious One,
  Because I love You.

2

Than all the earth can afford
Will You be closer to me
Dearer and sweeter too

3
Oh Lord, I ask Thee

When You from me blessings withhold 
When my future is standing still 
And You dry up all between   
Grant me sight to see the prize 
And gladly leave all behind 

4
Oh Lord, I ask Thee

Remove outwardly but cut my heart free  
From strings still ever attached 
Still yearning for what's been dispatched
Then when I’ve been fully released 
Only then will You be 

5

songs.title: Beside Bethesda
songs.lyrics:
*Capo 3*

[G]Beside Bethesda, here I [Em]lay.
Upon my [C]mat, a man in [D]sin.
I cannot [G]move; I watch the [Em]pool
And [C]hope to walk [D]again.
Here, waiting [Em]for a mira[C]cle,
For thirty-[Em]eight long years I’ve [D]stayed.
Beside this [Em]sometimes-stirring [C]pool,
Lame, [Em]impo[D]tent, I’ve [G]laid.

You knew my state. In mercy great,
You came to seek me where I lay.
A plain and lowly man You were
With such a gentle way.
“Man, do you wish to be made well?”
You asked me, as I turned around.
Oh, how I’ve longed to hear those words!
“I do! No help I’ve found.

I cannot move although I‘ve tried—
To no avail. And though I’ve seen
The water stir and stir again,
I’ve never active been.”
“Arise, take up your mat and walk”
You speak with such authority!
But even more, my legs felt strong:
Your word enlivened me.

No law and no activity;
No miracle descending down,
No effort I have made has helped.
I must be mercy shown.
Oh, Lord! Your kindness, mercy great,
And richest grace You’ve giv’n to me,
Redeeming me and healing me
By hanging on a tree.

You made me walk! So now my Lord,
I rise to follow after You.
I run toward You, my Goal, my Prize—
Your gift of grace in view.
Now, in Your house, I have a place,
And at Your table I enjoy
Your All-Inclusive richness, Lord
And rest in Your employ.

songs.title: Lord, Thou art our consecration
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, Thou art our consecration,
Thou the consecrated One;
Thou has satisfied the Father—
Consecration thus was done.
When on earth Thou hadst no pleasure,
Save to do the Father's will;
Now Thou livest here within us,
Consecration to fulfill.

2
Lord, we praise Thee for the picture:
Consecration's ram we see,
Burnt for God's full satisfaction,
Eaten and enjoyed to be.
Thou art now our ram, Lord Jesus,
Offered for the will of God;
By Thy consecration, faultless,
We may walk where Thou hast trod.

3
As we eat Thyself, Lord Jesus,
Consecrated we become;
By Thy wondrous life within us,
Thy obedience is our own.
No more need we strive and struggle,
Consecrated try to be;
Consecration dwells within us—
Now our part to eat of Thee.

4
Lord, we praise Thee, consecration
Is nought else but Thee as food:
As we eat Thee and enjoy Thee,
We are all made one with God;
One in will and one in purpose
We become by eating Thee:
As we take and eat Thyself, Lord,
Consecrated we will be.

songs.title: I have come to the Fountain of Life
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune

1
I have [C]come to the [G]Fountain of [C]Life,

And [C]come to the [G7]Elim of [C]love;

In the [G7]depths of my [C]being it springs[G7].

  The [F]fountain that [Am]never [D]runs [G]dry;[G7]
  Oh, [C]drink of the [G]boundless sup[Am-C]ply,
  For [C]Christ is the [G7]Fountain of [C]Life.

2
I have come to the Fountain of Blood
That for guilt and uncleanness doth flow;
I have washed in its sin-cleansing flood
And my garments are whiter than snow.
I count not my righteousness mine—
'Tis Jesus that lives in my soul.
I partake of His nature divine,
And in Him I am perfectly whole.

3
I have come to the Fountain of Health,
A boundless and endless supply;
'Tis a secret man's wisdom or wealth
Can never discover or buy.
But the secret my Lord hath revealed
In the fountain that flows from His side,
In the stripes by whose pain we are healed,
In Himself as He comes to abide.

4
I have come to the Fountain of Joy;
His joy is the strength of my heart.
My delight is unmixed with alloy,
My sunshine can never depart.
The fig tree may wither and die,
Earth's pleasures and prospects decline;
But my fountains can never be dry—
My portion, my joy is divine.

[C]Chosen, called, responding to Y[G]ou,

3

Oh my Lord, my love, quickly come,

songs.title: Here is Love
songs.lyrics:
[G]Here is love, vast as the [C]ocean,
Loving-[G]kindness as the [D]flood,
When the [G]Prince of Life, our [C]Ransom,
Shed for [G]us His [D]precious [G]blood.
Who His love will not re[D]member?
Who can [Am]cease to sing His [G]praise?
He can never be for[C]gotten,
Throughout [G]heav’n’s e[D]ternal [G]days.

On the mount of crucifixion,
Fountains opened deep and wide;
Through the floodgates of God’s mercy
Flowed a vast and gracious tide.
Grace and love, like mighty rivers,
Poured incessant from above,
And heav’n’s peace and perfect justice
Kissed a guilty world in love.

Let me, all Thy love accepting,
Love Thee, ever all my days;
Let me seek Thy kingdom only,
And my life be to Thy praise;
Thou alone shalt be my glory,
Nothing in the world I see;
Thou hast cleansed and sanctified me,
Thou Thyself hast set me free.

In Thy truth Thou dost direct me
By Thy Spirit through Thy Word;
And Thy grace my need is meeting,
As I trust in Thee, my Lord.
Of Thy fullness Thou art pouring
Thy great love and pow’r on me,
Without measure, full and boundless,
Drawing out my heart to Thee.

songs.title: Down at the cross where my Savior died (Hymns #1125)

1

  Glory to His [D]name;
  [G]There to my sin was the [C]blood ap[G]plied,
  Glory [D7]to His [G]name!

2
Saved from our sin at this fountain, we
Fully enjoy our redemption free;
This we'll enjoy for eternity,
Glory to His name!

3
Oh, precious fact, when my Savior died,
Not only sin's debt was satisfied;
Life's flowing fountain was opened wide!
Glory to His name!

  Glory to His name,
  Glory to His name;
  Life's flowing fountain was opened wide!
  Glory to His name!

4
Now both redemption and life we share,
Cleansed in His blood, we're abiding there
Drinking the water of life fore'er;
Glory to His name!

1

2

  Which has the foundations,
  Whose Architect and Builder is God.

3

#Chorus 1

songs.title: Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Praise Him! Praise Him! [Am]Jesus, our blessed Re[G]deemer!
Sing, ye [Em]saints! His [A7]wonderful love pro[D7]claim!
[G]Hail Him! Hail Him! [Am]Mightiest angels in [G]glory;
Strength [G7]and [C]ho[Am]nor [G]give to His [D7]holy [G]name!
[D]Like [G]a [D]shepherd, [Am]Jesus will [G]feed His [D]people,
[G]In His [Em]arms He [A7]carried them all day [D7]long;
[G]O ye saints that [Am]live in the light of His [G]presence,
Praise [G7]Him! [C]Praise [Am]Him! [G]Ever in [D7]joyful [G]song!

2
Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
For our sins He suffered and bled and died;
He, our Rock, our Hope of eternal salvation,
Hail Him! Hail Him! Jesus, the Crucified;
Loving Savior, meekly enduring sorrow,
Crowned with thorns that cruelly pierced His brow;
Once for us rejected, despised, and forsaken,
Prince of Glory, every triumphant now.

3
Praise Him! Praise Him! Jesus, our blessed Redeemer!
Heavenly portals, loud with hosannas ring!
Jesus, Savior, reigneth for ever and ever;
Crown Him! Crown Him! Prophet and Priest and King!
Death is vanquished! Tell it with joy, ye faithful,
Where is now thy victory, boasting grave?
Jesus lives! No longer thy portals are cheerless;
Jesus lives, the mighty and strong to save.

songs.title: Praise to the Lord, the Almighty, the
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]Praise to t[A]he L[D]ord, the Alm[A]ighty, the      
K[G]ing of cr[A7]eati[D]on!      
[D]O my s[A]oul, pr[D]aise Him, for [A]He is thy      
h[G]ealth and sal[A7]vati[D]on!      
[D]All ye who h[G]ear,

How thy desires all have been

3

wondrously, made thee!
Health hath vouchsafed and, when
heedlessly falling, hath stayed thee.
What need—or grief
Ever hath failed of reliefs
Wings of His mercy did shade thee.

4
Praise to the Lord, who doth prosper
thy work and defend thee,
Who from the heavens the streams of
His mercy doth send thee.
Ponder anew
What the Almighty can do,
Who with His love doth befriend thee.

5

Oh, let all that is in me adore Him!
All that hath life and breath, come
now with praises before Him!
Let the Amen

Gladly for aye we adore Him.

songs.title: O soul, are you weary and troubled?
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 3)

1
O [D]soul, are you weary and [G]trou[Em]bled?
No [D]light in the [A7]darkness you [D]see?
There’s light for a l[B7]ook at the [Em]Savior,

  [D]Turn your [A7]eyes upon [Bm]Jesu[D7]s,
  Look [G]full in His [Em]wonderful [A - A7]face,

  [Bm]strangely [G]dim,

2

3

songs.title: It is Jehovah’s lovingkindness (Lam. 3:22-25)
songs.lyrics:
# Lam. 3:22-25
[G]It is Jeh[C]ovah’s lovingk[Em]indness[C-G]

songs.title: Make me holy as You!
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

1
Up the [G]mount, I am coming;
To Your [Em]call, I’m responding.
Dearest [Am]Lord, I am [G]here to seek Your [D]face.[D7]
I have [G]seen how my living
Falls so [Em]short of Your building—
How could [Am]I match You, [C]Lord, without Your [D]grace?[D7]

  Make me [G]holy as [C]You!
  This is [G]Your promise [Em]true!
  Puri[Am]fy me for the [D7]building of Your [C]house.[G]

2
Cleanse me from all things sinful;
Deal with all worldly idols.
Separate me from all defilement.
Then impart life into me;
Flow throughout my whole being.
Saturate me with Your life element.

3
Here the air is so clear, Lord.
Speak to me through Your Word more.
Have Your way in me; heav’nly Light, do shine!
Search my heart, every chamber;
From each part, darkness scatter.
Make my whole body full of light divine!*
* cf. Matt. 6:22

4
In Your presence, I linger.
It’s Your beauty—I’m captured!
You have won me with Your attractiveness.
Vanity I’m exhaling,
All Your fullness inhaling;
Deeply breathe into me Your holiness.

5
Purify and make holy
And reconstitute fully—
Keep me growing, pursuing, in this way.
Gain us, Lord, for Your building!
For the Body, we’re willing!
To fulfill Your heart’s longing we will say:

  We will rise up and build!
  Spirits stirred up, hearts filled,
  We love You and we give all to build Your house!

#Capo 2
1. [G]I come [D]home,
[C]I lay [G]down,
[C]Something [Bm]feels a little [C]off right no[D7]w.
[G]I have no [D]peace,
[C]Feeling on my [G]own,
[C]Finding [Bm]life’s anxieties too [C]much to bear alo[D7]ne.

    [G]Hey Companion, I n[D]eed you now!
    [Em]You’ll help me weather this [Bm]storm
    [C]Together we’ll [G]touch the living [F]God within our
    [C]spirits.
    [G]Praying over a [D]verse with you
    [Em]Will get me out of my [Bm]mind
    [C]Hey companion, I n[G]eed you now!
    [D]Hey companion, where [Em]are you now?
    Hey companion, I n[C]eed you [D7]all the [G]time.

2. I go outside,
A perfect day,

I must take care,

more.

    Hey Companion, I need you now!
    You’ll help me turn to the Lord

    temptation
    Praying over a verse or two
    Will keep temptation away
    Hey companion, I need you now!
    Hey companion, where are you now?
    Hey companion, I need you every day.

3. I go about
My daily walk
Meet a friend and we begin to talk
They open up
Their heart's outpoured
Something tells me that they're searching for
the Lord.

   Hey companion, I need you now!

   Together we'll join with Christ
   And make an intercession
   Praying with you is such a gift
   You bring a great point of view
   Hey companion, I need you now,
   Hey companion, where are you now?
   Hey companion, I praise the Lord for you!

1
[C]What is the Jubilee?

[C]Is there some pain within?
[Dm]Are you a slave of Sin?
[F]Come now! Have [G7]Rest! Re[G]turn to [C]Jesus![C7]

  Christ is our [F]freedom [G]every[C]day![C7]
  All pain and [F]sin, [G]Go a[C]way[C7]!
  Yes feast on [F]Him [G]every[E7]day.[Am]..!

2

4

songs.title: I'm standing on the shore!
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

[G]I'm [C]standing on the[G-C-G] shore!

songs.title: Zion is God’s habitation
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Zion[F] is God’s habi[C]tation.[F]
Sing praises in [C-E7-Am]Zion,
The [F]city [G]of our [C]King[G].
[C]Zion[F], the place of His [C]choosing [F]
Where saints are re[C-E7-Am]joicing.
Here [F]God is t[G]heir sal[C]vation.

  [E]Beautiful [Am]Zion,[E] in ele[Am]vation,
  [F]The joy of our K[C]ing,
  His [E7]satisfac[Am]tion,
  The [F]joy [G]of the whole [C]earth[G].

2
Zion: how good and how pleasant,
The greatest enjoyment!
It's like the precious ointment.
Zion, how good and how pleasant,
In oneness we're dwelling.
The dew, oh, how refreshing!

  How good and how pleasant,
  The best enjoyment!
  Our oneness is just Him.

3
Zion: our Oneness a Person,
As ointment, He's moving,

Zion: our God is our dwelling,
As ointment, He's strengthening,
As dew, He's so supplying.

  Beautiful Zion, in elevation
  How good and how pleasant,
  Man's satisfaction,
  Our dwelling is this One.

4
Zion: in God we're abiding,

Zion, the ultimate blessing,

  Beautiful churches,
  The golden lampstands—
  God mingling with man;
  His satisfaction,
  The [F]ultimate [G]consumma[C]tion!

songs.title: Nor to give heed to myths (1 Tim. 1:4-5)
songs.lyrics:
#1 Tim. 1:4-5
#Capo 3
[C]Nor to give [F]heed to myths
and un[G]ending geneo[C]logies,
which produce [Am]questionings
[F]rather than God's e[G]conomy
God's econo[Am]my,
which is in [G]faith,

out of a [C]pure heart
and out of a good [Am]conscience and

songs.title: Do not allow me
songs.lyrics:
[C - Am - F - G]
1
Do not allow me to have my way
Be the Spirit in my spirit to direct me everyday
Lord I will only do your perfect will
Permissive will of God I won't accept

  Take me deeper than you've taken anyone before
  Just to mean enough for me to touch you first
  Turn my prayer into love-song, make it real to me
  Make me desperate to experience your love

2
I need your mercy, so that I could see
The vision of the age that's on your heart
Open my eyes Lord, reveal your heart to me
I don't need to understand, I want to see

  I've been pressing up against you Lord for so long
  Now I desire just to touch you with my heart
  Lord, I cannot live without you, be my measure of grace
  Sevenfold intensify your spirit within me

3
Be so personal, affectionate
Turn me to my spirit to abide in you
Control and govr'n me, restrict me with your love
Put to death my natural man, renew my mind

  I turn my eyes to you, Lord Jesus, how I love you
  You captivate me with your beauty everyday
  You have ravished my heart with one glance of your eyes
  With one strand of your necklace, my sister, my bride

songs.title: Lord, we've heard the call, "Come forward,"
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Lord, we've [F]heard the call, "Come f[G]orward,"      
Unto t[G7]he most Holy Pl[C]ace,      
To behold she[G]kinah gl[C]ory      
Shining fr[D]om Your [D7]blessed f[G]ace.      

  Coming f[G7]orward to the H[C]oliest,      
  Through the [G7]incense altar's pr[C]ayer;      
  [C7]No more v[F]eil of separ[C]ation,      
  We may boldly [G7]enter th[C]ere.  

2
We come forward by a new way,
Freshly cut and freshly slain,
To the Holiest of Holies;
Glorious access we obtain.

3
We come forward unto our God,
Who is sitting on the throne;
He has paved the way to glory
By His blood and cross alone.

4
We come forward to the new age,
With assured heart, true and bold.
To enjoy th' eternal purpose,
Ne're to shrink back to the old.

5
Praise You, Lord, we've all come forward.
Now within the Holiest,
You're our God, and we're Your people;
Here we dwell forever blest.

songs.title: Our God’s a Fountain!
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
     [C]Our God’s a [G]Fountain
     The [F]ever-flowing One.
     [C]And His com[G]passions come [C]rising with the [G]Sun.
     It’s [F]on His word we [G]feed; He’s [C]everything we
     [Am]need.
     [F]Nothing com[G]pares to our [C]God!

[Am]Though we are like [F]Israel, un[C]faithful and un[G]clean, 
[Am]Though there might be [F]countless things [C]us and God be[G]tween, 
[C]Even in His grief or [G]wrath, when[F]e’er we turn to [Am]Him,
[C]He will never fail to [G]give His [F]loving [G]compas[C]sion.

    Our God is loving,
    So He will not condemn
    When we repent and come running back to Him
    Oh how His heart does yearn that we our hearts 
    would turn.
    Praise Him for His tender love!

Our whole being thirsts for Him, each moment, every day
We need the Spirit’s filling, we’re simply made this way;
Broken cisterns will not do: they simply leave us dead.
Eternity within our hearts is longing for the fountainhead.

    Come to the Fountain
    That’s springing from within,
    And let it flood you and fill you to the brim!
    The cisterns will run dry, but not our Christ’s 
    supply!
    Praise Him, the fountain of life!

How we need to find His Word and take it as our food
Not only to have a taste, but masticate and chew.
When we take it in this way, our heart’s delight it is;
It constitutes our inward parts and makes our person more like His.

    Lord Jesus, fill us
    And feed us with Your words
    That joy and praise from our being might be 
    heard!
    Oh may Your words be found and in our heart 
    abound:
    Keep bringing us to Your Word.

Every kind of suffering is in His sovereign hand
We cannot but praise Him for His sovereign plan
Shall the vessel say to God, “Why did You make me thus?”
His ways are higher than our ways, praise Him for His mercy because...

     He’s ever faithful
     To mold us as the clay
     To purify us, His glory to display
     May every waking hour be more yield to His 
     power
     Vessels of honor He’ll gain.

“I will give you shepherds, according to My own heart,
Knowledge, understanding as food will they impart”
Overseer of our souls, He shepherds from above;
Our tenderhearted, sovereign God will meet our every need in love.

    Great is our Shepherd!
    And sweet His sovereign hand
    To lead and guide us to feed upon the land.
    He shepherds our heart first
    To quench another’s thirst,
    That we may all shepherds be.


    How great our God is!

3

As moments come and years go by.
Will I ever come to be
What You desire or will I flee from You?

4

And take more time to call and pray;

This is an everlasting vow from Me.

songs.title: God's Spirit is of Christ today
songs.lyrics:
1
God's Spirit is of Christ today,
The Spirit of reality,
He dwells in me with Christ as life
To make this Christ so real to me.

2
As Christ is God's embodiment,
Expressing God as life divine;
So is the Spirit unto Christ,
Revealing Him in life sublime.

3
The fulness of the Father God
In Christ the Son dwells bodily;
And all the riches of the Son
Are Spirit, our reality.

4
Oh in the Son the Father is,
And now the Spirit is the Son;
The Father with the Son is joined,
The Spirit with the Son is one.

5
'Tis when the Spirit strengthens us
And Christ His home makes in our hearts,
The Father's fulness with His love
Will fill us in our inward parts.

6
In Christ, the Father we possess,
Receiving Him for all our need;
In Spirit we experience Christ
As life and everything indeed.

7
With Thy divine reality,
Lord, fill us by Thy Spirit now,
That we may all be full of Thee,
And all Thy riches thus avow.

### Version 1

  Be[D7]holding face to face -  
  [G]I shouldn’t m[C]erely touch Him [G]
  And then just w[C]alk away
  [Em]But in my s[Am7]pirit stay and [C]linger
  [D7]All throughout the [G]day!

### Hymnal.net

1
Jehovah’s habitation isn’t made with hands;
It’s His eternal longing to abide in man.
His footstool is the earth,
The heavens are His throne,
But these are not His dwelling place;
The human spirit is His home.
 
#Brothers:
  Christ lives inside my spirit,
  Supplying me with grace;
  He wants to spend His time with me,
  Beholding face to face.

#Sisters:
  I shouldn’t merely touch Him
  And then just walk away,
  But in my spirit stay and linger

#All:
  All throughout the day.

2
Our spirit is within the holiest of all;
It’s here we worship and have fellowship with God.
Not in the outer court;
Beyond the Holy Place,
We must go further to behold
The glorious shining of His face.

3
Now Jesus lives inside us, so we all must take
Him daily as our fortress and our hiding place.
He’s being built in us,
We’re being built in Him,
The resting place of God and man
For all eternity, amen!

2
Ye children of men, attend to the word
So solemnly uttered by Jesus, the Lord,
And let not this message to you be in vain,
"Ye must be born again."

3
Oh, ye who would enter that glorious rest,
And sing with the ransomed the song
of the blest;
The life everlasting if ye would obtain,
"Ye must be born again."

songs.title: Made free! Made free! O captive
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Made free! Made [G]free! O [D]captive!
Bound by the [G]law of [A]sin,
The [D]law of [E]life in [A]Spirit
Will quicken [E]you with[A]in.
And [A]counting [A7]on the [D]Spirit,
His [B7]life shall now con[Em]trol
The [A]members of your body,
The [G]portals [A]of [A7]your [D]soul.

2
Made free! Made free in Jesus:
For crucified with Him,
From center to circumf'rence,
He breaks the power of sin.
No longer act in body
As if it had no "law";
His "law of life" must govern
All that ran wild before.

3
Made free! Made free in Jesus:
Deep planted in His death,
He liberates His life pow'r,
And breathes His Spirit's breath.
Then waxing strong in spirit,
With force of quickening life;
The soul and body governed,
Its members cease from strife!

4
Made free! Made free in Jesus:
Joined to the Risen One,
By conflict prayer you triumph,
And claim His victory won.
Freed with His glorious freedom,
Above the darkness rife;
For now the law of sin and death
Is conquered by His life.

songs.title: Rivers of living water
songs.lyrics:
#New Tune
1
[D]Riv[A]ers of [G]living [A]water,
[D]Ri[A]vers that f[G]low from the thr[A]one,
[G]Riv[D]ers o'er[Bm]flowing with [A]blessing,
[G]Com[D]ing from [Em7]Jesus al[A7]one.

  [D]Riv[A]ers of [Bm]living [A]water,
  [D]Rivers of [G]life so [A]free,
  [D]Flow[A]ing from T[Bm]hee, my [A]Savior,
  [D]Send now the [G]rivers through [A]me.

2
Whoso is thirsty come hither,
Here is abundant supply;
Water transparent as crystal,
Come without money and buy.

3
Cleanse me, oh, cleanse me, my Savior,
Make me a channel today;
Empty me, fill me and use me,
Teach me to trust and obey.

4
Then, and then only, Lord Jesus,
Through me the rivers can flow;
Thus and thus only will others
Learn Thy great fulness to know.

5
Now I surrender to Jesus,
Here I lay all at His feet
Anything, anywhere only,
Just for His service made meet!

songs.title: Come in!
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

[C]Come into every corner of my heart
I’d like to [Am]know Your healing art
The things I could [F]never fix on my [G]own
I now lay [C]down

Come and replace all that I know
Bring me to where I do not wish to go
Though I may think I know best
But only You know where’s my rest.

Come into my mind, emotion, will
Teach me to trust You, and be still
Even if I fuss & fight
Lord, I know Your ways are right.

Come into every room in my being
All of the parts I’ve kept, unseen
But the love that You have for me
Constrains me utterly.

songs.title: Simon, son of John
songs.lyrics:
#John 21:16
# Capo 2
[D]Simon, son of [A]John,
Do you [G]love [A]me?
He [G]said to Him, Yes [D]Lord,
You [G]know that I love [A]You.
I [D]love You, I [F#m]love You,
You [G]know that I love [D]You.
He [G]said to him, shepherd [A]My [D]sheep.

songs.title: Jesus won’t You come, won’t You come
songs.lyrics:
1
[E]Jesus won’t You come, won’t You [A]come,
[]won’t You come?
[E]We say to our [B]Bridegroom come.
[E]Jesus won’t You come, won’t You [A]come,
[]won’t You come?
[E]We say to our [B]Bridegroom [E]come.

2
Blend us all as one, all as one, that we will
be
A bride that matches You perfectly;
Make us all to be, all to be, all to be
The expression of Your glory.

3
Oh, our Love,
We know You are longing for Your Bride
Lord, we long,
That Your heart's desire would be satisfied.

#(Parts can be sung together)

songs.title: What a Mystery, Mystery of Mysteries
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]What a mystery,
[F#m]Mystery of mysteries,
[G]Our God is Triune,
[A]Our God is one yet th[D]ree!
Father, Son, and [F#m]Spirit flow in me,
[G]Praise the Lord for [A]His divine Trinit[D]y!

  [D]God the [F#m]Father [G]planned for His [A]purpose,
  [D]God the [F#m]Son died [G]and red[A]eemed,
  [D]We were [F#m]sealed with [G]God, the Holy [A]Spirit,
  [D]Oh, the [F#m]Triune God [G]has a [A]plan, econo[D]my!

2
What a mystery,
Wonderful mystery,
Our God is Spirit,
He flows the Son to me!
Calling Jesus’ name, we get all three,
Praise the Lord for His divine Trinity!

  How I love His name, “Oh Lord Jesus!”
  When I call He comes to me,
  As the Spirit from and with the Father,
  Oh, the Triune God reaches me, even me!

3
What a mystery,
Wonderful mystery,
The Triune God has,
Incorporated me,
As a member I’m in the Body,
Reconciled through His divine Trinity.

  Hallelujah He is dispensing,
  Hallelujah all His being,
  One with Him we stand as His own Body,
  Oh, the Triune God has the church eternally.

songs.title: As the hart panteth for the water (original)
songs.lyrics:
# Psa. 42:1-2; 28:7

1
[C]As the [G]hart panteth [Am]for the [C7]water,
So my [F]soul longeth [G]after [C]Thee[G].
[C]You a[G]lone are my [Am]heart’s [C7]desire
And I [F]long to [G]worship [C]Thee.

  [Am]You alone are my [F]Strength, my [C]Shield,
  To [F]You alone doth my [Dm]spirit [E]yield.
  [C]You a[G]lone are my [Am]heart’s [C7]desire
  And I [F]long to [G]worship [C]Thee.

2
You’re my Friend, and You are my Brother,
Even though You are a King.
I love You more than any other,
So much more than anything.

3
I want You more than Gold or Silver
Only You can satisfy
You alone are the real joy giver
And the apple of my eye.

songs.title: Where's the answer?
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[D]Where’s the [A]answer? There [Bm]must be more for [F#m]me.
Is this [G]all to [D]life—an [Em]empty [A7]vani[D-A]ty?
[D]Day by [A]day and [Bm]year by year go [F#m]by.
Am I [G]just a [D]man, a [Em]man just [G]born [A7]to [D]die?

  [Bm]Where’s the [F#m]answer? Oh [Em]I’m so [Bm]empty
  And [G]plagued by this [A]vani[Bm-A]ty.
  [Bm]Deep in[F#m]side me, My [Em]conscience [Bm]tells me:
  I [G]need an[A]other desti[Bm]ny.

2
I convinced my friends that everything’s alright,
That my life and future and everything’s so bright.
But a sense inside me, my friends, I can’t deny,
Warning deep inside me that I was living a lie.

  Where’s the answer? Oh I’m so empty
  And plagued by this vanity.
  Deep inside me, My conscience tells me:
  I need another destiny.

3
The world and its glitter left me anxious, dark, and bitter,
Always yearning, my friends, is there something better?
And religion, my friends, is just a Sunday game—
Dead teachings and doctrines will leave you just the same.

  Where’s the answer? Oh I’m so empty
  And plagued by this vanity.
  Deep inside me, My conscience tells me:
  I need another destiny.

4
Oh God, where are You? I need You desperately!
Oh God, who are You? Why don’t You answer me?
The heavens declare You and the earth shows Your beauty.
But I’m a man. Oh God, I’m so empty!

  Lord, have mercy! I’m crying for You!
  Please hear! Are you really true?
  I’m dark and lonely. You’re far, far from me.
  Oh Lord, I need You desperately!

5
One day a friend told me that Jesus is the Lord.
To my great surprise, it’s written in the Word.
They asked me to believe You. Your name I once blasphemed.
Dear Lord, You saved me just by calling on Your name.

  Oh, Lord Jesus, dear Son, so glorious,
  I’m cleansed and You entered into me.
  Oh, Lord Jesus, Your name most precious!
  Your Person, dear Lord, I now possess.

songs.title: Mary (Luke 10:41-42)
songs.lyrics:
#Luke 10:41-42

[C]Martha,[Em] Martha[Am] why [F]so many [C]cares?[Em]
Your eyes set on [Am]troubles, [F]your heart filled with [C]snares [G]

Lord, right now I'm turning back to You

#Chorus and verses can be sung together

songs.title: O Lord of life, breathe on us now
songs.lyrics:
1
O Lord of life, breathe on us now,
And move within us while we pray;
The spring of our new life art Thou,
The very light of our new day.

2
O strangely art Thou with us, Lord,
Neither in height nor depth to seek;
In nearness shall Thy voice be heard;
Spirit to spirit Thou dost speak.

3
Thou art our Advocate on high;
He is our Advocate within;
O plead the truth, and make reply
To every argument of sin.

4
But ah, this faithless heart of mine!
The way I know, I know my guide;
Forgive me, O my Friend divine,
That I so often turn aside.

5
Be with me when no other friend
The myst'ry of my heart can share;
And be Thou known, when fears transcend,
By Thy best name of Comforter.

songs.title: Lord, These Late Nights
songs.lyrics:
[C]Lord these late [Dm]nights
[F]Make me [C]realize
[Am]No love has [Em]ever felt
[F]deeper than [C]Thine.[Dm-G]

[C]I was searching for [Dm]joy
[F]But never [C]found
[Am]Yet before I [Em]knew it
Your sweet [F]love had [C]come.[Am7]

  [Dm]How could I [Am7]not subject
  [C]Myself to Your deep [G]love?
  [Dm]Oh Lord, I’ve [Dm7]never felt this [C]joy [G]before![Dm-G]

Lord, all I had seen
Were no more than shadows
Of Your life-changing person
Whom I strive to know.

Now Your love is moving
It makes me see
Your prudent economy,
Your will for me.

  And now I watch, and I am
  like a lone,
  Lone sparrow on a housetop, my Lord.

songs.lyrics:
# Matthew 8:11; 1 Peter 2:9; Philippians 2:15

[G] But I say to you that [C]many will co[G]me

And [C]will recline at [G]table
With [C]Abraham and [G]Isaac and [D]Jacob in the [G]kingdom;

The [D]kingdom of the [G]heavens.

# (repeat)

[G]But you are a ch[C]osen race,[D] a royal pries[G]thood,

songs.title: How I love Your reigning life Lord
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]How I love Your [Bm]reigning life Lord[G]
How I love a[A]bundant grace
[D]How I love to [Bm]have Your Presence[G]
As I live be[A]fore Your face

  [F#m]By Your life Lord [Bm]I am reigning[G]
  I am over, [A]over everything
  [F#m]As I'm joyful[Bm]ly confessing
  [G]Jesus! [A]As my Lord and [D]King

2
Sin you helpless little fellow

3
World, with all your little trappings

4

5

songs.title: In the mighty Name of Jesus
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 1
1
[G]In the mighty Name of Jesus,
[C]When we bow before the [G]throne,
[D]Many deadly foes are [G]vanquished,
[D]Many [D7]victories are [G]won.

  Mighty [C]Name! Mighty [G]Name!
  In that Name alone we [D]win[D7].
  Mighty [G]Name[G7]! Mighty [C]Name!
  Conquering [G]Satan, [D7]death and [G]sin.

2
When we plead the Name of Jesus,

Jesus! Jesus! Precious Jesus!

3

songs.lyrics:
# Exo. 15
# Capo 3

Je[G]hovah is a [Am7]man of war,
The [C]horse and its rider He [D]cast into the [G-Am7-C-D]sea.

1
[G]Pharaoh's chariot [Am7]and his armies
[C]He cast in the [D]sea.
[G]Waters cover them [Am7]deep in the Red Sea
[C]They sink like a [D]stone

  [C]God is my strength and [Em]song,
  [C]I will praise His [G]name forever!
  [C]God is my strength and [Em]song,
  [C]He has triumphed [D]glorious[G-Am7-C-D]ly!

2
Who is like You, O Jehovah?
Praise You for Your ways!
Splendid in holiness, awesome in praises,
Jehovah is my God.

  Praise my God for His glorious triumph,
  His right hand of power
  Crushed His foes and saved His people,
  Nevermore enslaved!
  He has triumphed gloriously!

3
Days will come when God is silent
Vindicate His name!

4
Now ascended to the throne,

5
Let Your enemies melt away,

songs.title: Every day there is much work to be done (First Enjoy the Lord!)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2
1
[C]Every day there is much [G]work to be done
[F]We are entrusted with the [G]work of the Lord!
[C]We need to do business [G]until He comes,
Bringing [F]in more men and feeding [G]them with His word
[F]Yet each day before we [G]start,
[F]He brings this word up in our [G7]hearts:

  [C]First we need to rest, just to lay [G]down,
  [C]This is what God [F]wants, [C]before the work [G]abounds.
  [C]First enjoy the Lord! Just drink Him [G]in.
  [C]Once we're filled with [F]Him[C]—let the [G]work be[C]gin.

2
He ordained our days to start in this way,
We clearly see in the creation of man—
The first day of man was the seventh day,
To enjoy God's presence, ere he worked on the land.
In our time it is the same,
This divine principle remains...

3
So begin your day reclining on Him,
Enjoying Him as the pleasant pasture land,
Sing until He overflows from the brim,
Flowing out from you to reach whoever's at hand.
If you first behold His face,
Your labor will be done by grace!

songs.title: Lord, You were in the temple
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Lord, You were [F]in the tem[C]ple,
teaching [F]all the peo[C]ple
Of Your[F]self as the l[C]ife.
[CM7]Meanwhile [F]I was elsew[C]here, com[F]mitting
The [C]biggest [F]sin of my l[C]ife.
[CM7]The Phari[F]sees they found [C]me,
dragged me th[F]rough the street;
[C]There midst the [F]people I [C]sat.
[CM7]Teacher, we [F]found this wo[C]man committing
a[F]dultery;
[C]We found her t[F]here in the [C]act.

  Great I [F-G]Am, stooping [C]do[-]wn[Am]
  To the [F]ground so [G]low where I was [C]foun[Am]d.
  Where are [F]they who [G]say that you must
  [C]die tod[Am]ay?
  [F]Woman, [G]go and sin no [C]more.

2
Down from the mountain You came;
I approached You in shame.
I'm a leper, You see.
Sin and rebellion's in me and
I long to be free;
If You're willing, cleanse me.
My destiny is to die; can You help me
survive?
Lord, I know that You can.
All others, Lord, run away when they come
see my face,
Helpless hopeless I am.

  Stretching out Your hand unto me,
  How my heart was warmed when You
  touched me
  With compassion; moved with love I
  never knew.
  By Your touch to me I'm healed.

3
I down to Jericho went, met my robbers
who stripped me and left me half dead.
The priests and levites 'cause they also
travelled my way,
Couldn't help me a bit.
But, Lord, You came to the earth, despised
and slandered;
A Samaritan low,
With divinity there and humanity's care,
Tender and merciful.

  Bound my wounds and poured in oil and wine,
  Gave Your Spirit to me and life divine,
  To the church brought me where care
  I could receive,
  Jesus, You're my Savior true!

songs.title: I have loved Your precepts
songs.lyrics:
# Psa. 119:159, 157, 160, 16, 15, 11

[C]I have loved Your precepts;[E7] O Jehovah,[Am]
Enliven [F]me. [F-G-C]
I have not swerved from Your[E7] testimonies. [Am]
Your word is [F]truth. [Dm]
In Your [G]statutes do I [C]take deli[Am]ght; [Dm]
In Your [G]precepts do I [C]muse[C7].     [Dm]
In my [G]heart do I [C]trea[E7]sure Your [Am]word

(Countermelody)

he will keep my word

Your word is truth

songs.title: Sing a new song (The songs of Zion)
songs.lyrics:
# THE SONGS OF ZION
 
  [D]Sing a new song, the [F#m]songs of Zion
  [A]Sing, sing the [G]song of [D]Jehovah
  [A]Sing, sing a [G]new song to Je[D]hovah

1
[D]Over[Bm]comers
[A]Standing on the glassy [G]sea
[D]Sing the song of [Bm]Moses
[A]And the song of the [G]Lamb

[D]Over[Bm]comers
[A]Standing with the Lamb on [G]Mount Zion
[D]Sing a [Bm]new song
They [G]praise, rejoice and [A]sing!

A normal Christian life should be

#Psa. 137:3-4; 149:1; Eph. 5:18-19; Col. 3:16; Rev. 14:1-3; 15:2-3

songs.title: Manna from heaven came down
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[D]Manna from [G]heaven came [D]down.
[G]M’raculous [D]mystery from [A]God.
[D]Jesus said, [G]“I am this [D]bread...
[G]Given for the [A]life of the [D]world.”
  [D]Eat [G]Him.
  [D]He is the [A]living bread.
  [D]Gain [G]Him.
  Oh [D]what a [A]supply!
  [D]Praise [G]Him!
  [D]Only He [A]satisfies.
  [D]Jes[G]us!
  [D]The all-in[A]clusive [D]Christ.

2
Christ is the spiritual rock,
Smitten and cleft by our God.
Water of life flowéd forth.
Now quenching all of our thirst.
  Drink Him.
  He is the fount of life.
  Taste Him.
  Oh sweet well of life.
  Praise Him!
  Never you’ll thirst again.
  Jesus!
  The all-inclusive Christ.

3
On the cross where He was nailed,

Why not receive and enjoy.
  Take Him.
  Our Savior and our King.
  Give Him,
  The first place in us.

  Jesus!
  The all-inclusive Christ.

4

  Praise Him!
  Life-giving Spirit.
  Jesus!
  The all-inclusive Christ.

songs.title: The love of God is greater far
songs.lyrics:
#3/4

1
The love of [C]God is [F]greater [C]far
Than tongue or [G]pen can [G7]ever [C]tell.
It goes beyond the [F]highest [C]star
And reaches [G]to the [G7]lowest [C]hell.
The guilty [F]pair, bowed down with [C]care,
God gave His [G]Son to [C]win;
His erring [F]child He recon[C]ciled
And pardoned [G]from his [C]sin.

  [C7]O love of [F]God, how rich and [C]pure!
  How measure[G]less [G7]and [C]strong![C7]
  It shall for[F]evermore en[C]dure
  The saints’ and [G]an[G7]gels' [C]song.

2
When hoary time shall pass away,

3
Could we with ink the ocean fill,
And were the skies of parchment made;
Were every stalk on earth a quill,
And every man a scribe by trade;
To write the love of God above
Would drain the ocean dry;
Nor could the scroll contain the whole,
Though stretched from sky to sky.

songs.title: God is a God of purpose according to His eternal purpose
songs.lyrics:
[D]God is a God of [G]purpose
Ac[A]cording to His e[D]ternal purpose,
[G]He has a [D]plan
His [G]plan is His [A]economy.

In [D]this econo[G]my, 
God cre[A]ated the [D]heavens
[G]and the [D]earth,
And [G]then created [A]man in such a [D]way
That He could work Him[G]self
Into [A]man in order [D]to produce
An [G]enti[D]ty of [G]dual nature-[A]human and [D]divine[D7]
To ex[G]press Him[A]self.
When [Bm]this econo[F#m]my reaches [G]us
[A]It becomes our [D]salva[D7]tion.

This is [G]the central [A]revelation
[Bm]of the entire Bi[F#m]ble
Especial[G]ly of the [A]New Testa[D]ment.

The [G]center of [A]the en[Bm]tire New Testa[F#m]ment
Is the [G]revelation to [A]us
Of [G]God's e[A]ternal econo[D]my.(x2)

#Abiding in the Lord and Enjoying His life (CWWL, 1983, vol. 3)

songs.title: Don't Say "Oh No!"
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Time to get up, but you want to sleep;
[C]Test is tougher than you thought it would be.
[G]Bus runs early when you’re [E7]running late;
[A7]Feels like there’s too [D7]much on your plate.
[]But you can

# Chorus
  [G]Call on Jesus! (Call on Jesus!)
  [C]O Lord Jesus! (O Lord Jesus!)
  [G]Don’t say, [E7]“Oh no!”
  [A7]Call, [D7-G]"O Lord!”

2
Homework to do, and essays to write;
Seems like every little thing is a fight.
Car’s not starting and the outlook’s bleak;
Don’t know how you’ll get through the week.
But you can

  Call on Jesus! (Call on Jesus!)
  O Lord Jesus! (O Lord Jesus!)
  Don’t say, “Oh no!”
  Call, “O Lord!”

#Bridge 
  [C]Any situation
  Can turn [G]out to your salvation
  As [C]long as you’re exclaiming
  A [D]life-giving [D7]exclamation! (O Lord Jesus!)

3
Call on Him softly, call right out loud;
Call alone, or you can call with a crowd.
Call His name and make His riches yours;
Don’t confuse “Oh no!” and “O Lord!”
You’ve got to

  Call on Jesus! (Call on Jesus!)
  O Lord Jesus! (O Lord Jesus!)
  Don’t say, “Oh no!”
  Call, “O Lord!”


#(c) 2020 Melody of Lilies

songs.title: You need more ground in my heart
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

[D]You need more [G]ground in my [D]heart
But I'm [D]full of [Bm]things that take me [Em]from You.
Lord, I'm [Em]scared to [B7]open every [Em]part
But I [A]know that [A7]You need my [D]heart[D7].

So, day by [G]da[A]y, turn me a[D]wa[Bm]y;
Bit by [Em]bit, work in [A]me, to gain [D]all of [D7]it.
Moment by [G]mo[A]ment, my heart be [F#]ope[Bm]ned,
Willing to [Em]give[A] my all to [D]You.

songs.title: Blessed Lord, our hallelujahs
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Blessed Lord, our hallelujahs
[D]Now to Thee we [A]raise.
[D]Never could we fully utter
[E7]All Thy worth and [A]praise!

  [D]Praise the Lamb, for He is worthy!
  [G]Sweet eternal [A]strain.
  [D]Hallelujah! [G]Hallelujah!
  [D]Praise the [A7]Lord! A[D]men.

2
Praise the Lamb! Yes, Thou art worthy,
Who didst shed Thy blood
To redeem Thy saints, and make us
Kings and priests to God!

3
Hallelujah! Thou, Lord Jesus,
Canst not cease to love;
Thine we are and Thine forever,
One with Thee above.

4
Praise the Lord! Yes, hallelujah!
Who would hush the song?
Join with saints from every nation,
Every tribe and tongue.

songs.title: Since long ago at Bethany we parted
songs.lyrics:
1
[(G7)]Since long a[C]go at [C7]Bethany we [F]parted,
Within my [Em]heart there [Am]is a [D7]ceaseless [G]void;[G7]
How can I [C]take my [C7]harp down from the [F]willow?
How can my [C]songs wi[G]thout Thee [G7]be en[C]joyed?[G7]
And when at [Am]night I'm [F]keeping lonely v[C-Am]igil—  [G7]
Grown numb a[Am]like to [F]sorrow and to [G-G7]cheer—
Then I re[C]call the [F]promise of Thy [C-Am]coming,[F]
But [G7]sigh: O [C]Lord, why, [(C7)]why Thou [F]dost not [G7]yet ap[C-F-C]pear?

2
Thy manger wakes the thought: I too am homeless;
Thy cross strips earthly pleasures from my soul;
Thy coming bids me seek a better country,
For Thou Thyself art now my final goal.
Since Thou art gone my joy has lost its flavor,
My song the sweetness I would fain convey.
Since Thou art gone the sense of void o'erwhelms me.
Oh, how I long that Thou wilt come and not delay.

3
Though even now I know Thy loving presence,
Yet in my heart there's still a sense of lack.
Enlightening and tenderest sustaining
Can no more satisfy: I want Thee back.
Despite Thy peace within, I still feel lonely;
Despite Thy joy there still remains a sigh;
When I feel most content, the silent yearning
To see Thee face to face becomes an uttered cry.

4
What exile cannot but desire his homeland
And long his people once again to greet?
What soul on alien soil forgets his kindred?
What parted lovers never yearn to meet?
O Lord, how can these earthly loves and pleasures
With all the joy of Thy return compare?
Then, if I cannot here behold Thy countenance,
What can I do but sigh till Thou, my Lord, appear?

5
Could'st Thou, O Lord, forget Thy word of promise
Soon to return and take me unto Thee?
Yet day by day and year by year I've waited
And still I wait, and no return I see!
Remember, Lord, the years I have been waiting
While Thy dear footsteps linger far away.
How long? How long? Oh! Must I wait still longer
Till Thou shalt come again in glorious array?

6
From generation unto generation
Thy saints have come and gone, but have not seen
Thy glorious promise pass into fulfilment.
How long, how very long the time has been!
Why cannot we, dear Lord, discern Thy footsteps?
Why are the heavens still so closely sealed?
Oh! Must our waiting be prolonged still further
Before Thou in Thy matchless splendor art revealed?

7
Lord, I recall the many years I've waited
For Thy return—yet, Lord, not I alone,
But Thy dear saints through many generations—
Beseeching Thee to come back for Thine own.
To countless tears and countless fervent pleadings,
By Thine appearing haste to make reply.
Oh, may Thou come, the echo of the ages,
Come, come and answer now this mighty corp'rate cry!

songs.lyrics:

Up[Am]on our Jesus [D7]Christ the church is [E]being built up today

[Am]All our work will [D7]be revealed that [E]day

No other ambition but to please the King of kings

songs.title: We've become the Lord's dear brothers
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]We've become the Lord's dear [F]broth[Dm]ers
[Em]Through His resur[Am]rection [Dm]pow'[G]r;
[F]He desires many [C]brothers
[G]Sharing in His [D7]triumph [G]hour!

  [C]Jesus is our Elder [F]Broth[C]er,
  First-born of God's sons is [G7]He;
  He came forth in resurrection,
  From religion He is [C]free!
  As His church we come together;
  Oldness, form, and self de[F]ny;
  Just to meet with [D7]our Big [C]Broth[A7]er,
  [D]Him alone to [G7]glori[C]fy!

2
In our Brother's resurrection
Resurrected we must meet,
Never in our natural standing—
This will make His joy complete!

3
Every day we must see Jesus
As we're eating of the Word;
Then we'll run to all the meetings
Burning, bubbling with the Lord!

4
In the meetings we are feasting
On the food unlimited.
Jesus always satisfies us,
Feeding us the living bread!

5
We would satisfy our Brother,
Even though our portion's small.
Every one must share his "new dish"
For the benefit of all!

6
Not for message or for speaker,
But to meet the Lord we're here;
Caring only for His presence,
We would see our Brother dear!

songs.title: Lord, day by day, I come to You
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[D]Lord, day by [F#m]day, I [Bm]come to Yo[D7-G]u.
I turn my [Em]heart to You right[A] no[A7]w.
[D]Lord, wash me [F#m]in Your [Bm]precious bloo[D7-G]d.
I give my[A7]self to[D] You.[D7-G]
Lord, by Your [D]mercy, I’m [A]eating [Bm-G]You.
By Your [D]bread I get[A] throu[A7-G]gh.
Eating Your [A]Word is en[D]joy[F#m]able.[Bm-G]
It fills my [A7]spirit [D]up.

2
Lord, breath by breath, I call on You;
Your name supplies and soothes my soul.
Lord, draw me to my spirit now;
Let me abide in You.
Lord, every moment, I drink of You.
It’s Your life that renews;
Your Spirit flows in and fills each part
Til soaked with only You.

3
Lord, year by year, I grow in You;
I’m rooted, grounded in Your love.
Lord, make Your home in all my heart;
Transform and fill each part.
Grant me the grace, Lord, to flee, pursue,
With all those who love You.
Knit us together and build us up
Your Bride and Body true.

songs.title: But without faith it is impossible (Hebrews 11:6)
songs.lyrics:
# Heb. 11:6; cf. Gal. 2:20; Luke 17:5; Gen. 5:24
# Capo 3
1
But without [C]faith it is im[G]possible to be
Well-[F]plea[G]sing to [C]Him,
But without [C]faith it is im[G]possible to be
Well-[F]plea[G]sing to [C]Him[C7],
For he who [F]comes [G]forward to [C]God[Am]
Must be[Dm]lieve [G]that He [C]is [C7]
And that He [F]is a [G]rewarder [C]of [G]those [Am]who
[F]Dili[G]gently [C]seek Him.

2
Christ is my faith, so it is possible to be
Well-pleasing to Thee!
Increase my faith, that I may daily grow to be
More well-pleasing to Thee!
Let me now come forward to Thee,
I believe Thou art the "I AM",
And that Thou wilt reward me with Thyself as I
Diligently seek Thee.

#Ending:
  He[F]brews e[G]leven : [C-F-C]six

songs.title: Rejoice, the Lord is King
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Rejoice, the Lord is K[Am]ing,
Your L[F]ord and K[Dm]ing ad[G]ore;
Mort[C]als, give th[Am]anks and s[D]ing,
And tr[D]iumph ev[D7]erm[G]ore:

  Lift [F]up y[G]our h[Am]eart, lift [Dm]up your voice;
  Re[F]joice, ag[Dm]ain I s[C]ay, [G7]rejo[C-F-C]ice.

2
His kingdom cannot fail;
He rules o'er earth and heav'n;
The keys of death and hell
Are to our Jesus giv'n:

3
Jesus, the Savior reigns,
The God of truth and love:
When He had purged our stains,
He took His seat above:

4
He sits, at God's right hand
Till all His foes submit,
And bow to His command,
And fall beneath His feet:

songs.title: Why was a cup made?
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 3)

[D]Why was a cup made? (echo)
To [G]have a drink in[A]side it.
[D]Why was a shoe made? (echo)
To [G]have a foot ins[A]ide it.
[D]Why was an envelope [D7]made?
To [G]have a letter in[Em]side it.
[D]Why were you and I made? (echo)
To [G]have God’s [A]life in [D-G-D]us.

Why was a glove made?
To have a hand inside it.
Why was a purse made?
To have some coins inside it.
Why was a flower vase made?
To have some flowers inside it.
Why were you and I made?
To have God’s life in us.

songs.title: Our Father Who’s in the Heav’ns (Matt. 6:9-13)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
9
[C]Our Father who’s [F]in the heav’ns,
Your name be [C]sanctified; [A]
10
Your kingdom [Dm]come; [G]
Your will be [C]done, [C7]
As in [F]heaven, so also on [C]earth. [A]
(Abba [Dm]Father,[G] Abba [C]Father.)
11
Give us today our [F]daily bread. ([C]Father)[G]
12
And for[C]give us our debts,
As we [F]also have for[C]given our [G]debtors.
13
And do not [Am]bring us into temp[Em]tation,
But de[F]liver us from the [C]evil one.
([F]Fa[G]ther, [Dm-G]Fa  -  [C]ther.)[C7]
(For [F]Yours is the [G]kingdom and the [E]power
And the [Am]glory for[F]ever. A[G]men. A[C]men.)

songs.title: Oh, come see a man!
songs.lyrics:
# 3/4
#Capo 2
1
[D]One day as the [A]Lord passed a [D]well,
A [G]woman so [D]thirsty was [A]there.
He [D]was not con[A]tent un[D]til
He [G]left her the [D]water that’s [A]real, pure, and [D]clear.[G]

  Oh, come see a [D]man, (Jes[A]us!)
  Oh, [A7]come see a [D]man, [D7]
  Who [G]told me all [D]things that [A]ever I [D]did.[G]
  Is this not the [D]Christ? (Oh [A]yes!)
  Is [A7]this not the [D]Christ?[D7]
  He [G]fills me for[D]ever and [A]ever! A[D G-D  G-D  G-D]men.

2
He spoke words that I’d never heard,
Yet how He did stir up my thirst!
He spoke of the water that lives,
To all who are thirsty, He freely will give.

3
Now this living water have I!
I drink and I soar to the sky!
His praises now fill all the air
Because I am speaking Him, now, everywhere!

songs.title: Life is God the Father
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Life is God the Father
In Christ [G]Jesus as the Spirit
Flowing [D]out and coming into [A]us.
[D]He's not just a teaching,
Or a [G]creed or a dead doctrine,
But the [D]processed Triune [A]God, glori[D-G-D]ous!

2
Life is not created
As man's body, soul, and spirit—
That's man's life that's weak and temporal.
Life is uncreated.
It's divine and it's eternal.
And this is the life that's indestructible.

3
And this life came in us
In our spirit through the Spirit;
This is where we were made alive!
Now this life is spreading.
Lord, don't stop—just keep invading.
For this, Lord, we must be daily revived.

4
Life needs our maintaining,
Otherwise we're suffocating.
Calling on His name we breathe Him in.
Everywhere we breathe Him,
Makes us fresh and makes us living.
O, this life is full of hope and meaning.

5
In our daily living
It's this life that we are sensing.
Are we in the flesh or in the Lord?
If you're dead and empty
And the troubles you have plenty,
Saints, get out of there and flee back to the Lord!

6
Then you'll sense life flowing.
It's this life that's overcoming
Satan, flesh, and the world, and sin.
What a life we're having.
Lord, Your virtues manifesting,
Thus, we're branches bearing fruit in John 15.

songs.title: He cares more for how we eat!
songs.lyrics:
1
Further rejection came from Israel
Those who received the Lord were few
Into the parts of Tyre and Sidon
Jesus went from there and withdrew
 
Out from those borders came a Canaanite
A gentile woman with a plea:
"Lord, Son of David, please have mercy!
My daughter suffers terribly!"
 
"I was sent
For the lost sheep of Israel.
Why do you
Come to me in this way?" 

"It is not good to take the children's bread
And throw it to the little dogs.
She said "YES - LORD! even the little dogs
Eat of the Master's crumbs that fall."
 
2
Not many people would receive the Lord,  
Eat Him as food and taste His grace 
So Jesus answered and He said to her,
"O woman, how great is your faith!"
 
How often, like her, we approach the Lord
When our life's problems have accrued.
Our wish is that He would dispose of them,
But our real need is Christ as food!
 
 
He was sent
For the lost sheep of Israel
But His grace 
Fell as crumbs to the world
We need not worry or be anxious
He knows our problems thoroughly
The Lord does care for our well-being,
But He cares more for how we eat!

songs.title: Oh, blow upon us, Lord, while here we wait on Thee
I heard the voice of Jesus say
songs.lyrics:
1
[Dm]I heard the voice of Jesus [Gm]say,
"Come [Bb]unto [C]Me, and [Dm]rest;
Lay down, thou weary one, lay [Gm]down
Thy [Bb]head [C]upon My [Dm]breast."
I [D]came to [Gm]Jesus [C]as I [F]was,
We[Bb]ary, and worn, and [C  A]sad;
I found in [Dm]Him a resting-[Gm]place,
And [Bb]He has [C]made me [Dm]glad.

2
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
"Behold, I freely give
The living water: thirsty one,
Stoop down, and drink, and live."
I came to Jesus, and I drank
Of that life-giving stream;
My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,
And now I live in Him.

3
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
"I am this dark world's Light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright."
I looked to Jesus, and I found
In Him my Star, my Sun;
And in that Light of life I'll walk
Till traveling days are done.

songs.title: Unless Jehovah builds the house
songs.lyrics:
# Psalm 127:1-2

Unless Jeh[G]ovah builds the h[Em]ouse,
Those who [C]build it labor in [D]vain.
Unless Jeh[G]ovah keeps the cit[Em]y,
The [C]guard watches in [D]vain.

It is [G]vain for you to [Em]rise up early,
To stay up [C]late, to eat the [D]bread of toil;
All the [G]same, He gives to [Em]His beloved
While they [C]sleep, while they [D]sleep.

#repeat

#ending:
  While they s[G]leep.

songs.title: O Lord, You know what’s in my heart
songs.lyrics:
1
O [D]Lord, You know what’s [G]in my [Em7]heart,
De[F#m]sires con[Bm]cealed in my [Em]inward [A]parts;
Though [D]“I am Yours” my [G]mouth’s [Em7]confessed,
By [D]many [Bm]loves my [A7]heart’s pos[D]sessed.
O Lord, my [G]desp’rate [D]cry now heed—
Regain my [G]heart! Your [D]help I [A7]need!
O’er[D]turn, expose what [G]weighs me [Em7]down,
That [D]in these [Bm]things I [A7]would not [D]drown.

2
How blind I’ve been, how filled with pride,
Believing in the things of sight,
In things uncertain placing hope,
And not in Him who all upholds.
Oh, turn my heart from meaner things;
Forgive me, Lord, for wavering.
I must pursue the One who’s real;
The false, release; no more deceived!

3
Cause me, dear Lord, to truly see—
I’m Yours; a man of God indeed.
Your life and nature I, too, share;
To flee earth’s snares, my earnest pray’r.
My heart, dear Lord, I yield anew
To only love, lay hold on You.
With cords of man, with bands of love,
Lord, keep me faithful till You come.

songs.title: Art thou hung'ring for the fulness
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune
1
[D]Art thou [Bm]hung'ring [A]for the [D]fulness
Of the blessing [A]Christ doth [D]give?
Longing now to [G]learn the [D]secret
Of the life He [G]bids thee [A]live?
[D]In His [Bm]word thine [A]answer [D]standeth,
"Christ who is our [A]Life" it [D]saith;
[D]Open now thy heart, and trust Him,
[D]There to dwell, henceforth, by faith.

2
Christ, the Lord's Anointed, reigning
O'er the life He died to win,
Daily shall reveal more fully
His great power, without, within.
What thou never could'st accomplish
Shall His Spirit work through thee,
While thy soul this witness beareth,
'Tis not I, but Christ in me.

3
In Him dwelleth all God's fulness,
In Him thou art made complete;
Rise, and claim thy heavenly birthright,
Kneeling at thy Father's feet.
He will never disappoint thee,
Praise Him that the gift is thine;
Then go forth to live each moment
On sufficiency divine.

4
Lord, I come, and simply resting
On Thy faithful, changeless word,
I believe the blood doth cleanse me,
And that Christ is crowned Lord.
Grant henceforth a ceaseless outflow
Of Thy life and love through me;
Reaching those who sit in darkness,
Winning priceless souls to Thee.

### New Tune
1
[C]Art thou [F]hung'ring [G]for the [Am]fulness
[C]Of the [F]blessing [G]Christ doth [G7]give?
[C]Longing [F]now to [G]learn the [Am]secret
Of the [F]life He [G]bids thee [C]live?

2

'Tis not I, but Christ in me.

3

How splendid, beauteous, Zion the High Peak!

ap[D]peared to me.

songs.title: Tremendous Grace!
songs.lyrics:
# Tune: Hymns, #313 ("Amazing Grace!")

1
Tre[G]mendous [G7]grace! How [C]grand the [G]sight!
The Word [A7]reveals it [D]thus:[D7]
‘Tis [G]nothing [G7]less than [C]God Him[G]self
To be en[D]joyed [D7]by [G]us!

2
The Word, eternal, flesh became,
Among men—full of grace;
By grace death tasted and became
The Breath of life and grace.

3
The Father, Son, and Spirit now
In Christ as grace flows free
Man with His glory to endow
In His economy.

4
Inside our spirit this grace came
When we did first believe.
Now, calling on this Jesus’ name,
Upon grace, grace receive.

5
Abounding grace we thus receive
Saves us in life to reign,
From Satan, sin, and death relieves,
And God’s true goal obtains.

6
By such a grace we’re justified,
Transformed and glorified;
Christ’s Body too is edified.
Thus, God is satisfied.

7
The New Jerusalem—complete—
The world on her will gaze;
Thenceforth, with all of God replete,
His grace fore’er displays!

8
Tremendous grace! Abounding grace!
The all-sufficient grace!
Let heav'n and earth forever praise
The glory of His grace!

Who dares to bind by his dull sense
The oracles of heaven,
For all the nations, tongues and climes
And all the ages given!
The universe how much unknown!
The ocean unexplored!
The Lord hath yet more light and truth
To break forth from His Word.

3
Darkling our great forefathers went
The first steps of the way;
'Twas but the dawning yet to grow
Into the perfect day;
And grow it shall, our glorious Sun
More fervid rays afford:
The Lord hath yet more light and truth
To break forth from His Word.

4
The valleys past, ascending still,
Our souls would higher climb,
And look down from supernal heights,
On all the bygone times;
Upward we press, the air is clear,
And the sphere-music heard!
The Lord hath yet more light and truth
To break forth from His Word.

5
O Father, Son and Spirit, send
Us increase from above;
Enlarge, expand all Christian hearts
To comprehend Thy love;
And make us all go on to know
With nobler powers conferred:
The Lord hath yet more light and truth
To break forth from His Word.

songs.title: I’ve Got a Spirit!
songs.lyrics:
I am made in three parts, yes I am.
The Lord made me a three part man.
I’ve got a body. I’ve got a soul.
I’ve got a spirit, and did you know.
I’ve got a spirit and I know why—
So the Lord can live inside and fill me up.
Yes, that is why I’ve got a spirit.

I’ve got a spirit, wonderful spirit,
I’m as happy as can be!
I’ve got a spirit, oh what a spirit!
Now the Lord can live inside of me.

I wake up every morning and I call,
"O Lord!" and I pray and I thank Him
For taking good care of my family.
"Thank you Lord for filling me.
And, O Lord Jesus, this I pray,
That you fill me every day.
Fill me in my deepest part."
That’s my spirit! I’ve got a spirit.

I’ve got a spirit!

songs.title: O Lord, Thou art the Son of man
songs.lyrics:
1
[A]O Lord, Thou art the [E7]Son of [F#m]man,
[B7]Our human [E]nature [B7]Thou didst [E]take;
Be[A]gotten [D]of a [A]virgin [F#m]true,
Of fl[E]esh and [D]blood Thou [E7]didst par[A]take.

2
In bondman's form, with lowliness,
Thou walkedst on this earth of woe;
The human living Thou didst have
And all its suff'rings undergo.

3
Born in a manger as a babe,
Thou wast a child among the poor;
Thou as a carpenter didst work,
And e'en an outlaw's death endure.

4
Then Thou wast raised up from the dead,
Still with the human nature true;
And as a man in form divine,
Thou didst ascend to heaven too.

5
Now over all, and on the throne,
Thou, still a man, art glorified;
A man with God in light divine
With whom our God is satisfied.

6
In glory Thou wilt come again,
Still as a man appearing then;
As King of kings, with pow'r divine,
With human nature seen by men.

7
Thou, as the center of all things,
In the new heav'n and earth shalt be,
Forever as the One divine,
Existing in humanity.

songs.title: "And Peter"
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]I told the Lord, I’d [Em]die for Him,
I [F]thought I was so [C]strong.
Yet I three times, [Em]denied Him then
In [F]weakness, I was [G]wrong.
In [Am]shame, I followed [Em]far behind,
But [F]He looked back at [C]me.
He knew I’d fail and [Em]fall three times.
Now [F]weeping bitter[G]ly.
 
  “And [F]Peter,” means also “and you.”
  “And [C]Peter,”—“I really love you.”
  The [G]most beautiful [G7]music in the 
  [C]world![C7]
  “And [F]Peter,”—“I’m thinking of you.”
  “And [C]Peter”—“My heart is for you.”
  Rise [G]up, and go to [G7]see the [C]Lord!

2
I wait three days in silent guilt
I wish the Lord forgot.
I wonder, could He love me still  
Is now my only thought
But when He speaks my name so soft—
Though others note it not—
New hope and joy now fill my heart
As He these tidings brought:

3
Your words my heart shall ever sing,
And strengthen me to turn.
Since willingly You died for me,
Your love won’t cease to burn.
I failed and fell, yet You still came
And loved me e’en in sin.
So now when I feel far away
I hear these words again:

4
Now with Your love and strength’ning power
Your sheep I’d shepherd here,
And with this love You showed me now
I’d feed the flock, so dear.
This feeding builds the church in love—
The love I felt that day.
The Lord will never give us up.
In faith, these words I say:

songs.title: What will you do with Jesus?
songs.lyrics:
1

1

Thou, O grave, canst not enthrall us.
Hallelujah!

2
Jesus lives! Henceforth is death
But the gate of Life immortal;
This shall calm our trembling breath,
When we pass its gloomy portal.
Hallelujah!

3
Jesus lives! For us He died;
Then alone to Jesus living,
Pure in heart may we abide,
Glory to our Savior giving.
Hallelujah!

4

Naught from us His love shall sever;
Life, nor death, nor powers of hell
Tear us from His keeping ever.
Hallelujah!

5
Jesus lives! To Him the Throne
Over all the world is given;
We, in spirit with Him one
Rest and reign with Him in heaven.
Hallelujah!

  Inside of me!

songs.title: Fill me with Thy gracious Spirit
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3
1
[D]Fill me with Thy gracious Spirit,      
Fill my longing spirit [A7]now;      
[D]Fill me with Thy hallowed presence,      
Come, dear Lord, and [A7]fill me n[D]ow!      

  [A]Fill me now! F[D]ill me now!      
  [G]Fill me w[D]ith Thy Spirit [A7]now!      
  [D]Strip me wholly, empty throughly,      
  Fill me with Thy Sp[A7]irit n[D]ow! 

2
Thou can'st fill me with Thy Spirit,
Though I cannot tell Thee how;
But I need Thee, greatly need Thee;
Come, dear Lord, and fill me now!

3
I am weakness, full of weakness;
At Thy sacred feet I bow;
By Thy blest, eternal Spirit,
Fill with strength, and fill me now!

4
Cleanse and comfort, bless and save me;
Fill my broken spirit now!
Thou art comforting and saving,
Thou art sweetly filling now.

  [C]Open to [G]me, my love, my [F]sister, my [C]dove

[Dm]Drops of [G]night drip from your [F]dew drenched [G]locks

2
I yearned for you in my inner parts

songs.title: There is a name I love to hear
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
There [D]is a name I love to hear,
I [A]love to [A7]sing its [D]worth;
It [D]sounds like music in mine ear,
The [A]sweetest [A7]name on [D]earth.

  [D]Oh, how I love Jesus,
  [A]Oh, [A7]how I love [D]Jesus,
  [D]Oh, how I love Jesus,
  Be[A]cause He [A7]first loved [D]me!

2
It tells me of a Savior's love,
Who died to set me free;
It tells me of His precious blood,

3

In store for every day,

4

songs.lyrics:
1

Let the [F]crowd try and follow

songs.title: (Only) Love Prevails
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]If I speak in [B]tongues of men 
And [C]angels that are [G]heaven sent  
To [Em]treasure gifts this [A7]child en[D]joyed [D7]

To [Em]give a sound, yet [A7]life de[D]void [D7]

[Em]If by prophe[C]cy I'd share                      
[Em]Mysteries sages [C]would declare
[Em]All my knowledge [Am7]won't compare to [C]love
For [D7]only love pre[G]vails

songs.title: Christ indeed was born of Spirit
songs.lyrics:
1
Christ indeed was born of Spirit
When He came a man to be;
And before His service started,
With the Spirit filled was He.
Yet He still received the baptism
Of the Spirit from on high
When He came to start His service
And was clothed with pow'r thereby.

2
Peter and the Lord's disciples
All were Spirit born and filled,
Breathing in the Holy Spirit
As on them Christ breathed and willed.
Yet they still received the baptism
Of the Spirit from on high
When they were equipped for service,
And were clothed with pow'r thereby.

3
Saul of Tarsus, the Ephesians,
And Samaritans believed;
Thus by Spirit generated,
Of His fulness they received.
Yet they still received the baptism
Of the Spirit from on high
When some laid their hands upon them,
And were clothed with pow'r thereby.

4
We are also born of Spirit
On the day when we believe,
And of Him we now are drinking
As we daily Him receive.
Yet we also must be baptized
With the Spirit from on high,
Thus to be equipped for service,
And be clothed with pow'r thereby.

5
Lord, baptize us with Thy Spirit!
This is what we need today;
Clothe us with Thy heav'nly power,
Bring us under its full sway.
Oh, baptize us in this hour!
This is all our earnest cry;
Now on us repeat Thine answer,
Clothe with power from on high.

songs.title: Morning dawn had arisen
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 2)

1
[G]Morning dawn had ar[Bm]isen.
[C]Abraham saddled h[D]is donkey,
[G]Took his two young men w[Bm]ith him,
And [C]Isaac, his be[D]loved son.

  [C]Lord, You’re God’s only S[G]on,
  [C]And of God begott[G]en.
  [C]“This is My bel[G]oved Son,
  In [D]whom [C]I [D]am well-[G]pleased.”

2
To his young men he said then,
“Stay and we’ll return to you.”
To Moriah he led him,
His son Isaac– just the two.

  Just the son and the father,
  Speaking with one another.
  Isaac said, “My father!” Abraham
  Said, “Here I am.”

3
As You spoke with Your Father
You bore the wood God laid on You.
As a lamb to the slaughter,
Obedient to the death were You.

  Precious blood of a Lamb,
  Slain before earth began,
  Laid Your life down for Your sheep, in love,
  That I might live.

4
Man of sorrows, I love You.
From You men did hide their face.
With no majesty to You,
Despised, forsaken and disgraced.

  For my sins You were crushed.
  Lord, I love You so much.
  Chastened, scourged and then pierced
  through, my griefs
  And sorrows bore.

5
Dead in sins and offenses,
I’m a bruised reed– smoking flax.
Yet to death You were given,
For of Your sheep, You’d not lose one.

  Like the woman, I'd weep,
  Flow my tears at Your feet.
  Jesus Lord, I just love You– dear Lord,
  Jesus my Lord.

songs.title: From the Head to the Body
songs.lyrics:
1
From the [C]Head to the [G]Body flows a [F]rich sup[C]ply.
Thus as [G]members of [Dm]Christ we must re[G]late.
Every need in the [Am7]Body can be [F]met there[C]by.
Build us [F]up in Your [G]Body, we [C]pray.

  Members [G]one of a[F]nother, the [C]Body will [G]grow,
  As we're [Dm7]knit together [C]in our inward [G]parts.
  Open firstly to [F]Christ our Head, then [C]life He
  will be[G]stow
  Through the [Dm7]function in [C]measure of each p[G]art.

2
Christ is Head of the Body; we're His members
true.
When we hold fast the Head, life freely flows.
As we're daily enjoying, we with Christ are infused,
All His heart for the Body we'll know.

3
For the sake of Your Body, Lord, unveil our eyes,
Deal with ‘self’, all the ground to You we give.
Save us from independence and all natural ties.
Blend us all in Your Body to live.

4
One with Christ in His Body, in the rich supply,
Every part causing growth in love each day.
Thus God's purpose eternal will be realized—
Christ expressed through His Body for aye.
Thus God's purpose eternal will be realized—
Christ expressed through His Body for aye.

songs.title: Lord, Don't Let me Fall Asleep
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

[F]Don't let me [G]fall asleep
I [Em]can't miss the [Am]mystery
[F]Christ and the [G]church
[Em]The meaning of my [Am]life
[F]Lord make my [G]spirit strong, [F]in a daily [G]way
[F]With the myster[G]y, hidden[Em] in G[Am]od
[F]Through personal [G]fellowship, [Em]Christ revealed to [Am]me
[F]To build the [G]church, [F]and bring the [G]New Jerusa[Am-Dm7-G]lem
[F]Awaiting the [G]voice of the [Em]seventh an[Am]gel
[F]Then the myste[G]ry [F]of [G]God is finished[Am-Dm7-G-C-F-C]

songs.title: Thou Magnet of my soul
songs.lyrics:
#New Tune

#Capo 3

1
[D]Thou Magnet [A]of my [Bm]soul!
Let [G]me come [D]nearer, [A]till
The [D]life of [A]self pul[Bm]sates no [G]more,
But [D]is for[A]ever [D]still.[G D]

2
Thou Sunshine of my heart!
Fill Thou each crevice there,
And let Thy garden yield to Thee
A fragrance sweet and rare.

3
Thou Ransomer from death!
Possess Thy ransomed one:
Appropriate to Thine Own use
The spoil that Thou hast won.

4
Thou Lord of Life and Light!
I bow beneath Thy sway,
And count it holy privilege
Thy precepts to obey.

5
Thou Gift unspeakable!
Straight from God's heart of love;
I break my heart to give Thee room
And thus Thy sweetness prove.

songs.title: O Lord, our Lord, how excellent
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
# Psalms 8
1
[D]O Lord, our Lord, how [D-A7-D]excellent
Thy [A]name in [A7]all the [D]earth!
Let [D]every people, [D]tribe, [A7]and [D]tongue
Pro[A]claim its [E7]boundless [A-A7]worth.
Out [D]of the mouth of little ones
Thou [D]hast established [A-A7]praise,
That [D]Thou may still Thine ene[G]my
And [D]swift[A]ly [D]end [A7]his [D]days.

2
When we the universe behold,
The work of Thy great hand—
The moon and stars, which Thou ordained,
By lofty wisdom planned;
O what is man that Thou should'st care
That Thou should'st mindful be?
The son of man Thou visitest
In Thine economy.

3
O Jesus Lord, Thou art that man,
The One who joined our race,
Who put upon Himself the flesh
And took a lower place.
But now with glory Thou art crowned,
With sovereignty complete.
Now through Thy Body Thou dost rule
With all beneath Thy feet.

4
Thine incarnation, rising too,
And Thy transcendency,
Thy Lordship, Headship, kingdom full,
And Body here we see.
By all these steps of work divine
Thou hast established praise.
With overflowing hearts to Thee
Our joyful voice we raise.

5
Oh, soon that blessed day shall come—
All tongues these words shall peal!
But in the local churches now
We have a foretaste real.
O Lord, our Lord, how excellent
Thy name in all the earth!
Let every people, tribe, and tongue
Proclaim its boundless worth.

songs.title: O Lord, we seek the power we need
songs.lyrics:
1
O Lord, we seek the power we need;
We are so weak in word and in deed
And in Thy service cannot proceed,
Clothe us with pow'r we pray!

  We are waiting, and to Thee we bow,
  In Thy presence all our need avow;
  Give us Thy power, give even now,
  Clothe us with pow'r today.

2
Lord, come and visit us at this place,
Grant to Thy Church the gifts of Thy grace,
Fully with might our service embrace,
Clothe us with pow'r we pray!

3
Send us Thy power with its full sway,
As Thou didst send on Pentecost day;
Answer our prayer and make no delay,
Clothe us with pow'r we pray!

4
Here, as Thy Body, Thy pow'r we claim;
Claiming by faith in Thy mighty Name,
Thy heav'nly show'r with Thy heav'nly flame;
Clothe us with pow'r we pray!

songs.title: Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power
songs.lyrics:
### Original Lyrics

1
H[G]ave you been [C]to [G]Jesus for the cleans[C]ing p[G]ow’r?
Are you washed in the [Em]blood of the La[D]mb?
Are you [G]fully [G7]trusting in His [C]grace this hour?
Are you [G]washed in the [D]blood of the L[G-C-G]amb?

  Are you [G-G7]washed in the [C]blood,
  In the [G]soul-cleansing [Em]blood of the L[D]amb?
  Are your [G]garments [G7]spotless? Are they [C]white as snow?
  Are you [G]washed in the b[D]lood of the [G-C-G]Lamb?

2
Are you walking daily by the Savior’s side?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

3
When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white!
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for His presence bright,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?

4
Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb;
There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,
O be washed in the blood of the Lamb.

### Chorus in the Affirmative

1
H[G]ave you been [C]to [G]Jesus for the cleans[C]ing p[G]ow’r?
Are you washed in the [Em]blood of the La[D]mb?
