Are you [G]washed in the [D]blood of the L[G-C-G]amb?

  We are [G-G7]washed in the [C]blood,
  In the [G]soul-cleansing [Em]blood of the L[D]amb!
  Yes, our [G]garments are [G7]spotless! They are [C]white as snow!
  We are [G]washed in the b[D]lood of the [G-C-G]Lamb!

2
Are you walking daily by the Savior’s side?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

3
When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white!
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for His presence bright,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?

4
Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb;
There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,
O be washed in the blood of the Lamb.

songs.title: How beauteous were the marks divine
songs.lyrics:
1
How beauteous were the marks divine,
That in Thy meekness used to shine,
That lit Thy lonely pathway, trod
In wondrous love, O Son of God!

2
O who like Thee, so mild, so bright,
Thou Son of man, Thou Light of light?
O who like Thee did ever go
So patient, through a world of woe?

3
O who like Thee so humbly bore
The scorn, the scoffs of men, before?
So meek, so lowly, yet so high,
So glorious in humility?

4
And death, that sets the prisoner free,
Was pang, and scoff, and scorn to Thee;
Yet love through all Thy torture glowed,
And mercy with Thy life-blood flowed.

5
O wondrous Lord, my soul would be
Still more and more conformed to Thee,
And learn of Thee, the lowly One,
And like Thee, all my journey run.

songs.title: O Head once full of bruises
songs.lyrics:
1
O Head once full of bruises,
So full of pain and scorn,
Mid other sore abuses,
Mocked with a crown of thorn:
O Head e'en now surrounded
With brightest majesty,
In death once bowed and wounded
On the accursed tree:

2
Thou Countenance transcendent!
Thou life-creating Sun!
To worlds on Thee dependent—
Yet bruised and spit upon:
O Lord, what Thee tormented
Was our sins' heavy load,
We had the debt augmented
Which Thou didst pay in blood.

3
We give Thee thanks unfeigned,
O Savior, Friend in need,
For what Thy soul sustained
When Thou for us didst bleed.
Grant us to lean unshaken
Upon Thy faithfulness,
Until, to glory taken,
We see Thee face to face.

songs.title: Behold! Behold the Lamb of God
songs.lyrics:
1
Behold! Behold the Lamb of God,
On the cross! On the cross!
For us He shed His precious blood,
On the cross! On the cross!
O hear His all-important cry,
"Eli, lama sabachthani?"
Draw near and see the Savior die,
On the cross! On the cross!

2
Behold His arms extended wide,
On the cross! On the cross!
Behold His bleeding hands and side,
On the cross! On the cross!
The sun withholds its rays of light,
The heav'ns are clothed in shades of night,
While Jesus wins the glorious fight,
On the cross! On the cross!

3
By faith we see Him lifted up,
On the cross! On the cross!
He drinks for us the bitter cup,
On the cross! On the cross!
The rocks do rend, the mountains quake,
While Jesus all our sins doth take,
While Jesus suffers for our sake,
On the cross! On the cross!

4
And now the mighty deed is done,
On the cross! On the cross!
The battle fought, the vict'ry won,
On the cross! On the cross!
To heav'n He turns triumphant eyes;
" 'Tis finished" now, the Conqu'ror cries,
Then bows His sacred head and dies,
On the cross! On the cross!

5
But now He's ris'n, ascended, crowned,
On the throne! On the throne!
Heav'n's highest place for Him is found,
On the throne! On the throne!
Our hearts we low in worship bow,
And join, as one, to hail Him now:
"Worthy, O Lamb of God, art Thou!"
On the throne! On the throne!

songs.title: Speak Lord, Thy servant’s listening
songs.lyrics:
# Tune: Hymn 870 Alternate Tune

# Capo 3

1
[D]Speak Lord, Thy servant’s [G]listening.
A [D]Nazarite I’ll [A]be.
Com[D]pletely sepa[G]rating
From [D]worldly [A]things to [D]Thee.
I [A]consecrate my [D]all, Lord,
For [G]Thou art now my [D]cho[A]ice.
Speak [D]Lord, Thy servant's [G]listening.
Oh, [D]let me [A]hear Thy [D]voice!

2
Speak Lord, Thy servant’s listening.
A priest I long to be.
One who is always coming,
And spending time with Thee.
Thy face I’d seek each day, Lord,
And in Thy presence stay.
Speak Lord, Thy servant's listening.
Oh, fill me, Lord, I pray!

3
Speak Lord, Thy servant's listening.
A prophet I would be.
One who is always speaking
The things I hear from Thee.
Thine every word I’d treasure,
And live on what You say;
Speak Lord, Thy servant's listening.
Thy word I will convey!

4
Speak Lord, Thy servant's listening.
A man of prayer I’d be.
I would not cease my praying
And sin, O Lord, ‘gainst Thee.
“Age-turning” prayers are needed.
I’ll pray: “Thy will be done.”
Speak Lord, Thy servant's listening.
Oh, may Thy kingdom come!

songs.title: Hallelujah! Sing to Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
Hallelujah! Sing to Jesus,
His the scepter, His the throne;
Hallelujah! His the triumph,
His the victory alone.
Hark, the songs of His redeemed ones
Thunder like a mighty flood:
Jesus out of every nation
Hath redeemed us by His blood.

2
Hallelujah! Not as orphans
Are we left in sorrow now;
Hallelujah! He is near us,
Faith believes, nor questions how.
Though the clouds from sight received Him
When the forty days were o'er,
Shall our hearts forget His promise,
"I am with you evermore"?

3
Hallelujah! Bread of heaven,
Thou on earth our food, our stay;
Hallelujah! Here the hungry
Come to Thee from day to day.
Advocate and Intercessor,
My Redeemer pleads for me,
On the throne of the Almighty
Now and to eternity.

4
Hallelujah! Sing to Jesus,
His the scepter, His the throne;
Hallelujah! His the triumph,
His the victory alone.
Hark, the songs of His redeemed ones
Thunder like a mighty flood:
Jesus out of every nation,
Hath redeemed us by His blood.

songs.title: Treasure in Earthen Vessels
songs.lyrics:
1
Chosen, called, responding to You,
Meeting You has given my life value.
Though I’m young, I haste to pursue You,
To be a vessel Your riches shine through.
Consecrating, I hesitate:
Can I that blest goal of glory attain?
In Your light I suddenly see:
Not my might, but Your unrivaled mercy!
 
  Fresh consecration! Wholly for Thee,
  I’ll closely follow, time redeem!
  Live Your transcendent life, Lord, through me,
  That the treasure within be seen!

2
Treasure hid in vessels of earth
Manifests Your power and transcendence;
In Your face’s light e’er abiding,
If nearer Thee, naught more would I desire.
Pressure, persecutions, and wounds
Just bring resurrection life into bloom;
Though we suffer light trans’ient pain,
The eternal weight of glory’s gained!

3
God of glory shines, drawing us;
Goodbye world, our lives are for God’s purpose!
Precious vessels ready for using,
No matter where, as long as it’s with Thee.
We are washed and cleansed by Your word,
Unencumbered, holy, transparent, pure;
Mold us, Lord, conform us to Thee;
At Your call, we’d rise up instantly!

4
New Jerusalem is our dream;
For her building, steadfast we’re pursuing;
Love outpoured, sweet ointment o’erflowing,
Fight boldly for the interests of our God.
Vital, spread the God-ordained way
Till as one the new revival we gain;
Oh my Lord, my love, quickly come,
As You promised, in our generation!

songs.title: "Must I go, and empty-handed,"
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune

1
"Must I go, and empty-handed,"
Thus my dear Redeemer meet?
Not one day of service give Him,
Lay no trophy at His feet?

  "Must I go, and empty-handed?"
  Must I meet my Savior so?
  Not one soul with which to greet Him:
  Must I empty-handed go?

2
Not at death I shrink nor falter,
For my Savior saves me now;
But to meet Him empty-handed,
Thought of that now clouds my brow.

3
O the years in sinning wasted;
Could I but recall them now,
I would give them to my Savior,
To His will I'd gladly bow.

4
O ye saints, arouse, be earnest,
Up the work while yet 'tis day;
Ere the night of death o'ertake thee,
Strive for souls while still you may.

### New Tune
Capo 2

1
"Must I [G]go, and [G/Em]empty-[Em]handed,"
Thus [Am]my dear Redeemer [D]meet?
Not one [G]day of [B]service [Em]give Him,
Lay no [Am]trophy at His [D]feet?

  "Must I [B7]go, and empty-[Em]handed?"
  Must I [C]meet my Savior [D]so?
  Not one [G]soul with [B]which to [Em]greet Him:
  Must I [C]empty-[D]handed [G]go?

2
Not at death I shrink nor falter,
For my Savior saves me now;
But to meet Him empty-handed,
Thought of that now clouds my brow.

3
O the years in sinning wasted;
Could I but recall them now,
I would give them to my Savior,
To His will I'd gladly bow.

4
O ye saints, arouse, be earnest,
Up the work while yet 'tis day;
Ere the night of death o'ertake thee,
Strive for souls while still you may.

songs.title: I am the vine, you are the branches
songs.lyrics:
# Jn. 15:4-5

I am the [D]vine, you are the [Em]branches,
He who a[G]bides in Me[Gm] and I in [D]him[A];
He bears much [D]fruit, for a[Em]part from Me
Apart from [G]Me, [Gm]you can do [D]nothing[D7].


  Abide in [G-A]Me and I in [F#m-Bm]you.
  As the [G]branch cannot bear [A]fruit of it[D]self[D7];
  Unless it a[G-A]bides in the [F#m - Bm]vine,
  So [Em]neither can you un[A]less you abide in [D]Me.

songs.title: Crown Him with many crowns
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[D]Crown Him with [Bm]many [G]crowns,
The [D]Lamb u[G]pon [D]His [A]throne;
Hark! [D]How the [Bm]heav'nly [E]anthem [A]drowns
[D]All [A]music [E]but its [A-A7]own!
A[D]wake, my soul, and [G]sing
Of [E]Him who died for [A-A7]thee,
And [D]hail Him [G]as thy [A]matchless [D]King
Through [G]all[D] e[A]terni[D]ty.

2
Crown Him the Virgin's Son,
The God Incarnate born,
Whose arm those crimson trophies won
Which now His brow adorn:
Fruit of the mystic Tree,
As of that Tree the Stem;
The Root whence flows Thy mercy free,
The Babe of Bethlehem.

3
Crown Him the Lord of Love:
Behold His hands and side;
Rich wounds yet visible above
In beauty glorified:
No angel in the sky
Can fully bear that sight,
But downward bends his burning eye
At mysteries so bright.

4
Crown Him the Lord of peace,
Whose power a scepter sways
From pole to pole, that wars may cease,
And all be prayer and praise.
His reign shall know no end,
And round His pierced feet
Fair flowers of glory now extend
Their fragrance ever sweet.

5
Crown Him the Lord of years,
The Potentate of time,
Creator of the rolling spheres,
Ineffably sublime.
All hail, Redeemer, hail!
For Thou hast died for me;
Thy praise shall never, never fail
Throughout eternity.

songs.title: On His Father's throne is seated
songs.lyrics:
1
On His Father's throne is seated
Christ the Lord, the living One!
All His toil on earth completed,
All His work for sinners done.
In the glory, in the glory,
See Him—God's eternal Son!

2
Every knee shall bow before Him,
Every tongue confess His name,
Ransomed myriads shall adore Him,
Who endured the sinner's shame!
From the glory, from the glory,
God doth now His worth proclaim.

3
Man, the cross to Him awarded;
Man, the Savior crucified;
This world's judgment stands recorded,
God's own justice satisfied!
By the glory, by the glory,
Christ was claimed on earth who died.

4
Son of Man, His incarnation
Opened first the tale of grace;
Son of Man, in new creation
Leader of a chosen race!
Well may glory, well may glory,
Give to Him the honored place!

songs.title: Jesus shall reign where'er the sun
songs.lyrics:
# New tune: (Capo 4) C G Am Em F C F G

1
Jesus shall reign where'er the sun
Doth his successive journeys run;
His Kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
Till moons shall wax and wane no more.

2
To Him shall endless prayer be made,
And princes throng to crown His head,
His name like sweet perfume shall rise
With every morning sacrifice.

3
People and realms of every tongue
Dwell on His love with sweetest song;
And infant voices shall proclaim
Their early blessings on His name.

4
Blessings abound where'er He reigns:
The prisoner leaps to lose his chains,
The weary find eternal rest,
And all the sons of want are blest.

5
Where He displays His healing power
Death and the curse are known no more;
In Him the tribes of Adam boast
More blessings than their father lost.

6
Let every creature rise and bring
Peculiar honors to our King;
Angels descend with songs again,
And earth repeat the loud Amen.

songs.title: The Spirit of life is within us today
songs.lyrics:
1
The Spirit of life is within us today,
Who's likened to water our thirst to allay;
Of Him we may drink and be filled thus with Him,
Until as a river He flows from within.

2
The Spirit of pow'r comes upon us today,
Who's likened to clothing ourselves to array;
In Him we are baptized, with Him we are dressed,
For service equipping with power possessed.

3
The Spirit of life is as breath glorious,
As spirit of life it is breathed into us;
The Spirit of pow'r doth the wind typify,
Which bloweth upon us with pow'r from on high.

4
Into His disciples the risen Lord breathed,
The Spirit of life thus to them He bequeathed;
Th' ascended Lord poured at the Pentecost hour
Upon His disciples the Spirit of pow'r.

5
The Spirit of life is within as the life,
The Spirit of power is giv'n for this life;
As blowing of wind brings the fresh air to breathe,
The Spirit of power to life doth bequeath.

6
These are not two spirits apart and afar,
But of the one Spirit the two functions are,
To clothe us with God and to fill us within,
That we may be thoroughly mingled with Him.

7
Lord, fill with Thy Spirit of life every part,
That we may grow up in Thy life as Thou art;
And clothe us without with Thy Spirit of pow'r
Thy will to fulfill in Thy service each hour.

songs.title: Hark! Ten thousand heav'nly voices
songs.lyrics:
1
Hark! Ten thousand heav'nly voices
Sound the note of praise above;
Jesus reigns and heav'n rejoices,
Jesus reigns, the God of love.
See, He sits on yonder throne;
Jesus rules the world alone.

  Hallelujah, Hallelujah,
  Hallelujah, Amen.

2
Sing how Jesus came from heaven,
How He bore the cross below,
How all power to Him is given,
How He reigns in glory now.
'Tis a great and endless theme—
Oh, 'tis sweet to Sing of Him.

3
Jesus, hail! Thy glory brightens
All above and gives it worth;
Lord of life, Thy smile enlightens,
Cheers, and charms Thy saints on earth.
When we think of love like Thine,
Lord, we own it love divine.

4
King of glory, reign forever!
Thine an everlasting crown.
Nothing from Thy love shall sever
Those whom Thou hast made Thine own:
Happy objects of Thy grace,
Destined to behold Thy face.

5
Savior, hasten Thine appearing:
Bring, oh, bring the glorious day,
When, the awful summons hearing,
Heav'n and earth shall pass away.
Then with raptured hearts we'll sing,
"Glory, glory to our King!"

songs.title: Serve Him! Serve Him!
songs.lyrics:
#Tune: Hymn 124

# Capo 1

1
[G]Serve Him! Serve Him! We can serve Him!
[C]In this [G]age and[Am]  in [D7]the [G]next!
For eternity we’ll [B7]serve Him!
[Em]How we’ll [C]serve Him, [D]He [A]knows [D]best!
[D7]What a privilege! [G]What an [Em]honor!
[Am]As His priests we [C]are [D7]so [G]blessed!

2
As His priests we must come forward,
To enjoy our precious Lord!
As we spend time in His presence,
Oh what grace He does afford!
So that when we serve together,
We will serve in one accord!

3
As the basis of our service,
His blood is our surety!
It shuts up the mouth of Satan,
Giving us full liberty!
Christ is now our priestly clothing,
”Stately robes” for service, He!

4
Now the key for all our service,
Is not our ability.
To “Serve Him!” we must in spirit,
Come to Him continually!
Spirit with our spirit working,
Joined as one eternally!

songs.title: Lord Jesus, are we one with Thee?
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Lord Jesus, are we [D]one [D7]with [G]Thee?
[C]O height, O depth of [G]love!
[D]Thou one [D7]with [G]us on [B7]Calva[Em]ry,
[C]We one with [G]Thee [D-G]above.

2
Such was Thy grace that for our sake
Thou didst from heaven come down,
With us of flesh and blood partake,
In all our misery one.

3
Our sins, our guilt, in love Divine
Confessed and borne by Thee;
The gall, the curse, the wrath were Thine,
To set Thy members free.

4
Ascended now, in glory bright,
Head of the Church Thou art;
Nor life nor death, nor depth nor height,
Thy saints and Thee can part.

5
Oh teach us, Lord, to know and own
This wondrous mystery,
That Thou in heaven with us art one,
And we are one with Thee.

6
Soon, soon shall come that glorious day
When, seated on Thy throne,
Thou shalt to wondering worlds display
That Thou with us art one.

songs.title: O for a thousand tongues to sing
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2
1
O [G]for a [D]thousand [G]tongues to sing
[D]My [G]great [C]Redee[G]mer's [D]praise,
[D7]The [G]glories of my [C]God and King,
The [G]triumphs of [D]His [G]grace.

#New Tune
# Repeat second line one time and last line three times
2
[D]My gracious Master [A]and my [D]God,
As[G]sist me to pro[A]claim,
As[D]sist me [E]to pro[A]claim,
[D]To spread through all the [G]earth a[A]broad,
The [D]honors of Thy [G]name.
The [D]honors of Thy [A]name.
The [G]honors [A]of Thy [D]name.

3
Jesus! The name that charms our fears,
That bids our sorrows cease;
'Tis music in the sinner's ears,
'Tis life, and health, and peace.

4
His love my heart has captive made,
His captive would I be,
For He was bound, and scourged and died,
My captive soul to free.

5
He breaks the power of canceled sin,
He sets the prisoner free;
His blood can make the foulest clean;
His blood availed for me.

6
So now Thy blessed Name I love,
Thy will would e'er be mine.
Had I a thousand hearts to give,
My Lord, they all were Thine!

songs.title: Between Two Trees
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Triangular [A]universality
[G]Man, God, and His [D]en[G]em[D]y                  
[D]Inextricably [A]planted inside of me
[G]My soul is standing be[D]tween [G]two [D]trees

[A]Battles raging
[G]Yet there is a [D]spirit [G]in [D]man
[A]Complicating
But [G]breath has [A]made me to [Bm]under[A]stand that

  [D]I a[G]m a [A7]miniature garden of Eden
  [D]Two [A]trees make [G]me [A]their [D]home
  [D]Life a[G]nd [A7]knowledge of good and evil
  [D]Set [A]me on [G]life [A]al[D]one

2
My history is a biography 
Three stations portraying me
Created then fallen then saved and now
Back in a garden between two trees

In this garden, 
Where will I choose to be?
Flesh or spirit? 
Choosing the law that sets me free? Oh

3
[A]One law demanding
[G]One in my mind wants [D]to [G]suc[D]cumb
[A]One law warring
[G]One in my [A]spirit can [Bm]over[A]come

#MDF 
#2022 Chords of a Man

songs.title: Now this was once my situation
songs.lyrics:
1. Now this was [D]once my situation:
Wanting to [G]be a sensation—
In my [D]fellows' estimation,
Quite a [A]guy.
But all I [D]met was great frustration 
And the [G]endless aggravation
Of those [D]unseen [A]complications
In [D]myself.


And it made me want to say, "It's a raw [G]deal!" 
And it made me want to think, "Only [A]if—"
D
And it [D]made me wonder, "Hey, is there [G]anything to living
'Cept to [D]slowly die and [A]dream of Some[D]day?"

2. But then I had a confrontation 
With a joyful delegation.
They were filled with great elation,
Jesus, too.
And Jesus paid a visitation
By His new life's germination:
I became a new creation
Through and through.

Oh, He made me scream and shout, "Hallelujah!" 
Oh, He made me cry aloud, "O my Lord!"
Oh, He flooded me with joy, 'cause the glory in my spirit
Made me part of God's own family.

3. So if you're craving liberation
From your old life's degradation,
You have found your destination
Here tonight.
Just turn your heart in preparation 
And proclaim your declaration:
"Jesus, be my full salvation!
Be my life!"

Now you've touched Him, so cry out, "Hallelujah!" 
Now you've found Him, so cry out, "O my Lord!" 
Jesus Lord, You are much more than I ever dreamed or longed for.
Take my life, Lord; I belong to You.

Yes, He made me scream and shout, "Hallelujah!" 
Yes, He made me cry aloud,
"O my Lord!"
Oh, He flooded me with joy and with glory in my spirit.
Jesus Lord, You're everything to me!

songs.title: River of living water
songs.lyrics:
1
River of living water,
River that flows from the throne,
Fellowship giving and making
God's own authority known.

  River of living water,
  Fellowship freely bestows;
  Bringing authority with it,
  Through every place where it flows.

2
Water of life is the Spirit,
God as the life in it flows;
Carrying with it His Lordship,
Through every place where it goes.

3
Midst the gold street it floweth,
Thus showing to us the way;
As in God's nature it floweth,
So in His way we will stay.

4
The tree of life by the river,
Shows to us God as our food;
We by the river's full flowing
Take of the tree's plenitude.

songs.title: Hast thou heard Him, seen Him, known Him?
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune

1
[G]Hast thou heard Him, [C]seen Him, [G]known Him?
Is not [Em]thine a [A7]captured [D7]heart? 
[G]Chief among ten [C]thousand [G]own Him;
Joyful [C]choose the [D7]better [G]part.

  [G]Captivated [C]by His [D]beauty,
  [Bm]Worthy t[Em]ribute h[A7]aste to b[D]ring;
  [G]Let His peerless [C]worth cons[G]train thee,
  Crown Him [C]now un[G]riv[D]aled [G]King.

2
Idols once they won thee, charmed thee,
Lovely things of time and sense;
Gilded thus does sin disarm thee,
Honeyed lest thou turn thee thence.

3
What has stripped the seeming beauty
From the idols of the earth?
Not a sense of right or duty,
But the sight of peerless worth.

4
Not the crushing of those idols,
With its bitter void and smart;
But the beaming of His beauty,
The unveiling of His heart.

5
Who extinguishes their taper
Till they hail the rising sun?
Who discards the garb of winter
Till the summer has begun?

6
'Tis the look that melted Peter,
'Tis that face that Stephen saw,
'Tis that heart that wept with Mary,
Can alone from idols draw:

7
Draw and win and fill completely,
Till the cup o'erflow the brim;
What have we to do with idols
Who have companied with Him?

### New tune

1
[G]Hast thou [Bm]heard Him, seen Him, [C]known Hi[D-G]m?
Is not [Bm]thine a captured [C]hea[D]rt? [G]
Chief a[Bm]mong ten thousand [C]own Him;
Joyful [D]choose the better part.

  [C]Capti[D]vated by His [G]beaut[Em]y,   [C]
  Worthy [D]tribute haste to [G]bri[G7]ng; [C]
  Let His [D]peerless worth con[Bm]strain [Em]thee,[C]
  Crown Him [D]now unrivaled [G]King.[C-G]

2
Idols once they won thee, charmed thee,
Lovely things of time and sense;
Gilded thus does sin disarm thee,
Honeyed lest thou turn thee thence.

3
What has stripped the seeming beauty
From the idols of the earth?
Not a sense of right or duty,
But the sight of peerless worth.

4
Not the crushing of those idols,
With its bitter void and smart;
But the beaming of His beauty,
The unveiling of His heart.

5
Who extinguishes their taper
Till they hail the rising sun?
Who discards the garb of winter
Till the summer has begun?

6
'Tis the look that melted Peter,
'Tis that face that Stephen saw,
'Tis that heart that wept with Mary,
Can alone from idols draw:

7
Draw and win and fill completely,
Till the cup o'erflow the brim;
What have we to do with idols
Who have companied with Him?

songs.title: Thou art fairer than the morning
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Thou art [C]fairer than the [G]morning,
[D]O my [D7]Savior and my [G]King!
Of Thy [C]grandeur and Thy [G]beau[Em]ty,
[D]How my [D7]soul delights to [G]sing.

  [G7]Thou art [C]fairer than the [G]morning,
  Thou art brighter, [Em]brighter than the [Am7]day;[D]
  At the [G]glo[G7]ry of Thy [C]pres[Am]ence
  [G]Clouds and [D7]darkness flee a[G]way.

2
Clothed in light as with a garment,
Crowned with majesty divine,
Lo, the scepter of dominion
Now and ever, Lord, is Thine.

3
O the greatness of Thy mercy,
And the richness of Thy grace!
O the love that in Thy kingdom
Is preparing me a place!

4
When at last I reach the kingdom,
Win the crown, the battle o’er,
With ten thousand times ten thousand
I shall sing forevermore.

songs.title: When we live in the mingled spirit
songs.lyrics:
#2006 Winter - Crystallisation-Study of the Gospel of Mark Banner 1

1
When we [G]live in the mingled [Em]spirit,
we are [Am]learning Christ ac[D]cording to the
re[G]ality in [Em]Jesus by the [C]Spirit of reali[D]ty,
so that His bi[G]ography becomes our [G7]history
to [C]be the reali[Cm]ty of the [G]Body
the [D-D7]Body of [G]Christ.

#Banner 2

2
[G]The kingdom of G[C]od (the kingdom of G[D]od)
is the Lord [G]Jesus (is the Lord Jesus)
sown as a [C]seed (sown as a [D]seed)
into the be[G]lievers (into the be[G7]lievers)
and develo[Am]ping (and develo[D]ping)
into a [G]realm (into a [Em]realm)
over which God can [C]rule
(over which God can [D]rule)
in the di[D7]vine [G]life.

#Banner 3

3
[G]Christ's pe[C]rson with His al[D]l-inclusive
death and His [G]wonderful resur[Em]rection
is our [Am]all-inclusive re[B/G]placement
for the pro[D]ducing of the one new [D7]man,
so we must "[G]hear Him[G7]" and see "[C]Jesus [Cm]only,"
we must "[G]hear Him" and [D]see "[D7]Jesus [G]only."

#Banner 4

4
[G]Let us go fo[C]rth and preach Chr[D]ist to all
the cre[G]ation, (all the cre[Em]ation)
proclaiming the [C]gospel, presenting the
[D]truth, and ministering [G]life (ministering [G7]life)
for the [Am]growth, develop[D]ment, and manifes[G]ta[Em]tion
of the kingdom of [C]God, (the kingdom of [D]God)
the [D7]kingdom of [G]God.

songs.title: Abide in Me and I'll abide in thee
songs.lyrics:
#Tune: Eventide, Hymns, #370, original tune (Abide with me)
#John 15:4-5, 7-8; Galatians 5:1, 4; 1 John 2:27 note 8

1
“[D]Abide [A]in [D]Me, and [G]I’ll a[A]bide in [D]thee”
Here [G]I’d [D]re[G]main [D]that [Emin]You’d make [E]home in [A]me.
[D]My spirit’s [D7]mingled! [G]In it I would [Emin]hide.
[A]Here joined to [D]You—[A]oh, [Bmin]teach [G]me [A7]to a[D]bide.

2
Branch of this Jesus, I am in the vine.
Riches, each moment, limitless, are mine!
Grafting me in, my Christ has set me free—
Not to enjoy Him is real slavery.

3
“Abide in Me; My words abide in thee;
Ask what you will; it shall be done for thee”
Not only knowing what my Lord desires,
But this same longing in me prayer inspires.

songs.title: O glorious Christ, Savior mine
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
O [G]glorious Christ, Savior [G7]mine,
Thou art [C]truly radiance di[G]vine;
God [D]infinite, in e[G]terni[Em]ty,
Yet [A]man in [A7]time, fi[D]nite to [D7]be.

  Oh! [G]Christ, expression of [D]God, the Great,
  Inex[D7]haustible, rich, and [G]sweet!
  God [G]mingled [B7]with hu[Em]mani[C]ty
  Lives [G]in me my [D7]all to [G]be.

2
The fullness of God dwells in Thee;
Thou dost manifest God’s glory;
In flesh Thou hast redemption wrought;
As Spirit, oneness with me sought.

3
All things of the Father are Thine;
All Thou art in Spirit is mine;
The Spirit makes Thee real to me,
That Thou experienced might be.

4
The Spirit of life causes Thee
By Thy Word to transfer to me.
Thy Spirit touched, Thy word received,
Thy life in me is thus conceived.

5
In spirit while gazing on Thee,
As a glass reflecting Thy glory,
Like to Thyself transformed I’ll be,
That Thou might be expressed thru me.

6
In no other way could we be
Sanctified and share Thy vict’ry;
Thus only spiritual we’ll be
And touch the life of glory.

7
Thy Spirit will me saturate
Every part will God permeate,
Deliv’ring me from the old man,
With all saints building for His plan.

songs.title: Christ has a full redemption made
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Christ has a full re[G]demption made:
What [D]wonderful [A]Sav[A7]ior!
We [D]are redeemed! The [G]price is paid:
What a [D]won[A]derful [A7]Sav[D]ior!

  What a wonderful Savior is [A]Je[A7]sus, my [D]Savior;
  What a won[G]derful [D]Savior is [A]Je[A7]sus, my [D]Lord[G]!  [D]

2
I praise Him for the cleansing blood,
What a wonderful Savior!
That reconciled my soul to God,
What a wonderful Savior!

3
He cleanses me from all my sin:
What a wonderful Savior!
And now He reigns and rules within;
What a wonderful Savior!

4
He dwells within me day by day,
What a wonderful Savior!
And keeps me faithful all the way,
What a wonderful Savior!

5
He gives me overcoming power,
What a wonderful Savior!
And triumph in each conflict hour,
What a wonderful Savior!

6
To Him I've given all my heart,
What a wonderful Savior!
The world shall never share a part,
What a wonderful Savior!

songs.title: First the blood, and then the ointment
songs.lyrics:
1
First the [D]blood, and then the ointment,
Cleansing, [A]then an[A7]ointing [D]comes;
If we pass not thru Gol[Bm]gotha,
Ne’er to [Em]Pentecost we’ll [A]come.
If the [D]blood has [G]never [D]cleansed us,
Ne’er the [Bm]Spirit’s pow’r we’ll [A]know,
If for [G]Christ we’d truly [D]witness,
Self-life to the [A]Cross must [D]go.

  Through the Cross, O [A]Lord I [D]pray,
  Put my [G]soul–life all a[A]way
  Make me [D]any price to pay,
  [G]Full [A]anointing [A7]to rec[D]eive.

2
Christ, the Rock, must first be smitten,
That the living water flow;
Without death the Spirit's fullness
Ne'er could dwell in man below.
If with Christ we die completely,
Willing thus our all to lose,
He will clothe us with His power
And to win the world will use.

3
First the altar, then the fire,
If no loss, there'll be no gain;
If our all has not been offered,
To the throne we'll ne'er attain.
If to sacrifice we're willing,
All forsaking, God t'obey,
He to us will be committed
And thru us His pow'r display.

4
First we must prepare the vessels
That the Oil they may contain;
Dig the valley full of ditches
That they may be filled with Rain.
First we must go thru the Jordan
Ere anointed from above;
First in death we must be baptized,
Then experience the Dove.

5
When we see the ripened harvest
Of the golden countryside,
We may know that many seeds have
Fallen to the earth and died.
Ere the fruit of life may blossom,
We must surely suffer death;
If with Christ we've not been buried,
We'll not feel the Spirit's breath.

6
Since it must be thus, I pray, Lord,
Help me go the narrow way;
Deal with pride and make me willing
Thus to suffer, Thee t'obey.
I for greater power pray not,
Deeper death is what I need;
All the meaning of the Cross, Lord,
Work in me—for this I plead.

songs.title: A Spiritual Vision
songs.lyrics:
1[C] We need to see a spiritual vision[G] of the throne,
    the throne of [Am]God
    as the center of God’s administration
  [F]  throughout the universe;

[C]   We need to see a spiritual vision[G] of the throne,
    the throne of [Am]God
    as the center of God’s administration
  [F]  throughout the uni[C]verse.

2 and reali[G]ze that the sovereign G[Am]od
  has the full capacit[F]y
  to carry out what He [C]wants
  according t[G]o the desire of His he[Am]art
  and according to His e[F]ternal econo[C]my

# Bridge
[Am] as He is [F]ruling over eve[C]ryone and every[Am]thing,
 as He is [F]ruling over eve[C]ryone and every[Am]thing,
 as He is [F]ruling over ever[C]yone and every[Am]thing,
 and every[G]thing.

#Parts 1 and 2 can be sung together 

#© 2020 Melody of Lilies

songs.title: We come, O Christ, to Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
We [C]come, O [G7]Christ, to [Am]Thee,
True [F]Son of God and [G]man,
By [C]whom all [F]things con[D7]sist,
In whom all [G7]life [D7]beg[G7]an:
In [F]Thee [G]al[Am]one we [Dm]live and move
And [F]have our being [C]in [G]Thy [C]love.

2
Thou art the Way to God,
Thy blood our ransom paid;
In Thee we face our Judge
And Maker unafraid.
Before the Throne absolved we stand:
Thy love has met Thy law's demand.

3
Thou art the living Truth!
All wisdom dwells in Thee,
Thou Source of every skill,
Eternal Verity!
Thou great I Am! In Thee we rest,
True answer to our every quest.

4
Thou only art true Life,
To know Thee is to live
The more abundant life
That earth can never give:
O Risen Lord! We live in Thee
And Thou in us eternally!

5
We worship Thee Lord Christ,
Our Savior and our King,
To Thee our youth and strength
Adoringly we bring:
So fill our hearts that men may see
Thy life in us and turn to Thee!

songs.title: How all-inclusive, Lord, Thou art
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]How all-inclusive, L[G]ord, Thou [D]art;
Of God we are in Th[A-A7]ee—
The p[D]ortion God prep[G]ared for [D]us,
Our [G]all in [A7]all to [D]be.

2
Thou art to us God's wisdom true,
We all are saved through Thee;
Thou art God's only way to save,
Thou art our only plea.

3
Thou art to us our righteousness,
All God requires to meet;
In Thee we all are justified,
In Thee we are complete.

4
Thou art to us our holiness
That we may be transformed;
In Thee we all are sanctified,
To Thee we'll be conformed.

5
Thou art to us redemption too,
That we Thy likeness bear;
Transfigured will our bodies be
Thy liberty to share.

6
Dear Lord, while we remember Thee,
Enjoying all Thou art,
We thus would hasten Thy return
And ne'er from Thee depart.

7
How sweet to have this foretaste here,
A taste so wonderful,
Yet still we fain would be with Thee,
And share Thyself in full.

songs.title: Christ is everything!
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

Chorus:
  [D]Christ is [Bm]everything in [G]God's econo[A]my
  [D]Christ is [Bm]everything - He [G]reigns in you and [A]me!
  [Em]What a blessing! [A]What a privilege;
  [D]To [A]en[Bm]joy this Christ and [G]
  Reigning [A]kings then we will [D]be!

1
[D]God has chosen [A]us in love
To [D]be His many [A]sons;
[Bm]Giving this auth[G]ority
Through [Em]Christ the Firstborn [A]One.

A divine inheritance;
We're privileged to possess.
We enjoy this portion as
Our right, we are so blessed!

2
Christ the all-inclusive land,
So vast, unsearchable.
Bountif'lly supplying us;
His riches we enjoy.

With the saints we walk this land;
We labour on this Christ.
Lord enlarge our borders to 
Receive the glorious prize!

3
Faithfully we come to God;
Before the throne of grace.
Filled with Him and serving Him;
Beholding face to face.

Minist'ring this Christ to all;
As gospel lab'ring priests.
We then offer man to God;
His Body is increased!

4
God the Spirit comes to us;
Abundantly as grace.
We can live a kingly life;
And over sin we'll reign!

Limited, restricted in
This age we're being trained.
In the coming kingdom age;
As kings with Christ we'll reign!

Last chorus:
  [D]Christ is [Bm]everything in [G]God's econo[A]my
  [D]Christ is [Bm]everything - He [G]reigns in you and [A]me!
  [Em]What a blessing! [A]What a privilege;
  [D]To [A]en[Bm]joy this Christ and [G]
  Reigning [A]kings then we will - [G]
  Reigning [A]kings then we will - [G]
  Yes, reigning [A]kings then we will [D]be!

songs.title: I've learned the secret, Christ lives in me
songs.lyrics:
[G]I've learned the secret[C-G], Christ lives in [C-Am]me,
Spirit with my [D]spirit, organic[G-C-G]ally
Increasing within me[C-G] to etern[C-Am]ity;
I've learned the s[G]ecret,[D] Christ lives in [G-C-G]me!

  Christ live in [C]me, Christ lives in [G-C-G]me!
  The hope of g[Em-C]lory, what myster[D]y,
  Christ as my per[G-C-G]son empowers [C-Am]me!
  I've learned the s[G]ecret[D], Christ lives in [G-C-G]me!

I'll share the secret, Christ can live in you,
When you open to Him, that's all you do;
Receive the Spirit and be renewed,
His blood redeems you, then He'll live in you!

  Christ lives in me, Christ lives in you!
  Our hope of glory, will get us through!
  Our life and person, Christ in me and you
  Now share the secret, Christ lives in you!

songs.title: Rain on me, rain on me
He giveth more grace when the burdens
songs.lyrics: ### Hymns 1 He giveth more grace when the burdens grow greater, He sendeth more strength when the labors increase, To added affliction He addeth His mercy, To multiplied trials, His multiplied peace. 2 When we have exhausted our store of endurance, When our strength has failed ere the day is half-done, When we reach the end of our hoarded resources, Our Father’s full giving is only begun. 3 His love has no limit, His grace has no measure, His power no boundary known unto men, For out of His infinite riches in Jesus, He giveth and giveth and giveth again. ### New Tune 1 He [C]giveth more [Am]grace when the [Dm]burdens grow [G]greater, He [C]sendeth more [Am]strength when the [Dm]labors in[G]crease, To [C]added aff[Am]liction He [Dm]addeth His [G]mercy, To [C]multiplied [Am]trials, His [Dm-G]multiplied [C]peace. His [C]love has no [Am]limit, His [F]grace has no [G]measure, His [Em]power no [Am]boundary[F] known unto [G]men, For [C]out of His [Am]infinite [F]riches in [G]Jesus, He [Em]giveth and [Am]giveth and [Dm-G]giveth a[C]gain. 2 When we have exhausted our store of endurance, When our strength has failed ere the day is half-done, When we reach the end of our hoarded resources, Our Father’s full giving is only begun. ### Additional Stanza 1 He [C]giveth more g[Am]race when the [Dm]burdens grow [G]greater, He [C]sendeth more s[Am]trength when the [Dm]labours in[G]crease; To [C]added aff[Am]liction He a[Dm]ddeth His [G]mercy To [C]multiplied t[Am]rials, His [F]multi[G]plied [C]peace. His [C]love has no [Am]limit, His [F]grace has no [G]measure, His [Em]power no [Am]boundary[F] known unto [G]men; For [C]out of His [Am]infinite [F]riches in [G]Jesus, He [Em]giveth and [Am]giveth and [Dm]give[G]th a[C]gain. 2 When we have exhausted our store of endurance, When our strength has failed ere the day is half-done, When we reach the end of our hoarded resources, Our Father’s full giving is only begun. 3 When Satan assails and temptations grow stronger, And often we feel it is too much to bear; In weakness we learn of an infinite Power— His grace is sufficient; our Father doth care.

songs.title: O Lord, Thou art the Alpha
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
[C]O Lord, Thou art the [G]Alpha
And [G7]the Omega t[C]oo;
Thou a[C]rt the First, bef[G]ore a[C]ll,
And a[G]rt the L[G7]ast so tr[C]ue.
Thou a[G]rt the s[G7]ole Be[C]ginning,
The [F]only End of a[G]ll;
In T[C]hee all [F]is inc[C]luded,
Cre[G]ations gr[G7]eat and sm[C]all.

2
Lord, since Thou art the Alpha,
All things commenced of Thee;
And as the sole Omega,
All things will end in Thee;
As God's full, Alphabet, Lord,
All is of Thee composed;
Since Thou art all the letters,
All is in Thee enclosed.

3
As First of all the creatures,
Thou art the Head of all;
As Last in God's creation,
Thou art the close of all.
As First of all the creatures,
All things by Thee consist;
As Last in God's creation,
All things for Thee subsist.

4
Since Thou art the Beginning,
Thou hast preceded all;
And since Thou art the Ending,
Thou wilt inherit all.
Thou, the unique Beginning,
Didst all originate;
Thou, as the only Ending,
Wilt all things terminate.

5
O Lord, how we adore Thee
And treasure Thee with love;
As Alpha and Omega,
Thou art all things above.
We praise Thee, the Beginning,
The very First we call;
We worship Thee, the Ending,
The only Last of all.

songs.title: Full salvation—Redemption’s not the goal
songs.lyrics:
[D]Full salvation—
Re[A]demption’s not the goal
[D]Full salvation—
In[A]volves much more 
[D]Full salvation—
Is [A]all about life spreading 
[G]Filling [A]every [D]part

Christ is in me as my hope of glory
Wonderful!
One day this seed will fully blossom 
I’ll be glorified!

songs.title: Waters to swim in
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Waters to swim in will [G]meet our every need,
[G7]Water is flowing and [C]never to recede;
Limited, restricted by [F]living, flowing [Dm7]grace
[G]Losing all our freedom, our [G7]soul-life is rep[C]laced[C7]

  [F]Drink the living water! (Sisters)
  [C]Rivers flowing free! (Brothers)
  [F]Water! Living waters! (Sisters)
  [G]Have Your way in me! (Brothers)
  [F]Daily in[C]creasing the [E]growth of life in [Am]me,
  [Dm7]For His glorious building and [G]His recove[G7]ry! [  (end: C)]

2
Waters to swim in are flowing toward the east,
Water is flowing to glory that we seek;
Having the preeminence in life, work and home,
The church life is a life-flow from which we never roam.

3
Waters to swim in, increasing stage by stage,
Flowing and rising to consummate the age;
Judging and testing that we, more life, possess,
Until the living Jesus, His name, all men confess.

songs.title: Far away in the depths of my spirit tonight (Peace, peace! wonderful peace)
songs.lyrics:
1
Far away in the depths of my spirit tonight
Rolls a melody sweeter than psalm;
In celestial-like strains it unceasingly falls
O’er my soul like an infinite calm.

  Peace, peace! wonderful peace,
  Coming down from the Father above,
  Sweep over my spirit forever, I pray,
  In fathomless billows of love.

2
What a treasure I have in this wonderful peace
Buried deep in the heart of my soul,
So secure that no power can mine it away
While the years of eternity roll.

3
I am resting tonight in this wonderful peace,
Resting sweetly in Jesus’ control,
For I’m kept from all danger by night and by day,
And His glory is flooding my soul.

4
And me thinks when I rise to that city of peace
Where the Author of peace I shall see,
That one strain of the song which the ransomed will sing
In that heavenly kingdom shall be:

5
Ah! soul, are you here without comfort and rest,
Marching down the rough pathway of time?
Make Jesus your friend ere the shadows grow dark
O accept this sweet peace so sublime!

songs.title: On that night of nights most solemn
songs.lyrics:
1
On that night of nights most solemn,
Jesus call His own
'Round the table of remembrance,
All alone.

2
Then this feast of feasts He ordered,
Feast of grace Divine;
Sacred symbols He appointed,
Bread and wine.

3
Thus His death of deaths is shadowed
In this simple way,
Looking backward, pointing upward,
To that day.

4
Till the morn of morns bright dawning,
Earth's dark shadows passed;
And the splendor of God's glory
Breaks at last.

5
Thus the day of days shall open,
Deathless, cloudless, fair;
In that day, the Savior's glories
We shall share!

songs.title: Lord, Thou knowest all the hunger
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, Thou knowest all the hunger
Of the heart that seeks Thee now;
How my soul hath long been craving
What Thou only canst bestow.

  Seeking now, seeking now,
  Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

2
Failure in my walk and witness,
Failure in my work I see;
Fruitless toil, un-Christlike living,
Calling forth no praise to Thee.
Seeking now, seeking now,
Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

3
Now to Thee my soul confesses
All its failure, all its sin;
All the pride, the self-contentment,
All the "secret faults" within.
Seeking now, seeking now,
Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

4
Save me from myself, my Father,
From each subtle form of pride;
Lead me now with Christ to Calvary,
Show me I with Him have died.
Seeking now, seeking now,
Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

5
No more let it be my working,
Nor my wisdom, love, or power,
But the life of Jesus only,
Passing through me hour by hour.
Seeking now, seeking now,
Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

6
Let the fulness of Thy Spirit
Resting on Him cover me,
That the witness borne to others.
May bring glory, Lord, to Thee.
Seeking now, seeking now,
Let Thy Spirit meet me now.

7
Father, in Thy Son's Name, pleading,
I believe my prayer is heard;
And I praise Thee for the answer,
Resting simply on Thy word.

  Praising now, praising now,
  Thou hast answered, Lord, I know.

songs.title: Nevermore this world shall bind me
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Never[Bm]more this world shall [Am]bind me[C]
I won't [Em]let it tie me [D]up
Nor [C]let it weigh me d[G]own
Although P[Bm]haroah's force surr[Am]ounds me[C]
I am f[Em]ree from f[D]ear and d[C-G]oubt

  Here I [C]am, standing [G]on Mount Zion high
  Far ab[C]ove the st[D]orms
  Where I h[B]ear the h[Em]eavenly Father's cry
  "Hear Him, t[C]his is My Beloved,
  My Be[D]loved for you He died!"

  [G]His Word, my st[B]rength, my stay, my [Em]life  [C]
  I'll [G]live, I'll [B]die, I'll [Em]fight
  [C]And on I'll [G]go
  [C]Wher[D]ever He [G]goes

2
More and more this living water
Gushes forth from deep within
And flows out to the end
There's a table spread before me
All-inclusive Christ my land

songs.title: Christ to minister is service
songs.lyrics:
1
Christ to minister is service
Both to God and others too,
Christ, the surplus, e'er supplying,
Off'ring Him as service true.

  Christ to minister is service
  Both to God and others too,
  Christ, the surplus, e'er supplying,
  Off'ring Him as service true

2
As the Israelites did offer
From the surplus of their land,
Thus some produce reaped of Jesus
Must be in our serving hand.

3
We on Christ, as land, must labor,
Harvest Him for all our fare;
Tasting Him to overflowing,
Christ with others we may share.

4
Holding Christ, as members growing,
Each his function must observe;
Christ receiving, Christ partaking,
To His Body Christ we serve.

5
Fellowship and testimony,
Ministry and worship too,
In all helps and ministrations
Christ is all our service true.

songs.title: My God, my Portion, and my Love
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune
1
My [G]God, my [D]Portion, [Em]and my [G]Love,
My [C]everlasting [G   D]All,
I’ve [G]none but [D]Thee in [G]heav’n a[Bm]bove,
Or [C]on this [D]earthly [C]ball.
Or [Em]on this [D]earthly [C   G]ball.

2
What empty things are all the skies,
And this inferior clod!
There’s nothing here deserves my joys,
There’s nothing like my God.
There’s nothing like my God.

3
To Thee I owe my wealth, and friends,
And health, and safe abode;
Thanks to Thy name for meaner things,
But they are not my God,
But they are not my God.

4
How vain a toy is glittering wealth,
If once compared to Thee!
Or what’s my safety, or my health,
Or all my friends to me.
Or all my friends to me.

5
Were I possessor of the earth,
And called the stars my own,
Without Thy graces and Thyself,
I were a wretch undone.
I were a wretch undone.

6
Let others stretch their arms like seas,
And grasp in all the shore;
Grant me the visits of Thy grace,
And I desire no more.
And I desire no more.

### New tune
1
My [D]God, my Portion, [F#m]and my Love,
My [Bm]everlasting A[F#m]ll,
I’ve [G]none but Thee in [D]heav’n above,
Or [Em]on this earthly [A]ball.
2
What [D]empty things are [F#m]all the skies,
And [Bm]this inferior c[F#m]lod!
There’s [G]nothing here de[D]serves my joys,
There’s [Em]nothing [A]like my [D]God.

3
To Thee I owe my wealth, and friends,
And health, and safe abode;
Thanks to Thy name for meaner things,
But they are not my God.

4
How vain a toy is glittering wealth,
If once compared to Thee!
Or what’s my safety, or my health,
Or all my friends to me.

5
Were I possessor of the earth,
And called the stars my own,
Without Thy graces and Thyself,
I were a wretch undone.
6
Let others stretch their arms like seas,
And grasp in all the shore;
Grant me the visits of Thy grace,
And I desire no more.

songs.title: What a mystery, yet true felicity! (O Trinity of eternity!)
songs.lyrics:
### Without Stanza 0
Capo 3

  [C]What a mystery, yet [G]true felicity!
  O [F]Trinity, Thou’rt [Dm]my reali[G]ty!
  [C]What a mystery, yet [G]sweet reality!
  O [F]Trinity, Thou’rt [Dm]my fe[G]lici[C]ty!

1
The [C]Trinity from e[G]ternity
Loved me [G7]tenderly with im[C]mensity.
De[C7]signed, then, He, an e[Dm]conomy
To be [G]one with me [G7]for e[C]ternity.

Accordingly, Thou, dear Trinity,
Made humanity—formed him just like Thee.
And Thou didst breathe into man the breeze
That made him to be in vitality.

  O [F]Trinity of e[C]ternity!
  Thou hast [Dm]longed to be [G]in hu[C]manity,
  De[F]sired to be my re[C]ality,
  Thus to [Dm]share with me [G]Thy di[C]vinity.

2
What tragedy! God’s sly enemy,
By his subtlety, tempted Adam’s Eve.
An enmity thus was put between
The dear Trinity and humanity.

To rescue me from this vanity,
Thou didst come to be in humanity,
Then, willingly, went to Calvary,
And died on the tree, yes, for even me.

  O Trinity of eternity!
  Thou took steps to be in humanity,
  With grace and peace and reality,
  As a man, revealed Thy divinity.

3
Still seeking me, Thou hast swept in me,
And, proclaiming the year of jubilee,
Restored to me the simplicity
And the purity t’wards the Trinity.

Approaching Thee in sincerity
Now I eat of Thee as the living tree
That grows in me daily rich and free
And partake, in Thee, of divinity.

  O Trinity of eternity!
  Thou didst rise, indeed, in humanity.
  Now, as the Breeze of reality,
  Thou dost share with me Thy divinity.

4
O Trinity, as we dwell in Thee,
We too are to be now a place for Thee.
Then, finally, truly, we will be
Dwelling mutually for eternity.

Enjoying Thee in felicity,
All the saints will be builded up to be
A place for Thee—for Thy Majesty—
For Thy rest and peace. Then, we’ll sing with Thee:

  O Trinity of eternity!
  We’re one entity in full harmony—
  Divinity and humanity
  Dwelling mutually for eternity.

### With Stanza 0

Capo 3

  [C]What a mystery, yet [G]true felicity!
  O [F]Trinity, Thou’rt [Dm]my reali[G]ty!
  [C]What a mystery, yet [G]sweet reality!
  O [F]Trinity, Thou’rt [Dm]my fe[G]lici[C]ty!

0
Eternally there’s an entity.
This One doth precede temporality.
And dwelleth He in infinity
Purely, totally, in divinity.

This entity is the Trinity.
He’s the Holy Breeze, Son, and Father—Three—
The Deity of supremacy.
And He doth exceed far our faculties.

  O Trinity of eternity!
  Thou’rt one entity in full harmony—
  The Holy Breeze, Son, and Father—Three—
  Dwelling mutually for eternity.

1
This [C]Trinity from e[G]ternity
Loved me [G7]tenderly with im[C]mensity.
De[C7]signed, then, He, an e[Dm]conomy
To be [G]one with me [G7]for e[C]ternity.

Accordingly, Thou, dear Trinity,
Made humanity—formed him just like Thee.
And Thou didst breathe into man the breeze
That made him to be in vitality.

  O [F]Trinity of e[C]ternity!
  Thou hast [Dm]longed to be [G]in hu[C]manity,
  De[F]sired to be my re[C]ality,
  Thus to [Dm]share with me [G]Thy di[C]vinity.

2
What tragedy! God’s sly enemy,
By his subtlety, tempted Adam’s Eve.
An enmity thus was put between
The dear Trinity and humanity.

To rescue me from this vanity,
Thou didst come to be in humanity,
Then, willingly, went to Calvary,
And died on the tree, yes, for even me.

  O Trinity of eternity!
  Thou took steps to be in humanity,
  With grace and peace and reality,
  As a man, revealed Thy divinity.

3
Still seeking me, Thou hast swept in me,
And, proclaiming the year of jubilee,
Restored to me the simplicity
And the purity t’wards the Trinity.

Approaching Thee in sincerity
Now I eat of Thee as the living tree
That grows in me daily rich and free
And partake, in Thee, of divinity.

  O Trinity of eternity!
  Thou didst rise, indeed, in humanity.
  Now, as the Breeze of reality,
  Thou dost share with me Thy divinity.

4
O Trinity, as we dwell in Thee,
We too are to be now a place for Thee.
Then, finally, truly, we will be
Dwelling mutually for eternity.

Enjoying Thee in felicity,
All the saints will be builded up to be
A place for Thee—for Thy Majesty—
For Thy rest and peace. Then, we’ll sing with Thee:

  O Trinity of eternity!
  We’re one entity in full harmony—
  Divinity and humanity
  Dwelling mutually for eternity.

songs.title: God's Christ, who is my righteousness
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]God's Christ, who [C]is my r[D]ighteousn[Em]ess,

4

5

songs.title: "No condemnation!" precious word
songs.lyrics:
1
"No condemnation!" precious word!
Consider it, my soul!
Thy sins were all on Jesus laid,
His stripes have made thee whole.

2
In God's own presence now for us
The Savior doth appear;
The saints, as jewels on His heart,
Jesus doth ever bear.

3
"No condemnation!" O my soul,
'Tis God that speaks the word;
Perfect in comeliness art thou
In Christ, the risen Lord.

4
Teach me, O God, to fix mine eyes
On Christ, the spotless Lamb,
So shall I love Thy precious will,
And glorify His name.

songs.title: Lamb of God! Our souls adore Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
Lamb of God! Our souls adore Thee,
While upon Thy face we gaze;
There the Father's love and glory
Shine in all their brightest rays;
Thine Almighty pow'r and wisdom
All creation's works proclaim;
Heav'n and earth alike confess Thee
As the ever great "I AM."

2
Lamb of God! Thy Father's bosom
Ever was Thy dwelling place;
His delight, in Him rejoicing,
One with Him in pow'r and grace;
O what wondrous love and mercy!
Thou didst lay Thy glory by;
And for us didst come from heaven
As the Lamb of God to die.

3
Lamb of God! When we behold Thee
Lowly in the manger laid,
Wand'ring as a homeless stranger
In the world Thy hands had made;
When we see Thee in the garden
In Thine agony of blood,
At Thy grace we are confounded,
Holy, spotless Lamb of God!

4
When we see Thee, as the victim,
Bound to the accursed tree,
For our guilt and folly striken,
All our judgment borne by Thee,
Lord, we own, with hearts adoring,
Thou hast loved us unto blood;
Glory, glory everlasting
Be to Thee, Thou Lamb of God.

5
Lamb of God, Thou soon in glory
Wilt to this sad earth return;
All Thy foes shall quake before Thee,
All that now despise Thee mourn;
Then Thy saints all gathered to Thee,
With Thee in Thy kingdom reign;
Thine the praise and Thine the glory,
Lamb of God, for sinners slain!

songs.title: Jesus, I live to Thee
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune
1
Jesus, I live to Thee,
The Loveliest and Best;
My life in Thee, Thy life in me,
In Thy blest love I rest.

2
Jesus, I die to Thee,
Whenever death shall come;
To die in Thee is life to me,
With Thee I'm ever one!

3
Whether to live or die,
I know not which is best;
To live in Thee is bliss to me,
To die is endless rest.

4
Living or dying, Lord,
I ask but to be Thine;
My life in Thee, Thy life in me,
Makes Thee forever mine.

### New Tune

# Capo 4

1
[Am G C F]Jesus, I live to Thee,
The [C]Loveli[G]est and [C]Best;

In [C]Thy blest [G]love I [C]rest.

2
[F   C]Jesus, I [G]die to [C]Thee,
[F]Whenever [C]death shall [G]come;
[C E7]To die in [Am]Thee is [F]life to me,
With [C]Thee I'm [G]ever [C]one!

3
Whether to live or die,
I know not which is best;
To live in Thee is bliss to me,
To die is endless rest.

4
Living or dying, Lord,
I ask but to be Thine;
My life in Thee, Thy life in me,
Makes Thee forever mine.

songs.title: Now I see
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 1

1
[D]Lord, You're with me when I'm [A]by myself,
[G]Always comforting me [A]when I'm lonely,
[D]You're the One in whom I [Bm]find my true rest,
And You s[Em]atisfy me[A]...

  And now I see[D]... Lord, You are the only [Bm]One for me.
  And I see[G]... You're the Friend who's with me [A]constantly.
  And I see[D]... Lord You're living right in[Bm]side of me.
  And I see[Em], Lord You ar[A]e for me[D-G-D].

2
You became a man to die for me,
You shed Your blood that I might be redeemed,
You loved me more than my words can ere tell,
And You attracted me...

  And now I see... Lord, You died and rose to save me to You.
  And I see... A divine romance with us human beings.
  And I see... You loved me before time ever began,
  And I see You really love me.

3
You're the One inside who cherishes me,
Feeding me with milk from Your holy Word,
Lord, You bring me just to feast upon You.
And You feed me richly...

  And now I see... You're the One who's always shepherding me.
  And I see... You're the One who's feeding, watering me.
  And I see... You're the One who loves me as Your sheep.
  And I see, Lord, You shepherd me.

4
Lord, I consecrate myself unto You,
My time my life, my riches; future to you,
You're the One on whom I'll pour everything,
That's because I love You...

  And now I see... You're the only One who's within my view.
  And I see... You're the One who I will give myself to.
  And I see... You're the only One who I will pursue.
  'Cause I see, Lord, You are lovely.

5
Lord, without You I just cannot go on,
You're the One in whom my life has meaning,
I am absolutely for Your purpose,
And I know why I live...

  And now I see... You're the only One who I truly need.
  And I see... I am living for Your economy.
  And I see... It's because Your being captivates me.
  And I see I'm in love with You.

6
Lord, I've set my feet upon the track,
Pressing onward just to fulfil your dream,
And may I nevermore turn my head back,
'Cause I am just for You...

  And now I see... Lord You've drawn me away to Yourself.
  And I see... I'm pursuing You, Lord, wholeheartedly.
  And I see... There is nothing else on earth for me.
  And I see, Lord You are my goal.

#Capo 3

1

songs.title: Jesus only is our message
songs.lyrics:
1
Jesus only is our message,
Jesus all our theme shall be;
We will lift up Jesus ever,
Jesus only will we see.

  Jesus only, Jesus ever,

  Savior, Sanctifier, and Healer,
  Glorious Lord and coming King.

2
Jesus only is our Savior,
All our guilt He bore away,
He, our righteousness forever,
All our strength from day to day.

3
Jesus is our Sanctifier,
Saving us from self and sin,

4
Jesus only is our Healer,

And His risen life and fulness,

5

6

songs.title: Naught have I gotten but what I received
What is the Meaning of the Universe?
songs.lyrics:
[G]What is the [D]meaning [Em]of the uni[C]verse?
[G]Are we just mere [D]matter
With [Em]energy flowing in our [C]veins?
[G]Does [D]God [Em]truly e[C]xist?
[G]What is God? [D]Who is God?
[Em]Do we even [C]have a soul?
[G]What is the [D]purpose
[C]Of our human [G]life?

  [C]Deep within our [D]heart,
  There is a [G]cry from e[Em]ternity: 
  [C]There is nothing [D]new
  Under the [G-G7]sun!
  [C]Everything is [B7]vanity
  And a [Am]chasing after [F]wind.
  [D]What futili[D7]ty!

When I gaze up in the night
At the moon and the stars  
There’s a sense that there must be
Something greater looking down on me.
What’s the truth? What’s reality?
Do I need a “holy” book?
Should I even take a look?
Someone, please tell me 
What’s my destiny?
 
  Man’s religion, philosophy 
  Dead teachings, empty doctrines
  Cannot satisfy our soul’s yearning. 
  There is One who made a cry,
  “If anyone thirsts,
  Let him come to Me and drink!”

Out of your innermost being
Shall flow rivers of living water
That will satisfy. 
Come and take a drink and live!
God is the fountain of life,
Peace, joy and love divine.
Come now and take 
A drink and live. 

  His name is Jesus Christ:
  King and Slave,
  Both God and Man. 
  Wonderful Savior God I love!
  He shed His blood for all my sins.
  Now He imparts
  His life into me!

[G]I’ve been re[D]deemed
From a [Em]life of vani[D]ty
[G]Rescued from this [D]evil age
To [Em]live with Christ e[C]ternally.
[G]I’m in [D]Christ! [Em]Jesus lives in [C]me!
[G]God in man, [D]man in God,
[Em]Blending now so [C]beautif’ly. 
[G]Myst’ry hid from the [D]ages: 
The [C]Triune [CM7]God [Cm]mingled with [G]man!

Psa 36:9; Rev 22:17; Matt 1:21; Rev 19:16; Mark 10:45; John 1:1, 20:28, 1:14; Heb 2:14; Phil 2:5-8; Isa 9:6; Titus 3:4; 1 Tim 2:3; Matt 26:28; 1 Cor 15:45; John 10:10; Rom 8:6, 10, 11; 1 Pet 1:18; Gal 1:4; 2 Cor 5:17; Rom 8:1; Gal 2:20; Lev 2:4; Eph 3:17; Gal 4:19

songs.title: Some day the silver cord will break
songs.lyrics:
1
Some day the silver cord will break,
And I no more as now shall sing;
But, O the joy when I shall wake
Within the presence of the King!

  And I shall see Him face to face,
  And tell the story, saved by grace:
  And I shall see Him face to face,
  And tell the story, saved by grace.

2
Some day my earthly house will fall,
I cannot tell how soon 'twill be,
But this I know—my All in all
Has now a place with Him for me.

3
Or some day when my Lord will come,
And called to meet Him I'll be blest,
He then will say to me, "Well done,"
And I shall enter into rest.

4
Some day, till then I'll watch and wait,
My lamp all trimmed and burning bright,
That when my Savior I will greet,
My faith will then be changed to sight.

# Capo 2

1
