songs.title: All is in Christ
songs.lyrics:
1
All is in Christ;
God's dear Son is Lord of all.
Jesus Christ is life's perfection,
Perfect love and perfect light.
Son of God, the true reflection
Of the Father's radiance bright.
All the treasures of God's riches,
All the secrets of His wisdom,
All in Christ are hid away.
Let His name be praised today!

2
All is in Christ;
God's dear Son is Lord of all.
Blessings are imparted to us
By the shameful cross He bore.
By His suffering inglorious
We have peace forevermore.
By the Cross we have forgiveness,
Life eternal, endless mercy.
By God's Son is freely giv'n
Everything in earth and heav'n.

3
All is in Christ;
God's dear Son is Lord of all.
In me there is naught but weakness,
I am worthless, full of sin,
Stricken by its mortal sickness,
Lacking light and hope within.
Now in Christ I find abundant
Victory and strength and power.
Savior, come and live in me,
Come and make me rich in Thee.

4
All is in Christ;
God's dear Son is Lord of all.
Savior, pardon my transgressions,
For my love is still so small;
Though I gave all my possessions,
This would profit scarce at all.
'Tis myself that Thou desirest;
So I give myself, dear Master;
No thing hast Thou kept from me—
Nor will I keep aught from Thee.

5
All is in Christ;
Your whole self present to Him.
Vain your quest for lasting pleasure,
Wealth, success, and worldly fame;
Christ alone must be your treasure,
His resource your only claim.
Come, let Him disperse the famine
Of your arid, waste existence.
Let God's Son, th' Immortal King
Freely give you everything.

Transformation,
Conformation,
Glorification—we
Become God in life
And nature, not in Godhead
Through His organic salvation.
We are processed thus:
Oh, how glorious
To express the processed Triune [G]God.

songs.title: Lord, I consecrate myself (Christ is life)
songs.lyrics:
# Christ is Life
# (2023 Mid-Atlantic SSOT) 

# Capo 1 (Eb)

1
[D]Lord, [Bm]I con[G]secrate my[A]self;
[G]Body, soul, and spirit [A]too.
[D]Lord,[Bm] pres[G]erve me in this [A]age.
[G]Paint me with the Ointment [A]true—
    
  [D]Christ[G] is l[A]ife and in my [Bm]spirit.
  [G]When I turn I get this [A]Life!
  When I[F#m] pray, L[Bm]ord—Y[G]our voice, I [A]hear it!
  [G]Thank You, [A]Lord, I have this [D]life!

2
We must flee these youthful lusts-
Lord, we really want to grow.
Praying, speaking, fellowshipping—
All the sense of life to know.

  Lord, Your love is sweet and tender.
  Day by day, I’m drawn to You.
  When I touch You I am recovered.
  Keep me turning back to You. 

3
God is working now within me;
Every moment, every day
By obeying His anointing.
“Oh Lord Jesus” is the way! 

  Oh Lord, strengthen and constrain us!
  Keep increasing, grow in us. 
  Break through every kind of blockage
  Life is so mysterious!

4
Jesus is reality.
He’s the only One we need.
Sin, death, doubts: we’re now set free!
He is life and peace to me. 

  Lord, in us, continue growing.
  You’re the all-sufficient One!
  Keep our spirits burning and flowing—
  We will love You ‘til You come!

songs.title: I thank Thee, Lord, that Thou hast shown
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]I thank Thee, Lord, that [C]Thou hast [G]shown,
And [D]I begin to [D7]see,
What [G]Thou canst [C]be to [Am]all Thine [D]own,
What [C]they may [D]be to [G]Thee;
If only [C]they will [D]yield Thee [G]all,[Em]
And trustin[Am7]gly ob[D7]ey Thy [G]call.

2
How wonderful! I never knew
That I might trust Thee so;
That Thou wouldst be so much to me.
In all the way I go,
That every need Thou wouldst supply.
And all my longings satisfy.

3
I take Thee as my keeper now
And I commit to Thee
My soul, my way, my works, my cause.
In Thy sole charge to be;
And my deposit, Thou, I know
Wilt guard secure from every foe.

4
I take Thee for my peace, O Lord.
My heart to keep and fill
Thine own great calm, amid earth’s storms
Shall keep me always still;
And as Thy kingdom doth increase,
So shall Thine ever-deep’ning peace.

5
I take Thee as my wisdom too
For wisdom’s sum Thou art;
Thou, who dost choose the foolish things.
Set me henceforth apart,
That I may speak and work for Thee
As Thou shalt work and speak in me.

6
I take Thee, Lord, to be my all.
Since all Thou art is mine;
I nothing have, and nothing am;
That nothing, Lord, is Thine.
Thou shalt be everything to me
In all things my sufficiency.

songs.title: Let Him kiss me with the kisses of His mouth (Two Kisses)
songs.lyrics:
1
Let Him [C]kiss me with the [G]kisses of His [Am]mouth,
Whether [F]bitter cold north [G7]wind or gentle [C]south;[C7]
You are [F]beautiful, my [G]love,
With your [Em]eyes of turtle[A7]doves;
"Let Him [Dm]kiss me with the kisses of His [G]mouth".[G7]

  Lord I [F]love [G]You, I really [Em]love [Am]You,
  You’re the [F]dearest, sweetest, [G7]precious love to [C]me![C7]
  Lord I [F]love [G]You, I really [Em]love [Am]You,
  Jesus, [Dm7]my Beloved, [G7]for eterni[C]ty!

2
She’s become a lily, simple, pure and sweet,
Not relying on her naturalness and strength
She is trusting in Christ’s life,
In His rich abundant life;
"Let Him kiss me with the kisses of His mouth".

3
She’s become a garden, fountain, streams, and springs,
From which fragrant, luscious produce Christ’s life brings,
Resurrection life expressed,
In ascension she can rest;
"Let Him kiss me with the kisses of His mouth".

4
She’s become the New Jerusalem, His Bride,
Where His presence for eternity abides,
Here His faithfulness we prove,
And we serve Him for His move;
"Let Him kiss me with the kisses of His mouth".

5
In the final stage of love a kiss remains,
Where the lover and His love forever reign,
"When I find you here with Me, 
I will kiss you, all will see";
"Let Him kiss me with the kisses of His mouth".

songs.title: My Lord, I have believed in You
songs.lyrics:
My [C]Lord, I [Am]have be[F]lieved in [G]You,
And [C]dearest [Am]Lord, I [F]still [G]believe.
With[F]in the [G]valley, [C]on [G]the [Am]mount,
You’re [F]always [G]here, You [C]ne[G]ver [Am]leave.
You’re [F]always [G]here, You [C]never leave.

For all my darkness, You are light.
As Seven Lamps, You burn in me.
My Lord, You know my inward parts,
And care for me still, tenderly.

Here, whispered in the wilderness,
Your every Word is living bread.
Your rod and staff are comforting —
You’re saving me, as I am led.

A High retreat for me to hide,
My Lord, You’re all I’ll ever need.
When every earthly joy has died,
You come with bread and wine to feed.

The way ahead may yet be hard.
I do not fear it: You are there.
You spread a table ‘mid the fight.
Within Your house, I’d live fore’er.

songs.title: Love is the most excellent way (Love Prevails, Never Fails)
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

  [D]Love is the most [A]excellent way,
  (Brothers) Love pre[Bm]vails! Never [G]fails!
  [](Sisters) Love prevails!
  [D]More than what we [A]do or say,
  (Brothers) Love pre[Bm]vails! Never [G]fails!
  [](Sisters) Love prevails!
  [G]Love [A]pre[Bm]vails when all [A]else [G]fails;
  Love never [D]fails!

1
The [G]love described by G[D]od’s own word
Ex[F#m]presses God as l[Bm]ife;
The [G]life, a law, within God’s h[F#m]eart
Is the [Em]Spirit of [G]Jesus C[A-A7]hrist.

2
The love of God poured out from God,
Through Christ into our hearts,
Is nothing less than Christ Himself
Who spreads through all our parts.

3
It covers, bends, endures all things,
Love’s strength to last is great;
The love of God, like none on earth,
Cannot discriminate.

4
Now let this love, the love of Christ,
Support, sustain the weak;
Supply the love to build the church,
And care for all God’s sheep.


#(cf. 2022 Spring ITERO, Message 1)

songs.lyrics:

[C]Do not store up for your[F]selves treasures on the [Am]earth, where moth and rust con[G]sume
[C]Do not store up for your[F]selves treasures on the [Am]earth, where thieves dig through and [G]steal.
[F]But [G]store up for [C]yourselves [F]trea[G]sures in [C]heaven, [F]where neither [Am]moth nor [C]rust con[F]sumes and where thieves do not dig through nor [G]steal.

  [C]For where your [C7]treasure [F]is, there [G]will your [C]heart [F]be [C]also.

[C]For your heavenly [F]Father knows that [Am]you need all these [G]things.
[C]But seek first His [F]kingdom and His righteous[Am]ness, and all these things will be [G]added to you.
[F]Therefore [G]do not be [C]anxious for tomorrow, [F]for to[G]morrow will be [C]anxious for itself; [F]suffi[G]cient for the [Am]day is its own [C]evil.
[F]But seek first His kingdom and His [G]righteousness...

songs.title: Nothing have I, but this one life to give
songs.lyrics:
#D Bm G A
1
Nothing have I, but this one life to give
To be obedient to all that You say
Oh how I long to say that I did!
Not being derailed, nor once going astray.

2
I tire of coldness, no depth to my being
My heart’s temp’rature would sudden replete
And kindle again once decadent embers
Under Your Spirit, the aegis of heat.

3
Throughout all of my days, gain me O Lord
More revelation and light to receive
Each word that I say, ev’ry thought I afford
To reach one new man, not just know but to see.

4
Permeate, and replace through Your divine plan
Manifesting to all this economy
This Person within, to be a corp’rate man
Must swallow with Life and saturate me.

5
Deliver from self, each dawn a new start
This process continue indefinitely
To know the cross deeply in my inward parts
My life’s testimony; a seed become wheat.

songs.title: O Lord Jesus (Stir up, rise up)
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]O Lord Je[A]sus,
[D]O Lord Jesus [Bm]Christ,
[G]We want to be [A]filled [D]with the Triune [Bm]God
[G]And to be con[A]formed to His [D]im[Bm]age.
[G]With our spirits [A]we are pressing [D]on[D7].

  [G]Stir up, [A]rise up,
  [F#m]Go up and [Bm]bring up,
  [A]For the building [Bm]up,
  [G]For the building [A]up of the [D]church.

2
The purpose of our being
Is to be one with Christ
To fulfill His heart’s desire corporately.
For the building and Your coming back.
Gain us use us we are in Your hands.

3
Lord, give us such a word,
And a turning point,
Never to go back; Lord, keep us pressing on
Occupy, saturate, and permeate our hearts,
O grant us a clear vision of You plan.

4
Your remnant, here we are,
Your dwelling place on earth,
Your reproduction and expression in spirit.
We consecrate ourselves;
We give our lives to You;
Sanctify us, make us one with You.

songs.title: And He came to Nazareth (Luke 4:16-21)
songs.lyrics:
And He came to Nazareth,
Where He had been brought up,
And He entered on the Sabbath
According to His custom.
And the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was handed to Him
And He unfurled the scroll and found the place
Where it was written

  The spirit of the Lord is upon me
  Because He has anointed me
  To announce the gospels to the poor
  He has sent me
  To proclaim release to the captives
  And recovery of sight to the blind
  To send away and release
  Those who are oppressed
  To proclaim the acceptable year
  The year of the Lord
  The year of jubilee.

songs.title: The church has waited long
songs.lyrics:
1
The Church has waited long,
Her absent Lord to see,
And still in loneliness she waits,
A friendless stranger she.
Age after age had gone,
Sun after sun has set,
And still in weeds of widowhood,
She weeps a mourner yet.

2
Saint after saint on earth
Has lived, and loved, and died;
And as they left us one by one,
We laid them side by side;
We laid them down to sleep,
But not in hope forlorn;
We laid them but to ripen there,
Till the last glorious morn.

3
The serpent's brood increase,
The powers of hell grow bold,
The conflict thickens, faith is low,
And love is waxing cold.
How long, O Lord our God,
Holy, and true, and good,
Wilt Thou not judge Thy suffering Church,
Her sighs, and tears, and blood?

4
We long to hear Thy voice,
To see Thee face to face,
To share Thy crown and glory then,
As now we share Thy grace.
Should not the loving bride
Her absent bridegroom mourn?
Should she not wear the signs of grief
Until her Lord return?

5
The whole creation groans,
And waits to hear that voice
That shall her beauteousness restore,
And make her wastes rejoice.
Come, Lord, and wipe away
The curse, the sin, the stain,
And make this blighted world of ours
Thine own fair world again.

songs.lyrics:

#Brothers & Sisters
1
[D]What is your Be[A]loved

3

#Brothers & Sisters
  [D]No oneʼs [A7]like Him,
  [D]He is so [A7]dazzling.
  [D]Thatʼs the One [A7]I have found
  [D]From the [A7]ten thou[D]sand.

#Sisters
4
He has cheeks like a bed of spices,
And His lips like pure lilies,
His legs are pillars of marble,

5
His appearance like Lebanon,

#Brothers & Sisters
  No oneʼs like Him,

fully qualified; laid down Your life for me.

always at my side, ready to meet my need.

songs.title: I’ve found a friend in Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
I’ve [D]found a friend in [D7]Jesus,
He’s [G]everything to [D]me,
He’s the [Bm]fairest of ten thousand to my [A7]soul;
The [D]Apple-tree of [D7]trees, in [G]Him alone I [D]see
All I [Bm]need to cleanse and [A7]make me fully [D]whole[D7].
In [G]sorrow He’s my comfort,
In [D]trouble He’s my stay,
He [Bm]tells me every care on Him to [A]rol[A7]l:
He’s the [D]Apple-tree of [D7]trees,
the [G]Bright and Morning [D]Star,
He’s the [Bm]fairest of ten [A]thousand to my [D]soul.

2
He all my griefs has taken, and all my sorrows borne;
In temptation He’s my strong and mighty tower;
I’ve all for Him forsaken, and all my idols torn
From my heart, and now He keeps me by His power.
Though all the world forsake me, and Satan tempt me sore,
Through Jesus I shall safely reach the goal:
He’s the Apple-tree of trees, the Bright and Morning Star,
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul.

3
He’ll never, never leave me, nor yet forsake me here,
While I live by faith and do His blessed will;
A wall of fire about me, I’ve nothing now to fear,
With His manna He my hungry soul shall fill.
Then sweeping up to glory to see His blessed face,
Where rivers of delight shall ever roll:
He’s the Apple-tree of trees, the Bright and Morning Star,
He’s the fairest of ten thousand to my soul.

songs.title: I am sick with love (A longing)
songs.lyrics:
1
[Am]I am [F]sick with [C]love,
[Am]Awaiting the [F]moment [C]of
[Am]Our reunion to[F]gether,
Your [C]presence for[Am]ever,
I [F]yearn to [G]be with [C]you.

2
Lord, I am at the door,
And I am waiting for,
For you to reach me,
For you to touch me,
I long to be touched by you.

3
My heart yearns for you.

No words could describe it,

O Lord, I do love you.

4

All I can give, I threw:

My feelings abundant,

5

songs.title: A person with many grand dreams
songs.lyrics:
A person with many grand dreams
  and plans for the future,
A peaceful life, a prosperous life –
  a life I wanted for sure,
But there was something there – or rather,
  there was something that was not,
My life was full of purpose,
  and yet I had lost sight of God.

But God, rich in wisdom and mercy,
  did not forsake or leave me,
Through the saints and through His Word,
  He touched my innermost being,
How could I, a reborn sinner
  not do the will of the Lord?
Though the world keeps beckoning, calling,
  I consecrate, I give my life to the Lord.

The world does not surrender;
  it calls me day and night,
But I am not my master;
  my master, Jesus Christ,
Has a vision that He's imparting
  that I know my life must be,
So I touch Him and I open
  to carry out my God's economy.

songs.title: Seek the Lord while He may be found
songs.lyrics:
# Isa. 55:6-7
# Capo 2

[G]Seek the Lord while He [C]may be f[G]ound,[G7]
Call u[C]pon Him while He is [G]near:
Let the wicked for[D]sake his way,
And the un[G]righteous [C]man his [G]thoughts:
And [A]let him re[A7]turn to the [D]Lord,
Unto our [D7]God,
And [G]He will ab[G7]undantly pardon,
[C]He will ab[G]undantly[D] pa[G]rdon you—[D7]
Return to the [G]Lord.

songs.title: The darkest hour overtakes the many sleeping
songs.lyrics:
# Same tune as Hymns #958 "Since long ago"

1
The darkest [C]hour o’er[C7]takes the many [F]sleeping,
Those drunken [Em]with the [Am]stupor [D7]of this [G]age;[G7]
Awake! A[C]rise! And [C7]let Christ shine up[F]on you!
Love His ap[C]pearing, s[G]eeking His dear [C]face![G7]
We’ve been be[Am]trothed to [F]Christ, our Lord, our B[C]ridegroom,[G]
So let’s take [Am]sides with [F]Him and run the [G]race![G7]
May we be t[C]hose who [F]hasten His re[C]turning,[Am7]
And welcome [C]Him, draw nigh, with [F]bridal l[G7]ove emb[C]race!

2
While we’re on earth, a sojourner and widow,
Our Husband gone and still so far from view,
The nuanced things that struck a spark of gladness,
Have lost their taste and are no longer “new,”
Because we long for Zion with foundations,
And seek a better country as our own.
Let’s not lose heart! Beseech Him with persistence
Till He and we are joined, the corp’rate smiting stone.

3
Recall Lot’s wife, turned to a shameful pillar,
Fit neither for the land nor rubbish hill;
Who turned her gaze back to the cursèd city—
Where glimm’ring things her heart did beckon still.
Two in the field—may I be that one taken,
My heart not stuck, while grinding at the mill,
Not tarrying, descending from the housetop,
Ne’er looking back while plowing, faithful in the field.

4
As we await Thy coming with long-suff’ring,
God as a Farmer, eagerly waits too,
That we Thy children, grow unto Thy fullness
Thine early harvest, rapture-ready fruits.
May we in all things see Thy kind arrangement,
To strip, consume us, all Thyself infuse.
Oh, let us seize each precious golden moment
To let Christ grow in us by being the One we choose.

5
What is our attitude in all our living?
Our exercise to touch the Lord each day?
The foolish virgins fail to fill their vessels,
The evil, slothful slave says, “He delays!”
Heed the prophetic word—be faithful, prudent—
As to a lamp that shines in a dark place;
O Morning Star, our blessèd hope, we hail Thee;
Rise in our hearts until we see Thee face to face!

6
Come, my belov’d, let’s go into the vineyards,
See if the pomegranates are in bloom;
While in the church, while shepherding and loving,
Our life and service hastens our Bridegroom.
Make haste, Belovèd, on the mount of spices!
Come quickly, Lord! How long will we delay?
As we express our joint desire and longing,
We foretaste Thy dear presence here in us today.

songs.title: Are you willing to be an age-turner? (This Divine Power)
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Are you willing[G7] to be an age-[C]turner?
Are you t[D]rusting[D7] to listen to [G]Him?
The Spirit of life[G7] is ours for the [C]taking
So let’s charge f[G]orth with boldness,
L[D7]eave the world beh[G]ind![C]

  [G]We have to claim this divine [Am7]power,
  Not be ash[D]amed[D7] of our wonderful [G]Christ.
  We have to claim[G7] this divine S[C]pirit
  To minis[G]ter and function, [D7]propagate and 
  sp[G]read!

2
Will you be making a fresh consecration?
To build a new altar, preparing for His bride,
It’s all up to us—His corporate expression
So let’s charge forth with boldness,
Taking Christ as life!

3
Are you open to this dispensation?
Are you ready to answer His call?
To turn this age, He needs the young people
So let’s charge forth with boldness
For the Lord’s return!

  Yes! We will claim this divine power,
  Not be ashamed of our wonderful Christ.
  Yes! We will claim this divine Spirit
  To minister and function, propagate and 
  spread!

songs.title: All for Jesus! All for Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1

All my being's ransomed pow'rs:

Looking at the Crucified.

All for Jesus! All for Jesus!
Resting now beneath His wings.

songs.title: Breathe Thou, O Lord, on me
songs.lyrics:
1

  [G]I’ll make you [A]fishers of [D]men!

  [G]I’ll make you [A]fishers, [G]I’ll make you [A]fishers, [G]I’ll make you [A]fishers of [D]men!”

songs.title: Lord, Thou art our peace offering
songs.lyrics:
# Leviticus 3,Leviticus 7:11-38
1
[D]Lord, Thou art [A]our peace [D]offering;      
We lay our h[A]ands on Th[D]ee.      
We're [G]one with Thee, Lord J[D]esus,      
In f[E7]act and practicall[A]y.      
Here [D]in the tent of meeting      
We [A]offer Thee to G[D]od      
And w[G]ith the Father f[D]easting      
Enj[A]oy Thee [A7]as our f[D]ood.      

  Christ [A]is our peace! Christ [D]is our peace!      
  We pr[G]aise Thee, bl[B7]essed L[Em]ord!      
  Our p[A]eace with G[A7]od, our p[D]eace with man      
  Have f[G]ully b[A7]een rest[D]ored[G]. [D] 

2
O what a peace it gives us
To see the sprinkled blood.
The blood of our peace offering
Has brought us peace with God.
With boldness we're proclaiming—
Now hear this, enemy—
"Peace by the blood of Jesus!"
This is our victory.

3
Based on the burnt oblation
And the meal offering too,
We now may offer Jesus
As our peace offering true.
The more we eat and drink Him
In His humanity,
The more we may enjoy Him
While feasting corporately.

#Chorus for verse 3 only
  What fellowship, what fellowship
  With God and man we share!
  O what a joy, O what a feast
  With all God's people here.

4
Here God enjoys His portion—
'Tis inward, hidden, sweet—
And all the priestly family
May here the wave breast eat.
The offering priest—how precious—
May of the best partake:
He gets the right heave shoulder
And one unleavened cake.

5
How sweet to eat the wave breast,
The all-embracing love
Of Christ in resurrection!
It sets us all above.
What strength to eat the shoulder
Of the ascended One
And with the cake be nourished
To walk as He has done.

6
With all the cleansed ones feasting,
How rich the Christ we eat!
Oh, this is true communion,
The only way to meet.
We bring our full thanksgiving
And e'en would make a vow—
We're for the Lord's recovery
As He is for us now.

By the ga[F]zelles, or [F7]by the hinds of the [Bb]field,
Not to [C]rouse up or a[Am]waken my [D]love
Un[Gm]til she [C]plea[F]ses.

songs.title: What awe what Mystery, I have right to God's divinity
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

[C]God intended for [Am]man to be
					  
[F]One with Him in his en[G]tirety 
    				
[C]God Himself we [Am]would express
        
This [F-G]was His hope 


But man fell so far so low
Took in Satan—there was no hope
Though men fell, God did not stop
         
He [F]made a [G-G7]way!!


Chorus:

[C]What awe, what mystery 

[F]I have right to God’s di[G]vinity 
                        
[C]God’s in me and [Am]I’m in God
                  
How [F]wonder[G]ful! 


What love has been shown to me 
Sonship, image, and likeness— He 
Gave me right to have and share. 
Oh what a joy!

Oh how marvelous it is—
God-man kind I am reborn to be. 
My destiny is to become
The same as He!!!


Bridge:
			
Wher[F]ever I [C]go,
			 
What[F]ever I [C]do,
			 
I [F]need to re[C]member 
			
[F]My divine [G-G7]right

(Back to chorus)

#(Cf. July 2023 Semiannual Training  Message 10)

songs.title: Lord, I love You
songs.lyrics:
*Chorus*
Lord, I love You.
Thank You for opening my eyes.
Lord I've seen who You are,
And I can't help falling in love.

1
One day so desperate for You,
Praying earnestly to You.
Lord, I'm not satisfied.
Show me, Lord, how lovely You are.

2
Thank You for Your faithfulness.
I have seen Thy preciousness.
Now, Lord, I can't deny
Your beauty has captured my heart.

3
Now, Lord, You're all I want.
I waste all that I have
No one compares to You
Here in love, Lord, will I remain.

songs.title: Tell me not of earthly pleasures
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Tell me not of earthly [Em]pleasures,
[A]Tempt me [A7]not with sordid [D]gain;
[D]Mock me not with earth's il[G]lu[Em]sions,
[A7]Vex me not with honors [D]vain.
[A]I am [A7]weaned from sinful[Bm] ido[D]ls;
[E]I am [E7]henceforth not my [A]own;[A7]
[D]I have given my heart to [G]Je[Em]sus,
[A7]I belong to Him a[D]lone.

  [D]I [G]am not my [D]own,
  [D]I [G]am not my [D]own.
  [G]I [E7]belong to [D]Je[Bm]sus,
  And [D]I [A7]am not my [D]own[G].   [D]

2
Oh, the blessed rest it brings us
To belong to Christ alone;
We can draw on all His fulness
When we've nothing of our own.
Blessed Jesus, take me, own me,
Make me, keep me wholly Thine.
Deign to find in me Thy portion,
While I joy to call Thee mine.

3
Weary soul, give up the struggle,
Cease at length thyself to own;
Give yourself away to Jesus,
And belong to Him alone.
Once He gave His all to win thee,
Now He asks as much of thee;
All He has He fully give thee;
Let thy love His portion be.

songs.title: Lord, save me today
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1
1
[C]Lord, save me to[Em]day
From things that [Am]take You [G] away.
[C]I want to [Em]stay, remain with [Am]You
All my [G]days.

  [F]Looking a[G]way to my [F]Savior's [C] face,
  [Dm]What a [G]joy to see Your [C-F-C]smile.

2
I call on Your name, Jehovah God!
I'm filled to the brim!
You're sweeter than yesterday
None can ever compare!

  You conquered me through Your love divine!
  You’re beautiful and precious in my eyes.

3
Lord, take me on along with You
To the very peak.
Take me much more deeper.
I open to You.

  O Triune God, come fill my every part
  Burn and search me with Your eyes.

songs.title: The Triune God Is for Enjoyment
songs.lyrics:
1
The Triune God is for enjoyment,
Not only for understanding.
God the Father, God the Son,
The Spirit all are one.

  God’s economy,
  He made for you and me.
  God’s dispensing in His Trinity.

2
Coexisting, coinhering—
Father, Son, and Holy Spirit—
God is one yet God is three.
He is the Triune God.

3
God the Father is the planner;
God the Son—the áccomplisher;
God the Spirit—the applier—
Reaching you and me

4
When we call upon His name
We get the person of that name,
Who is the Spirit as the Son
The Father sent to us.

songs.title: Sing praise to Christ Who lives in us
songs.lyrics: ### Hymnal.net Chords # Hebrews 7 1 [C]Sing praise to Christ Who l[F]ives in [C]us, The G[F]od of our sal[G7]vati[C]on; Who saves us by His l[F]ife div[C]ine, [F]And not by regu[G7]lati[C]on; Aft[F]er we've w[C]orked-done [F]all we c[C]an, His life has power to ch[D7]ange a m[G]an: His l[F]ife divine can ch[G7]ange [C]us. 2 He saves us to the uttermost By His life-giving power; Transfusing Himself into us, He saves us hour by hour. He saved the lost by coming in, He's saving now from more than sin: He's saving us to glory! 3 Our Lord was constituted priest To be a real life-giver; Life is the nature of this One Who can from self deliver: His life is indestructible, By it He saves us to the full: Praise God, He's fully able! 4 [C]His life is fully [F]quali[C]fied To [F]bring us through to [G7]glo[C]ry; Were it not for His [F]tested [C]life, [F]'Twould be another [G7]sto[C]ry: His [F]life was [C]fully [F]tried on [C]earth, To crucifixion [D7]from His [G]birth: He [F]passed through death and [G7]Ha[C]des. 5 He's pledged to save us to the full, His life is operating; He's doing everything for us 'Tis all for our perfecting; Our life's a failure at its best, Only His life can stand the test: His life brings full salvation! 6 He's living now to intercede, Continuing forever; He undertakes into the age, His priesthood changes never; He always lives to intercede, Such a High Priest is what we need: He's higher than the heavens. 7 Come forward now to God through Him, Ne'er shrink back to destruction; Come forward now to get the life, Which brings the proper function; Come forward now the life to take, By life His people us He'll make, And swallow death forever. ### Hymns 1 [Eb]Sing praise to Christ Who [Ab]lives in [Eb7]us, [C]The [Fm]God of our S[Bb(7)]alvat[Eb]ion; Who saves us by His [Ab]life div[Eb7]ine, [C]And [Fm]not by [Bb(7)]regulat[Eb]ion; [Cm]Aft[G]er [D]we've [Eb]worked-[Cm]done [Bb]all [F]we [Bb]can, [Bb7]His [Eb]life has power to [Cm]change [F7]a [Bb7]man: [Eb7]His [Ab]life div[Bb]ine [Eb-Fm]can ch[Bb7]ange [Eb]us. 2 He saves us to the uttermost By His life-giving power; Transfusing Himself into us, He saves us hour by hour. He saved the lost by coming in, He's saving now from more than sin: He's saving us to glory! 3 Our Lord was constituted priest To be a real life-giver; Life is the nature of this One Who can from self deliver: His life is indestructible, By it He saves us to the full: Praise God, He's fully able! 4 [C]His life is fully [F]quali[C]fied To [F]bring us through to [G7]glo[C]ry; Were it not for His [F]tested [C]life, [F]'Twould be another [G7]sto[C]ry: His [F]life was [C]fully [F]tried on [C]earth, To crucifixion [D7]from His [G]birth: He [F]passed through death and [G7]Ha[C]des. 5 He's pledged to save us to the full, His life is operating; He's doing everything for us 'Tis all for our perfecting; Our life's a failure at its best, Only His life can stand the test: His life brings full salvation! 6 He's living now to intercede, Continuing forever; He undertakes into the age, His priesthood changes never; He always lives to intercede, Such a High Priest is what we need: He's higher than the heavens. 7 Come forward now to God through Him, Ne'er shrink back to destruction; Come forward now to get the life, Which brings the proper function; Come forward now the life to take, By life His people us He'll make, And swallow death forever.

songs.title: Oh, may my spirit flow
songs.lyrics:
### Classic Tune

#Capo 1

1
O[D]h, may my s[A]pirit flow,
O[G]h, may it f[D]low!
Now I bes[A]eech Thee, Lord,
O[E]h, may it fl[A]ow!
[B7]My past I w[Em]ould forsake,
T[A7]he iron w[D7]alls would break,
M[G]y spirit fr[D]ee would make;
[A]Oh, may [A7]it fl[D]ow!

2
Oh, may my spirit flow,
Oh, may it flow!
Now I implore Thee, Lord,
Oh, may it flow!
No more self-satisfied, 
No more in self-bound pride,
No more my spirit tied;
Oh, may it flow!

3
Oh, may my spirit flow,
Oh, may it flow!
For this I plead with Thee,
Oh, may it flow!
High-minded, not to be,
Pride shall not prison me,
I'll flow unceasingly,
In spirit flow.

4
Oh, may my spirit flow,
Oh, may it flow!
For this I seek Thee, Lord,
Oh, may it flow!
No more to isolate,
Nor self to perfect make,
My spirit nought abate,
Deeply to flow.

5
Oh, may my spirit flow,
Oh, may it flow!
I ask Thee, gracious Lord,
Oh, may it flow!
My trust in self o'erthrow,
Down from self's throne I'll go,
That living water flow
In spirit, Lord.

6
Oh, may my spirit flow,
Oh, may it flow!
Answer my prayer, dear Lord,
Oh, may it flow!
Not just commune with Thee,
I long to builded be,
Mingled with others free
In spirit, Lord.

songs.title: Give me a drink!
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Every day I would [G]walk to this [Asus4]same, same old [D]well
Hoping all of my [G]thirst it’d [Asus4-A] quell.
Yet each [Bm]time I would still [F#m]find
Myself [G]sore, wanting but [D]more—
This [C]water did [Asus4]not satisfy[A7].

[D]Then I heard of a [G]spring that would [Asus4]never run [D]dry
(For contentment my [G]heart did [Asus4-A]cry!):
“Whoso [Bm]drinks shall by no [F#m]means
Ever [G]thirst; in him will [D]burst
A [C]fountain of [Asus4 A]life divine![A7]”

  [D]Give me a [G]drink!
  For this [F#m]water I would [Bm]sing!
  I am [G]filled, my thirst’s [Asus4]stilled.
  [A7]My heart sings again:
  [D]Give me a [G]drink!
  There’s a [F#m]fount of life in [Bm]me!
  All I [G]know, it just [Asus4]flows,
  [A7]Flowing deep wit[D]hin.

2
I discovered that spring was the Lord Jesus Christ—
He died for me and He’s alive!
Of my sins I was forgiv’n,
But much more He had in store—
His very own life to give!

Where then does He give life? Well the Bible tells:
In my spirit where Jesus dwells!
Raised from death, He became breath,
Water too, even true food—
He’s processed to live in me!

  Christ lives in me
  As the Spirit reaching me!
  This my song, all day long:
  Life is flowing free!
  He’s flooding me
  As a river ceaselessly!
  This my God, to me brought:
  The processed Trinity!

3
If you haven’t yet found what your heart’s looking for,
Come and listen to His own word:
“Whoso drinks shall by no means
Ever thirst; in him will burst
A fountain of life divine!”

Come, oh come see this man! Is He not the Christ?
He came that you would have His life!
Just believe, then you will see
He’s so real, living, and free—
A genuine prayer’s the way:

  Christ lives in me
  As the Spirit flowing free!
  Yes, in me! I believe!
  Take a drink and see!
  Christ lives in you!
  He’s the living water true!
  We’re filled with Him to the brim
  For eternity!

  (repeat chorus)

songs.title: O Jehovah, in the morning (Psalm 5:3; Isaiah 50:4)
songs.lyrics:
# Psalm 5:3; Isaiah 50:4
# Capo 2

[G]O Jehovah, [C]in the morning
[G]You will hear my v[C]oice;
[G]O Jehovah, [C]in the morning
[G]You will hear my v[C]oice;
[Am]O Jehovah, [D]in the morning
[Am]You will hear my v[D]oice;
[G]In the morning [Em]I will set my [C]words
In order to [D]You, and I will [G]watch.

The [G]Lord Jehovah has [C]given me
The [G]tongue of the in[C]structed,
That [G]I should know how [C]to sustain 
The [G]weary with a [C]word.
He a[Am]wakens [D]me morning by [Am]mor[D]ning;
He a[G]wakens my e[Em]ar
To [C]hear as an in[D]structed [G]one.

# can be sung in a round

songs.title: Thou whose name is called Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
Thou whose name is called Jesus,
Risen Lord of life and pow'r,
Oh, it is so sweet to trust Thee,
Every day and every hour;
Of Thy wondrous grace I sing,
Savior, Counselor, and King.

2
Thou canst keep my feet from falling,
Even my poor wayward feet;
Thou who dost present me faultless
In Thee—Righteousness complete;
Jesus, Lord, in knowing Thee,
Oh, what strength and victory.

3
All the sin in me, my Savior,
Thou canst conquer and subdue;
With Thy sanctifying power
Permeate my spirit through;
Let Thy government increase,
Risen, crowned, Prince of Peace.

4
Thou canst keep my upward looking,
Ever upward in Thy face;
Thou canst make me stand, upholden
By the greatness of Thy grace;
Every promise of Thy word
Now I claim from Thee, dear Lord.

5
Oh! What joy to trust Thee, Jesus,
Mighty Victor o'er the grave,
And to learn amid earth's shadows
Thine unceasing power to save!
Only those who prove Thee know
What the grace Thou dost bestow.

6
Make my life a bright outshining
Of Thy life, that all my see
Thine own resurrection power
Mightily put forth in me;
Ever let my heart become
Yet more consciously Thy home.

songs.title: My grace is sufficient for you (My flesh and my heart fail)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1.
[G]My flesh and [A]my heart [D]fail.
In [G]myself I [A]cannot pre[D]vail.
[G]But there's a [A]High Priest—I'm [D]not a[Bm]lone,
[G]Praying for [A]me to [D]touch the [A]throne.
[G]So in these [A]times I [F#m]hear His [Bm]voice,
He [G]says to [A]me:

  [G]I am your [A]Comforter, [D]I am your [Bm]Friend,
  A [G]never [A]ending [D]supply.[D7]
  For my [G]power is [A]perfected in [F#m]weak[Bm]ness,
  And my [G]grace is [A]sufficient for [D]you.

2.
You have ascended on high,
The devil's forces defy.
You then sat down at God's right hand,
Ministering so I can stand.
For all you've done I praise Your Name,
You say to me:

3.
We have no need of fearing,
For His life is now in our being.
The storm but help us to run the race;
Each trial but helps us behold his face.
So in these times I call His name,
He says to me:

4.
Lord, bring me on anew.
Oh Lord just to rest in You.
Keep me to call and praise Your name,
My spirit never cease to flame.
Lord, gain my living day by day.
You say to me:

songs.title: On Thee my heart is resting
songs.lyrics:
1
On Thee my heart is resting,
Ah, this is rest indeed:
What else, Almighty Savior,
Can a poor sinner need?
Thy light is all my wisdom,
Thy love is all my stay;
Thy coming back in glory,
Draws nearer every day.

  On Thee my heart is resting,
  Ah, this is rest indeed:
  What else, Almighty Savior,
  Can a poor sinner need?

2
My guilt is great, but greater
The mercy Thou dost give;
Thyself, a spotless Off'ring,
Hast died that I should live.
With Thee, my soul unfettered
Has risen from the dust;
Thy blood is all my treasure,
Thy word is all my trust.

3
Through me, Thou gentle Master,
Thy purpose fulfill;
I yield myself forever
To Thy most holy will.
What though I be but weakness?
My strength is not in me;
The poorest for Thy people
Has all things, having Thee.

4
When clouds are darkest round me,
Thou, Lord, art then most near,
My drooping faith to quicken,
My weary soul to cheer.
Safe nestling in Thy bosom,
I gaze upon Thy face;
In vain my foes would drive me
From Thee, my hiding-place.

5
'Tis Thou hast made me happy,
'Tis Thou hast set me free;
To whom shall I give glory
Forever, but to Thee?
Of earthly love and blessing
Should every stream run dry,
Thy grace shall still be with me,
Thy grace, to live and die.

songs.title: In the stream! In the stream! Let us work for the Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]In the stream! In the stream! Let us work for the Lord,
By His [A7]mind, in His way, as re[D]vealed in His Word;
In the flow of His life let us work with His pow'r
For His K[A]ingdom and Ch[E]urch in the t[A]ime of His h[A7]our.

  In the st[D]ream! In the st[A]ream!
  Let us w[A7]ork in the st[D]ream!
  In the stream! In the st[G]ream!
  We'll w[D]ork as [G]in the h[D]eav'[A7]nly te[D]am!

2
In the stream! In the stream! Let us work with the Lord
In the flow of the Spirit, as taught by His Word;
Never working by self, independent and free,
But in service related in full harmony.

3
In the stream! In the stream! Let us work in the Lord
With the Church, with the saints, in the light of His Word;
Give the Word, life supply to the people in need,
Thus fulfilling God's plan, in His flow we'll proceed.

songs.title: Jesus, I my cross taken
songs.lyrics:
1
Jesus, I my cross taken,
All to leave and follow Thee;
Destitute, despised, forsaken,
Thou, from hence, my all shalt be.
Perish every fond ambition,
All I've sought, and hoped, and known;
Yet how rich is my condition,
God and Christ are still my own!

2
Let the world despise and leave me,
They have left my Savior, too;
Human hearts and looks deceive me;
Thou art not, like man, untrue;
And, while Thou shalt smile upon me,
God of wisdom, love, and might,
Foes may hate, and friends disown me;
Show Thy face, and all is bright.

3
Man may trouble and distress me,
'Twill but drive me to Thy breast;
Life with trials hard may press me,
Christ will bring me sweeter rest.
O 'tis not in grief to harm me,
While Thy love is left to me;
O 'twere not in joy to charm me,
Were that joy unmixed with Thee.

4
Haste thee on from grace to glory,
Armed by faith and winged by prayer;
God's eternal day's before thee,
God's own hand shall guide thee there.
Soon shall close thy earthly mission,
Swift shall pass thy pilgrim days,
Hope shall change to glad fruition,
Faith to sight, and prayer to praise.

songs.title: Have you found your human spirit?
songs.lyrics:
[G]Have you f[C]ound your human [G]spirit?
[C]It’s connected to your [G]mouth!
“Hallelujah, O Lord [C]Jesus!”
[D7]That’s the way to let it [G]out!

  What is b[G]orn of [G7]God is [C]our human s[G]pirit—
  [Em]Praise God, the [A7]job has been d[D]one[D7]!
  What is [G]born of S[G7]pirit [C]is just our [G]spirit,
  [Em]And the two s[D]pirits are [G]one.

Don’t wait for an inspiration—
That’s the subtle enemy.
Open up! Release your spirit,
Testifying you are free.

songs.title: Am I a soldier of the Cross
songs.lyrics:
1
Am I a soldier of the Cross—
A follower of the Lamb?
And shall I fear to own His cause,
Or blush to speak His name?

  In the name, the precious name,
  Of Him who died for me,
  Through grace I'll win the promised crown,
  Whate'er my cross may be.

2
Must I be carried to the skies
On flowery beds of ease,
While others fought to win the prize
And sailed through bloody seas?

3
Are there no foes for me to face?
Must I not stem the flood?
Is this vile world a friend to grace,
To help me on to God?

4
Since I must fight if I would reign,
Increase my courage, Lord!
I'll bear the toil, endure the pain,
Supported by Thy Word.

songs.title: I take Thy promise, Lord, in all its length
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]I take Thy promise, [DM7]Lord, in all its length,
[G]And breadth and fulness, [A]as my daily strength;
[D]Into life's future [DM7]fearless I may gaze,
[G]For, Savior, Thou art [A]with me all the [D]days.

2
Days may be coming fraught with loss and change,
New scenes surround my life and fancies strange;
I thank Thee that no day can ever break,
Savior, when Thou wilt leave me or forsake.

3
There may be days of darkness and distress,
When sin has power to tempt, and care to press,
Yet in the darkest day I will not fear,
For, 'mid the shadows, Thou wilt still be near.

4
Days there may be of joy and deep delight,
When earth seems fairest, and her skies most bright,
Then draw me closer to Thee, lest I rest
Elsewhere, my Savior, than upon Thy breast.

5
And all the other days that make my life,
Marked by no special joy or grief or strife,
Days filled with quiet duties, trivial care,
Burdens too small for other hearts to share;

6
Spend Thou those days with me, all shall be Thine,
So shall the darkest hour with glory shine.

songs.title: Begin the day with God, He is thy Sun and Day

1

Join the fresh winds and seas and plains,

Not to the creatures of His hand,
But to the glorious One.

4

Let Him go forth with thee;
By stream, or sea, or mountain path,
Seek still His company.

5
Thy first transaction be
With God Himself above;
So shall thy business prosper well
And all the day be love.

songs.title: One with Thee, Thou Son eternal
songs.lyrics:
1
O[G]ne with Thee, Thou Son eternal,
Jo[D]ined by faith in sp[D7]irit one,
Sh[G]are we in Thy death inclusive
A[D]nd T[A7]hy l[D7]ife, O G[G]od t[D7]he S[G]on.
O[D]ne with Thee, Thou S[D7]on beloved,
P[G]art of Thee bec[C]ome thru gr[G-D]ace,
He[G]irs with Thee of our one Father,
W[D]e're T[A7]hy Sp[D]irit's d[G-D]welling pl[G]ace.

2
One with Thee, Thou Son incarnate,
Born with Thee, the Man of worth,
We, the members of Thy body,
Sojourn with Thee here on earth.
One with Thee, Thou Son anointed,
Sharing too the Spirit's power,
We in full cooperation
Labor with Thee hour by hour.

3
One with Thee, Thou Son forsaken,
Judgment and the curse we've passed;
We to sin are dead forever,
Hell beneath our feet is cast.
One with Thee in resurrection,
Death can never us oppress;
Live we in Thy new creation,
Bearing fruits of righteousness.

4
One with Thee, Thou Son ascended,
Seated with Thee on the throne,
Thine authority we share and
Rule with Thee, Thy rank our own.
One with Thee, Thou Son returning,
Glorified with Thee we'll be,
E'er to manifest Thy beauty,
One with Thee eternally.

songs.title: It's no longer I that liveth
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

[D]It’s no longer I that [G]liveth,
But [D]Christ that [Bm]liveth in[Em A7] me.
It’s [D]no longer I that [G]liveth,
But [D]Christ that [A7]liveth in[D] me.
He l[G]ives, He[D] lives,
Jesus is [Bm]alive in[Em A7] me!
It’s [D]no longer I that l[G Em]iveth,
But C[D]hrist that [A7]liveth in[D] me.

songs.title: Crucified with Christ my Savior
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[D]Crucified with Christ my Savior,
To the [A]world and [A7]self and [D]sin;
To the death-born life of Jesus
I am [E]sweetly [E7]ent'ring [A]in:
In His [D]fellow[G]ship of [D]suff'ring,
To His death conformed to [A]be,
I am [G]going with my [D]Savior
All the way to [A7]Calva[D]ry.

  [D]All the way to [A7]Calva[D]ry,
  Where my [G]Savior went for [A]me,
  Help me, [D]Lord, to go with Thee,
  [G]All the [D]way to [A7]Calva[D]ry.

2
'Tis not hard to die with Christ
When His risen life we know;
'Tis not hard to share His suff'rings
When our hearts with joy o'erflow.
In His resurrection power
He has come to dwell in me,
And my heart is gladly going
All the way to Calvary.

3
If we die we'll live with Christ,
If we suffer we shall reign;
Only thus the prize of glory
Can the conqueror attain.
Oh, how sweet, on that glad morning
Should the Master say to thee,
"Yes, my child, thou didst go with me
All the way to Calvary."

songs.title: Such confidence we have through Christ (2 Cor. 3:4-6)
songs.lyrics:
# 2 Corinthians 3:4-6

Capo 2
[D]Such confidence we have through Christ toward [G]God,

To account any[DM7]thing as of our[G]selves,

[Bm]Who also [G]made us suf[Em]ficient as mini[Bm]sters,
[Bm]Sufficient as [G]ministers [Em]of a new cove[Bm]nant,

But of the [A7]Spirit,

For the [D]letter kills, but the [Em]Spirit gives life,
The [A]Spirit gives life, the [D]Spirit [G]gives [D]life.
For the letter kil[DM7]ls, but the [G]Spirit gives life,
The [A]Spirit gives [D]life.

songs.title: Around Thy grave, Lord Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
Around Thy grave, Lord Jesus,
In spirit here we stand,
With hearts all full of praises,
To keep Thy blest command:
Our souls by faith rejoicing,
To trace Thy path of love,
Down through death's angry billows,
Up to the throne above.

2
Lord Jesus! We remember
The travail of Thy soul,
When through Thy love's deep pity,
The waves did o'er Thee roll;
Baptized in death's dark waters,
For us Thy blood was shed;
For us Thou, Lord of Glory,
Wast numbered with the dead.

3
O Lord! Thou now art risen,
Thy travail all is o'er;
For sin Thou once hast suffered,
Thou liv'st to die no more;
Sin, death and hell are vanquished
By Thee, the Church's Head;
And lo! We share Thy triumphs,
Thou first-born from the dead.

4
Unto Thy death baptized,
We own with Thee we died;
With Thee, our Life, we're risen,
And shall be glorified.
From sin, the world, and Satan,
We're ransomed by Thy blood,
And here would walk as strangers,
Alive with Thee to God.

songs.title: I am crucified with Christ and the cross hath set me free
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3
1
[D]I am cruci[G]fied with Chr[D]ist,
And the cross hath set me [A]free;
[D]I have ris'n again with [G]Christ,
And He [D]lives and [A]reigns in [D]me.

  [D]Oh! It is so sweet to [G]die with [D]Christ,
  To the [A]world, and [D]self, and [A]sin;
  [D]Oh! It is so sweet to [G]live with [D]Christ,
  As He lives and [A]reigns wi[D]thin.

2
Mystery hid from ancient ages!
But at length to faith made plain:
Christ in me the Hope of Glory,
Tell it o'er and o'er again.

3
This the secret nature hideth,
Harvest grows from buried grain;
A poor tree with better grafted,
Richer, sweeter life doth gain.

4
This the secret of the holy,
Not our holiness, but Him;
O Lord! Empty us and fill us,
With Thy fulness to the brim.

5
This the balm for pain and sickness,
Just to all our strength to die,
And to find His life and fulness,
All our being's need supply.

6
This the story of the Master,
Thru the Cross, He reached the Throne,
And like Him our path to glory,
Ever leads through death alone.

songs.title: Lord, when by baptism we confess
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, when by baptism we confess
Our oneness in Thy death,
Oh, by Thy mercy and Thy grace,
May Thou reveal its worth.

2
By baptism in Thy death we're one
And buried too with Thee;
Thus we're forever dead to sin
And from its bondage free.

3
By baptism in Thy death we're one
And buried too with Thee;
Thus to the world we did farewell,
From Satan's slavery free.

4
We're resurrected with Thee too,
From death's great pow'r set free;
Now fruit of holiness we bear
In our new life with Thee.

5
We're baptized unto Thy dear name,
No more our own are we;
Thy steps we'd follow, for Thee live,
And e'er be one with Thee.

songs.title: In death's waters I am buried
songs.lyrics:
1
In death's waters I am buried,
For with Christ my Savior, I have died;
Now the world cannot pursue me,
For its power here is nullified.
I with Christ have risen too,
Out of death with Him I walk and live;
Now the Spirit life supplies
And His strength exhaustless unto me doth give.

songs.title: The overflow of life is work
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2
1
[G]The overflow of [D7]life is work,
The work should be our [G]living!
What [G]we experience [C]e'er should be
The [G]message [D7]we are gi[G]ving.
When [D]living and the [G]work are one,
The [C]work will [A7]be ef[D7]fectual;
When [G]message and the [C]life are one,
The [G]word will [D7]be success[G]ful.

2
The work must be the fruit of life,
Born thru the Spirit's flowing
As branches of the Lord, the vine,
Fruit bearing, life bestowing.
'Tis Christ Himself thru us to work,
Himself as life expressing,
And all the riches of His life
To others manifesting.

3
'Tis not a movement borne of man,
But by His power moving;
'Tis not the deeds done outwardly,
But inward action proving.
'Tis not the work of enterprise,
But 'tis His life confessing;
'Tis not to toil for our success,
But 'tis Himself expressing.

4
Our plans, our aims, our energy
We must abandon wholly,
That He may work His plan thru us,
His aim and object solely.
Ourselves, with all we are and have,
To death we must surrender,
That Christ may live Himself thru us
With riches and with splendor.

songs.title: He washed away my sins (He tells me, guard thy heart)
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3
1
He washed away [D]my sins,
Gave me a brand ne[Bm]w heart,
A heart to [G]love Him, trust Him,
[Em]Seek Him in His [A-A7]Word.

  He tells me, “Guard [D]thy heart
  Above all that thou[Bm] guardest.
  For out o[G]f it flow the s[Em7]prings,
  The springs of [A7]life.”

2
He walks with me each day;
I open up to Him.
He is my life, my stay,
And everything I need.

3
And sometimes when I fail,
I forget that He is there;
He’s just there waiting, watching,
Then He draws me near.

  He tells me, “Guard [D]thy heart
  Above all that thou[Bm] guardest.
  For out o[G]f it flow the s[Em7]prings,
  The [A7]springs of [D]life.

songs.title: We've found the thing that puts fear in the devil
songs.lyrics:
1
[Em]We've found the thing that puts fear in the devil,
[C]Calling on Jesus his kingdom we level.
He [Am7]causes some [D7]people to [G]think that it's [C]wrong,
But [G]calling on [C]Jesus makes [Am]our spirit [B7]strong.

  [Em]O Lord Jesus, [Am]O Lord Jes[B7]us,
  [Em]You've become our [C]all!
  This is the way we are [A7]mingled with God.
  Un[G]til You re[C]turn, [D7]we'll [G]call.

2
Calling "O Lord" is the way to salvation
For every kindred, tongue, people, and nation.
By calling each day we are saved, really saved;
Out of low dungeons and pits we are raised!

3
We get in spirit by calling "Lord Jesus!"
From all the old-fashioned methods it frees us.
Forms, gifts, and teachings just won't do the trick
It's calling on Jesus that gets us there quick!

4
Righteousness, faith, love, and peace we pursue,
With them who call on the Lord with hearts true.
By our experience daily we know,
This is the way the Lord's shown us to grow.

songs.title: I must do this! I must do that!
songs.lyrics:
# Can be sung to: Habanera from Carmen

# Capo 1

I must do [Am]this! I must do that!
I must do everything in nothing [Dm]flat!
I brush my teeth and floss them, [Am]too;
Remember [E]everything I have to [Am]do.
Put my [Am]homework into my backpack;
Where are my shoes? And I need my [Dm]lunch sack!
Comb my hair and find my s[Am]weater,
Let’s hope to[E]morrow morning will be [A]better!

Oh, I won't [A]lose my good school shoes
If I will put them in the place I c[Bm]hoose;
Then I can [Bm]find them right away
And get a g[E]reat start on a brand-new [A]day.
Yes, when I [A]plan the night before,
I make an [A7]easy exit out the [Bm]door!
It’s up to [Bm]me to not be late;
It feels so g[E]reat to cooper[A]ate!

songs.title: Did you know that I’m a God-man
songs.lyrics:
[G]Did you [C]know that I[Am]’m a God-[D]man,
  A [G]three-part [C]man mingled
  [Am]With the Triune [C]God?
  And [G]I have a [C]spirit
  [G]Where the [C]enemy has [D]no way,
  No [C]hope, no [D]ground.
  I am a God-[G]man.
  []Declaration: I am a God-man!

[G]The Lord lives in[C]side of [D]me
And He's [G]using my [C]spirit as a [G]beachhead
to s[C]pread Himself into e[D]very part
Of my [Em]mind, e[C]motion, and [G]will[D].
[G]He sowed Himself [C]as the seed
In[B7]to my innermost p[Em]art.
[C]And the kingdom is [D]here,
to[C]day, now inside of [G]me.
And my [C]heart is [D]now His [G]home.

Every time I say—Amen!
To His Spirit and walk by my spirit,
The kingdom seed grows and develops
Deep inside of me.
On the outside, it may seem that
There’s no change in me.
But I’m not the same,
Cause as the seed grows in me,
Inside I’m becoming God.

songs.title: I came from a cursed land
songs.lyrics:
[G]I came [D]from a cursed [Em]land,
Yet you [D]treat me like [Em]I'm
[C]One of your [G]ser[D]vants.
You [G]told me to [D]only glean your [Em]field,
And you [D]charged your young [Em]men 
Not to [C]touch [G]me. [D]

[Em]Why have I [C]found such [G]fav[D]our?
[Em]What have You [C]seen, Lord, in [G]me? [D]
[Em]Even though I [C]was a [G]stran[D]ger,
[Em]You've allowed me [C]under Your [G]wings.

According to my mother-in-law,
I laid down on the floor,
And uncovered your feet.
You blessed and covered me with your cloak,
Told me to stay, and not
Be afraid at all.

Now I'm resting at Your feet, Lord;
Faithful, You will marry me.
Now I know, because of Your love,
Lord, You always satisfy me!

# Based on Ruth chapters 2 and 3

songs.title: We are willing
songs.lyrics:
Are we willing to
To suffer the loss
Of our individuality on account of Christ
Can we empty ourselves
And who we are
To be filled with Christ and all He is
And express Him

We are willing
Yes old ways will be lost.
How much better
Life is when we move on
To Christ
Yes Christ
Gain Christ our Lord
We love You Lord

Are we willing to 
To be found in Him
Enjoying His abundant life 
No matter the cost
Will we take the time
In our daily life
And be constituted in His word
Hold it close to us

Are we willing to
To be conformed
To His death and resurrection 
And bear His cross
Will we strive to know
His presence sweet
And to know His sufferings
To be one with Christ

Oh may God lay hold
Of one thing we do
Forgetting the things which are behind Stretching forward now
We pursue the goal
For the prize of Christ
God has called us upward 
Until we prevail

songs.title: When this passing world is done
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune

1
[C]When this passing world is [F]done,
When has [Dm]sunk yon glaring [G]sun,
When we [C]stand with Christ on [F]high,
Looking [Dm]o'er life's history[G];
Then, Lord, [Am]shall I fully [C7]know,
Not till [F]then, how much I [Fm]owe.
Then Lord, [C]shall I fully [D]know,
Not till [F]then, how much[C]I owe

2
When I stand before the throne
Dressed in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart;
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.

3
E'en on earth, as through a glass
Darkly, let Thy glory pass;
Make forgiveness feel so sweet;
Make Thy Spirit's help so meet:
E'en on earth, Lord, make me know
Something of how much I owe.

#Repeat the last two lines of each stanza

### New tune


1
[C]When this [Am]passing world is [F]done,
[C]When has [Am]sunk yon glaring [F]sun,
[C]When we [G]stand with Christ on [Am]high,
Looking [G]o'er life's histo[C]ry;[Am]
[F]Then, Lord, [G]shall I fully [C]know,[Am]
[F]Not till [G]then, how much I [C] owe. 

2
When I stand before the throne
Dressed in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart;
Then, Lord, shall I fully know,
Not till then, how much I owe.

3
E'en on earth, as through a glass
Darkly, let Thy glory pass;
Make forgiveness feel so sweet;
Make Thy Spirit's help so meet:
E'en on earth, Lord, make me know

songs.title: Lord, Thou hast shown the mystery
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, Thou hast shown the mystery,
How on the Cross I died with Thee;
I need no other pow'r or way
That I may triumph day by day.

2
That cross of Thine is also mine,
Into my life its light doth shine;
When I believe I'm dead with Thee,
The world has lost it pow'r o'er me.

3
Since I am crucified with Thee,
From sin and self I am set free;
How can I still enjoy the world
Or seek its vanities unfurled?

4
I take my place, dear Lord, with Thee
Upon the cross of Calvary.
Thy life and power then are mine,
Since Thou and I in oneness twine.

5
Since Thou didst come to slay the foe,
His work and power to overthrow,
I too can overcome in Thee
And prove Thy mighty pow'r in me.

6
Yet, for the vict'ry we rely
Upon the death which Thou didst die;
We tread the path which Thou hast trod
Until we reach the goal in God.

7
My death with Thee I now believe
And all its meaning would receive.
Thy death more deeply show to me,
That from my flesh I may be free.

8
I long to win as Thou hast won,
To reign with Thee when Thou dost come.
If we the cross will gladly bear,
Then in Thy glory we will share.

songs.title: Oh, Jesus, Lord, when Thou on earth
songs.lyrics:
1
Oh, Jesus, Lord, when Thou on earth
Accompanied Thy faithful band,
It seemed they knew, but knew Thee not,
Thyself they did not understand.

2
They heard Thy voice, beheld Thy form,
Thy beauteous stature unforgot;
They crowded 'round Thee, met Thy gaze,
But who Thou art, they knew it not.

3
As they of old we too are veiled;
We've known Thee long apparently;
Yet if we say we know, at best
We know Thee not transparently.

4
But as the Spirit now Thou art,
Another Comforter become;
Reveal Thyself within my heart,
Since to Thy temple Thou hast come.

5
With Thy blest Spirit, Lord, fill me,
Fill every corner of my soul;
May Thou inspire my every part,
Oh may Thou touch, renew the whole.

6
The Spirit then revealing make
Thyself more real within my heart,
That ear not hear, nor eye may see
How very real to me Thou art.

7
When Thou in mercy dost reveal
And give Thyself as Spirit thus,
What in the world can be more real,
More true than what Thou art to us?

8
Thy Spirit, Lord, in mine, I pray,
O'erflow my being as a flood,
That every part with glory shine
And everywhere be Thee and God.

9
How close we are in such a life,
In one is blended earth with heav'n;
Thy presence sweetly fills our souls;
Our hearts are to Thy praises giv'n.

songs.title: In the universe
songs.lyrics:
#Capo1
[D]In [D7]the [G]universe he is like an [A]immense
[F#m]magn[Bm]et,                                
drawing all his [G]seekers to [A]him, his [G]seekers to [D]him                                                           
[D]The wonderful [Em]Jesus, [A]who is enthroned in 
[D]heaven                                        
And crowned with [Em]glory and honor [A]is the greatest 
[D]attraction.
[D]In [D7]the [G]universe he is like an [A]immense
[F#m]magn[Bm]et,                                
drawing all his [G]seekers to [A]him, his [G]seekers to [D]him

songs.title: When this poor sinner stands at last
songs.lyrics:
When this [D]poor [G]sinner [A]stands at [D]last
Per[G]fected [D]as a [A]son,
I'll [D]praise my [G]God for [A]many [Bm]things
But [G]most, what [A]mercy's [D]done.

  While [G]far from [D]God and [A]dead in [D]sin,
  Rich [G]mercy [D]did a[A]bound;
  I [G]did not [D]ask or [A]seek for [D]God,
  But [G]yet my [A]Lord I [D]found.

I'm mercy's vessel, this I know,
For God has chosen me;
The riches of His glory shall
Thus manifested be.

  Not him who wills can follow now
  This way as yet unknown;
  Not him who runs can yet pursue,
  But to whom mercy's shown.

My Father's lovingkindness 'tis,
That I am not consumed—
For His compassions never fail;
Each morning they are new.

  Through His compassions day by day
  I give myself to be
  Transformed and built with other saints,
  Christ's Body thus to see.

songs.title: Lord, when the Father ne'er was known
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord, when the Father [G]ne'er was k[D]nown,
The Father [A]came through [A7]Thee be[D]low,
That we who lived in [A]igno[D]rance
[G]Might through Thy[D]self the [A-A7]Father [D]know.

2
But, Lord, when Thou wast here on earth,
How scarce were those Thyself who knew;
A veil there was 'twixt Thee and them;
They crowded 'round but saw not through.

3
Now as the Spirit Thou hast come
E'en as the Father came in Thee;
As we through Thee the Father know,
Now through the Spirit we know Thee.

4
Not with the flesh Thou now art clothed—
Then must Thou walk with toil around;
But as the Spirit in our heart
Thou dost supply Thyself unbound.

5
Thou, Lord, the Father once wast called,
But now the Holy Spirit art;
The Spirit is Thine other form,
Thyself to dwell within our heart.

6
By knowing Thee as Spirit, Lord,
We realize Thy life's outflow,
Thy glory and Thy character,
And all Thy being's wonders know.

7
Praise to Thy Name now floods our heart;
There is no one as dear as Thee;
For since we know how real Thou art,
No other one could lovelier be.

songs.title: Lord, Thou didst know when in the flesh
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, Thou didst know when in the flesh,
As such I'd know Thee shallowly;
Then as the Spirit Thou didst come
Within my spirit, known to be.

2
In flesh Redeemer mine Thou art;
As Spirit now my Comforter.
The outward touch has passed away
For inward union worthier.

3
Because Thou art the Spirit now,
Thyself revealing ceaselessly,
Within my spirit I may know
Thy presence and reality.

4
I know Thy life surpassing far
The knowledge Thy disciples had,
Although they walked and lived with Thee,
When Thou on earth in flesh wast clad.

5
Because Thy Spirit dwells within,
How real, O Lord, Thou art to me;
Not touched, yet more reliable,
Not seen, yet loved more fervently.

6
Thy Holy Spirit deep within
Supplies Thyself as righteousness,
As holiness, redemption full,
As wisdom and as fruitfulness.

7
Thy Spirit in my spirit now
Supplies Thyself, unites with me,
Thus I am all the time myself
And constantly am also Thee.

songs.title: From my spirit within flows a fountain of life
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 1

1
From my [G]spirit with[G7]in flows a
[C]Fountain of [Am]life—
The [D]Triune God [D7]flowing in [G]me;[D]
God the [G]Father’s the [G7]source,
Christ the [C]Son is the [Am]course,
And the [D]Spirit im[D7]parts life to [G]me.

  Lord, I [D]treasure the [D7]sweet flow of [G]life[G7],
  And my [C]soul-life at last I lay [G]down;[D]
  O Lord, [G]deepen the [G7]pure flow of [C]life;[Am]
  At Your [G]coming may [D]life be my [G]crown.

2
In the fresh, tender grass
Jesus makes me lie down;
He leads me by waters of rest;
No more struggle and strain;
All self-effort is vain;
In the flow I am perfectly blessed.

3
Jesus called me one day
To the Holiest Place,
To live in His presence divine;
Hallelujah, I’ve heard
An encouraging word:
"Abide—you're a branch in the vine."

songs.title: The queen in gold of Ophir
songs.lyrics:
# Psalms 45:9-17
1
The queen in gold of Ophir
At Thy right hand doth stand;
King's daughters are the women
Who fill Thy honored band.
The church in all her glory
Shall match her glorious King,
And all the saints, the women,
Thy likeness there shall bring.

2
O daughter, now consider,
E'en now incline thine ear:
Remember not thy people
And all thine own things here.
Thy beauty then shall blossom—
'Twill be the King's desire;
For He thy worthy Lord is,
Thy worship to inspire.

3
The daughter's glorious garments
Are made of inwrought gold—
Within the inner palace,
How wondrous to behold!
The glory of God's nature
Is given her to wear,
That all His holy being
She may in life declare.

4
In clothing too embroidered
She'll to the King be led,
In that fine linen garment
To be exhibited.
'Tis by the Spirit's stitching
That Christ in us is wrought,
And with this glorious garment
We'll to the King be brought.

5
What gladness and rejoicing
When we the King shall see!
We'll shout His worthy praises
Through all eternity.
And though the King we worship
Or glory in the Queen,
In all this blest enjoyment
The glory goes to Him.

songs.title: Therefore we do not lose heart (2 Corinthians 4:16)

songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[G]A flowing river [C]and a [G]tree,
Eden’s out[C]standing features [G]are,
Man to sup[D]ply with food and drink
That he may [A]live for[D-D7]e’er.

  If upon Christ in spirit I [C]feed,
  [A]Filled with His [G]life [D7]I’ll [G]be.

2

As living food to man supplied,
That he God’s riches may enjoy,
Thus to be satisfied.

3
The river does the Spirit show,
Coming man’s spirit to supply,
That with God’s riches he be filled,
Holy to be thereby.

4
The Christ of glory is my life,
He as the Spirit lives in mine,
That I with God be fully blent
And in His image shine.

5
I would exalt this glorious Christ,
Ever the Spirit I’d obey,
Making His glory fully known,
Filled with His grace for aye.

[C]Knowing Him’s the goal of [D]my whole life.
Gaining [G]Him supplies me [Em]day by day,

As I'm [C]dwelling one with [D]Him continual[G]ly.

songs.title: I count it privilege supreme
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]I count it [G]privilege su[Am]preme
To [F]serve Him till the [C]end.
I count my [G]life a sacri[Am]fice
So [F]willingly I'll [Am]bear
The [F]cross of Christ while [C]I shall [G]live.
To [Am]follow [F]Him for [C]e'er.

2

To waste myself on Him.
I count it error and loss to Him
If I would serve this world
For I have wasted precious time
I could have spent on Him.

3
Oh, who am I that Thou chose me 
And set me from the womb
Oh, how is it Thou callest me
To pay the debt I owe
To go and speak the words of life
To bear abundant fruit.

4
I count it privilege supreme
To serve Him till the end.
I count my life of no esteem
That I could be poured out
To fight and finish full this course
For His own heart's desire.

5
Henceforth there is laid up for me
The crown of righteousness
Not for reward do I serve Him
Or for the praise of Men
But His constraining love drives me
By grace I follow Him.

Oh, guide me, call me, draw me,

songs.title: Christ is the one reality of all
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Christ is the one re[F]ality of [C]all,
[F]Of Godhead [Am]and of man and [D7]all things [G]else;
[C]No man without Him [F]ever findeth [G]God,
[F]Without Him [C]man and everyth[G-G7]ing is [C]false.

2
All types and figures of the ancient time,
All things we ever need, both great and small,
Only are shadows of the Christ of God,
Showing that He must be our all in all.

3
All things are vanity of vanities,
Christ, the reality all things to fill;
Though everything we may enjoy and own,
If we're devoid of Christ we're empty still.

4
Christ is our real God, our real Lord,
Christ is our real life, our real light;
Christ is our real food, our real drink,
Our real clothing, and our real might.

5
Christ also is the one reality
Of all our doctrine and theology;
And all our scriptural knowledge without Him
Is just in letter and is vanity.

6
Christ, the reality of time and space,
Christ, the reality of every stage;
Christ is the one reality of all
Thru all eternity from age to age.

songs.title: O how blessed is the priest's life
songs.lyrics:
1
O how blessed is the priest's life,
Christ to him is all in all:
All His clothing, food, and dwelling,
And His portion therewithal.

  O how blessed is the priest's life,
  Christ to him is all in all:
  All His clothing, food, and dwelling,
  And His portion therewithal.

2
All the clothing of his service
Is the beauty of the Lord;
Glorious splendor do his garments,
Breast and shoulder-piece afford.

3
When in sacrifice he offers
Christ to God as God has willed,
Then as food he doth enjoy Him
And is with His riches filled.

4
Putting on the Lord as clothing,
Christ without he doth express;
Eating, drinking, with Him mingled,
Christ within doth him possess.

5
Holy, glorious is their dwelling,
'Tis the increase of the Lord;
Here the priests built up together
Unto God a house afford.

6
All his portion, all his living,
Everything the priests possess—
All is Christ and Christ forever,
In His all-inclusiveness.

songs.title: Grace in its highest definition is
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Grace  [A]in its [Bm]high[G]est  [D]defi[A7]nition [D]is
[D]God  [Bm]in the [F#m]Son  [D]to  [A]be en[E7]joyed by [A7]us;
[G]It  [D]is not [Em]only something [A]done or [D]giv'n,
[D]But  [G]God Him[F#m]self,  [Bm]our  [Em]portion [A7]glori[D]ous.

2
God is incarnate in the flesh that we
Him may receive, experience ourself;
This is the grace which we receive of God,
Which comes thru Christ and which is
Christ Himself.

3
Paul the Apostle counted all as dung,
T'was only God in Christ he counted grace;
‘Tis by this grace—the Lord experienced—
That he surpassed the others in the race.

4
It is this grace—Christ as our inward
strength—
Which with His all-sufficiency doth fill;
It is this grace which in our spirit is,
There energizing, working out God's will.

5
This grace, which is the living Christ Himself,
Is what we need and must experience;
Lord, may we know this grace and by it live,
Thyself increasingly as grace to sense.

songs.title: Thy mighty love, O God, constraineth me
songs.lyrics:
### Classic tune

1
[D]Thy mighty love, O [A]God, constraineth [D]me, 
[D]As some strong tide it [E7]presseth on its [A]way, 
[D]Seeking a channel [G]in my self-bound [D]soul,
[G]Yearning to [D]sweep all barri[A]ers a[D]way.

2
Shall I not yield to that constraining power?
Shall I not say, O tide of love, flow in?
My God, Thy gentleness hath conquered me
Life cannot be as it hath hither been.

3
Break through my nature, mighty, heavenly love,
Clear every avenue of thought and brain,
Flood my affections, purify my will,
Let nothing but Thine own pure life remain.

4
Thus wholly mastered and possessed by God,
Forth from my life, spontaneous and free,
Shall flow a stream of tenderness and grace,
Loving, because God loved, eternally.

1

songs.title: Whom have I, Lord, in heav'n but Thee?
songs.lyrics:
1
Whom have I, Lord, in heav'n but Thee?
None but Thee! None but Thee!
And this my song through life shall be:
Christ for me! Christ for me!
He hath for me the serpent trod,
He hath redeemed me "by His blood,"
And reconciled my soul to God:
Christ for me! Christ for me!

2
I envy not the rich their joys:
Christ for me! Christ for me!
I covet not earth's glitt'ring toys:
Christ for me! Christ for me!
Earth can no lasting bliss bestow,
"Fading" is stamped on all below;
Mine is a joy no end can know:
Christ for me! Christ for me!

3
Though with the poor be cast my lot:
Christ for me! Christ for me!
"He knoweth best," I murmur not:
Christ for me! Christ for me!
Though "vine" and "fig-tree" blight assail,
The "labor of the olive fail,"
And death o'er flock and herd prevail,
Christ for me! Christ for me!

4
Though I am now on hostile ground,
Christ for me! Christ for me!
And sin beset me all around,
Christ for me! Christ for me!
Let earth her fiercest battles wage,
And foes against my soul engage,
Strong in His strength I scorn their rage:
Christ for me! Christ for me!

5
And when my life draws to its close,
Christ for me! Christ for me!
Safe in His arms I shall repose,
Christ for me! Christ for me!
When sharpest pains my frame pervade,
And all the powers of nature fade,
Still will I sing through death's cold shade;
Christ for me! Christ for me!

songs.title: Lord, Thou hast made Thyself to me
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Lord, Thou hast made Thy[D]self to [G]me
[C]A living, [G]bright re[A7]ali[D]ty,
[G]More present to faith's [D]vision [Em]keen
[C]Than any [G]earthly [D]object [G]seen;
[C]More dear, more [G]inti[D]mately [Em]nigh
[G]Than e'en the [C]clos[Am]est [D]earth[D7]ly [G]tie.

2
And Thou, blest vision of my soul,
Hast made my broken nature whole;
Hast purified my base desires,
And kindled passion's holiest fires;
My nature Thou hast lifted up,
And filled me with a glorious hope.

3
Nearer and dearer still to me,
Thou living, loving Savior be;
Brighter the vision of Thy face,
More charming still Thy words of grace;
So, life shall be transformed to love,
Thy grace and mercy more to prove.

songs.title: Father God, You're my source
songs.lyrics:
[A]Father God, You’re my [AM7]source,

songs.title: How tedious and tasteless the hours
songs.lyrics:
#New Tune
1
[D]How tedious and [F#m]tasteless the [G]hours
When Jesus no [A]longer I see!
[D]Sweet prospects, sweet [F#m]birds and sweet
[G]flow'rs,
Have all lost their [A]sweetness to me.
[Bm]The midsummer [F#m]sun shines but [G]dim,
The fields strive in [D]vain to look [Em]gay;
But when I am [Bm]happy in [G]Him
December's as [A]pleasant as [D]May.

2
His name yields the richest perfume,
And sweeter than music His voice;
His presence disperses my gloom,
And makes all within me rejoice.
I should, were He always thus nigh,
Have nothing to wish or to fear;
No mortal so happy as I;
My summer would last all the year.

3
Content with beholding His face,
My all to His pleasure resigned;
No changes of season or place,
Would make any change in my mind.
While blessed with a sense of His love,
A palace a toy would appear;
And prisons would palaces prove,
If Jesus would dwell with me there.

4
My Lord, if indeed I am Thine,
If Thou art my sun and my song,
Say, why do I languish and pine?
And why are my winters so long?
Oh, drive these dark clouds from the sky,
Thy soul-cheering presence restore;
Or take me to Thee up on high,
Where winter and clouds are no more.

songs.title: Lord, keep my heart open and soft toward You
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord, keep my h[A]eart
[G]Open and soft toward Y[A]ou.
[D]Lord, draw my e[A]yes,
To [G]see nothing else but Y[A]ou.

2
Whatever may [D]happen[A].
I know You w[G]ant to gain my h[A]eart.
Though I may not u[D]nderstand[A].
Just keep disp[G]ensing into my every p[A]art.

3
Make me a be[G]liever[A]
By looking at Y[Bm]ou. (Looking at Y[G]ou)
Standing on Your [D]Word[A]
Faithful and [G]true.[D]

songs.title: Jesus is all the world to me
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Jesus is [C]all the [D]world to [G]me:
My life, my [D]joy, my [G]all.
He [D]is my strength from [G]day to day;
With[A]out Him [A7]I would [D - D7]fall.
[G]When I am [C]sad, to [G]Him I go;
No other [C]one can [G]cheer me so.
[G]When I am [Em]sad, He makes me [G]glad;
[C]He's [D]my [G]Friend.

2
Jesus is all the world to me,
My Friend in trial sore.
I go to Him for blessings, and
He gives them o'er and o'er.
He sends the sunshine and the rain;
He sends the harvest's golden grain:
Sunshine and rain, harvest of grain—
He's my Friend.

3
Jesus is all the world to me,
And true to Him I'll be.
Oh, how could I this Friend deny
When He's so true to me?
Following Him I know I'm right;
He watches o'er me day and night.
Following Him by day and night,
He's my Friend.

4
Jesus is all the world to me,
I want no better friend.
I trust Him now; I'll trust Him when
Life's fleeting days shall end.
Beautiful life with such a Friend;
Beautiful life that has no end!
Eternal life, eternal joy,
He's my Friend.

songs.title: Had I a thousand
songs.lyrics:
1
Had I a thousand lives to live would I live one to Thee
By faith I say that I would live all thousand lives to Thee.
Lord make this my deepest longing to live solely to Thee.
Lord my one life that I was given I’d gladly live to Thee. 

2
Had I a thousand hearts within would I love Thee with one? 
By faith I say that Thou my Lord, all of my hearts would win.
Lord draw my heart from other things, Lord draw me close to Thee
Crush all the idols from within that draw my heart from Thee

3
Had I from just one source to choose, Father would I choose You?
By faith I say that Thou my God art greater than those hewn.
Oh break all of my cisterns Lord, dry up all of the seas.
Lord deal with me that I’d choose You, Lord this is now my plea.

4
Had I a thousand tongues to sing, would I sing once to Thee?
By faith I say that I would only sing, Lord, only unto Thee.
Lord nothing else is worth my voice, Lord cause my eyes to see,
That thou my Lord art all to me, how could I not but sing.

Thus [G]I ex[D7]perience [G-G7]Thee.

  O [C]Lord, Thou art the [F]Spi[C]rit!
  How [F]dear and [C]near to [G]me!
  How [C]I en[G]joy Thy [C]marve[F]lous
  A[C]vaila[G7]bilit[C]y!

2
To all my needs both great and small
Thou art the rich supply;
So ready and sufficient too
For me now to apply.

3
Thy sweet anointing with Thy might
In weakness doth sustain;
By Thy supply of energy
My strength Thou dost maintain.

4
Thy law of life in heart and mind
My conduct regulates;
The wealth of Thy reality
My being saturates.

5
O Thou art ever one with me,
Unrivaled unity!
One spirit with me all the time
For all eternity!

songs.title: When I survey the wondrous cross
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune

1
[G]When I [D7]sur[G]vey the wond[C]rous [G]cross
On [Em]which the Lord of [Am]glory [D]died,
My [D]rich[A7]est [D]gain I [G]count [A7]but [D]loss,
And [Am]pour con[Am7]tempt on [D7]all my [G]pride.

2
Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ, my God;
All the vain things that charm me most,
I'd sacrifice them to His blood.

3
See from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flowed mingled down;
Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

4
His dying crimson, from His head
Spreads o'er His body on the tree;
To all the world then am I dead,
And all the world is dead to me.

5
Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were an offering far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my all.

### Alternate tune
#Capo 3

1
[C]When I survey [F]the wondrous [C]cross
On [C/B]which the [Am]Prince of [Dm]glory [G]died, [Gsus-G]
My richest [C]gain[F] I count but [Am]loss, [F]
And pour con[C]tempt[G] on all my [C]pride.

2
Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ, my God!
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood.

3
See from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flowed mingled down!
Did e'er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

4
[D]Were the whole realm[G] of nature [D]mine,
That were an [Bm]offering [Em]far too [A]small; [Asus-A]
Love so a[D]maz[G]ing, so di[Bm]vine, [G]
Demands my [D]soul, [A]my life, my [D]all.

songs.title: 'Midst the darkness, storm, and sorrow
songs.lyrics:
1
'Midst the darkness, storm, and sorrow,
One bright gleam I see'
Well I know the blessed morrow
Christ will come for me.
'Midst the peace, the joy, the glory
And the light, God's own,
Christ for me is watching, waiting,
Waiting 'til I come.

2
Long the blessed Guide has led me,
By the desert road;
Now I see the coming splendor,
Splendor of my God.
There amidst the love and glory
He is waiting yet;
On His hands a name is graven
He can ne'er forget.

3
Who is this, who come to meet me,
On the desert way,
As the Morning Star foretelling
God's unclouded day?
He it is who came to win me,
On the cross of shame;
In His glory well I know Him,
Evermore the same.

4
O the blessed joy of meeting,
All the desert past;
O the wondrous words of greeting,
He shall speak at last!
He and I together ent'ring
The fair realm above;
He and I together sharing
All the Father's love.

5
Where no shade nor stain can enter,
Nor the gold be dim,
In His holiness unsullied,
I shall walk with Him.
Meet companion then for Jesus,
From Him, for Him, made—
Glory of God's grace forever
There in me displayed.

6
He who in His hour of sorrow
Bore the curse alone;
I who through the lonely desert
Trod where He had gone;
He and I, in that bright glory,
One deep joy shall share—
Mine, to be forever with Him;
His, that I am there.

songs.title: What release the Savior gave me
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
What [G]release the Savior [C]gave me!
Christ in[A7]deed has set me [D]free!
All the [G]pow'r of sin is [C]broken,
All death's [G]sting is [D7]passed from [G]me!

  Christ has [C]made me more than [G]conqu'ror,
  By His [A7]mighty victo[D]ry,
  Now His [G]resurrection [C]power
  From my [G]spirit [D]strengthens [G]me!

2
From the law Christ has delivered,
To its claims I'm ever dead;
Nevermore the law shall bind me,
But by grace I'll live instead.

3
Christ has sin condemned at Calv'ry
And its power done away;
Now it has no ground within me,
I am freed from all its sway.

4
Death by Him has been abolished,
Incorrupted life is shown;
Death's enthralling bonds are broken,
Resurrection life is known.

5
Christ through death has crushed the devil,
World and demons by His might,
From the pow'r of darkness brought me
To the realm of life and light.

6
All-sufficient grace He giveth,
With His pow'r He covers me,
Makes me glory in my weakness
And in weakness strengthens me.

songs.title: Encamped along the hills of light
songs.lyrics:
1
Encamped along the hills of light,
Ye Christian soldiers rise,
And press the battle ere the night
Shall veil the glowing skies;
Against the foe in vales below
Let all our strength be hurled;
Faith is the victory, we know,
That overcomes the world.

  Faith is the victory!
  Faith is the victory!
  O glorious victory,
  That overcomes the world.

2
His banner over us is love,
Our sword the Word of God;
We tread the road the saints before
With shouts of triumph trod.
