  G-O-D-’S P-U-R-P-O-S-E, Amen! (x2)

songs.title: Draw me dear Lord, with Your beauty
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Draw me dear L[G]ord[A], with Your beau[D-Bm]ty
Capture my h[G]eart till e[A7]arth fades aw[D-Bm]ay
I need Your l[G]ove[A7] to att[D]ract me[Bm]
So I can l[Em]ove[A7] You more tod[D]ay.

2
Empty me Lord, how I need You!  
Unclog my mind, emotion, and will.
All that I have, I abandon
So all my heart, Your life can fill.

3
Oh fill me now, with Your life, Lord,
Flood my whole being with rivers divine.
I open wide; what enjoyment!
To live Your life, dear Lord, as mine.

songs.title: Steal me away
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

  [D]Steal me a[Bm]way, I[G] want to be well-[A]pleasing to You.
  [D]Through all my [F#m]time with You, would You [Em]fill me through and th[A]rough?
  [G]You’re coming [A]as a thief, my [F#m]house will be bro[Bm]ken into, so
  [Em]while I still h[D]ave today, make me [G]pre[A]cious to Y[D]ou. 

1
[Bm]Lord, re[A]store [D]the years the locusts have e[G]aten.[A]
[Bm]You re[A]deemed[D] me from a life that is fl[G]eeting;
[Em]A life of much ac[D]tivity,[Em] but no concern for [D]Your deep need.
May we [G]find grace like [D]Noah in Your [Asus]eyes.  [A7]

2
We can choose, will we be foolish or prudent
Vessels filled when we go forth to meet Him?
We’ll be with our Bridegroom sweet, and we’ll enjoy the wedding feast.
May we grasp every opportunity.

3
When we rise, we must make time in the morning.
Lord, You’ll hear, our voices singing and praising.
Lord, grow in us day by day, make us stones, transform the clay;
Constitute us the men of preciousness.

4
We must not forsake assembling together
As we see the day draw nearer and nearer.
Thus together we’ll possess, the vast dimensions of this Christ.
May we be those who hasten Your return.

songs.title: Let the north wind blow
songs.lyrics:
Let the [D]north wind blow
Let the [G]south wind blow
Let the [D]north and the south wind
Come and blow my [A]way...

[D]Look to the east
[D]Look to the west
[D]North, south, east, west
[G]All this land you see is ours to [A]take!

A[D]rise, walk the [G]land!
[D]He is the One who is leading us to [A]fight!
The [D  G]giants [A]there—
They're [D]food [G]for [A]us!
[D]Let's go at once and pos[A]sess it!
[D]For we are well-[G]able to over[A]come it!

songs.title: Sun in the day, the moon at night (Morning Dew)
songs.lyrics:
# Psa. 92:2; Acts 17:25-27; Isa. 43:1; Psa. 73:23; 110:3; Heb. 12:2; Zech. 4:6; 2 Tim. 2:13; Rom. 11:29; Psa. 84:7; Jn. 1:16; Heb. 13:5

#Capo 2
1
[D]Sun in the [Bm]day, the [G]moon at night,
dec[A]lare how great is [D]Thy
Lovingkind[A]ness and [E]Thy faithful[A]ness;
[D]Give life and [A]breath[D] to man, Your [Bm]race
[G]Longing for [A7]them to seek Your [D]face.
[G]Loved me, You're [A7]not as[D]hamed.
[]"I have called you by name."
[G]Healed me, the [A7]brutish and [D]lame.
[]"I have held you by hand."
[G]Your faithful[A7]ness, Your [D]love un[Bm]told
[G]At last, Lord,[A7] You break my stron[D]ghold.

  [G]We conse[A7]crate a[D]new;
  [G]Do train, con[A7]form us to [D]You.
  [G]May we be l[A7]ike the m[D]orning d[Bm]ew,
  "How I [G]love You."
  Young people [A7]satisfying [D]You.

2
Your charming self and cheering love
drew me to run to You.
I thought I could be absolute
But how I've failed, how I've stumbled,
To run this race divine by self.
Now I abhor myself.
"Look away unto Me."
I just cannot prevail.
"It is by My Spirit."
I am faithless, You're faithful still,
Your love is stronger than my will.

3
Your gracious gifts, Your holy calls
are irrevocable.
Though I am not but You are able
From strength to strength, grace upon
grace,
Sustaining me to win the race.
My life I give to You.
"I will never leave you."
My dreams and future, too.
"Nor will I forsake you."
Oh Lord I do! I do! I do!
I love You Lord, I really do.

songs.title: "Seven Spirits" of our God
songs.lyrics:
# Revelation 1:4; 4:5; 5:6
# Capo 3
1
[D]"Seven Spirits" of our God—
Lo, the [A]age has [A7]now been [D]turned
To the Spirit with the Son.
For the [A]churches [E7]He's con[A]cerned.

  Come, O [G]seven Spirits, [Em]come,
  Thy re[A7]covery work be [D]done!
  Burn and search us thorough[G]ly,
  All the [D]churches [A7]are for [D]Thee.
  Burn u[G]s, search u[D]s,
  [A]All the churches [A7]are for [D]Thee!

2
Sevenfold the Spirit is
For the deadness of the church,
That the saints may turn and live,
That the Lord may burn and search.

3
Now the Spirit of our God
Has become intensified:
'Tis not one but sevenfold
That the church may be supplied!

4
Now the seven Spirits are
Seven lamps of burning fire,
Not to teach us, but to burn,
Satisfying God's desire.

5
See the seven Spirits now—
Seven piercing, searching eyes.
In the church exposing us,
All the church He purifies.

6
Seven Spirits doth the Lord
For the churches now employ;
All those in the local church
May this Spirit now enjoy.

songs.title: O what a miracle, my Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]O what a mira[G]cle, [A]my [D]Lord,      
That [D]I'm in [A]Thee and Thou [D]in [A]me,      
That [A]Thou [E]and [A]I are [E7]really [A7]one;      
O [D]what a [Em]wondrous [D-A-D]mystery! 

2
For me Thy body Thou didst give,
That I may ever share in Thee;
For me Thy precious blood was shed,
That from my sins I might be free.

3
By resurrection Thou didst change
Thy form and as the Spirit come;
Thou wouldst that I be filled with Thee
That all Thy riches mine become.

4
Now as the symbols we behold,
Thy loving self we see anew;
We thank Thee for Thy heart's desire
As all Thy travail we review.

5
We eat the bread and drink the wine,
And to Thy sweetness we are led;
In spirit each receiving Thee,
Our spirits with Thyself are fed.

6
We long to eat and drink e'en more,
To take Thyself in spirit thus,
Till Thou shalt all our being fill
And true remembrance have from us.

songs.title: Since long before the world began (O glorious divine love!)
Thou sweet, beloved will of God
songs.lyrics:
### tune 1

1
[C]Thou sweet, beloved will of God,
My anchor ground, my fortress hill,
[F]My spirit's silent, fair abode,
[C]In Thee I hide me and am still.

2
O Will, that willest good alone,
Lead Thou the way, Thou guidest best;
A little child, I follow on,
And, trusting, lean upon Thy breast.

3
God's will doth make the bitter sweet,
And all is well when it is done;
Unless His will doth hallow it,
The glory of all joy is gone.

4
Thy beautiful sweet will, my God,
Hold fast in its sublime embrace
My captive will, a gladsome bird,
Prisoned in such a realm of grace.

5
Within this place of certain good
Love evermore expands her wings,
Or nestling in Thy perfect choice,
Abides content with what it brings.

6
Oh, lightest burden, sweetest yoke;
It lifts, it bears my happy soul,
It giveth wings to this poor heart;
My freedom is Thy grand control.

7
Upon God's will I lay me down,
As child upon its mother's breast;
No silken couch, nor softest bed,
Could ever give me such deep rest.

8
Thy wonderful grand will, my God,
With triumph now I make it mine;
And faith shall cry a joyous Yes
To every dear command of Thine.

### tune 2 (simple)
1
[A]Thou sweet, be[D]loved will of [A]God,
[D]My anchor gr[E]ound, my fortress [F#m]hill,
[A]My spirit's s[E]ilent, fair ab[F#m]ode,
[D]In Thee I [E]hide me and am [A]still.

2
O Will, that willest good alone,
Lead Thou the way, Thou guidest best;
A little child, I follow on,
And, trusting, lean upon Thy breast.

3
God's will doth make the bitter sweet,
And all is well when it is done;
Unless His will doth hallow it,
The glory of all joy is gone.

4
Thy beautiful sweet will, my God,
Hold fast in its sublime embrace
My captive will, a gladsome bird,
Prisoned in such a realm of grace.

5
Within this place of certain good
Love evermore expands her wings,
Or nestling in Thy perfect choice,
Abides content with what it brings.

6
Oh, lightest burden, sweetest yoke;
It lifts, it bears my happy soul,
It giveth wings to this poor heart;
My freedom is Thy grand control.

7
Upon God's will I lay me down,
As child upon its mother's breast;
No silken couch, nor softest bed,
Could ever give me such deep rest.

8
Thy wonderful grand will, my God,
With triumph now I make it mine;
And faith shall cry a joyous Yes
To every dear command of Thine.

songs.title: Lord, Thou art the lovely Bridegroom
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Lord, Thou [F]art the lovely [C]Bridegroom,
God appointed, [D]dear to [G]us;
[C]Thy dear [F]self is so at[C]tractive,
To our heart so [G]beaute[C]ous!

2
Dear Beloved, we admire Thee,
Who can tell Thy preciousness;
All Thy love we deeply treasure
And Thine untold loveliness.

3
Thou art fairer than the fairest,
Thou art sweeter than the sweet;
Thou art meek and Thou art gracious,
None can e'er with Thee compete.

4
Full of myrrh are all Thy garments,
And Thy lips are filled with grace;
In the savor of Thy suffering,
We in love Thyself embrace.

5
It is with the oil of gladness
Thy God hath anointed Thee;
From the palaces of ivory
Praise shall ever rise to Thee.

6
God hath blessed Thee, Lord, forever,
Thou hast won the victory;
Now we see Thee throned in glory
With Thy pow'r and majesty.

7
Thou art the desire of nations,
All Thy worth they'll ever prove;
Thou, the chiefest of ten thousand,
Ever worthy of our love.

songs.title: "Abba, Father," we approach Thee
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 1

1
[D]"Abba, Fat[A]her," [A7]we [D]ap[A]proach [D]Thee
[G]In [D]our [A7]Savi[D]or's [Em-E7]precious [A]name. 
[D]We, Thy chil[A]dren, [A7]here [D]as[A]sem[D]bling,
[G]Now [D]the [A7]pro[D]mised [Em-E7]blessing [A]claim.
[A]From [D]our [A]guilt His [A7]blood [D]has [A]washed us,
[D]'Tis through [Bm]Him our [E7]souls draw [A]nigh,
[D]And Thy [G]Spi[D]rit [G]too has [A]taught [D]us
[A-A7]"Abba, [D]Fat[G]her," [D]thus [A7]to c[D]ry.

2
Once as prodigals we wandered,
In our folly, far from Thee;
But Thy grace, o'er sin abounding,
Rescued us from misery.
Clothed in garments of salvation
At Thy table is our place;
We rejoice, and Thou rejoicest,
In the riches of Thy grace.

3
Thou the prodigal hast pardoned,
"Kissed us" with a Father's love;
"Killed the fatted calf," and made us
Fit Thy purpose to approve
"It is meet," we hear Thee saying,
"We should merry be and glad;
I have found My once-lost children,
Now they live who once were dead."

4
"Abba, Father," we adore Thee,
While the hosts in heaven above
E'en in us now learn the wonders
Of Thy wisdom, grace, and love.
Soon before Thy throne assembled,
All Thy children shall proclaim
Abba's love shown in redemption,
And how full is Abba's name!

songs.title: Once I thirsted for a fountain
songs.lyrics:
### Simpler Chords
1
[Dm]Once I [A7]thirsted [Dm]for a [A7]fountain, [Dm]
Something [Gm]deep that would [Dm-Gm-A7]satisfy,
[Dm]But the [A7]fountain [Dm]that I'd [A7]drink from, [Dm]
Left me [Gm]searching and [Dm-A7-Dm]still so dry.
[C]Then one day I [F]found Him, [C]
He satis[C7]fied my th[F]irst,
[C]Became in [C7]me a [F]deep[C]er so[Dm]urce
[Gm]Whence [A7]living waters [Dm]burst.
Now I drink Him!
[A7]Jesus, Jesus is my [Dm]life now,
[C]Jesus, Jesus is my [F]life;
[A7]I'm fully satis[Dm]fied now,
[A7]Jesus, Jesus is my [Dm-A7-Dm]life.

2
After tasting such a fountain,
Longed my heart for a place of springs;
Caught a vision on a mountain,
In Jerusalem's a gathering.
Then one day He found me,
He brought me to the church,
Pleasures here abound fore'er
I've given up my search.
Hallelujah!
Jesus, Jesus is my life now,
Jesus, Jesus is my life;
I'm fully satisfied now,
Jesus, Jesus is my life.

3
Empty wanderer drop the striving—
Isn't worth all the troublin';
Open up your heart believing,
Call "Lord Jesus" and He'll come in!
Then today you'll find Him,
And calling on His name,
You're joined to Him, you're one with Him—
You'll never be the same.
You won't want to!
Jesus, Jesus is my life now,
Jesus, Jesus is my life;
I'm fully satisfied now,
Jesus, Jesus is my life.

songs.lyrics:
[C]Worthy is the Lamb to receive [Gm]power
[Dm]Worthy is the Lamb to receive [Ddim]riches

songs.title: So let us go into the good land
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[C]Jehovah [Dm]promised [G]us this [C]good land,
Saved us from [Dm]Egypt’s [G]slave[C]ry.
Wandering [Dm]forty [G]years, we’re [C]fi-[E7]nally [Am]here; 
To Canaan’s [Dm]land, we [G]march and [C]feast!

2
So let us go into the good land,
Defeat the giants, fight the kings.
Enjoying Christ, my rich possession,
Enjoying Christ, my righteous King.

3
Come on, let’s cross the Jordan River,
The land of milk, honey so sweet;
Inheriting Christ as my everything,
Obtain the land, God’s given me.

4
Fulfilling God’s eternal purpose,
This is to build His dwelling place.
His expression on earth, fully displayed,
Eternity we’ll be complete.

5
So let us go into the good land,
Defeat the giants, fight the kings.
Enjoying Christ, my rich possession,
Enjoying Christ, my righteous King.

songs.title: All the saints of Christ are
songs.lyrics:
1
All the saints of Christ are
Members every one;
All coordinating
Into oneness come.

2
Though the gifts are many,
Yet the Spirit one;
Many too the functions,
But one Lord, the Son.

3
Each, the others needing,
Must impartial be;
Each its place possesses
And utility.

4
By our grace are measured
Gifts both large and small;
Each with sober judgment
Takes his place with all.

5
Each fulfills his duty,
Shows his usefulness,
Fervent in the spirit,
Girt with faithfulness.

6
Knitting and supplying,
Bearing much in grace;
Not a trace of discord,
Christ is giv'n His place.

7
We, the Church, His Body,
He, the Head, the Son;
By the Spirit's flowing,
We are joined in one.

songs.title: We were dead in our offenses and sins (But God...) (Eph 2:1-14)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]We were dead in our off[D]enses and sins,
[C]walked according to the [D]age of this world,
[G]did desires of the [D]flesh and of thoughts[C],
by nature: [D7]children of wrath. 

#(Part 1) 
#First time: "But God"
  (Our [G]God) Our God, being [Em]rich in mercy,
  [C]Because of [D]His great love,
  (With [G]which) With which He [Em]loved us,
  [C]Even when we were [D]dead in offenses, 
#(Part 2)
  [G]Made [Em]us [C]alive to[D]gether with Christ.
  [G]By gr[Em]ace [C]you have been s[D]aved. [(G)]

2
And raised us up together with Him,
raised us up and seated us with Him,
seated with Him in the heavenlies,
with and in - Christ Jesus.

3
That He might display in ages to come
the surpassing riches of His grace,
riches of His grace in kindness toward us, 
toward us in - Christ Jesus.

4
For by grace you have been saved through faith,
not of yourselves, it is the gift of God;
remember once you were apart from Christ,
no hope, without God in the world.

5
In Christ Jesus you were once far off,
you have now become near in the blood,
become near in the blood of Christ.
For He Himself is our peace.



#Eph 2:1-2a, 3b, 4-8, 12a, 12c, 13-14a

songs.title: Though Thou art God, most glorious high
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune
# Capo 3

1
[G]Though Thou art God, most [C]glorious, [G]high,
[D]Thou in the flesh to [D7]us came [G]nigh,
A lowly man be[G7]come there[C]by;
Lord, [G]I re[D]member [G]Thee!

2
Glory divine was put away
Under the tent of flesh to stay,
No outward beauty to display;
Lord, I remember Thee!

3
Thou art a root from out dry ground,
Thou wast the Man of sorrows found,
Hated, despised by man around;
Lord, I remember Thee!

4
Gentle and lowly is Thy heart,
Willing to suffer all Thou art,
To God and man complaining not;
Lord, I remember Thee!

5
Thou as a man art tender, sweet,
Balanced in every way, complete,
Meal-offering to the Father meet;
Lord, I remember Thee!

6
Doing the Father’s will Thy prize,
Never accepting Satan’s lies,
None like Thyself, so faithful, wise;
Lord, I remember Thee!

7
For Thine obedience to God’s will,
Willing to suffer deathly ill,
E’en on the Cross my place to fill,
Lord, I remember Thee!

8
Therefore hath God exalted Thee,
Given Thee glory, majesty,
Heaven and earth will bow the knee;
O Lord, I worship Thee!

### New tune

1
[G]Though Thou art [D]God, most glorious, [Em]high,
Thou in the [Bm]flesh to us came n[Em]igh,
A lowly m[C]an become there[G]by;
Lord, I re[D]mem[D7]ber [G]Thee!

2
Glory divine was put away
Under the tent of flesh to stay,
No outward beauty to display;
Lord, I remember Thee!

3
Thou art a root from out dry ground,
Thou wast the Man of sorrows found,
Hated, despised by man around;
Lord, I remember Thee!

4
Gentle and lowly is Thy heart,
Willing to suffer all Thou art,
To God and man complaining not;
Lord, I remember Thee!

5
Thou as a man art tender, sweet,
Balanced in every way, complete,
Meal-offering to the Father meet;
Lord, I remember Thee!

6
Doing the Father’s will Thy prize,
Never accepting Satan’s lies,
None like Thyself, so faithful, wise;
Lord, I remember Thee!

7
For Thine obedience to God’s will,
Willing to suffer deathly ill,
E’en on the Cross my place to fill,
Lord, I remember Thee!

8
Therefore hath God exalted Thee,
Given Thee glory, majesty,
Heaven and earth will bow the knee;
O Lord, I worship Thee!

songs.title: I have been regenerated
songs.lyrics:
I have been regenerated,
re-born according to God's plan!
Christ Jesus died for me,
that He might dwell in me,
Inside my inner man. (inside my inner man)

#work in progress

songs.title: Marvelous grace of our loving Lord (Grace greater than sin)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Marvelous [C]grace of our loving [G]Lord,
Grace that ex[C]ceeds our sin and our [D]guilt,
[G]Yonder on [C]Calvary's [D]mount out[Em]poured,
[D]There where the [C]blood of the [G]Lamb [D]was [G]spilt.

  [G]Grace, [C]grace, [D]God's [G]grace,
  Grace that will [C]pardon and [D]cleanse from wi[Em]thin!
  [G]Grace, [C]grace, [D]God's [Em]grace,
  [G]Grace that is [C]greater than [D]all of my [G]sin!

2
Sin and despair, like the sea waves cold,
Threaten the soul with infinite loss;
Grace that is greater, yes, grace untold,
Points to the refuge, the mighty cross.

3
Dark is the stain that we cannot hide;
What can avail to wash it away?
Look! There is flowing a crimson tide;
Whiter than snow you may be today.

4
Marvelous, infinite, matchless grace,
Freely bestowed on all who believe,
All who are longing to see His face,
Will you this moment His grace recieve?

songs.title: O Light of light, shine in
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]O Light of l[B7]ight, shine [Em]in!
Cast out, this n[C]ight of s[G]in,
Create true d[B7]ay with[Em]in:
O Light of l[C]ight, shine [G]in!

  O Light, all light excelling,
  Make my heart Thy dwelling;
  O Joy, all grief dispelling,
  To my poor heart come in!

2
O Joy of joys, come in!
End Thou this grief of sin,
Create calm peace within:
O Joy of joys, come in!

3
O Life of life, pour in!
Expel this death of sin,
Awake true life within:
O Life of life, pour in!

4
O Love of love, flow in!
This hateful root of sin
Deal with, renew, within:
O Love of love, flow in!

5
O Heaven of heavens, descend!
This cloudy curtain rend,
And all earth's turmoil end:
O Heaven of heavens, descend!

6
My God and Lord, O come!
Of joys the Joy and Sum,
Make in this heart Thy home:
My God and Lord, O come!

songs.title: My Father God, when on Thy vast creation
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
[D7]My Father [G]God, when [G7]on Thy [C]vast creation,
The wonders [G]of the [D7]heav’n and earth, I [G-D7]gaze,
Things great and [G]small, be[G7]yond e[C]numeration,
Which mani[G]fest Thy [D7]pow’r in untold [G]ways;

  Then all my [G]being [C]sings in praise to [G]Thee,
  How marvel[Am7-D7]lous! How great Thou [G]art!
  And this I’ll [G]sing through [C]all eterni[G]ty,
  How [G7]marvel[Am7]lous! [E7]How [Am]great [D7]Thou [G-C-G]art!

2
As I enjoy the grace of Thy salvation
And contemplate how Thou Thy Son hast sent,
Who died that we might be Thy new creation,
Thy life expressing to the full extent;

3
When in the church, in blest participation,
I see how millions Thine own life possess,
How they are built to form Thy habitation,
Containing Thee, Thy fulness to express;

4
As I expect the coming age of fulness
And hope to share the new Jerusalem,
With all the heavens and the earth in newness
And all Thou art expressed in all of them;

songs.title: Death cannot hold the resurrection life
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 2)

1
[D]Death cannot [D7]hold the [G]resurrection l[D]ife,
[G]The life o[D]f God e[E7]ternal man[A]ifest;
[D]’Tis unc[D7]reated, [G]indestructib[Em]le,
[A7]’Tis Christ [D]Himself, un[Em]conqu’rab[A7]le ex[D]pressed.

2
Death cannot hold the resurrection life,
Though all its force against it may combine;
Death only gives it opportunity
To show the boundless pow’r of life divine.

3
Death cannot hold the resurrection life,
The more interred, the more it multiplies;
All kinds of suff’ring only help it grow,
And fruits of life abundant realize.

4
Death cannot hold the resurrection life,
Thru every block and barrier it breaks;
Conqu’ring the pow’r of darkness and of hell,
It swallows death and victory partakes.

5
Death cannot hold the resurrection life,
All of God’s fullness it will manifest;
God’s righteousness and holiness it yields,
His glorious image by it is expressed.

6
Oh, may I know this resurrection life,
In every kind of death its pow’r outpoured,
In my experience ever realize
This life is nought but Christ my living Lord.

songs.title: Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[D]Lord, teach us [A]to dis[D]cern the [G]spirit
From [D]soul that we Thy[E7]self may [A]know;
Thou [D]art the [A]Spirit [D]in our [G]spirit,
In [D]oneness mingled [A]with [A7]us [D]so.

2
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
The soul-life ever to deny,
And ever follow Thee in spirit,
Thyself, the Spirit, to apply.

3
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
That we may never set our mind
Upon the flesh but on the spirit,
That sin and self no more may bind.

4
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
That we may never soulish be,
But truly spiritual, in spirit
To know all things discernibly.

5
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
That subtle self exposed might be,
That by the cross to it applying
We'll live not by ourselves but Thee.

6
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
That we may be transformed in soul,
Till we're conformed to Thine own image,
Till we're matured and reach the goal.

7
Lord, teach us to discern the spirit
To us Thy living Word so give
That soul from spirit be divided
And in the holiest place we'll live.

songs.title: Young David
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Young David had a [G]sweet relation[D]ship 
With Jehovah, whom he [A]loved.
[D]David knew the [G]Lord as his [D]Shepherd
And His tender [A]care from a[D]bove.[G - D]

Chorus:
  [D]Let's sing (Let's sing) and [G]praise Je[D]hovah! 
  He’s so rich and marvelo[A]us!
  “[D]Thou art loving, [G]ever so [D]faithful!
  O dear Lord, in [A]Thee we trust!”[G - D]

2
The Lord “sought a man according to His heart,”
David, as Jesse’s eighth son.
Even though “he was but a youth,”
He was God’s anointed one.

3
When David found himself in deep distress,
To Jehovah he would cry:
“O Jehovah, Thou art my refuge,
And my source of endless supply!”

4
As David fought “the battles of Jehovah,”
God was his strength and shield,
And the rock of his salvation;
He called, “O Lord!” the vict’ry to wield!

5
The Lord appointed David as ruler,
Over God’s people as king.
He would serve according to God’s counsel,
Writing psalms that now we can sing.

songs.title: Check with His face
songs.lyrics:
[C]Check with His [CM7]face              
[Am]Check with His [F]smile
[C]Check with the [CM7]Lord                 
[Am]Check with His [F]presence

[Dm7]From [G]the beginning to the [C-E7-Am]end, 
[Dm7]Our Christian [G7]life is just His [C]face.

Regeneration (2 Cor. 4:6) (Begins with His face)
Transformation (2 Cor. 3:18) (Beholding His face)
His parousia (1 John 3:2) (His smiling face)
Eternal blessing (Rev. 22:4) (Forever His face)

It’s all about His face
Our Christian life is just His face.

Seeing His face
Seeing His smile
Seeing the Lord
Seeing His presence

It’s all about His face
Our Christian life is summed up in His face

Seeing Your face
Seeing Your smile
Seeing You Lord
Seeing Your presence 

From the beginning to the end, 
Our Christian life is just His face.

I love Your face
I love Your smile
I love You Lord
I love Your presence 

It’s all about Your face
Our Christian life is summed up in Your face

songs.title: Holy Father, we adore Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Holy Father, [F]we a[C]dore Thee,
Rev'rent [Am]song to [D]Thee we [G]raise;
[C]Thou art holy, [F]Thou art [C]lofty,
"Holy is Thy [G]Name," [G7]we [C]praise.

2
Loving is Thy heart, dear Father,
Righteous ever are Thy ways;
But how holy is Thy nature,
Yet, to us, Christ it conveys.

3
Thou hast ever sanctified us
With the blood of Christ our Lord;
Thou hast separated sinners
Thru the truth which is Thy Word.

4
Thou hast, by Thy Holy Spirit,
Made us holy unto Thee;
And our spirit, soul, and body
Wholly sanctified will be.

5
Oh! The holy life of Jesus
Thru Thy grace we now possess;
Thou wilt make us e'en partakers
Of Thy very holiness.

6
When within that holy city,
Thy full holiness we'll share,
To the uttermost forever,
"Thou art holy," we'll declare.

songs.title: Lord, I come by mercy free
songs.lyrics:
# Tune of “Lord, Thou art a potter skilled”
# 3/4
1
Lord, I [D]come by [G]mercy [D]free
Through the outer court to [A]Thee.
I ap[D]ply what [G]Thou hast [D]done
For my [E7]sake, Redeeming [A]One.
[A7]Cleanse me [D]in Thy [D7]blood so [G]blest!
Judge and [D]burn all I pos[A]sess.
[A7]Wash a[D]way my [G]dirti[D]ness.
[G]Make me [D]now Thy [A7]righteous[D-G-D]ness.
 
2
In the Holy Place, I share
In Thy building work so fair.
I enjoy all that Thou art
That Thou may Thyself impart.
Nourish me, Bread of delight!
Shining Spirit, grant me sight!
Add Thine incense to my plea—
Sanctified I'll wholly be.

3
To the holiest of all—
Mingled spirit, where I'm called
Boldly to the throne of grace,
Meeting with Thee face to face.
Hide Thy speaking in my being!
Write Thy law of life in me!
Bud forth with authority,
Glorifying fruitfully.
 
4
Daily draw me to Thy face—
Outer court, then Holy Place
To the Holy of Holies,
Dwelling in Thee, Thou to please.
My experience expand
That, according to Thy plan,
New Jerusalem may be
Lived out in reality.

songs.title: From my spirit, when I’m sensing the supply
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[D]From my spir[D7]it, when I’m [G]sensing the supply
[A7]Of God’s [D]speakin[Bm]g, from a [E7]fount that ne’er runs [A7]dry,
And with[D]in me comes a [G]fresh and sweet sup[Em]ply,
Then I’ve [D]got to open [A7]up and water [D-G-D]you.

  [A7]Water [D]you, water you,
  From the [Em]flowing in my [Em7]spirit water [A]you;[A7]
  [D]When the saints need my sup[D7]ply,
  Then I’ll [G]surely testi[Em]fy,
  I’ll stand [D]up, release my [A7]Christ and water [D-G-D]you!

2
In the meeting, when the spirit’s rising high,
And it seems like we will go beyond the sky—
I can’t help it, I must speak or else I’ll die,
For my Christ is rising up to water you.

3
Should a pause come, or the meeting ebb real low,
While within me there’s a rich and living flow,
Then I’ll stand up, so that all the saints will know,
That I’m here to share my Christ and water you.

4
In the church life, in our daily living too,
In the meeting, and in everything we do,
Christ is speaking and the Spirit’s breaking through,
That is why there’s the supply to water you.

songs.title: They will not hunger anymore (Rev. 7:16-17)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2
[C]They will not hunger anymore, neither will they 
[Em]thirst anymore, neither will the [F]sun beat up[Fm]on 
them, nor any [C]heat;[G] 
For the [C]Lamb who is in the [Em]midst of throne will 
[F]shepherd them and [Fm]guide them to [C]springs of 
[E]living [Am]waters;  [F]
and God will [G]wipe away [C]every tear.

#Revelation 7:16-17

songs.title: God's intention in this universe
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
God's in[G]tention in this universe
Is [G7]with humanity,
So the [C]Lord became the Spirit
Just with [G]man to mingled [D]be.
We re[G]joice that we can all partake
Of [B7]His econo[Em]my.
Yes, [Am]mingling [D]is the [G]way.

  [G]Mingle, mingle, halle[G7]lujah,
  [C]Mingle, mingle, halle[G]lujah,
  [G]Mingle, mingle, halle[B7-Em]lujah,
  Yes, [Am]mingling [D]is the [G]way!

2
In the center of our being,
Past our mind, emotion, will,
Is a certain spot created
To contain the Lord until
By His flowing and His flooding
He will all our being fill;
Yes, mingling is the way.

3
Now within the Lord's recov'ry,
We're so glad to find the way
To experience the Triune God
And live by Him today—
Get into the mingled spirit,
And within the spirit stay;
Yes, mingling is the way.

4
In the midst of seven lampstands,
Now the Son of Man we see;
Eyes ablaze and feet a'burning,
He's for God's recovery.
God's intention He's accomplishing—
A corporate entity;
Yes, mingling is the way.

5
In our daily life and all we are
And do and think and say,
How we need a deeper mingling
Just to gain the Lord each day;
Lord, we give ourselves completely
Just to take the mingled way.
Yes, mingling is the way.

6
From the fruit of daily living,
New Jerusalem we'll see,
It's the ultimate in mingling—
it's divine humanity.
And what joy that we can share it all,
And share it corporately.
Yes, mingling is the way.

songs.title: What made You, Lord, to die for me?
songs.lyrics:
#capo 3
1
[G]What made You, [Em]Lord, to [D]die for [G]me?
Why would You [Em]die for [Bm]me, Your ene[D]my?
[G]You took my [Em]place to [C]hang on a [Am]tree,
To [G]be a [Em]curse, a [C]curse for [G]me.

  What made You [Em]die for me? [C]
  I was Your [G]enemy.[Em]
  Lord, You be[D]came a curse for [G]me.
  Oh, what a [Em]mystery, [C]
  My God You d[G]ied for me![Em]
  You died for [D]me, Your ene[G]my.

2
I never thought that You would be
So full of love and tender mercy.
How could You love a person like me?
You loved me, dear Jesus, Your enemy.

3
You loved me, Lord, so very long;
And with a love enduring and strong.
Although I mocked and cursed You so long,
You waited and prayed for me all along.

4
I was a man who was just sin,
Which issued in a life full of sins.
My heart toward You was in rebellion,
But, Lord, You touched me with Your compassion.

  Your love has conquered me,
  Even Your enemy.
  In love, dear Lord, You came to me.
  Nothing could change me
  But love and mercy.
  Your love, dear Lord, has conquered me.

5
One little turn and You were there,
Waiting for me with Your loving care.
How could I still remain Your enemy?
Your love, dear Jesus, disarmed me.

songs.title: Where have you laid Him, my Jesus? (Lord, I can't forget)
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Where have you laid Him, my Jesus?
Where have you [G]put Him, my precious Lord?
There are His [D]grave clothes, but He’s not there.
Where is my [G]Jesus, my lovely One, where is[A] He?

  [D]Lord, I can’t forget
  Since the [G]day we first met.
  All my [D]heart belongs to You.
  I just love You, just [G]You,
  Just [A]love You.

2
Jesus, my dear Lord, I love You.
I can’t go on Lord, without You.
I’m sick of love, my soul has failed;
I need You Jesus, my Beloved, I love You.

3
Mary, My seeker, I am alive.
Stop, do not touch Me, as I have not
Yet ascended to the Father,
For this freshness is for the Father’s enjoyment.

4
My dear Rabboni, my heart’s desire,
You have risen out of the grave.
O Lord, I love You, my dearest One.
You’ve truly risen from among the dead.

  Dear Rabboni,
  Lord, I can’t believe it’s You!
  I don’t know how this could be
  But I enjoy You here.
  I love You!

5
O Lord, my heart is filled with ecstasy
In resurrection, to be here with Thee.
I am elated, beside myself.
Jesus, I’ll love You with all my heart, forever.

6
Go tell my brothers you have seen Me.
Tell them the words which I speak to you:
I must ascend to My Father
And to your Father, and to My God
and to your God.

  I have found my Love,
  He has risen from the dead.
  Now our Jesus is alive.
  I have seen Him, seen Him!
  I love Him!

7
Jesus, we love You with all our heart.
Our Love, we need You so desperately.
O Lord, we love You immensely.
We will be loving You for all eternity.

songs.title: Marvel not that Christ in glory
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3
1
[D]Marvel not that Christ in g[A7]lory      
All my [A]inmost heart hath w[D]on;      
Not a st[G]ar to cheer my d[D]arkness,      
But a l[A]ight beyond the s[D]un,      
All below lies dark and sh[Em]adowed,      
Nothing h[G]ere to claim my h[D]eart,      
Save the l[Bm]onely track of s[G]orrow      
Where of [D]old He [A7]walked ap[D]art.

2
Others in the earthly sunshine
Wearily may journey on,
I have seen a light from heaven
Past the brightness of the sun—
Light that knows no cloud, no waning,
Light wherein I see His face,
All His love's uncounted treasures,
All the riches of His grace:

3
All the wonders of His glory,
Deeper wonders of His love—
How for me He won, He keepeth
That high standing all above;
Not a glimpse—the veil uplifted—
But within the veil to dwell,
Gazing on His face forever,
Hearing words unspeakable.

4
I have seen the face of Jesus—
Tell me not of aught beside;
I have heard the voice of Jesus—
All my soul is satisfied.
In the radiance of the glory
First I saw His blessed face,
And forever shall that glory
Be my home, my dwelling-place.

songs.title: Just a sojourner wandering on the earth (Psalm 119)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[D]Just a [G]sojourner wandering [A]on the [D]earth,
having seen an end [G]to all [A]perfec[D]tion.
[Bm]Before I was [G]afflicted and [A]went [D]astray,
[G]Asking how should one [A]keep your [D]way[D7]?
[Bm]I have sought for an [G]answer,
and [A]now I [D]see,
By [G]keeping Your [A]words with [D]me.  [G]   [D]

2
Distress and anguish have come upon me.
My soul melts because of my sorrow and grief.
Let your hand be ready to encourage me
so I may know your loving way.
Your hands have made me
and fashioned me;
Now I may hope in Your words.

3
At midnight I rise, giving thanks to You
I anticipate the dawn and cry out loud too;
Toward Your righteous ordinances,
I incline my heart.
Blessed are those who keep Your words.
Your presence as my shield, my hiding place;
I seek You with all my heart.

4
Dear Lord, may You grant us grace today.
To love and seek Your words forever to stay.
We would treasure Your words
Deep in our hearts
Your words shine light and give life.
We will not be ashamed to speak only You,
Lord make us your men so true

songs.title: Bless the Lord, O my soul (Who coverest Thyself with light)

songs.title: Triune God: dispense Yourself into man
songs.lyrics:
#NZSSOT 2023-2024 
#Triune God

  [F]Triune [Bb]God: dis[F]pense Yourself into [C]man
  [F]We need Your [Bb]essence growing 
  [Am]To fulfil Your e[Dm]ternal plan[Bb C F]
  So [Dm]God You [Gm]sent Your Son kn[A]owing[A7]
  That the [Bb]Spir[C]it would be [F Am Dm]flowing
  [Bb]Triune God, [C]mingle with [F]us!

1
[F]The Vine Tree, [Bb]how wonderful[F]
(How wonder[C]ful!)
[F]Father: [Bb] the husband[Am]man
The [Dm]Son: the vine [Bb C F]
Spirit [Dm]is the flowing [Gm]life with[A]in  [A7]

songs.title: All my life, religion taught...
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
[G]All my life, re[Bm]ligion taught: "[Bm]Serve [Bbm]your [C]God,"
while it taught: "He's [G]far aw[D]ay."
[G]They told me to "[Bm]Care for God-[Bm]" I [Bbm]could [C]not,
In fact, I cared [G]less each [D]day.
  [C]Oh, how could they [D]ask from [D7]me[C]:
  "Live pleasing this [D]God you [D7]cannot see[C]"?
  Oh, I've tried re[D]lentless[D7]ly, but-
  [C]every time,[D] I fail to [G]please.

2
Then, one day, I heard that God came as man-
stepped down out of His glory.
They called Him: "Emmanuel"- God with us;
Jesus- just as small as me.
  God's righteous demand- I couldn't meet...
  Jesus, sinless man- fulfilled for me!
  Death I owed from sin in me. He-
  paid the price! He died for me!

3
Passed through death and Hades He: took the keys,
then He resurrected free!
Through this, He, the Spirit came: life-giving!
To impart God's life to me!
  Resurrection life can now be drawn;
  I can be supplied, by sinless God!
  Sin is nullified when I call: 
  "Jesus Lord, flow to me!"

4
He ascended far above- everything.
I am one with Him; He, me.
With Him in the heavenlies- is my seat.
Satan tries, he cannot reach!
  I can rise from Sheol to mount Zion!  
  to stay in ascension, I just call:
  "O Lord Jesus, Oh Lord, Jesus-"
  Every day, in every place!

5
When I called His name He came- into me!
He's not far-off; I'm His home.
Right when I apply His blood: "Lord, wash me!"
All His riches freely flow!
  My sin-ridden flesh can't live for God...
  God can live through me- my problem's solved!
  God indeed is pleased with me, for-
  He's revealed His Son in me!

6
I want to abide with Him, constantly!
Loving, caring mutually.
All is vanity but Him. Vanity!
I have met Reality!
  I have found a friend in Elohim!
  I'll just turn to Him, He'll meet the need!
  Savior, Brother, Father, Bridegroom-
  Jesus Christ, my all to be!
  -
  [C]Jesus Christ,[D] my all to [G]be!

songs.title: Be still my heart! These anxious cares
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Be still my heart! These [A]anxious [D]cares
To thee are burdens, [E]thorns [E7]and [A]snares;
[D]They cast dishonor [B7]on the [Em]Lord,
[A7]And contra[D]dict His [A]gracious [D]word.

2
Brought safely by His hand thus far,
Why wilt thou now give place to fear?
How canst thou want if He provide,
Or lose thy way with such a Guide?

3
When first before His mercy-seat
Thou didst to Him thine all commit;
He gave thee warrant from that hour
To trust His wisdom, love, and power.

4
Did ever trouble yet befall,
And He refuse to hear thy call?
And has He not His promise passed,
That thou shalt overcome at last?

5
He who has helped me hitherto
Will help me all my journey through,
And give me daily cause to raise
New Ebenezers to His praise.

6
Though rough and thorny be the road,
It leads thee on, apace, to God;
Then count thy present trials small,
For God will make amends for all.

songs.title: My song shall be of Jesus
songs.lyrics:
My [D]song shall be of Jesus;
His [G]mercy crowns my days,
He [Gm]fills my cup with blessings,
And [D]tunes my heart to praise[A].
My [D]song shall be of Jesus,
The [G]precious Lamb of God,
Who [Gm]gave Himself my ransom,
And [D]bought me [A]with His [D]blood.

  My [F#m]song shall [Bm]be of [F#m]Jesus
  When, [G]sitting at His [D]feet,
  I [F#m]call to [Bm]mind His [F#m]goodness
  In [E]meditation [A7]sweet:
  My [A]song shall be of [D]Jesus,
  What[F#]ever ill be[Bm]tide;
  I’ll [G]sing the grace that [D]saves [Bm]me,
  And [A]keeps me at His [D]side.
  I’ll [G]sing the grace that [D]saves [Bm]me,
  And [A]keeps me at His [D]side.

My song shall be of Jesus
While pressing on my way
To reach the blissful kingdom
Of pure and perfect day:
And when my soul shall enter
That realm of splendor fair,
A song of praise to Jesus
I’ll sing forever there.

songs.title: What a wonderful change (since Jesus came into my heart)
songs.lyrics:
1
What a w[G]onderful change in my life has been wrought
Since J[C]esus came into my he[G]art![D]
I have [G]light in my soul for which long I had sought,
Since J[A]esus came into my h[D]eart!

  [D7]Since J[G]esus came into my heart[G7]!
  Since J[C]esus came into my h[G]eart![D]
  Floods of j[G]oy o’er my soul like the sea billows roll,
  S[C]ince J[G]esus came [D]into my he[G]art!

2
I have ceased from my wand’ring and going astray,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And my sins which were many are all washed away,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

3
I’m possessed of a hope that is steadfast and sure,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And no dark clouds of doubt now my pathway obscure,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

4
There’s a light in the valley of death now for me,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And the gates of the City beyond I can see,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

5
I shall go there to dwell in that City I know,
Since Jesus came into my heart!
And I’m happy, so happy as onward I go,
Since Jesus came into my heart!

songs.title: I need a vision, a heavenly vision
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[G]Now the prophet Ezekiel, [C]while he was a [CDim]captive,
[G]He saw the [E7]visions of God[A7-D7] for His move;
[G]By the river Chebar [C]the heavens were [CDim]opened,
[G]And he saw [A7]visi[D7]ons of [G-C-G-C]God.

  [G]I need a vision, [C]a heavenly [CDim]vision,
  [G]A revel[A7]ation of the [D]Lord (and this age);[D7]
  [G]Grant me a vision, [C]such a heavenly [Cdim]vision,
  [G]A reve[A7]lation[D7], dear Lord![G-C-G-C]

2
Then the word of Jehovah came to him expressly,
He understood and proclaimed what he saw
And the hand of Jehovah was with Ezekiel
To see these visions of God.

  (Chorus 1)

3
On the isle of Patmos John saw the vision,
The revelation of the Lord Jesus Christ.
Saw the seven churches, and the seven Spirits,
He saw the vision of this age.

  I’ve seen a vision, a heavenly vision,
  I’ve seen a vision of the Lord Jesus Christ
  Grant me a living, such a heavenly living,
  To match this vision, dear Lord!

4
See the New Jerusalem, see the holy city,
See the bride adorned for the Lord (Jesus Christ),
See the consummation of all the visions,
See the final vision of the age!

  (Chorus 2)

songs.title: All hail the pow'r of Jesus' name (Hymns: #137)
songs.lyrics:
1
All hail the pow'r of Jesus' name!
Before Him prostrate fall;
With one accord His praise proclaim,
And crown Him Lord of all!

2
Ye saints redeemed from, Adam’s race,
Ye ransomed from the fall,
Hail Him who saves you by His grace,
And crown Him Lord of all.

3
Tell forth the only Name that's giv'n
On which we now may call,
The Name adored by hosts in heav'n,
And crown Him Lord of all.

4
In glory all the ransomed throng
Soon at His feet shall fall;
Join in the blest eternal song,
And crown Him Lord of all.
(Repeat the last two lines of each stanza)

songs.title: Lord, it seems (A little more, each day)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
Lord, it [G]seems[Em]
That I [Am]fail and fail ag[D]ain.
I see Your [G]face, [Em]
But then the [C]veils return ag[D]ain.
E[Bm]motion’s [Em]stirred, but [B]there’s no change in [Em]me.
I’m [F]living in my [C]soul; I have to [D]learn
A [Am]little more, each [D]day, O Lord, to [G]turn.

2
Lord, I know
That I’ve truly seen Your face, 
but vision fades;
I look away to other things.
Remind me, Lord, reveal Yourself to me,
That from my idols I would be set free.
A little more, each day, I want to see.

3
Lord, my mind
Is occupied with many things--
This thorny age,
With all of its anxieties.
My faith is weak; I’m caught up in my cares.
I need to learn to tell it all to You!
A little more, each day, my mind renew.

4
Lord, my will
Is resistant to Your touch.
Disarm me, Lord;
Don’t let me win against Your grace.
I turn my eyes and see Your patient love--
What can I do but stop and come to You?
A little more, each day, my will subdue.

5
Lord, I pray,
Make me desperate for You.
Keep drawing me
And training me to hear Your voice.
Lord, even though my progress is so slow,
You’re by my side; You will not let me go.
A little more, each day, I’d love You so.
A [C]little more, each [D]day, and I will [G]grow.

songs.title: Sweet feast of love divine
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
Sweet [D]feast of [G]love di[D  A]vine!
’Tis [Bm]grace that [A]makes us [D  D7]free
To [G]feed upon this [D]bread and [Bm]wine,
In [G]mem’ry, [A]Lord, of [D]Thee.

2
Here every welcome guest
Waits, Lord, from Thee to learn
The secrets of Thy Father’s breast,
And all Thy grace discern.

3
Here conscience ends its strife,
And faith delights to prove
The sweetness of the Bread of Life,
The fulness of Thy love.

4
That blood that flowed for sin
In symbol here we see,
And feel the blessed pledge within
That we are loved of Thee.

5
O if this glimpse of love
Is so divinely sweet,
What will it be, O Lord, above,
Thy gladd’ning smile to meet!

6
To see Thee face to face,
Thy perfect likeness wear,
And all Thy ways of wondrous grace
Through endless years declare.

songs.title: Earthen vessel I was made
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Earthen vessel I was made,      
Chr[A]ist in me the tr[D]easure laid;      
His container[F#m] I must [Bm]be,      
As the [Em]content [A]He in [D]me[G]. [D] 

2
In His image I was made,
Fit that Christ should all pervade;
Thus the vessel God did form
With the content uniform.

3
In my spirit He remains,
With His power He sustains;
As the Spirit one with me,
He is my reality.

4
Moving in me day by day,
Mingling with me all the way,
All my steps He regulates,
Every part He saturates.

5
Him expressing from within,
Making Him to others seen,
I transparent have to be
That He may be shown thru me.

6
Transformation is my need,
To be broken more indeed,
That the clay may change in form,
To the treasure to conform.

songs.title: How Long
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Keep my heart [A]always burning [G]with my best love [D]to love You,
Keep my eyes [A]pure and simple [G]with a view to see [D]only You,
Loving [Bm]You, [A]surely there’s no better [G-A]way,
Drinking [Bm]You, [A]saturate me thoroug[G]hly to[A]day.  [D]

  How long! How [G]very long You’ve waited [D]patiently for [G]me,
  How [D]long! How [G]very long You’ve waited [D]for Your bride to [G]be.
  (How [D-G-D]long)

2
Keep my lips (so quick to anger) full of grace to speak forth You,
Keep my ears firmly planted in my spirit to hear You,
By Your blood, cleanse me from my every sin,
By Your word, sanctify me more and more within.

3
Set my hands in constant labor on the land to bring forth You,
Set my feet swift and able going forth to bring good news,
On the cross, You have won the victory,
On the throne, You’re interceding every day for me.

songs.title: Jesus Lord, You’re our first love
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune

1
[D]Jesus [DM7]Lord, You’re our first [D]love[DM7];
[D]You’re the [DM7]One we love the [Em]best.[A]
[Em]When our [A]heart is loving [Em]You,[A]
[Em]How we’re [A]filled with Your sweet [D]rest[DM7]!

2
Lord, we love You for Yourself,
Not for what You give or do.
Nothing else could e’er compare
With the joy of loving You.

  [Bm]Lord, we’ve [E]been drawn off by m[A]any things;
  [Am]Now we [D]turn our heart back—
  [G]How it[Gm] sings!
  [D]We re[DM7]pent of loving [F#m]other t[B]hings
  [Em]Jesus Lord, You’re [A7]our first [D]love[DM7].

3
Never more could we desire
Anything that’s less than You,
And to this we will aspire—
Simply to be filled with You.

Jesus Lord, You’re our first love;
You’re the One we love the best.
When our heart is loving You,
How we’re filled with Your sweet rest!

  Lord, we’ve been drawn off by many things;
  Now we turn our heart back—
  How it sings!
  We repent of loving other things
  Jesus Lord, You’re our first love.

### New Tune

# Capo 4

1
Jesus [G]Lord, You’re our first [Bm]love;
You’re the [C]One we love the [G]best.
When our [C]heart is loving [G]You,
How we’re [D]filled with Your sweet rest!

2
Lord, we [G]love You for Your[Bm]self,
Not for [C]what You give [D]or [Em]do.
Nothing [C]else could e’er com[Am]pare
With the [C]joy of [D]loving [G]You.

  [C]Lord, we’ve been drawn [G]off by [C]many [G]things;
  [C]Now we turn our [G]heart back—[Em]how it [D]sings!
  [G]We re[D]pent of [C]loving other [G]things—
  [C]Jesus [Em]Lord, You’re [C]our [D]first [G]love.

3
Never more could we desire
Anything that’s less than You,
And to this we will aspire—
Simply to be filled with You.

4
Jesus Lord, You’re our first love;
You’re the One we love the best.
When our heart is loving You,
How we’re filled with Your sweet rest!

  Lord, we’ve been drawn off by many things;
  Now we turn our heart back—how it sings!
  We repent of loving other things—
  Jesus Lord, You’re our first love.

songs.title: There’s a race for us to run—Hallelujah
songs.lyrics:
1
There’s a [G]race for us to [D]run—Halle[G]luj[C]ah,
And a [G]way for us the [D]race to [G]win.
To all [G]those who have be[D]gun—Halle[G]luj[C]ah,
God has [G]spoken, “Look a[D]way to [G]Him!”

  Look a[G]way! O look a[D]way!
  Look to [G]Jesus [A7]now to[D-D7]day!
  Look a[G]way from every[D]thing unto [G]Jes[C]us,
  Look a[G]way from every[D]thing to [G]Him!

2
Look away from all around—Hallelujah,
Look away from all the strife and din;
Look away where peace is found—Hallelujah,
Look away from everything to Him.

3
Look away from fickle soul—Hallelujah,
Look away from failing self within;
Look away toward the goal—Hallelujah,
Look away from everything to Him.

4
Look away from all the past—Hallelujah,
Look away from both the good and sin;
To the living One hold fast—Hallelujah,
Look away from everything to Him.

5
Look away into His face—Hallelujah,
He who’ll finish what He did begin.
O what grace to run the race—Hallelujah,
We obtain by looking off to Him!

songs.title: You are our letter (2 Corinthians 3:2-4, 6)
songs.lyrics:
[G]You are our [Em]letter
[C]Inscribed in our [D]hearts
[G]Known and [Em]read 
by all [C]men.        [D-D7]

#(repeat verse 1)

[G]Since you are [C9]being mani[G]fested
that [C9]you are a [G]letter of [Em7]Christ
[Am7]ministered by [D7]us,
[G]Inscribed not with [C9]ink but the
[G]Spirit of the [C9]living God;
not in [Am7]tablets of [C]stone
but in [Am7]tablets of [D7]hearts of [G]flesh



[G]and such [Em]confidence we 
[C]have through Christ toward [D]God,
[G]confi[Em]dence through [C]Christ 
toward [D]God,

#(repeat verse 3)

[G]who has [C9]also made [G]us suffi[C9]cient
as [G]ministers [Em7]of
a [Am7]new cove[D7]nant,
[G]ministers [C9]not of the [G]letter,
[C9]but of the [Am7]Spirit,
for the [C]letter kills
but the [Am7-D7]Spirit gives [G]life



#2 Corinthians 3:2-4, 6

songs.title: Shepherd my Soul
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Shepherd my soul, 
My inward con[F]dition.
I open to [C]You,
My mind, will, e[F]motion
all need [C]You. 
Spread [F]from my spirit [G]to my [C]soul. 

#Chorus
[Am]All-inclusive [C]tender care, to [G]me.
Ad[Am]ministrating, [C]there, be[G]hind the [C]scenes.
Your [F]rod and Youe [Am]staff,
They [F]com[G]fort [C]me. 

2
Encourage me, Lord,
To walk in Your presence,
Just trusting You, Lord,
And stay in enjoyment; 
Live by You, 
And anchored in the vision of Your word.

songs.title: Olives that have known no pressure
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Olives that have known no pr[G]essure
[Bm]No oil can best[A-A7]ow;
[D]If the grapes escape the w[G]inepress,
Ch[Bm]eering wine can [A]nev[A7]er fl[D]ow;
[D]Spikenard only through the cr[G]ushing,
Fr[Bm]agrance can diff[A]use.
Sh[D]all I then, Lord, shrink from s[G]uff'ring
Wh[Bm]ich Thy love for m[A]e w[A7]ould ch[D]oose?

  E[G]ach blow I s[D]uff[Bm]er
  [Em]Is true g[D]ain to m[A]e.
  [D]In the place of what Thou t[G]akest
  T[Bm]hou dost give Thys[A]elf t[A7]o m[D]e.

2
Do my heartstrings need Thy stretching,
Songs divine to prove?
Do I need for sweetest music
Cruel treatment of Thy love?
Lord, I fear no deprivation
If it draws to Thee;
I would yield in full surrender
All Thy heart of love to see.

3
I'm ashamed, my Lord, for seeking
Self to guard always;
Though Thy love has done its stripping,
Yet I've been compelled this way.
Lord, according to Thy pleasure
Fully work on me;
Heeding not my human feelings,
Only do what pleases Thee.

4
If Thy mind and mine should differ,
Still pursue Thy way;
If Thy pleasure means my sorrow,
Still my heart shall answer, "Yea!"
'Tis my deep desire to please Thee,
Though I suffer loss;
E'en though Thy delight and glory
Mean that I endure the cross.

5
Oh, I'll praise Thee, e'en if weeping
Mingle with my song.
Thine increasing sweetness calls forth
Grateful praises all day long.
Thou hast made Thyself more precious
Than all else to me:
Thou increase and I decrease, Lord—
This is now my only plea.

songs.title: A Man's Steps are Ordered by Jehovah (Prov. 20:24, 27; 1 Cor. 2:11a)
songs.lyrics:
#Prov. 20:24, 27; 1 Cor. 2:11a
[D]A man's steps are [A]ordered by Je[Bm-D]hovah;
[G]How then can a [D]man under[A]stand his own [Bm]way?
[G]How then can a [D]man under[A-Bm]stand [G]his own [D-D7]way?

  The spirit of [G-A]man is the [D]lamp of Je[Bm]hovah, 
  [G]Searching all the innermost [A]parts of the inner [D-G-D-A]being.

For who among men knows the things, 
Who knows the things of men, except the spirit of man,
The spirit of man which is within him?

songs.title: I belong to Jesus
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]I belong to [C]Jesus;
[D]I am not my [G]own;
All I have and a[C]ll I am
[D]Shall be H[D7]is al[G]one.

2
I belong to Jesus;
He is Lord and King,
Reigning in my inmost heart
Over everything.

3
I belong to Jesus;
What can hurt or harm,
When He folds around my soul
His almighty Arm?

4
I belong to Jesus;
Blessed, blessed thought!
With His own most precious blood
Has my soul been bought.

5
I belong to Jesus;
He has died for me;
I am His and He is mine
Through eternity.

6
I belong to Jesus;
He will keep my soul,
If the deathly waters dark
Round about me roll.

7
I belong to Jesus;
And ere long I’ll be
With my precious Savior there
In His royalty.

songs.title: As the hart panteth for the water (Psalm 42:4 footnote)
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]As the [G]hart panteth [Am]for the [C7]water 
So my [F]soul pants [G]after [C]Thee[G7] 
[C]You [G]alone are my [Am]heart’s [C7]desire 
And I [F]long to [G7]drink of [C]Thee 

  [Am]You alone are my [F]goal and [C]prize 
  For[Dm]getting all things which [G7]are be[E]hind 
  [C]You [G]alone are my [Am]heart’s [C7]desire
  And I [F]long to [G7]drink of [C]Thee

2
As the throngs passeth through with shouts of joy
And praises unto You 
Ent'ring into the house of God, 
I recall the days of youth.

3
Shine on me, O Sun of Righteousness 
With healing in Your wings
The salvation of Your countenance 
Becomes my saving grace

4
Bright and clear is the river flowing forth,
From God and from the Lamb,
Making those who drink so full of light
And clear as jasper stone

#Psalm 42:4 footnote 1, 5b, 11b,  Phil 3:13, 14, John 4:14, Malachi 4:2, Rev 22:1, Rev 21:11

songs.title: Amazing grace! how sweet the sound
songs.lyrics:
1
A[G]mazing [G7]grace! how s[C]weet the [G]sound,
That [G]saved a wretch like [D-D7]me!
I [G]once was [G7]lost, but [C]now am [G]found,
Was [Em]blind, but [D]now I [G]see.

2
’Twas grace that taught my heart to fear,
And grace my fears relieved;
How precious did that grace appear
The hour I first believed!

3
The Lord hath promised good to me,
His word my hope secures;
He will my shield and portion be
As long as life endures.

4
When we’ve been there ten thousand years,
Bright shining as the sun,
We’ve no less days to sing God’s praise
Than when we first begun.

songs.title: Unto him that hath Thou givest
songs.lyrics:
1
Unto [D]him that hath Thou [Bm]givest
Ever [Em]more abundant[A]ly;
Lord, I [D]live because Thou [G]livest,
Therefore [E]give more life to [A7]me,
Therefore [G]speed me in the [D]race,
Therefore [F#]let me grow in [Bm]grace.
  Therefore [G]speed me in the [D]race,
  Therefore [Em]let me [A]grow in [D]grace.

2
Deepen all Thy work, O Master,
Strengthen every downward root;
Only do Thou ripen faster,
More and more Thy pleasant fruit;
Purge me, prune me, self abase;
Only let me grow in grace.

3
Let me grow by sun and shower,
Every moment water me;
Make me really, hour by hour,
More and more conformed to Thee,
That Thy loving eye may trace
Day by day my growth in grace.

4
From Thy fullness grace outpouring,
Show me ever greater things;
Raise me higher, sunward soaring,
Mounting as on eagle-wings.
By the brightness of Thy face,
Ever let me grow in grace.

5
Let me, then, be always growing,
Never, never standing still,
Listening, learning, better knowing
Thee and Thy most blessed will.
Till I win the glorious race,
Daily let me grow in grace.

songs.title: Lord, I love You so
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 1

1
[G]Lord I love You [Am7]so      [D]
Others ask me [G]why [Em]
Why You occu[Am7]py      [C]
The [Am7]first place in my [D]heart  [G]

I know they under[Am]stand  [D]
How empty life can [G]be  [Em]
[Em]Just watch the gladness [Am7]flee   [C]
Many ca[D]lamities un[G]planned

  But [G]Lord,  Your [Em]words  were [Am7]found and I ate them         
  This [D]budding heart of mi[D7]ne
  Now sings [G]praises all the time [B7]
  And [Em]Lord  I've [Em7]found  those [A]touched by You as well
  They [Am]love You and prop[D]el    [G]me.

2
Lord, You love me too
You gave Your only Son         
Just to gain the one
For this I now pursue

I was so far away
In me, You longed to stay
Now Lord, I won’t depart
I love You from my whole heart.

  Now this  joy of mine  therefore is made full
  This budding heart of mine
  Now sings praises all the time
  And Lord  I've found  those touched by You as well
  They love You and propel   me.

#Jer 15:16, John 3:16, Matt 18:12, Mark 12:30, John 3:29

songs.title: Lord, the Spirit, Truth divine
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord, the Spirit, Truth divine,
Dawn upon this heart of mine;
Word of God, and inward light,
Wake my spirit, clear my sight.
#(Repeat the last line of each stanza)

2
Lord, the Spirit, Love divine,
Glow within this heart of mine,
Kindle every high desire,
Perish self in Thy pure fire.

3
Lord, the Spirit, Power divine,
Fill and nerve this will of mine;
By Thee may I strongly live,
Bravely bear, and nobly strive.

4
Lord, the Spirit, Peace divine,
Still this restless heart of mine,
Speak to calm this tossing sea,
Stayed in Thy tranquility.

5
Lord, the Spirit, Joy divine,
Gladden Thou this heart of mine;
In the desert ways I'll sing:
Spring, O Well, forever spring!

songs.title: With unveiled face
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 4
1
[G]With unveiled face, 
O ever [C]turn my heart [G]back to You.
Redeem my days; 
beholding [C]not the world but [G]unto You. 
[C]I need Your [G]light to shine
[C]I need Your [G]grace to find
I want to [C]be found
Reflecting [G]You. 

2
With no more veils, 
I want to live a life just seeing You. 
To be transformed, 
not by improvement but Your element, 
Dispensed and added in, 
Constitute from within.
I want to be found
Made just like You. 

3
The Lord is now 
the Spirit who is with my spirit.
My treasure is 
the face of Jesus Christ my comforter.
A vessel I am made,
His image to contain.
I want to be found,  
Open to Him. 

4
A minister 
of the new covenant O may I be.
Speaking forth Christ
Out of my spirit that is joined to Christ. 
One spirit with the Lord, 
With saints in one accord, 
I want to be found, 
Working with Him.

songs.title: Thou art the Son beloved
songs.lyrics:
1
Thou [D]art the Son bel[A7]oved,
The [G]image [A]of our [D]God;
Thou art the saints’ dear [Bm]portion,
Im[Em]parted th[A]ru Thy [D]blood.
A[A7]mong all God’s cr[G]eat[D]ion
Thou [G]art the f[Em]irstborn [A]One;
By [D]Thee all [G]was creat[D]ed,
All [Em]for Thys[A]elf to [D]own.

2
Thou art before all creatures,
In Thee all things consist;
Of all Thou art the center,
By Thee all things subsist.
Thou art the sole beginning,
The Firstborn from the dead;
And for the Church, Thy Body,
Thou art the glorious Head.

3
Because it pleased the Father,
All fulness dwells in Thee,
That Thou might have the first place
In all we ever see.
All things Thou reconciledst
To God by Thy shed blood,
To thus present us holy
And blameless unto God.

4
In Thee God’s fulness dwelleth,
Thou art God’s mystery;
The treasures of all wisdom
And knowledge are in Thee.
Thou art the hope of glory,
In us Thou dost abide;
In Thee we are perfected
And God is satisfied.

5
All things are but a shadow
Which unto us reveal
Thyself, in whom we’re rooted,
The only One that’s real.
Enjoying all Thy riches,
Thy fulness we will be;
We’ll hold Thee, as Thy Body,
And grow with God in Thee.

6
With Thee in God we’re hidden,
Thou art in us our life;
Thy peace in us presiding,
We rest from all our strife.
In the new man, Thy Body,
Thou art the all in all;
Our all-inclusive Savior,
Thyself we’ll ever call

songs.title: Something every heart is loving
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune
1
[D]Something [A]every [D]heart is [A]loving:
[Bm]If not [G]Jesus, [Em]none can [A]rest;
[Bm]Lord, my [A]heart to [Em]Thee is [F#m]given;
[G]Take it, [F#m]for it [A]loves Thee [D]best.

2
Thus I cast the world behind me;
Jesus most beloved shall be;
Beauteous more than all things beauteous,
He alone is joy to me.

3
Bright with all eternal radiance
Is the glory of Thy face;
Thou art loving, sweet, and tender,
Full of pity, full of grace.

4
When I hated, Thou didst love me,
Shedd'st for me Thy precious blood;
Still Thou lovest, lovest ever,
Shall I not love Thee, my God?

5
Keep my heart still faithful to Thee,
That my earthly life may be,
But a shadow to that glory
Of my hidden life in Thee.

### New tune
1
[C]Something every [Em]heart is loving:
[C]If not Jesus, [Em]none can rest;[F]
Lord, my [G]heart to [Em]Thee is [A]given;
[Dm7]Take it, f[G]or it loves Thee b[C]est.

2
Thus I cast the world behind me;
Jesus most beloved shall be;
Beauteous more than all things beauteous,
He alone is joy to me.

3
Bright with all eternal radiance
Is the glory of Thy face;
Thou art loving, sweet, and tender,
Full of pity, full of grace.

4
When I hated, Thou didst love me,
Shedd'st for me Thy precious blood;
Still Thou lovest, lovest ever,
Shall I not love Thee, my God?

5
Keep my heart still faithful to Thee,
That my earthly life may be,
But a shadow to that glory
Of my hidden life in Thee.

songs.title: Praise the Lord! The God of glory
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2
1
[D]Praise the Lord! The [G]God of [A]glory
[D]Who ap[F#m]peared to [G]Abra[A]ham
[D]Has appeared to [G]us in [A]spirit
[Em]For His purpose [A7]and His [D]plan!

  [D]God of [A7]glory, [Bm]God of [F#m]glory,
  [G]Do ap[Em]pear to [Bm A7 D]us today.
  [D]Satu[A7]rate and [Bm]perme[F#m]ate us
  [G]'Til You [Em]fully have [A7]Your [D]way.

2
Once we were in old Chaldea,
Worshipping the idols there;
But the God of glory called us,
Saved us all from Satan’s snare.

  Get out, get out, from Chaldea,
  From that evil, foreign land.
  Come in, come in, to the good land—
  Christ, the church, the one new man.

3
With the calling comes the promise
Of the kingdom life on earth.
This becomes our strength and motive
To get out of all the dearth!

  Lord, we’re crossing every river—
  For this You must call us on,
  'Til Your kingdom and expression
  On this earth are fully come.

4
This is now the highest gospel
To those still in Chaldee’s land—
Leave the fallen situation,
You’ve been chosen for God’s plan.

  God of glory, God of glory,
  Do appear to us each day.
  Call us out into Your building,
  Your desire on earth today.

songs.title: Dear Lord, we thank Thee for this bread
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Dear Lord, we thank Thee f[G]or this br[C]ead,      
It is a s[D7]ign div[G]ine;      
In [C]it we s[G]ee the m[C]yster[F]ies      
Of G[C]od's un[G]ique des[C]ign.  

2
This bread Thy body signifies,
Which Thou hast giv'n for us,
That we may share Thy life divine,
Partaking of Thee thus.

3
For us Thy body Thou didst break
That Thou may thus impart
Thyself as life to us that we
May be Thy counterpart.

4
This bread thus also signifies
Thy body mystical,
Of which we living members are,
With Thee identical.

5
Though we are many grains of wheat,
Yet all one loaf, one bread;
Remembering Thee in such a way,
With Thee we all are fed.

6
As of this bread we all commune,
Thou, Lord, dost satisfy,
With all the saints we fellowship,
And Thee we testify.

songs.title: We rest on Thee, our Shield and our defender
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]We rest on [Dm]Thee, our [G]Shield and our De[C]fender;
We go not [Dm]forth a[G]lone against the [C]foe;
Strong in Thy s[Am]trength, safe in Thy [Em]keeping ten[Dm]der.
We rest on [C]Thee, and in Thy [Dm]Name we [E]go.
Strong in Thy st[Am]rength, safe in Thy [Em]keeping ten[Dm]der.
We rest on [C]Thee, and[F] in Thy [G]Name we [C]go.

2
Yea, in Thy Name, O Captain of salvation!
In Thy dear Name, all other names above;
Jesus our Righteousness, our sure Foundation,
Our Prince of glory and our King of love.

3
We go in faith, our own great weakness feeling,
And needing more each day Thy grace to know:
Yet from our hearts a Song of triumph pealing;
We rest on Thee, and in Thy Name we go.

4
We rest on Thee, our Shield and our Defender:
Thine is the battle, Thine shall be the praise
When reigning in the Kingdom of Thy splendor;
Victors, we rest with Thee, through endless days.

songs.title: Just taste and see that the Lord is good
songs.lyrics:
1
Just taste and [D-G-D]see that the [G]Lord is [D-G-D]good;
Just taste and [F#m-Bm]see that the Lord is [Em]goo[A7]d.
He’s good for [D-D7]you, as He is for [G]me;[Gm]
So whatever you [D-A7]do, just taste and [D-G-D]see.

2
Just call O Lord—He’ll change your life;
Just call O Lord—He’ll change your life.
Amazing grace He will afford
If in every place you call “O Lord”!

3
You’ll feel real love coming into your heart;
You’ll feel real love coming into your heart.
You’ll sense a flow from God above;
And you will know you’ve found real love.

4
So praise the Lord for His life in you;
Yes, praise the Lord for His life in you.
Something of Christ He has outpoured
Into your life; so praise the Lord!

songs.title: O Lord, breathe Thy Spirit on me
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
O Lord, [G]breathe Thy [C]Spirit [G]on me,
Teach me [D7]how to breathe Thee [G]in;
Help me pour in[B7]to Thy [C]bosom

2
She is named suff’ring, yet soon it will pass.

3
Her name means marriage, yet not unto Me.
Mixture and classes, in her the great tree.
Piercing and slaying, from My mouth a sword.
Manna, a white stone, new name I’ll reward.
 
4
Ceaselessly off’ring, many works has she.

Bronze are my feet and My eyes flame as fire.

5

I’ll make you pillars, give you a name new.

7
She has opinions, and thinks she is rich.
Poor, blind and naked, I’m not in her midst.
I am the Amen, the Faithful and True.
Take heed My counsel, the throne I'll give you.

songs.title: There is a great myst’ry (A divine, romantic story)
songs.lyrics: ### New Translation (hymnal.net) 1 [C]There is a great myst’ry, A wonderful [Em]story; For ages t'was [F]hidden[Dm], Now shown in His [G]wisdom[G7]; ‘Tis a divine [C]romance Of God and man [Em]in time; Beyond under[F]standing[Dm], Yet seen in God’s [G]speaking[G7]. God fell in love [C]with man; For only God’s [Am]love can Make man just the [F]same as He[Dm] In life and in [G]nature[G7]. We are His ex[C]pression, His bride, His en[Am]largement; Forever, to[F]gether[Dm], As living, in[C]sep’rable as one [G]couple Eternal[C-F-C]ly. 2 Though He was rejected By men who were blinded; His love is constraining, His heart still unchanging; Thus in incarnation Came He as salvation; His name is called Jesus, And He came to seek us. 3 Though born as a sinner, His blood has redeemed me. He suffered on Calv’ry, Then raised up in glory, To regenerate me. Now joined in one spirit I love to enjoy Him, For I’ve been forgiven! 4 His love is so tender, To Him I’ll surrender; His name is so precious, I gladly call, “Jesus!” His Person’s so charming, My heart ever winning; I’ll hold back no longer, I’ll love Him forever. ### Original Translation 1 [C]There is a great myst'ry A romantic [Em]story, For ages it [F]was veiled, But now fully [C]re[G]vealed; 'Tis a romance [C]divine Of God and man [Em]in time; Beyond under[F]standing, Yet seen in God's s[G]peaking. God fell in love [C]with man. For only God’s [Am]love can Make man just the [F]same as He In life and in [G]nature. We are His ex[C]pression, His bride, His en[Am]largement; Forever, to[F]gether, As living, in[C]sep’rable as one [G]couple Eterna[C]lly. 2 Though He was rejected By men who were blinded; His love is constraining, His heart still unchanging; Thus He became a man With a definite plan; His name is called Jesus, And He came to seek us. 3 Though I have lived in sin, I now have been redeemed by Christ who died for me, Who was raised in glory. Now I am joined to Him, Together we're living; I love to enjoy Him, For I've been forgiven. 4 His love is so tender, To Him I’ll surrender, His name's full of savor I gladly call in prayer; His person’s so charming, My heart ever winning; I’ll hold back no longer, I’ll love Him forever.

  When Jesus [Am]comes,

  He’s coming [Am]soon
  To [F]take the wise ones [C]with Him. [Am]
  Oh, let us [C]not be l[Dm]eft outs[G]ide the [C]feast.[F C]

Golden moments;

  And welcome tribulations—

  Oh, what a rest, what joy,

#Capo 3

songs.title: Has the wine run dry so soon
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Has the wine run [C]dry so [G]soon?
I have barely [C]tasted [D]it;

2
I have spent my final dime
On the thing I thought would last,
But as soon as I held it, it slipped away,
Now I'm still so dry.

3
I have climbed the highest peak;
Took me twenty years to train;
As I reach the top, I looked around and all I saw:
Vanity that's all.

4
I have probed the greatest minds,
I've believed in every cause,
But my heart wont hear philosophy or reasonings,
Left again dissatisfied.

5
Took me too, too long to see
That this worlds all vanity;
I've been through too much to just pretend its all okay;
Give me reality.

6
On my deepest, darkest night,
On my knees I cried aloud,
Someone came to me, he changed my
death to eternal life,
Gave me meaning, reason to live.

7
I will call upon His name,
I will draw this well and drink;
When I call His name, Jesus Lord, the waters flow;
That's the name I love.

8
All this time it was just Him,
He has saved the best for last;
Now I've finally found the wine that won't run dry.
And He's the sweetest wine of all.

1

Safe on His gentle breast,

Borne in the sweetest voice,
Echoed by saints in spirit,
Making my heart rejoice.

  Safe on His gentle breast,
  There by His love o'ershaded,
  Sweetly my soul doth rest.

2

Safe from corroding care,
Safe from the world's temptations,
Sin cannot harm me there.
Free from the blight of sorrow,
Free from my doubts and fears;
Only a few more trials,
Only a few more tears.

3
Jesus, my heart's dear Refuge,
Jesus has died for me;
Firm on the Rock of Ages
Ever my trust shall be.
Here let my wait with patience,
Wait till the night is o'er,
Wait till I see the morning
Break on the golden shore.

awesomely and wonderfully [D7]made!

Your works are [C]wonderful and I know it

# Part 2
[D7]I am awe[G]somely [G7]and [C]wonderfully
I'm [G]awesomely and [D7]wonderfully made!

And [G]my soul [D]knows it [D7]very [G-C-G]well.

songs.title: I’ve found the One of peerless worth
songs.lyrics:
1
I’ve [D]found the [A]One of [E]peerless [A]worth,
My [Em]heart doth [A]sing for [D]joy;
And [D]sing I [D7]must, for [G]Christ I [D]have:
Oh, [Em]what a [A7]Christ have [D]I!

2
My Christ, He is the Lamb of God,
Who full salvation brings;
He is the Sun of Righteousness,
With healing in His wings.

3
My Christ, He is the Tree of Life
With fruit abundant, sweet;
My hunger He doth satisfy;
Of Him I daily eat.

4
My Christ, He is the smitten Rock
Whence living waters burst;
He is the fountain in my heart
Which quenches all my thirst.

5
Christ is my life, my light, my way,
My comfort and my health,
My peace, my rest, my joy, my hope,
My glory and my wealth.

6
Christ is my wisdom and my pow’r,
My boast and righteousness,
My vict’ry and redemption sure,
My truth and holiness.

7
Christ is my Savior, Shepherd, Lord,
My Advocate above,
My Counsellor, my Father, God,
My Brother, Friend, and Love.

8
Christ is my Captain and my Guard,
My Teacher and my Guide,
My Bridegroom, Master and my Head;
In me doth He reside.

9
Christ is my Prophet, Priest, and King;
My Prophet full of sight;
My Priest who stands ‘twixt me and God,
My King who rules with might.

10
Christ is the Author of my faith,
And its Perfecter too,
My Mediator, Guarantee,
And faithful Witness true.

11
Christ is my everlasting home,
My all-sufficient land;
My fortress, tower, hiding-place,
And my eternal stand.

12
Christ is my sabbath and new moon,
My morning and my day,
My age and my eternity
That ne’er will pass away.

13
Christ is my trust and my desire,
In comeliness replete,
My satisfaction and delight,
Who all my need doth meet.

14
My Christ, the all-inclusive One,
My Christ what shall I call?
He is the first, He is the last,
My Christ is All in all.

15
Since such a treasure I possess,
My heart doth sing for joy;
And I must sing, and sing again;
Oh, what a Christ have I!

songs.title: The image of the Father God
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune
1
The [G]image of the [C]Father God,
Lord, [G]we behold in [D]Thee;
The [G]fulness [G7]of the [C]Godhead true
In [G]Thee dwells [D7]bodi[G]ly.

2
Lord, Thou art God's eternal Word
With life divine in Thee;
In Thee His grace we all receive
With His reality.

3
Effulgence of God's glory true,
The Son of God art Thou;
The very substance of Himself
In Thee we all avow.

4
Embodiment of God Thou art,
And with Him ever one;
In Thee is God expressed to us
Beyond comparison.

5
God we enjoy in Thee, dear Lord,
As life and everything;
To Thee and God our heartfelt thanks
And praise we'll ever bring.

### Alternate Tune
1
The [F]image of the [Dm]Father God,
Lord, [F]we behold in [C]Thee;
The [F]fulness of [Bb]the [F]Godhead true
In [C]Thee dwells bodi[F]ly.

2
Lord, Thou art God's eternal Word
With life divine in Thee;
In Thee His grace we all receive
With His reality.

3
Effulgence of God's glory true,
The Son of God art Thou;
The very substance of Himself
In Thee we all avow.

4
Embodiment of God Thou art,
And with Him ever one;
In Thee is God expressed to us
Beyond comparison.

5
God we enjoy in Thee, dear Lord,
As life and everything;
To Thee and God our heartfelt thanks
And praise we'll ever bring.

songs.title: Lord, I didn't come this far (This Broken Outer Man)
songs.lyrics:
#capo 2

1
[D]Lord, I didn't come this [A]far
To pre[Bm]serve my taste, to main[G]tain my scent,
[D]Lord, again I set my [A]heart
On Your [Bm]loving face, on your [G]burning eyes.

  [D]Empty me [A]Lord!
  Pour me [Bm]out again, through Your [G]sovereign hand.
  [D]Gain my [A]amen,
  And re[Bm]move the dregs, all the [G]taste of my [A]outer [D]man.

2
Lord, You truly know my heart,
I don't want to stay whole unbroken clay.
Save me when I try to blame
Circumstances, they are Your wisest way.

  (chorus 1)

3
Lord, You know I love myself.
I'm dissatisfied due to hidden pride.
Secretly preserving me,
From Your hand I've guarded my natural lees.

  (chorus 1)

4
Lord, You know I love You best,
In my spirit pure there's a love most sure.
Break my alabaster flask,
Fill Your church complete with this fragrance sweet.

  Lord, I receive–
  For Your purpose clear, and your Body dear–
  Your sovereign plan,
  For your life released through this broken outer man.

#2024 Memorial Day Conference Message 1 point IV, Jeremiah 48:11

songs.title: If you wish to find the Lord
songs.lyrics:
1
If you [G]wish to find the [Em]Lord,
Do not [C]seek Him in the [Am]world,
For the w[C]orld is not the [D]place in [C]which
He [G]dwells.
  In which [G]He dwells, in which [Em]He dwells,
  In which H[C]e dwells, in which [Am]He dwells,
For the [C]world is not the [D]place in [C]which
He [G]dwells.

2
If you wish to find the Lord,
Do not seek Him in the mind,
For the mind can only know, it cannot taste.
  It cannot taste, it cannot taste,
  It cannot taste, it cannot taste,
For the mind can only know, it cannot taste.

3
If you wish to find the Lord,
You must open up your heart,
You must open up your heart and let Him in.
  Let Him in, let Him in,
  Let Him in, let Him in,
You must open up your heart and let Him in.

4
If you wish to let Him in,
You just call upon His name,
You just call upon His name and let Him in.
  Call His name, call His name,
  Call His name, call His name,
You just call upon His name and let Him in.

songs.title: Christ my very peace is
songs.lyrics:
1
Christ my very peace is
And my life within;
Sharing in the spirit
I unite with Him.

  Following the Spirit,
  Living in the Lord,
  Life He doth supply me
  And His peace afford.

2
To the Lord belonging,
Bound I'll never be,
For the law of life now
Sets me wholly free.

3
Minding flesh no longer,
I'll the spirit mind;
Self-will never follow,
But the Spirit's find.

4
Christ within empow'rs me
Spiritual to be!
E'en my body quick'ning
By His pow'r in me.

5
Spirit with the spirit
Witnesseth in one,
I'm of God begotten,
Heir with Christ the Son.

songs.title: Once I was dead in sin
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune
1
Once [C]I was dead in [F]sin,
And [C]hope with[G7]in me [C]died;
But now I'm dead to [F]sin,
With [C]Christ I'm [G7]cruci[C]fied.

  And [G7]can it be that [C]"He loved me,
  And [G7]gave Himself for [C]me"?
  And [G7]can it be that [C]"He loved me,
  And [G7]gave Himself for [C]me"?

2
O height I cannot reach!
O depth I cannot sound!
O love, O boundless love,
In my Redeemer found!

3
I live—and yet not I,
But Christ that lives in me,
Who from the law of sin
And death has made me free.

### New Tune
1
[C]Once I was dead in [Am]sin,
And [E]hope within me [Am]died;
[C]But now I'm dead to [Am]sin,
With [E]Christ I'm cruci[Am]fied.[A]

  [C]And can it [G]be that "He loved [F]me,
  And gave Him[G]self for [C]me"?

2
O height I cannot reach!
O depth I cannot sound!
O love, O boundless love,
In my Redeemer found!

3
I live—and yet not I,
But Christ that lives in me,
Who from the law of sin
And death has made me free.

songs.title: Immortal, invisible, God only wise
songs.lyrics:
1
I[C]mmortal, in[D]visible, [G]God on[D]ly [G]wise,
In [C]light ina[D]ccessible [C]hid from [D]our [G]eyes,
Most [G]blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of [D]Days,
Al[C]mighty, vic[D]torious, Thy [C]great name [D7]we [G]praise.

2
Unresting, unhasting, and silent as light,
Nor wanting, nor wasting, Thou rulest in might;
Thy justice like mountains high soaring above,
Thy clouds which are fountains of goodness and love.

3
To all life Thou givest, to both great and small;
In all life Thou livest, the true life of all;
We blossom and flourish as leaves on the tree,
And wither and perish, but nought changeth Thee.

4
Great Father of Glory, pure Father of Light,
Thine angels adore Thee, all veiling their sight;
All laud we would render, O help us to see:
'Tis only the splendor of light hideth Thee.

5
Immortal, invisible, God only wise,
In light inaccessible hid from our eyes,
Most blessed, most glorious, the Ancient of Days,
Almighty, victorious, Thy great name we praise.

songs.title: In the holiest place
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[G]In the holiest place,
[C]Touch the throne of [G]grace,
Grace as a river shall [D]flow;
