songs.title: O Holy Father, who in tender love
songs.lyrics:
1
O [D]Holy Father, who in tender love
Didst [Em]give Thine only Son for [D]us to [A]die,
The [D]while He pleads at Thy right hand above,
We [G]in one [E]Spirit [A]now with [E7]faith draw [A]nigh;
And, [D]as we eat this [G]bread and drink this [D]wine,
Plead [G]His once offered [Em]sacri[A]fice Di[D]vine.

2
We are not worthy to be called Thy sons,
Nor gather up the fragments of Thy feast;
Yet look on us, Thy sorrowing contrite ones,
On us in Him our Advocate and Priest,
Whose robe is fringed with mercy's golden bells,
Whose breastplate fathomless compassion tells.

3
Oh, hear us, for Thou always hearest Him;
Behold us sprinkled with His precious blood;
And from between the shadowing cherubim
Shine forth, and grant us by this heav'nly food
Foretastes of coming glory, and meanwhile
A Father's blessing and a Father's smile.

4
And, Father, ere we leave Thy mercy-throne,
Bound by these sacred pledges, yet most free,
We give our hearts, and not our hearts alone,
But all we are and all we have to Thee;
Glad free-will offerings all our pilgrim days,
Hereafter an eternity of praise.

songs.title: Lord, today cover me
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Lord, today [C]cover me 
[D]With Your precious [G]blood.
[G]That I may be [C]one with You,
[D]Enjoying ceaseless [G]floods
Of [G]Your salvation [C]flowing free.
[D]Lord, today [D7]cover [G]me.

2
Lord, today be my love
The centre of my heart.
Every moment fixed on you,
Never to depart.
So great a love from God above.
Lord, today be my love.

3
Lord, today be my grace
And endless supply.
Minister life to my being
On You I rely.
Dispense Yourself in every place.
Lord, today, be my grace.

songs.title: Dear Lord Jesus, we adore Thee
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Dear Lord Jesus, we a[A]dore Thee,
[D]"Seed of [A]woman" [A7]Thou be[D]came;
[D]Of the virgin wast be[A]gotten,
[D]Called e'en [A7]with a human [D]name.
[A]Taking thus the [D]human nature,
[A7]Thou as man the [D]serpent trod;
[D]By the Cross his [G]head Thou [Bm]bruised
[G]And ful[D]filled the [A]plan of [D]God.

  [D]Lord, we see Thy [A]glory,
  [A7]Shown in human [D]beauty,
  [D]Full of splendor, [G]manifested [D]In hu[A]mani[D]ty.

2
As a man, by incarnation,
Flesh and blood didst Thou partake
To destroy the devil, Satan,
In our stead and for our sake.
With the name of Jesus given
And Emmanuel called too,
Thou becam'st our precious Savior,
Bringing us salvation true.

3
Thou, "Last Adam" wast entitled,
And wast called the "second man",
Head of all the new creation,
Better than the first man.
On this earth in life and conduct
Thou indeed wast Son of man;
Now in heaven with this nature
Thou dost still appear as man.

4
In the time which God appointed
Thou wilt come, dear Lord, again,
With the glory of the Father,
Still appearing as a man.
Even on the throne of judgment
Son of man Thou still wilt be;
And with this, our human nature,
Thou forevermore wilt be.

songs.title: Of the Father's love begotten
songs.lyrics:
1
[F]Of the Father's love be[C]gotten,
[F]Ere the [Bb]worlds be[C7]gan to [F]be,
[F]He is Alpha and O[C]mega,
[F]He the source, the [C7]ending [F]He,
[C]Of the things that [F]are and have been,
[F]And that future years shall [C]see,
[F]Evermore and [C7]ever[F]more.

2
This is He whom they in old time
Chanted of with one accord,
Whom the voices of the prophets
Promised in their faithful word;
Now He shines, the long-expected;
Let creation praise its Lord,
Evermore and evermore.

3
O ye heights of hea'n, adore Him;
Angel hosts, His praises sing;
All dominions, bow before Him,
And extol our Lord and King.
Let no tongue on earth be silent,
Every voice in concert ring,
Evermore and evermore.

4
Christ, to Thee, with God the Father,
And, with Holy Ghost, to Thee,
Hymn and chant and high thanksgiving,
And unwearied praises be;
Honor, glory, and dominion,
And eternal victory,
Evermore and evermore.

songs.title: Lord, this light
songs.lyrics:
[C]Lord, this [G]light
[C]My heart's longing [G]for
[C]Shine it [Em]forth
[C]From Your treasure [G]store.
[C]Make Your [F]way
[C]So clear to [G]me.
[C]With [G]Your [C]grace, a[F]bundantly.

The way ahead
I know not of
'Cept to please my
God, my only love.
Dark or light
I pray to You
That Your grace would still break through.

Tend the light
You would ask of me
Lord, my request
Through You it would be.
O'er the mounts

songs.lyrics:
# D capo 2

1
[D]Nearer, my [G]God, to Thee,
[D]Nearer to [A]Thee;
[D]E'en though it [G]be a cross
[D]That [A7]raiseth [D]me,

2
Though, like a wanderer,
The sun gone down,
Darkness comes over me,
My rest a stone;
Yet in my dreams I'd be
Nearer, my God, to Thee,

3
There let me see the sight,
An open heaven;

Nearer, my God, to Thee,

songs.lyrics:

songs.title: A time for everything (He has made everything beautiful)
God used John the baptist
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]God used John, the Baptist,
[Am]Who left his home and good past;
[F]Left the rel[G]igion of his a[C]ge.[G]
[C]He turned from the oldness,
[Am]And spoke the Word with boldness,
[F]"Repent and [G]leave this crooked [C]age."

  [Am]God needs the overcomers,
  [F]"Our dear Lord Jesus" lovers!
  [C]Make us those who live to turn the [G]age!
  [Am]God needs the overcomers,
  [F]"Our dear Lord Jesus" lovers!
  [C]Make us those who consummate the [G]age!

2
God called Saul of Tarsus,
For His own plan and purpose,
Who became Paul, the apostle;
He saw a heav'nly vision,
Where there is no division,
In the one Body of the Lord.

3
God called Timothy, now,
Like-souled with Paul, who knew how
To pray and be soaked in the Word;
His spirit fanned into flame,
Lord, make my spirit the same,
An overcoming man of God!

[C]Make us the overcomers,
[Am]Christ’s Bride, and God’s age-turners.
[F]Make us those who [G]consummate the a[C]ge!

songs.title: Lord, I seek Your will
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Lord, I seek Your [Bm]will
And [G]Your will a[A]lone.
[D]Though there's times I hold my [Bm]ground
[G]And block the [A]way.
[G]Lord, wait [A]longer than I 
Un[D]til Your way You've [Bm]gained,
Un[G]til Your [A]way You've [D]gained.

2
This naturalness within
Disguises my intentions.
It’s a mixture of soul.
Show me where You lie
And I’ll discover there
Alone my heart’s true delight,
Alone my heart’s true delight.

3
May I not rush the night;
Though signs I may not see,
Yet Lord I trust You will
End my soulish source
And with the morning light
Resurrection will remain,
Resurrection will remain.

4
So I resign this day
The ruling of my life;
Lord, You will meet my need.
Faithful unto God,
You make me so content
When Your heart’s satisfied.
When Your heart’s satisfied.

songs.title: The way of the Cross means sacrifice
songs.lyrics:
#(Capo 1)

1
The [G]way of the [C]Cross means [D]sacri[Em]fice,
As to [C]God you [Cm]yield your [G]all
To be [D]laid on the [C]altar, the [G]place of [Em]death,
Where [C]fire will [A7]surely [D]fal[D7]l.

  ’Tis the [G]way of the [C]Cross,
  Are you [Am]willing for [D]this?
  What does [B7]bearing the [Em]Cross
  Mean to [B7]you?
  You who’ve [Am]given your[D]self,
  Your [B7]all to [Em]God!
  To [C]God are you [D7]wholly [G]true?

2
As the voice of song and prayer we raise,
How easy to say, We give all;
Till some rougher cross lies just before,
And sterner is duty’s call.

3
Do you falter then, or, true to death,
Just die on the cross in the way,
Till the fulness of life from the Living One
Is filling you day by day?

4
’Tis the plan of life, for you die to live,
One with Jesus crucified;
With the life alone to be lived through you,
Of the Risen, the Glorified.

songs.lyrics:
1
[D]If I’d know Christ’s [A]risen power,
[D]I must [G]ever [A7]love the [D]Cross;

songs.title: When war is hot and fierce
songs.lyrics:
1
When war is hot and fierce,
And Satan strong,
Then firmly trust God's Word
And sing faith's song.

2
You need to shout but once,
And you will win;
Oh, do not shut your mouth
And lose therein.

3
If pressed your spirit is
And powerless,
Pray thru the precious blood,
Victorious.

4
The foe though fierce, you can
Still fight with him;
If you will keep your stand,
You soon will win.

5
Therefore you must declare
Christ's victory;
The situation dark
Soon changed will be.

songs.title: "Wrecked outright on Jesus' breast"
songs.lyrics:
1
"Wrecked outright on Jesus' breast":
Only "wrecked" souls thus can sing;
Little boats that hug the shore,
Fearing what the storm may bring,
Never find on Jesus' breast,
All that "wrecked" souls mean by rest.

2
"Wrecked outright!" So we lament;
But when storms have done their worst,
Then the soul, surviving all,
In Eternal arms is nursed;
There to find that nought can move
One, embosomed in such love.

3
"Wrecked outright!" No more to own
E'en a craft to sail the sea;
Still a voyager, yet now
Anchored to Infinity;
Nothing left to do but fling
Care aside, and simply cling.

4
"Wrecked outright!" 'Twas purest gain,
Henceforth other craft can see
That the storm may be a boon,
That, however rough the sea,
God Himself doth watchful stand,
For the "wreck' is in His hand.

songs.title: I'm thankful that God has placed me

1
[D]I'm thankful that [A]God has placed [D]me[Bm]
With [Em]you to build [D]up His Bo[A]dy.
Christ in [D]you is the [D7]hope for [G]me![Em]
You [D]also need [A]Christ lived in [D]me[A].

  [D]I live, if [Bm]you stand [Em]firm in the L[A]ord.
  You [D]live, if [Bm]I stand [Em]firm in the L[A]ord.
  My [D]going on is [D7]for you,
  Your [G]going on is [Em]for me,
  Not [D]sep'rate ent[A]ities,
  I [G]need you [A]saints desp'rate[D]ly!

2
Oh, what a sweet church life have we!
Built up in Him, His bride to be!
In Him steadfast, you help me be;
Encouraged by Christ whom I see.

3
Your faith in Christ helps me pursue;
My progress depends upon you!
As I seek Christ, with you in view,
My heart, full of prayers, is for you.

4
God's heart longs, desires that we,
His lovers, seek Him corp'rately.
On each other spent constantly;
My life is for you, yours for me.

5
I want to encourage you all,
Without your supply I would fall.
Never think that your Christ is small.
Christ needs you, and so do we all.

songs.title: How lovely is Thy dwelling place
songs.lyrics:
# Psalm 84
# Capo 1

1
[D]How lovely [G]is Thy [A]dwelling [D]place!
Within Thy courts I [G]long to [A]be;
[A]Thy presence, [D]Lord, my [G]spirit [A]craves,
For [D]this [G]my [D]heart cries [A]out to [D]Thee.

2
At Thy burnt-offering altar, Lord
And at Thine incense altar blest,
Even the sparrow finds home,
And swallow there prepares her nest.

3
Men, as the sparrow, frail and small,
When living in Thy house find rest,
Relying on the altar's blood,
Enjoying there the incense blest.

4
How blessed are those men indeed!
Trusting in Thee they are made strong;
Highways to Zion in their hearts,
The way they care not, rough or long.

5
Passing the weeping valley they
Make it a place of springing wells;
The rain with blessings covers it
And in the way God's mercy tells.

6
From strength to strength they go, and all
Before the Lord in Zion meet;
Thus ever seeking Thine own self,
They need Thy care and grace replete.

7
Better a day within Thy courts
Than days a thousand I would tell;
I'd rather at Thy threshold stand
Than in the wicked's tents to dwell.

8
Thou art a sun, Thou art a shield,
Thou grace and glory wilt supply;
Thy presence and Thy very self
My need in fulness satisfy.

9
Not one good thing wilt Thou withhold
From those who walk in uprightness;
Bless'd is the man that trusts in Thee
With grace and glory measureless.

songs.title: I dare not be defeated
songs.lyrics:
#capo 3
1
[A7]I da[D]re not [G]be de[D]feated
With Calvary in [A7]view,
Where Jesus conquered Satan,
Where all His foes He [D]slew;
Come, [D]Lord, and [B7]give the [Em]vision
To [A7]nerve me for the [D]fight,
Make [F#]me an [Bm]over[F#]comer,
Clothed with Thy [G]Spirit's [F#]might[A7].

  A [D]victor, [B]a [Em]victor!
  Be[A]cause of Calvar[D]y.
  Make [B7]me an [Em]over[A]com[D]er,
  A [G]conqu'ror, a [D]con[G]qu'ror, [D]Lord, [A7]in [D]Thee.

2
I dare not be defeated
Since Christ, my conquering King
Has called me to the battle
Which He did surely win.
Come, Lord, and give me courage,
Thy conquering Spirit give,
Make me an overcomer,
In power within me live.

3
I dare not be defeated,
When Jesus leads me on
To press through hellish regions
To share with Him His Throne;
Come, Lord, and give Thy soldier
The power to wield the sword,
Make me an overcomer
Through Thine inerrant Word.

4
I dare not be defeated,
Just at the set of sun,
When Jesus waits to whisper,
"Well done, beloved, well done";
Come, Lord, bend from the Glory,
On me Thy Spirit cast,
Make me an overcomer,
A victor to the last.

songs.title: For a day in Your courts (Psalm 84:10-12)
songs.lyrics:
### English (Translation)

# Psalm 84:10-12

For a day in Your courts is better than a thousand;
I would rather stand at the threshold of the house of God
Than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
For Jehovah God is a sun and a shield;
Jehovah gives grace and glory;
He does not withhold anything good from those who walk uprightly.
O Jehovah of hosts, blessed is the man who trusts in You.
O Jehovah of hosts, I will trust in You alone.

### Korean (Original)

주의 궁전에서 한 날이 다른 곳의 천날보다 나은즉
악인의 장막에 사는 것 보다 하나님의 집의 문지기가 좋으니
여호와 하나님은 해요 방패 여호와께서 은혜와 영광 주시며
정직하게 행하는 자에게 좋은 것을 아끼지 아니하실 것이라
만군의 여호와여 주께 의지하는 자는 복이 있나이다
만군의 여호와여 내가 주만 의지하리

songs.title: Is your life a channel of blessing?
songs.lyrics:
1
Is your life a channel of blessing?
Is the love of God flowing through you?
Are you telling the lost of the Savior?
Are you ready His service to do?

  Make me a channel of blessing today,
  Make me a channel of blessing, I pray;
  My life possessing, my service blessing,
  Make me a channel of blessing today.

2
Is your life a channel of blessing?
Are you burdened for those that are lost?

The Savior who died on the cross?

3
We cannot be channels of blessing
If our lives are not free from all sin;
We will barriers be and a hindrance
To those we are trying to win.

songs.title: In the secret of His presence
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune
1
[G]In the secret of His [C]presence
How my [D7]soul delights to [G]hide!
Oh, how [D]precious are the [G]lessons
Which I [A7]learn at Jesus' [D]side!
Earthly [D7]cares can never [G]vex me,
Neither [B]trials [Em]lay me [B]low;
For when [G]Satan [G7]comes to [C]tempt me,
[Cm]To the [Gm]secret [Bb7]place I [Eb]go.
[Cm]To the [G]secret [D7]place I [G]go.

2
When my soul is faint and thirsty,
'Neath the shadow of His wing
There is cool and pleasant shelter,
And a fresh and crystal spring;
And my Savior rests beside me,
As we hold communion sweet;
If I tried, I could not utter
What He says when thus we meet.

3
Only this I know: I tell Him
All my doubts and griefs and fears;
Oh, how patiently He listens!
And my drooping soul He cheers;
Do you think He ne'er reproves me?
What a false friend He would be,
If He never, never told me
Of the sins which He must see.

4
Would you like to know the sweetness
Of the secret of the Lord?
Go and hide beneath the shadow;
This shall then be your reward;
And whene'er you leave the silence
Of that happy meeting-place,
By the Spirit bear the image
Of the Master in your face.

### New Tune
1

[C]For when Satan [D]comes to tempt me,
[G]To the [D]secret [Em]place I go.
[G]To the [D]secret [Em]place I go.

2

3

What a false friend He would be,
If He never, never told me
Of the sins which He must see.

4
Would you like to know the sweetness
Of the secret of the Lord?
Go and hide beneath the shadow;

And whene'er you leave the silence

Of the Master in your face.

songs.lyrics:
# Bible Story Songs

1
[A]Before God put the [D]leaves on the [A]trees,
Before He [E]made the [A]herbs bearing [E7]seeds,
He [D]thought about you, and He [A]thought about me,

2

3

songs.title: In His Christ to head up all things
songs.lyrics:
1
In His Christ to head up all things
Is our God's economy;
Taking Christ as Head and Center,
All is one in harmony.

2
Christ as Head will be the Center;
God within will be the Light;
Christ enthroned, with God, His substance,
Will fulfill His heart's delight.

3
Christ as life will be the content,
Heading up all things in light;
All the saints will be the vessel,
To express His glory bright.

4
Satan hath himself injected
Into man all things to spoil,
Bringing darkness and corruption
God's eternal plan to foil.

5
Christ has come, Himself imparting
Into man as life to save,
That the pow'r of death and darkness
May no more all things enslave.

6
Thru the Church which is His Body
Christ as Head will sum up all;
All will fitly join together,
All things either great or small.

7
Under Christ, by His full headship,
All in union will subsist;
In the light the Church expresses
All in oneness will exist.

8
Owning Christ as Head and Center,
All will be in harmony;
Thru the shining of His Body
All will share His liberty.

9
No more darkness and corruption,
No more death and vanity;
All will be released from bondage
Throughout all eternity.

songs.title: Enoch and God
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3
1
[D]Enoch and [Bm]God, [Em]  walked for three c[A]enturies
[D]And then God t[Bm]ook him,[Em]    and he was n[A]ot,
[D]And Abrah[Bm]am,     [Em]  lingered in G[A]od’s presence
[D]As they were t[Bm]alking God sho[Em]wed His heart.[A]

     Lor[Em]d, I’m here[A]
     Just sp[D]ending time to g[Bm]et to know You;
     J[Em]ust draw near,[A]
     Rev[D]eal Your heart, show [Bm]me Your purpose,
     K[Em]eep disp[A]ensing into [D]me[G]   [D]

2
Walking with God, we are in fellowship;

3
Regular days, but there is God in them;

songs.title: Let’s seek God’s will for His purpose (Know and Experience the All-Inclusive, Extensive Christ)
songs.lyrics:
(capo 1)

1
[C]Let’s seek God’s will for His purpose:
[G]Christ our center, Christ our focus;
[F]Christ our life and every[C]thing![G]
[C]God’s eternal will and pleasure:
[G]Christ wrought in us in full measure,
[F]All His fullness [G]ex[G7]pressing![C7]

He’s [F]all-in[G]clusive
And [Em]all-ex[Am]tensive!
Let’s [F]know, ex[G]perience [C]Him![C7]
Let’s [F]trust God’s [G]counsel,
A[Em]bide in God’s [Am]will,
Make [F]Christ our [G]goal, [G7]quest, and [C]theme!

2
Daily, weekly, monthly, yearly,
Christ our milk and Christ our honey,
Sabbath, new moon and new feasts!
Eat Him! Eat Him! Eat more of Him!
Drink Him! Drink Him! Overflow Him!
Breathe Him! Be His life increase!

Christ is our good land,
A rich and vast land;
We lack for nothing in Him!
Now walk more in Him,
Absorb more of Him,
Filled more and more to the brim!

3
Christ must be preeminent in
Our love, our tripartite being,
And our daily living too!
In our spiritual experience,
And our private universes,
He must have the first place true!

We’ve all been chosen,
A corporate person,
To make Christ preeminent!
God’s ruling o’er us
In our universe
To give Christ preeminence.

4
Christ, God’s myst’ry, God embodied—
In Him we’re made full and splendid;
All God’s fullness dwells in Him!
Let us realize what is in Him,
Exercise faith, partake of Him,
And lose sight of all but Him!

For all He is and
Attained and obtained
Belongs to us already!
For all that He has
Experienced has
Become our own history!

5
With Christ we have one position,
One life, living, destination,
Glory, in the heavenlies!
Christ is our life, Christ’s subjective;
He’s our living with one motive—
Life and glory to release!

He’s all the members,
In all the members;
He constitutes the new man!
His peace must rule us,
His word must fill us,
To manifest one new man.

6
Broaden, lengthen, heighten, deepen
Our spiritual dimensions;
All Your fullness manifest!
In each daily situation,
With each person, time, location,
Magnify Your boundlessness!

You’re all inclusive!
You’re all extensive!
This light must penetrate us!
May all Your riches,
Your exhaustlessness,
Be day by day wrought in us!

songs.title: O that Christ may make His home my heart
songs.lyrics:
O that [C]Christ [Em]may [F]make His home my [C]heart!

  Satu[Dm]rate and life im[G]part!
  That with [Am]all s[Em]aints [F]I may appre[C]hend

1
[C]Father God, for[F]give me if I [G-C]groan;
For so long I've [F]been on a pla[G-C]teau.
Now with tears, I [F]bow my knees and [C]pray,
By Your [F]Spirit make my [G]spirit strong to[C]day.

2
As I came this morning to Your word
With no strength to even read a verse;
Yet my plea, is "Lord I do need You!"
How You strengthen me, Your power within to prove.

3
I myself was losing heart each day;
Then the Lord brought some saints my own way;
I alone could not Thee apprehend
But with all the saints You now my joy have been.

4
All these years I've come the church to know,
Yet O Lord, there're things I can't let go;
Yet within me there is an “Amen";
Now the joy I lost is flowing once again

songs.title: God’s Intention is to be the Tree of Life
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 1

1
[D]Every [Bm]day we [G]muse upon the w[A]ord,
[D]To con[F#m]verse in the [G]presence of the L[A]ord!
[G]When we [D]eat, we [F#]breathe Him into [Bm]us,
[Em]And we become full of enjo[A]yment.

  [G]God’s in[D]tention is to [A]be the tree of l[Bm]ife
  [G]For our enj[D]oyment and [A]our life sup[D7]ply.
  [G]We live the [D]Christian life by [F#]eating the L[Bm]ord
  [G]For [A]His econo[D]my. 

2
We just need to open up our mouth,
Call His name, and He feeds us with Himself!
As we heed the sense of life inside,
Our appetite’s bigger and deeper.

3
We must learn to live by Jesus Christ—
He’s the way, the reality and life!
As we love and contact our dear Lord,
We are conformed into His image.

4
Do you have a hoof that’s split in two?
Are you chewing the cud the whole day through?
Spirit, flesh, the new man or the old—
We must be those full of discernment.

5
Fish with fins and scales to beat the tide;
Birds that fly, and enjoy the seeds of life;
Insects jumping, leaping from the world.
Lord, keep us pure, with Your believers!

6
Let’s be simple and enjoy the Lord—
Not alone, but with saints in one accord.
Thank You for the church life where we feast—
Our hearts released, full of rejoicing!

songs.title: I am chosen by God
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2 

1
[D]I was chosen by [G]God long be[D]fore
The foundations of earth He did [A]form.
It was [D]by God’s fore[G]knowledge so [D]vast,
That one day He would [A]call me at [D]last.


Chorus:

  And although I may feel that I’m [D]flawed,
  It’s His mercy I [G]see,
  That by [D]God’s grace He [A]ever chose [D]me.


2
He chose me for the purpose He planned,
To express Him, that’s why He made man,
And to represent God as a king,
One day ruling with Him o'er all things.


3
Although chosen by God we have been,
We can still have the struggles within.
For the troubles without cause us pain,
Yet through “all things” our God we will gain.


4
Just like Jacob of old we can be,
One to bless others thus, Lord, with Thee.
Then we’ll worship our God just like him
For His shepherding work done within.

songs.title: There's a secret
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

1
[D]There’s a secret we must learn from
Joseph’s [G]life so long a[D]go.
How he came to be one r[Bm]eigning,
This is [D]what we must [A]come to [D]know.

  [D]See the vision of God’s people;
  They are [G]sheaves so full of [D]life.
  And regardless, how we [Bm]see them,
  In God’s [D]view they are [A]full of [D]light.

2
But before we will be reigning, 
God knows we must be confined.
Just like Joseph in his prison,
There’s a secret to this, we will find.

  God is with us in our troubles,
  And on Him we can rely.
  Even though we may not see it,
  God is with us to be our supply.

3
Even in all of our troubles,
Some may come to us in need.
In their seeking we can help them
Come to God, and let Him take the lead.

  Through our speaking of God’s vision,
  Oh the more we’ll be released!
  Speak the “dreams” that God has shown you.
  Speak with God’s full authority!

4
Now the secret to our reigning
Is to first be ruled by God.
Oh, we need the Spirit’s ruling
In our life through the long path we trod.

  Give your life over to Jesus;
  Then you'll have a full supply,
  And to others be a blessing,
  In all things, as you “reign in life!”

songs.title: Deep Within God's Heart
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]Deep within God's [D]heart, a [Em]desire made [C]known.
"[G]It is not [D]good for [Em]man to be [C]alone
[G]I will [D]make him a [Em]helper as his [C]counterpart."
To [G]have a [D]bride was His [Em]need [C]and [G]heart.

2
So God be[D]came a [Em]lowly [C]man
[G]Lived a [D]life [Em]according to the [C]Father's will
Whol[G]ly [D]one with His [Em]heart and [C]plan
[G]Obedient to the [D]Cross, His [Em]plan [C]fulfilled[G]

3
What [D]life-releasing death!
Pro[Em]ducing His Bride, the [C]Church
[Am]What life-imparting [D]resurrection!
A [Em]beautiful [C]man in [Am]life and na[D]ture[D7].

4
[G]Christ loved the [D]church
And [Em]gave Himself up [C]for her
A [G]love sur[D]passing [Em]compre[C]hend
Such [G]mercy and [D]grace to [Em]appre[C]hend
[G]With all of our [D]hearts,
We [Em]love Yo[C]u, Lord[Am]
J[D]e[G]sus.

songs.title: Out from the region of Galilee (But then He found me)
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 2

1
[C]Out from the region of [F]Gali[C]lee
We heard of a Man, who [G]claimed to be
[C]God's own anointed, but I [F]just could not s[C]ee
Anything but a [G]Naza[C]rene;
Anything but a [G]Naza[C]rene.

2
When Rome crucified Him I thought it was done,
But His people insisted that still He lived.
I tried to destroy any trace of this One
And take His followers captive;
I took His followers captive.

  But then He [Am]found me;
  On the w[F]ay
  A [C]light brighter than [G]any
  Shone a[Am]round me;
  Heard Him s[F]ay:
  "I am [C]Jesus" when I said [G]Lord!

3
Now I'm included in His vict'ry train;
Led to proclaim a gospel: that He
Destroyed the devil and ended his reign!
And He also conquered me;
And He still is conquering me.

  Yes He found me;
  On the way
  A light brighter than any
  Shone around me;
  Heard Him say:
  "I am Jesus" when I said Lord!
  "I am Jesus" when I said Lord!
  Yes, Jesus Christ is Lord.

songs.title: God, we praise Thee for Thy mercy
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]God, we praise Thee for Thy mercy,
[A]'Tis so g[A7]reat and so pro[D]found!
[D]In our weakness and our failures;
[A]With its gr[A7]eatness it ab[D-D7]ounds.
[G]We adore Thee! [D]We adore Thee!
[G]With such mercy we've been cr[A-A7]owned!
[D]With s[D7]uch m[G]ercy w[A]e've b[A7]een cr[D]owned!

2
How we marvel at this mercy
So far-reaching and so vast!
It has reached us, e'en the sinners,
And will ever hold us fast.
From this mercy, from this mercy,
What can cause us to be cast?

3
For Thy mercy we are grateful,
'Tis so rich, so plenteous!
Thru Thy mercy in redemption,
Thou hast richly favored us.
If without this, if without this,
How could we be favored thus?

4
Oh, Thy mercy, so inspiring!
Gentle, tender, dear and sweet!
With Thy patience and Thy kindness,
Us in all our need it meets.
It we treasure, it we treasure,
Nothing can with it compete.

5
Father we enjoy Thy mercy,
Ever fresh and ever new;
Every morning shed upon us,
It refreshes as the dew.
How we taste it! How we taste it!
Giving Thee the praises due.

6
We can never cease to praise Thee,
As Thy mercy e'er endures;
All Thy grace and all Thy favor,
Ever for us it secures.
Trusting in it, trusting in it,
Thy sure mercy us assures.

songs.title: When we contact this Triune God (2)
songs.lyrics:
When we [E]contact this T[B]riune [E]God
through [A]prayer and by [E]looking to [B]Him,
by [E]means [A]of our s[E]pir[B]it,

to be[E]come the faith to[B]ward Him
[E]and the love toward t[A]hose who
be[E]long [B]to [E]Him.

[A]Faith and love are the
re[E]ality and expression of the [B]Triune [E]God[E7]—
[A]in whom we be[E]lieve
and whom we [F#]worship and re[B]ceive[B7].

#(Repeat 1st 4 lines of 1st stanza to end)

songs.lyrics:
1
[D]When we contact this Triune God [G-D]
through prayer and by [A]looking to Him,
by means of our sp[G]irit,
which was once d[A]ead
and was made a[D]live,

to become the faith with[G]in us toward Him
and the love out[D]side of us

songs.title: Out of my bondage, sorrow, and night
songs.lyrics:
### Original tune

1
[G]Out of my bondage, [C]sorrow, and [G]night,
Jesus, I [D]come! [D7]Jesus, I [G]come!
Into Thy freedom, [C]gladness, and [G]light,
Jesus, I [D7]come to [G]Thee![G7]
[C]Out of my sickness [G]into Thy health,
[D]Out of my want and [A7]into Thy [D7]wealth,
[G]Out of my sin and [C]into Thy[G]self,
Jesus, I [D]come to [G]Thee!

2
Out of my shameful failure and loss,
Jesus, I come! Jesus, I come!
Into the glorious gain of Thy cross,
Jesus, I come to Thee!
Out of earth's sorrows into Thy balm,
Out of life's storm and into Thy calm,
Out of distress to jubilant psalm,
Jesus, I come to Thee!

3
Out of unrest and arrogant pride,
Jesus, I come! Jesus, I come!
Into Thy blessed will to abide,
Jesus I come to Thee!
Out of myself to dwell in Thy love,
Out of despair into raptures above,
Upward for aye on wings like a dove,
Jesus, I come to Thee!

4
Out of the fear and dread of the tomb,
Jesus, I come! Jesus, I come!
Into the joy and pleasure, Thine own,
Jesus, I come to Thee!
Out of the depths of ruin untold,
Into the flock Thy love doth enfold,
Ever Thy glorious face to behold,
Jesus, I come to Thee!

songs.title: The Bible is a romance
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3
1
The [D]Bible is a [Bm]romance
In the [Em]most holy s[A]ense;
God and [F#m]His chosen [Bm]people
In [Em]love it so pre[A]sents.
This [G]universal [D]couple
Through[G]out it i[D]s disp[A]layed
God [Bm]in Christ is the [G]Bridegroom,
His [Em]saints, the [A]bride, port[D]rayed.

2
Through shadows, types and figures,
God's deepest thought is known;
As typified by Adam,
The Husband, Christ, is shown.
A rib brought forth from Adam
Reveals the source of life
By which God built a woman:
Eve, as the church, His wife.

3
To be His people's Husband,
To take them as His wife:
This is what God desires
To live in marriage life.
Their sacrifice and worship
Alone could not content;
But with them to be married
Was God's foremost intent.

4
This romance is the finest
As seen in Song of Songs;
For her Beloved's kisses
His seeking lover longs.
Love's work in her produces
No person of her own,
But she becomes the city,
Her person, Christ alone.

5
Christ is our coming Bridegroom;
We are the church, His bride,
Redeemed, regenerated,
The issue of His side,
In source, in life, in nature
And person fully one,
His counterpart forever,
The New Jerusalem.

songs.title: Take time to receive Him
songs.lyrics:
1
Take [D]time to rec[Bm]eive Him
The [G]blessing’s out[D]poured,
And [Bm]we may ob[F#m]tain it by r[G]eading His [A]Word;
[D]We bask in the s[D7]plendor of [G]His healing l[Gm]ight,
And [D]light becomes [Bm]life,
As in [Em]Him we [A7]deli[D]ght.

2
Take time to absorb Him,
To gain the supply.
That we may be watered
And nourished thereby;
The deeper the roots spread,
The deeper the flow,
And richer and higher within us He’ll grow.

3
Take time to inhale Him
His Word we may breathe;
By breathing it, God’s very life we receive
He breathes Himself out
So that we may breathe in
The life, the reality, fullness of Him.

4
Take time to enjoy Him,
Our portion is He:
Our present available reality;
Our practical, real, and enjoyable Lord
Is everything to us through His living Word.

5
Take time to behold Him,
Gaze oft on His face,
Receiving His person, and grace upon grace.
By His pleasant shining, infused we will be;
Our faces will glow with His light, radiantly.

# Music © Melody of Lilies

songs.lyrics:

1
[G]The [Am]Son of [C]God is [D]in my [G  Am  C  D  G]spirit.
But my [Am]mind, emotion, [C]will
Have [D]not been con[G]formed yet[Am  C  D].

Bears the image
Of the Son of God.




# © 1999 Melody of Lilies

1
[G]The [Am]Son of [C]God is [D]in my [G  Am  C  D  G]spirit.
But my [Am]mind, emotion, [C]will

songs.title: In nothing be anxious; the Lord is at hand
songs.lyrics:
1
In nothing be anxious; the Lord is at hand.
In peace and in vict'ry triumphantly stand;
Let nothing affright thee and nothing dismay,
For Jesus is coming! It may be today.

2
In nothing be anxious; on Him roll thy care.
Thy sins were laid on Him, thy sorrows He'll bear;
Care free and triumphant press on, still to prove
The strength of His arm and the balm of His love.

3
In nothing be anxious; should Jesus delay
His strength will be thine till the end of the day.
His arm thou canst lean on; His Spirit will cheer;
Then wherefore be anxious, press on without fear.

songs.title: The Saints Go Marching
songs.lyrics:
1
The saints go marching one by one Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching one by one Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching one by one,
Our Christian walk had just begun,
And they all go marching on with the Lord today.

2
The saints go marching two by two Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching two by two Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching two by two,
I need companions just like you,
And we’ll all go marching on with the Lord today.

3
The saints go marching three by three Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching three by three Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching three by three,
Christ is our life supply we breath,
As we all go marching on with the Lord today.

4
The saints go marching four by four Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching four by four Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching four by four,
We're one with our ascended Lord,
And we all go marching on with the Lord today.

5
The saints go marching five by five Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching five by five Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching five by five,
We're pressing on to gain the prize,
As we all go marching on in the Lord today.

6
The saints go marching six by six Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching six by six Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching six by six,
Eyes on the Hope of Glory fixed,
And we all go marching on in the Lord today.

7
The saints go marching seven by seven Hurrah-hurrah,
The saints go marching seven by seven Hurrah-hurrah.
The saints go marching seven by seven,
New Jerusalem's our goal not heaven!
Let’s all go marching on with the Lord today.

On with the Lord today.
On with the Lord today.
On with the Lord today.

songs.title: Fallen, that’s the way we all begin
songs.lyrics:
### Original version

1
[D]Fallen, [G]that’s the way we [A]all beg[D]in:
Imp[D]risoned [G]by the evil [A]fate we’re [D]in.
[D]How can [G]we from this hard [A]world of s[D]in
be [A]save[A7]d?

  Just by calling J[G]esus, J[A]esus, J[D]esus!
  [G]Every [A]moment, each [D]day!
  [G]Calling on the [A]name of J[D]esus—
  We're [Em]finding is the [A]way.
  It's J[G-D]esus! Lord J[G-D]esus!

2
Even though we love the Lord so much,
Somehow, it seems we get out of touch
with Jesus, how can we be freed from such
distress?

3
Sometimes we know we aren’t being real.
Then times, we just live by how we feel.
Is there some way we could ever deal
with self?

4
Christians, scattered throughout all the earth
Are wondering—Lord, where is Your bride of worth?
How can all those of the second birth
be one?

### Extended version

1
[D]Fallen, [G]that’s the way we [A]all beg[D]in:
Imp[D]risoned [G]by the evil [A]fate we’re [D]in.
[D]How can [G]we from this hard [A]world of s[D]in
be [A]save[A7]d?

  Just by calling J[G]esus, J[A]esus, J[D]esus!
  [G]Every [A]moment, each [D]day!
  [G]Calling on the [A]name of J[D]esus—
  We're [Em]finding is the [A]way.
  It's J[G-D]esus! Lord J[G-D]esus!

Even though we love the Lord so much,

3

5
Calling, you’ll find this will fill your lack.

today!

songs.title: Enter into the enjoyment
songs.lyrics:
### New version

Enter i[G]nto the enjoyment,
Experience the [D]Lord.
He’s the [G]rich supply,
Don’t let a [C]day go by,
Without the [G]presence [D]of the [G]Lord.

We don’t care about the tree of knowledge
Good and evil kill us dead.
We don’t need to behave ourselves into the grave
Just touch the living Lord instead.

### Original version

Enter i[G]nto the enjoyment,
Experience the [D]Lord.
He’s the [G]rich supply,
Don’t let a [C]minute go by,
Without [G]calling [D]on the [G]Lord.

Enter into the enjoyment
Of blending with the saints.
Reviving, praying, vital groups
Is God’s ordained new way.

songs.title: In a time before time (The Heart of God)
songs.lyrics:
### Shorter version
# Capo 1

1
In a [D]time   before [A]time, 
In an [Bm]age [G]  before the [D]ages;
There was God,   all a[A]lone   in e[Bm]ternity.
Yet He [G]had a heart’s des[D]ire, 
And a [G]counterpart re[D]quired.
A De[G]si - re in His h[D]eart, 
For a [G]bride, a counter[D]part
That was [G]deep inside the [D]hidden [A7]heart of [D  G  D]God.

2
In His plan,   He formed man, 
Who surveyed   all that God had made.
While he ached   for a mate,   for a counterpart.
Man could taste the e’ternal yearning 
That so long in God was burning!
Eve was built   from Adam’s side, 
And his heart was satisfied;
Told the story of the hidden heart of God.

3
But when Eve   was deceived, 
What was pure   fell beyond a cure;
All crea - tion enslaved   under vanity!
God was born in human hist’ry, 
To reveal its greatest myst’ry!
That the an - swer for the earth 
Was that Christ so loved the church;
He would die to satisfy the heart of God.

4
So alone   this grain dies, 
But with joy   to obtain His prize.
And with life   both divine   and unbreakable!
He arises, powers hear it! 
He will court her as the Spirit!
Blood and wa - ter from His side 
Will redeem and build His bride,
She will satisfy the riven heart of God.

5
When He breathed   she received 
His divine   personality;
Flowing in,   washing sin,   death and age away.
So that He might sanctify her 
By the washing of the water;
Adding beau - ty, adding health, 
To present her to Himself:
Full of glory for the holy heart of God.

6
In a time   beyond time, 
In an age   beyond the ages;
God and man   will be one   for eternity.
Hallelujah! What a story! 
She is brought from gloom to glory!
And the long - ing from the start, 
For a bride, a counterpart,
Is fulfilled inside the happy heart of God!


### Extended version

1
In a [D]time   before [A]time,
In an [Bm]age [G]  before the [D]ages,
There was God,   all a[A]lone,   in e[Bm]ternity.
Yet He [G]had a heart’s des[D]ire.
And an [G]object He re[D]quired;
A de[G]si - re in His [D]heart
For a [G]bride, a counter[D]part
That was [G]deep inside the [D]hidden [A7]heart of [D  G  D]God.

2
So the hea-vens He spread,
Earth was made,   its foundations laid.
At His word   were the birds   and the animals.
Then He breathed the breath of life in
To a man created like Him.
As they walked   along the way
In the coolness of the day
The intent was still within the heart of God.

3
Man surveyed   what God made
Giving names,   but he never came
To a mate,   and he ached   for a counterpart.
He could taste the ’ternal yearning
That so long in God was burning!
Eve was built   from Adam’s side
And his heart was satisfied;
Told the story of the hidden heart of God.

4
But when Eve   was deceived
What was pure   fell beyond a cure.
Dead to God   through the dread   serpent’s subtlety.
Left creation in a quand'ry!
Generations lived in myst'ry!
Seeking Job   could not perceive
But persisted to believe
There was purpose in the hidden heart of God.

5
In the time   He designed
He was born   of a virgin’s womb
To reveal   what was sealed   from eternity.
He was born in human hist'ry
To reveal its greatest myst'ry.
That the an - swer for the earth
Was that Christ so loved the church.
He would die to satisfy the heart of God.

6
As the throne   had foreknown
Many men   were deceived again
Through the lies   they devised
He was crucified.
As the lonely grain was falling
Still the joy before was calling;
Blood and wa - ter from His side
Would redeem and build His bride.
She would satisfy the riven heart of God.

7
Though His death’s   final breath,
Fin'lly fell,   He could not be held
For His life   was divine   and unbreakable.
He arises, powers hear it!
He will court her as the Spirit!
As the Spi - rit giving life
He will find and form His wife.
She will satisfy the living heart of God.

8
When He breathed,   she received
His divine   personality,
Moving in,   washing sin,   death and age away.
So that He might sanctify her
By the washing of the water!
Adding beau - ty, adding health
To present her to Himself
And to satisfy the holy heart of God.

9
In a time   beyond time,
In an age   beyond the ages,
God and man   will be one   for eternity.
Hallelujah, what a story!
She was brought from gloom to glory!
And the long - ing from the start
For a bride, a counterpart
Is fulfilled inside the happy heart of God.

songs.title: To God be the glory, great things He hath done
songs.lyrics:
1
To [G]God be the glory, great [D]things He hath [G]done,
So [C]loved He the [G]world that He [A]gave us His [D]Son,
Who [G]yielded His life our re[D]demption to [G]win,
And [C]opened the [G]life-gate that [D]all may go [G]in.

  Praise the [G]Lord, praise the Lord,
  Let the earth hear His [D]voice;
  Praise the [D7]Lord, praise the Lord,
  Let the people re[G]joice;
  Oh, come to the Father, through [D]Jesus the [G]Son,
  And [C]give Him the [G]glory; great [D]things He hath [G]done.

2
Oh, perfect redemption, the purchase of blood,
To every believer the promise of God;
The vilest offender who truly believes,
That moment from Jesus a pardon receives.

3
Great things He hath taught us, great things He hath done,
And great our rejoicing through Jesus the Son;
But purer, and higher, and greater will be
Our wonder, our transport when Jesus we see.

songs.title: Savior, lead me up the mountain
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Savior, lead me up the mou[F#m]ntain,
Where the [G]Lord alone is [D]seen[A7],
Where we [D]hear the voice from [F#m]heaven,
Where the [G]air is pure and [A]clean.

  Lead me [G]higher up the moun[D]tain,
  Give me [F#m]fellowship with [G]Thee;
  In Thy [D]light I see the foun[F#m]tain,
  And the [G]blood it [A7]cleanses [D]me.

2
Higher up where light increases,
Far above all earthly strife,
Where the strain of effort ceases,

3

songs.title: Watch, for the night is ending
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Watch, for the night is [G]end[D]ing!
[G]Watch, and the world n[A-D]ot seek;
Watch, for the day is [G]daw[D]ning!
[G]Watch, sink [A]not in [D]sleep.
[A]Watch, for the Lord is [A7]coming!
[D]Watch for the [E7]foe's a[A]ttack:
[D]Watch, for the Lord is [G]waiting!
[G]Watch, be [A]never s[D]lack.

2
Watch, and arise in service!
Watch, though the day be drear;
Watch, and go forth to labor!
Watch, the end is near.
Watch and put on the armor!
Watch with thy spirit strong;
Watch to resist the devil!
Watch, Christ comes ere long.

3
Watch for the Savior's coming!
Watch for the Morning Star;
Watch and pursue the Kingdom!
Watch with many a scar.
Watch, and be ever watchful!
Watch, till the night is done;
Watch till the dawn of glory!
Watch till the Lord shall come.

songs.title: O Lord, Thy boundless love to me
Father God, You're my source (This Flowing Triune God)
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2
1
[A]Father God, You’re my [AM7]source,
[G]Fountain of living [D]waters.
[A]Thirsty sinner I [AM7]was
[G]And You gave me to [D]drink. 
[A]Everything that this world [AM7]offers:
[G]Broken cisterns that [D]all run dry.
[A]Under the sun all is [AM7]vanity.
[G]You’re the one u[D]nique reali[A]ty. 
 
  [C]Now the enticing dis[D]tractions
  [C]Cannot compare with [D]You!
  [C]Wonderful Counselor, [D]Mighty God,
  My [FM7]Lord and My God,
  You [Em]are my portion di[A]vine. 
  My [Bm7]Lord and My God,
  You [E9]are my portion d[AM7]ivine. 

2
Savior God, dear Lord Jesus!
Christ, Son of the living God!
Bread of God, You came down 
To give life to the world. 
Friend of sinners, You came to seek
The dead sitting in darkness,
Scattered, led astray, far lost sheep.
Now You’re the Shepherd of our once lone souls. 

  Lamb of God, You endured the cross
  Despising all the shame. 
  Scourged, beaten and crucified,
  Man of sorrows,
  You bore all our sins.  
  Man of sorrows,
  You bore all our sins.  

3
Come, Spirit of Jesus!
Fill me, Spirit of Christ!
Life-giving Spirit,
Renew and transform me. 
Spirit of God intensified,
Burn and search me so thoroughly. 
Infuse, impart God into me. 
Fill me with the riches of Your life. 

  Spirit of Jesus Christ, now fill!
  Supply me bountifully!
  Give me life abundantly. 
  Guide me into all reality. 
  Guide me into all reality. 

4
Triune God, O Elohim!
El Shaddai, Adoni!
God in Christ as the Spirit flows
Dispensing God into me!
God the Father’s the fountain. 
Christ the Son is the spring. 
The Holy Spirit’s the river
Flowing into eternal life. 

  This flowing God has a destiny
  Which includes you and me
  Mingled with the Triune God. 
  The New Jerusalem we’ll be:

  The mutual habitation of
  The Triune God and man,
  The loving counterpart of Christ,
  The holy, glorious wife of the Lamb!


  This [Bm7]flowing Triune [E9]God
  [Bm7]Has reached You and [E9]me!
  The [Bm7]New Jerusa[E9]lem we’ll [A]be!

songs.title: Have you felt the Father's love?
songs.lyrics:
1
Have you felt the Father's love?
Still there's more to follow;
And His mercy have you proved?
Still there's more to follow.
Oh, the love the Father shows,
Still there's more to follow;
Freely He His love bestows,
Still there's more to follow.

  More and more, more and more,
  Always more to follow;
  Oh, His matchless, boundless love,
  Still there's more to follow.

2
Have you felt the Savior near?
Still there's more to follow;
Does His blessed presence cheer?
Still there's more to follow;
Oh, the grace that Jesus shows,
Still there's more to follow;
Freely He His grace bestows,
Still there's more to follow.

3
Have you felt the Spirit's power?
Still there's more to follow;
Falling like the gentle shower?
Still there's more to follow;
Oh, the power the Spirit shows,
Still there's more to follow;
Freely He His power bestows,
Still there's more to follow.

songs.title: Take the name of Jesus with you
songs.lyrics:
1

  Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
  Hope of earth and joy of heav'n;
  Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
  Hope of earth and joy of heav'n.

2
Take the name of Jesus ever,
As a shield from every snare.
If temptations round you gather,
Breathe that holy name in prayer.

3
Oh, the precious name of Jesus,
How it thrills our souls with joy;
All the favor of the Father
In this name we may enjoy.
Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heav'n;
Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heav'n.

4
At the name of Jesus bowing,
Falling prostrate at His feet,
Claim His vict'ry over evil
And the enemy defeat.
Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heav'n;
Precious name! Oh, how sweet!
Hope of earth and joy of heav'n.

songs.title: Faith So Small
songs.lyrics:
1
[C]Faith so small, how [F]could I ever [G]follow [C]Thee,
Veiled by [Am]earthly [F]glories in my [G]being?
Why would [C]I hand [F]o'er my life to [G]suff'[C]ring,
When there [Am]is no[F]thing of guaran[G]tee?
Lord my [Am]thoughts, so [F]filled with these [G]anxie[C]ties,
I can't [Am]help but [F]fall away from [G]peace.
Yet [C]within, You [F]softly and so [G]caring[C]ly
Whisper, "[Am]Come, come [F]back dear [G7]love to [C]Me."

2
Here I am, before You in my conflict and woe,
Nothing good have I to offer Thee.
What could You, do with my mixed, divided plea?
Hear me Lord, my yearnings do You know?
Deep within, my heart's to give my all to You,
Yet without, the cost is all I see.
Turn me Lord, on You my eyes would only be,
Lord just You, my heart would ever view.

3
Wreck me Lord, save me from making more compromise,
So that I constrained, would then You choose.
Of all things, it's You alone I now fear to lose,
To your calling finally I rise.
Though the world, sees all I'd give as squandered waste,
This is my delight to pour on You.
Take my heart, my life, my all, my being through,
Have Your way, that You might then, make haste.

# Hymn 1210 New Tune

songs.lyrics:
# D Capo 2


1
[D]I’m [G]seeing the [D]Lord, [G]
So I [Em]can’t just touch Him [A]- here and there.
[D]When [G]He’s on my [D]mind [G]
We’re en[Em]gaged affectionat[A]ely!

  [G]Now [A]He’s so Ha[Bm]ppy!
  [Em7]“My lover’s [A7]walking with [Bm]Me.”
  [G]In this em[A]brace we [F#m]two become [Bm]one.
  [Em]Now everything can be [A-A7]done.

2
The Lord is my breath,
So I need to breathe Him - everywhere.
Not gasping for air,
But inhaling effortlessly.

  Now He is so pleased!
  “My vessel’s open to Me.”

  If we would just never leave.

3
I’m growing in life 
By absorbing from His inner being.
When I turn my heart
He resumes infusing again.

  Now He is expressed!
  He emanates as we touch.
  Beholding I can’t help but reflect 
  The One that I’m becoming.

4
I’m serving the Lord
As a branch abiding in the vine.
Joined organically,
Bearing fruit spontaneously!

  Oh what a living!
  We fellowship in all things.
  Through His infusing I become Him
  And minister who I am.

5
He’s dealing with me
Every time I look into His eyes;
All other things fade
As His love grows deeper in me.

  His care is so sweet!
  He knows exactly my need
  And carries off all negative things
  To make me His bride-to-be!

6
Soon we’ll be married
To the One we contact all the time.
As we just love Him
We’re made ready for our wedding!

  What a destiny!
  A living we’ve been bequeathed;
  Full of incentives so bountiful
  To come to Him and remain.

  What a destiny!
  A living we’ve been bequeathed;
  Full of incentives so bountiful.
  [G]Lord cause [A7]my heart to [D]turn!

and [D]said “Where is [A]he?” (9:4)[A7]

  I eat food at His [G]table… con[D]tinual[A]ly! (2 Sam 9:7)

songs.title: Jesus, our wonderful Shepherd
songs.lyrics:
#Capo 3

1
[G]Jesus, our [D7]wonderful [G]Shepherd
[D]Brought us right [D7]out of the [G-G7]fold
[C]Into His pasture so [G]plent[Em]eous,
[A7]Into His riches un[D]told.[D7]

  [G]Glorious church life,
  Feasting from such a rich [D]store!
  [G]Here where we’re [C]dwelling in [G]one[Em]ness
  [D]God commands [D7]life ever[G]more.

2
In the divisions He sought us,

3

songs.title: We're the river-crossers, Hebrews is our name
songs.lyrics:
1
[Dm]We’re the river-crossers, [Gm]Hebrews is our [Dm]name;
[Gm]Crossed the Eu[Dm]phrates, [A7]idols all are [Dm]slain.
[Dm]Entered into Canaan, [Gm]left the other [Dm]side;
[Gm]Seeking a [Dm]city, [A7]which shall e’er a[Dm]bide.

  We’ve crossed the [Gm]river, [C]we are not the [Dm]same.
  [Gm]Building God’s [Dm]house that [Gm]He may dwell on [Dm]earth,
  [Gm]Building God’s [Dm]house that [A7]He may dwell on [Dm]earth.

2
We were bound in Egypt, building for the foe;
God of the Hebrews said, “Let My people go!”
We have crossed the Red Sea, reached the other side;
Pharaoh, his army, perished in the tide.

  God of the Hebrews, lead us all the way.
  Save all Your people from this crooked age,
  Save all Your people from this crooked age.

3
We’re released, and now we build the house of God;
His tabernacle is our true abode.

  City by city, take we more and more,
  To gain His kingdom, enter into rest,
  To gain His kingdom, enter into rest.

4
What was once God-given soon a form became;

Make another crossing, God is going on;
Judaism’s over; listen to My Son!

  Turn from the prophets, turn unto the Son;
  He’s My Beloved, He and I are one;
  His Word will save you to the uttermost,
  His Word will save you to the uttermost.

5
Now we’re overcomers on the sea of glass;
This final crossing will forever last.
Sing the song of Moses, make the praise complete,
Look! All our enemies beneath our feet.

  We’re overcomers, that’s our real name.
  God has His city; Satan gets the shame.
  God is our portion for eternity,
  God is our portion for eternity.

songs.title: Tell me, whom my soul loves
songs.lyrics:
S.S. 1:7, 8b

Tell me, whom my soul loves, 
Where do you pasture your flock?
Where do you make it lie down at noon?
Where do you make it lie down at noon?

For why should I be like one who is veiled
Beside the flocks of your companions?

Go forth on the footsteps of the flock,
And pasture your young goats
By the shepherds’ tents

songs.title: Jesus, Sun and Shield art Thou
songs.lyrics:
1
[D]Jesus, Sun and S[F#m]hield art Thou,
[D]Sun and Shield forever.
[F#m]Never canst Thou [B7]cease to shine,
[Em]Cease to guard us, never.
[G]Cheer our steps as on we go,
[D]Come between us [Bm]and the foe.
[Em]Jesus, Sun and [A7]Shield art Thou for[D]ever.

2
Jesus, Bread and Wine art Thou,
Wine and Bread forever.
Never canst Thou cease to feed
Or refresh us, never.
Feed us still on bread divine,
drink we still of heavenly wine,
Jesus, Bread and Wine art Thou forever.

3
Jesus, Love and Life art Thou,
Life and Love forever.
Ne’er to quicken shalt Thou cease,
Or to love us, never.
All of life and love we need
Is in Thee, in Thee indeed.
Jesus, Love and Life art Thou forever.

4
Jesus, Peace and Joy art Thou,
Joy and Peace forever.
Joy that fades not, changes not,
Peace that leaves us never.
Joy and Peace we have in Thee,
Now and through eternity.
Jesus, Peace and Joy art Thou forever.

5
Jesus, Song and Strength art Thou,
Strength and Song forever.
Strength that never can decay,
Song that ceaseth never.
Still to us this strength and song,
Through eternal days prolong.
Jesus, Song and Strength art Thou forever.

songs.title: Jesus, Raiser of the dead
songs.lyrics:
#Tune: Jesus, Lover of my soul (new tune)
#capo 2

1
[G]Jesus, [C]Raiser of the d[G]ead,
Raise me n[D]ow to take You i[Em]n.
Clear my [C]sin/self-ridden h[G]ead,
Captiv[C]ate my [D]thoughts with[G]in.
Lord, You [C]shed Your blood for m[G]e,
Not in v[D]ain- here I appl[Em]y.
I wish [C]nothing in betw[G]een
Your warm, [C]radiant [D]face and m[G]ine.

2
You’re the only righteous One.
Death, injustice surround me.
Come, O noble healing Sun.
Dispel shadows in my being.
Sun of righteousness arise,
Rays of zoe radiate.
I’ll feed, photosynthesize;
Grow new roots; absorb all day.

3
Lord, just lead me here and now;
You’re a person living, real;
I will stay where You are found-
That location, do reveal. 
Lord I pray to nevermore
Come to You religiously.
Lead me now how I explore
All Your vast sufficiencies.

4
Lord, I love You more today;
More than all my days behind.
Keep me turned from else away;
All in You, Lord, I would find.
Lord there’s nothing worth my time
But to gain You through and through
All day long, into me shine,
So I stay reflecting You.

5
Guiding light’s seen in Your word
Like a lamp, enlightening.
‘Till the morn arrives to earth,
‘Luminate Your path for me.
Rise up in the darkest hour;
Morning star, appear for me.
‘Fore You come to earth in pow’r,
take me up in secrecy.

songs.title: More holiness give me
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]More holiness [D]give me,
[Em]More sweetness [B]within,
[C]More patience in [G]suff'ring,
[Am]More [D]sorrow for [G]sin,
[G]More faith in my [D]Savior,
[Em]More sense of His [B]care,
[C]More joy in His [G]ser[Em]vice,
[G]More [D7]freedom in [G]prayer.

  [G]Come, my [D]Savior, and [G]help [Em]me,
  [D]Comfort, [D7]strengthen and [G]keep [G7]me;
  [C]Thou each [Am]moment wilt [G]save [Em]me,
  [G]Thou art [D7]saving me [G]now.

2
More gratitude give me,
More trust in the Lord,
More zeal for His glory,
More hope in His Word,
More tears for His sorrows,
More pain at His grief,
More meekness in trial,
More praise for relief.

3
More victory give me,
More strength to o'ercome,
More freedom from earth-stains,
More quest for the throne,
More fit for the kingdom,
More useful I'd be,
More blessed and holy,
More, Savior, like Thee.

songs.title: The tree of life, how sweet the fruit
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
[D]The tree of [D7]life, how [G]sweet the [D]fruit,
With [Bm]God as [E7]life comp[A-A7]lete.
I [D]once was [D7]dead, but [G]now I [D]live,
Was [Bm]starved, but [A]now I [G-D]eat.

2
'Twas God that brought me to the tree,
With Christ Himself as meat;
How precious did that tree become
When I began to eat.

3
The Lord Himself is food to me,
He is my life supply;
He will my pure enjoyment be,
None else can satisfy.

4
I freely eat this living tree,
For eating is the way
To put God's life inside of me,
To live by Him today.

songs.title: Sing aloud your praises to the Lord of all
songs.lyrics:
1
[Dm]Sing aloud your praises [Gm]to the Lord of [Dm]all,
[Gm]Now He is [Dm]dwelling [A7]in Jerusa[Dm]lem.
[Dm]Tell among us all His [G]doings great and [Dm]small,
[Gm]His throne, the [Dm]heavens, [A7]yet He walks with [Dm]men.
[Dm]Oh, the salvation [C]out of Zion [Dm]comes;
[Dm]He brought us back from [C]our captivi[Dm]ty.
[Gm]Now we re[Dm]joice and [Gm]are exceeding [Dm]glad;
[Gm]Now we re[Dm]joice and [A7]are exceeding [Dm]glad!

2
In the Holy City with His own He dwells;
O Lord, our Lord how excellent Thy name!
He's enthroned upon the praises of His saints;
All His delight in Zion does remain.
The local churches are His move today—
He is our portion, we are satisfied.
Oh, what a goodly heritage have we;
Oh, what a goodly heritage have we!

3
Who shall in His holy tabernacle dwell,
Who shall ascend to His most holy hill?
Those who seek for Him and purify their heart;
This generation now that seeks His face.
Oh, seek His face, ye children of the earth,
Open your heart, and let the King come in.
He will come in, and He shall live and reign;
He will come in, and He shall live and reign!

4
Look! God's tabernacle now is with the saints;
Emmanuel—God with us, we proclaim.
Everything is done, so let His children come;
Christ and the church—where God and man are one!
Lift up your heads, ye cities of the earth;
Open your gates, and let the King come in.
Shout to His praise—He's coming in to reign!
Shout to His praise—He's coming in to reign!

songs.title: Oh, how glorious is Thy table, Lord
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3

1
[G]Oh, how glorious is Thy ta[D]ble, [G]Lord,
[C]Thou, the man, our Host, presi[G]ding,
[D]In Thy house, Thy [D7]home, a[G]biding;
[G]Oh, how [C]glorious is Thy [G]ta[D]ble, [G]Lord!

  Halle[G - G7]lujah! Halle[C]lujah!
  Halle[G]lujah [Em]for this [D-D7]feast!
  Halle[G - G7]lujah! Halle[C]lujah!
  Oh, how [G]glorious is Thy [D7]table, [G]Lord!

2
How enjoyable Thy table, Lord,
As we fellowship around it,
Hallelujah, we have found it,
How enjoyable Thy table, Lord!

3
Oh, how precious is Thy table, Lord
Bread and wine Thy death announcing;
Here our soul-life we’re renouncing,
By partaking of Thy table, Lord.

4
How significant Thy table, Lord
We Thy Body in the loaf seen,
Object of Thy love bespeaking;
How significant Thy table, Lord!

5
How refreshing is Thy table, Lord
So completely satisfying,
Day by day our need supplying;
How refreshing is Thy table, Lord.

6
How encouraging Thy table, Lord
“Till He come,” its promise giving
Hope, to fill our daily living;
How encouraging Thy table, Lord!

songs.title: God gave His Son to man to be
songs.lyrics:
1
God [D]gave His Son to man to be      
The [A]tree of life so rich and [D]free,      
That [G]every man may [D]taste and see      
That [A7]God is good for [D]food.      
Yes, [D]God is [A7]good for [D]food!      
Yes, [A7]God is good for [D]food!      
We've [G]tasted and we [D]testify      
That [A7]God is good for [D]food!

2
We eat this feast and take God in,
And as we eat we live by Him,
For all the elements within
This feast are God Himself.
Yes, Jesus is our feast!
Yes, Jesus is our feast!
We eat this feast and live by Him,
For Jesus is our feast!

3
Christ Jesus is the food we eat;
He is our bread, He is our meat;
He is our life-supply complete;
We daily eat of Him.
We daily eat of Him,
We daily eat of Him.
He is our life-supply complete;
We daily eat of Him.

4
This feast is so enjoyable;
To men it's so available,
For God said whosoever will
May come and freely eat;
Yes, come and freely eat;
Yes, come and freely eat.
For God said whosoever will
May come and freely eat.

songs.title: My Heart Overflows
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3
1
[F]You are [G]fairer, my [C]Lord, than the [Am]sons of men,  [F]
fairer th[G]an the sons of m[C    C7]en.
[F]Grace is [G]poured out u[C]pon your [Am]lips
[F]God has [G]blessed You, Lord, for[C]ever.

2
Gird Your sword upon Your thigh, O mighty One
In Your majesty and splendor
Because of truth and meekness and righteousness
Ride on victoriously.


So my [C]heart overflows 

I speak what I’ve composed
[C7]My tongue is ready to [F]write
[Fm]Christ is my King
[C]To Him [E7]I will [Am]sing,
Sing [Dm]praise to the [D7]Lord whom I [G]love
So my heart overflows
I speak what I’ve composed
My tongue is ready to write
Christ is my King
To Him I will sing,
Sing [F]praise to the [G]Lord whom I l[C]ove


3
Your throne, O God, is forever and ever
The sceptre of Your kingdom is uprightness
Righteousness you’ve loved, wickedness You hated
Anointed with the oil of gladness

4
All Your garments smell of myrrh and of aloes
Of myrrh and aloes and of cassia
From palaces of ivory, built for Christ the King,
Harpstrings have made You glad.

songs.title: Hark! A voice from heav'n proclaiming
songs.lyrics:
1
Hark! A voice from heav'n proclaiming,
"It is done."
Faith repeats the echo claiming,
"It is done."

  Hear the message from the throne,
  Claim the promise, doubting one;
  God hath spoken, "It is done."
  Faith has answered, "It is done."
  Prayer is over, praise begun.
  Hallelujah, "It is done."

2
Hear the bleeding Savior crying,
"It is done."
Claim His finished work, replying,
"It is done."
Hear the message from the throne,
Claim the promise, doubting one;
God hath spoken, "It is done."
Faith has answered, "It is done."
Prayer is over, praise begun.
Hallelujah, "It is done."

3
Yield thyself in consecration,
"It is done."
Take the Lord for full salvation,
"It is done."

4
Claim the promise of His healing,
"It is done."
Trust without a sign or feeling,
"It is done."

5
Say of every promised blessing,
"It is done."
Rest upon His word, confessing,
"It is done."

6
This the secret of receiving,
"It is done."
Take Him at His word believing,
"It is done."

songs.title: We are feeding on the living bread
songs.lyrics:
1
We are [C]feeding on the [F]living bread,
We are [D7]drinking at the [G]fountainhead;
And [C]whoso [F]drinketh, [C]Jesus [G]said,
Shall [Am]never, never [G7]thirst a[C]gain.

  What, [C]never thirst again?
  No, [F]never thirst again!
  What, [D7]never thirst again?
  No, [G]never thirst again!
  And [C]whoso [F]drinketh, [C]Jesus [G]said,
  Shall [Am]never, never [G]thirst [C]again!

2
We are feeding on the living bread,
Eating of the feast our Lord has spread,
And whoso eateth, Jesus said,
Shall hunger nevermore.

  What, hunger nevermore?
  Yes, hunger nevermore!
  What, hunger nevermore?
  Yes, hunger nevermore!
  And whoso eateth, Jesus said,
  Shall hunger nevermore.

3
We are breathing in the living air,
Breathing in the One whose life we share,
And whoso breatheth—now, fore’er—
Shall have the life of God.

  What, have the life of God?
  Yes, have the life of God!
  What, have the life of God?
  Yes, have the life of God!
  And whoso breatheth—now, fore’er—
  Shall have the life of God.

4
We are tasting of the living wine,
In spirit tasting life divine,
And whoso tasteth, everytime
Shall have the joy of God.

  What, have the joy of God?
  Yes, have the joy of God!
  What, have the joy of God?
  Yes, have the joy of God!
  And whoso tasteth, everytime
  Shall have the joy of God.

5
Christ is the resurrected King,
Who died and rose, our life to bring,
If you receive Him you will sing,
And live forevermore.

  What, live forevermore?
  Yes, live forevermore!
  What, live forevermore?
  Yes, live forevermore!
  If you receive Him you will sing,
  And live forevermore.

songs.title: Lord Jesus, Thou art Lord of all
songs.lyrics:
1
Lord Jesus, Thou art Lord of all,
With glory ever crowned;
In power and in majesty
Thou art to all renowned.

2
As God in man, on earth Thou wast,
A slave-form Thou didst own;
As man in God, in heav'n Thou art,
As Lord of all art known.

3
Thou art the Man in glory there,
And there by God enthroned;
All pow'r in heaven and on earth
Now by Thyself is owned.

4
Exalted highly to the heav'ns
And giv'n the highest Name,
All shall confess Thee as the Lord
And all bow at Thy Name.

5
God made Thee both the Lord and Christ,
The Spirit hath declared;
In glory and in heav'n we see
God's throne by Thee is shared.

6
As Lord of glory we adore,
To Thee our song we raise;
We worship Thee as Lord of all,
How worthy of our praise!

songs.title: He faileth not, for He is God
songs.lyrics:
1
He faileth not, for He is God;
He faileth not, His grace how good!
He faileth not, His Word is clear;
If we have God, whom need we fear?

2
The highest mount, He can make plain;
The wildest flood, He can restrain!
God of Impossibilities!
Poor puny man, now learn His ways.

3
The axe did swim on Jordan's wave!
Our God the Red Sea's waters clave!
He stopped the sun! Made long the day!
This is the God to whom we pray.

4
He bars the sea with feeble sand!
The proud waves bow at His command!
If God is thine, what more your need?
Can He not work for you indeed?

5
Our God is love; your needs are known;
His promises He'll fully own.
Our gracious God bows down His ear
The feeblest, weakest cry to hear.

6
Our God is light, and never yet,
One promise did He e'er forget.
His promises in Christ the Son
Are fully pledged, Yea and Amen.

7
Our faithful God, faith cannot break,
Nor death, nor hell, His promise shake!
Who ask in faith, He'll not deny;
His Word is sure, He must reply.

8
He faileth not, let all men hear;
He faileth not, His Word is clear.
He faileth not, His grace how good;
He faileth not, for He is God!

songs.title: Be not dismayed whate'er betide
songs.lyrics:
1
Be not dismayed whate'er betide,
God will take care of you!
Beneath His wings of love abide,
God will take care of you!

  God will take care of you,
  Through every day o'er all the way;
  He will take care of you;
  God will take care of you!

2
Through days of toil when heart doth fail,
God will take care of you!
When dangers fierce your path assail,
God will take care of you!

3
All you may need He will provide,
God will take care of you!
Trust Him, and you will be satisfied,
God will take care of you!

4
Lonely and sad, from friends apart,
God will take care of you!
He will give peace to your aching heart,
God will take care of you!

5
No matter what may be the test,
God will take care of you!
Lean, weary one, upon His breast,
God will take care of you!

songs.title: Weary pilgrim on life's pathway
songs.lyrics:
1
Weary pilgrim on life's pathway—
Struggling on beneath thy load—
Hear these words of consolation,
"Cast thy burden on the Lord."

  Cast thy burden on the Lord!
  Cast thy burden on the Lord,
  And He will strengthen thee,
  sustain and comfort thee—
  Cast thy burden on the Lord.

2
Are thy tired feet unsteady?
Does thy lamp no light afford?
Is thy cross too great and heavy?
"Cast thy burden on the Lord."

3
Are the ties of friendship severed?
Hushed the voices fondly heard?
Breaks thy heart with weight of anguish?
"Cast thy burden on the Lord."

4
Does thy heart with faintness falter?
Does thy mind forget His word?
Does thy strength succumb to weakness?
"Cast thy burden on the Lord."

5
He will hold thee up from falling;
He will guide thy steps aright;
He will strengthen each endeavor;
He will keep thee by His might.

songs.title: O how nigh the Lord is unto all who call on Him
songs.lyrics:
1
[G]O how nigh the Lord is unto 
[D]All who call on [G]Him!
When we [E]call, His [D]very presence 
[A7]strengthens us with[D7]in.
[G]Seeking Jesus, He is found, 
And [C]calling, He is [B7]near—
O [E7]what a comfort [A7]to our hearts 
To [A]call His name so [D7]dear!

  [G]Jesus! O what a name!
  [G7]O Lord [C]Jesus! Life-giving [G]name!
  Name vic[D7]torious, name all-[G]glorious[Em],
  Name e[A7]xalted—O what a n[D]ame![D7]
  [G]Jesus! Strengthening name!
  [G7]O Lord [C]Jesus! Comforting [G]name!
  []Name to breathe in [G7]prayer,
  calling e[C]veryw[Am]here,
  [Em]“O L[Am]ord [G]Jesus!” [D7]O what a n[G]ame!

2
Call upon the name of Jesus, 
And you will be saved,
O Lord Jesus, hallelujah, 
Nevermore enslaved!
We may take salvation’s cup 
By calling on the Lord;
Salvation from a host of things
Does His dear name afford.

3
To the Lord, the Jew, the Greek 
And everyone’s the same;
He is rich unto all men 
That call upon His name.
O Lord Jesus, what a joy 
To call and really live;
When breathing in Thy name, what pleasure
Thou to us dost give.

4
In the God of our salvation 
We may take delight,
Calling on His name at all times, 
Though in bliss or blight.
I will call upon His name 
As long as I shall live,
Because He has inclined His ear, 
And grace so full does give.

5
We will call upon the Lord, 
Who’s worthy of our praise;
Thus our grateful hearts in worship 
We to Him may raise.
We are those who call upon 
His name in every place
With all the saints who from a pure heart
Call and taste His grace.

songs.title: Still, still with Thee, when purple morning breaketh
songs.lyrics:
### Original Tune

#Capo 1

1
Still, still with Thee, when purple morning breaketh,
When the bird waketh, and the shadows flee;
Fairer than morning, lovelier than daylight,
Dawns the sweet consciousness, I am with Thee.

2
As in the dawning, o'er the waveless ocean,
The image of the morning star doth rest,
So in this stillness Thou beholdest only
Thine image in the waters of my breast.

3
[D]When sinks the [G]soul, sub[E7]dued by toil, to [A]slumber,
[Em]Its closing eye looks [A7]up to Thee in pr[D]ayer;
Sweet the re[Bm]pose, beneath [B]Thy wings o'ersh[Em]adowing,
But sweeter still to [A7]wake and find Thee [D]there.

4
So shall it be at last, in that bright morning
When the soul waketh, and life's shadows flee;
Oh, in that hour, fairer than daylight's dawning,
Shall rise the glorious thought, I am with Thee!

### New Tune

1
[C]Still, still with [F]Thee, when [G]purple morning [C]breaketh,
[Am]When the bird [Em]waketh, and [F]the shadows [G]flee;
[F]Fairer than [G]morning, [E7]lovelier than [Am]daylight,
[F]Dawns the sweet [G]consciousness, [F]I [G]am with [C]Thee.

  As in the [F]dawning, [G]o'er the waveless [C]ocean,
  The image [F]of the [G]morning star doth [C]rest,
  So in this [F]stillness [G]Thou beholdest [E7]only[Am]
  Thine [F]image in the [G]waters of my [C]breast.

2
When sinks the soul, subdued by toil, to slumber,
Its closing eye looks up to Thee in prayer;
Sweet the repose, beneath Thy wings o'ershadowing,
But sweeter still to wake and find Thee there.

  So shall it be at last, in that bright morning
  When the soul waketh, and life's shadows flee;
  Oh, in that hour, fairer than daylight's dawning,
  Shall rise the glorious thought, I am with Thee!

songs.title: How much more will the blood of Christ (Heb. 9:14)
songs.lyrics:
# Heb. 9:14

[G]How much more will the [D]blood of Christ,
Who [C]through the eternal [D]Spirit
[G]Offered Himself [D]without blemish to [C]God, to [D]God
[C]Purify our [D]conscience from dead [G]works to [Em]serve
The [C]living God? the [D]living God?
Hebrews nine for[G]teen

songs.title: Splendid church life! His green garden
songs.lyrics:
1
Splendid [G]church life! His green garden!
He has [C]brought us, praise the Lord,
To ex[D]perience the Christ
Who's growing [G]here!
He is []full of rich enjoyment
To His [C]saints in one accord;
He is [D]new and fresh, a[D7]vailable and [G-C-G]dear.

  I'm so [G7]happy [C]in this lovely place,
  [D]In the garden [D7]growing in His [G]grace!
  []There is no finer pleasure
  Than to [C]eat the living tree
  And to [D]get the living [D7]water into [G-C-G]me.

2
It is not a school or fact'ry
Or a chapel in the air;
But a garden where our Lord
Can plant and sow.
So He's placed us all here corporately
To be His garden fair,
Where He's free to cultivate
And make us grow.

3
Thus within the church-life garden
There's a fruit-producing tree
Full of life and so available to eat.
So be simple, don't be hardened,
Drop your concepts—eat that tree!
Take in Jesus every moment—He's so sweet!

4
With the tree there is the water,
Flowing God in Christ to us,
Quenching all our dryness,
Ending all our strife.
Hallelujah! In His garden
Jesus flows Himself to us,
As the full supply for us to grow in life.

5
Aren't you satisfied and thankful
That our Lord has brought you in
Where His pleasures and His riches
Flow so free?
So be happy and be joyful,
In the spirit feast on Him,
So God's garden can bear fruit abundantly.

songs.title: His Name is Wonderful
What He is: He’s the Father
songs.lyrics:
Capo 3

1
What He [D]is: He’s the Father.
He’s the [G]everlasting [D]Father.
He’s the [G]firstborn of cre[D]ation.
He’s the [Em]One who lives in[G]side of me.
He’s the [D]Father! [A7]Wonderf[D]ul![G]    [D]

2
What He is: He’s the river.
He’s the mighty flowing river.
He waters me in a desert land.
He’s my hiding place; He is our man.
He’s the river! Wonderful!

3
What He is: He’s the vine tree.
He’s the branch, the root of Jesse.
He’s the tree of life: we have the right
To eat of Him and have His life.
He’s the vine tree! Wonderful!

4
What He is: He’s the Shepherd.
He’s the lamb of God, the he-goat.
We rest and feed in the pasture land.
We strike the blood and eat the lamb.
He’s the Shepherd! Wonderful!

5

He’s the all-inclusive Spirit.
He’s our everything; He’s our all in all.
He gives life to us whene’er we call.
He’s the Spirit! Wonderful!

6
What He is: He’s a Person.
He’s a real and living Person.
He is living now inside of us.
This Person is so glorious.
He’s a Person! Wonderful!

7
What He is: He’s the Body;
He’s the fullness of the Godhead;
He’s the center of the Father’s plan,
Christ and the church, the one new man.
He is wonderful, wonderful.
[]He is wonderful, wonderful.
He is wonderful, wonderful.

songs.lyrics:

2

Many times I fail to redeem the time wisely,

3

songs.title: Appear to me dear Lord
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 2

1
[D]Appear to [G]me dear Lord,
[D]Appear to [A]me.
[D]I need [G]Thee desperately
[D]To ap[A]pear to [D]me.
Come [G]Lord [D]as light divine,
In[G]to my [D]heart to [A]shine
[D]Till I am wholly [G]Thine.
[D]Ap[A]pear to [D]me.

2
Oh God of Glory, now
Appear to me,
Just as with Abraham,
Shine repeatedly.
Come, Lord, expose with light
What idols I hold tight.
Be more my heart’s delight;
Appear to me.

3
When Lord, I drag my feet,
Appear to me.
When things with Thee compete,
Lord, appear to me.
Light from Thy glorious face
Infuses me with grace
That I may run the race.

4
Lord, as each day goes by,
Appear to me.
Till face to face, so nigh,

songs.title: Known of my Father before time began
songs.lyrics:
# Capo 3
1
[D]Known of my [G]Father be[D]fore time be[A]gan,
[D]Washed in the s[G]prinkling [D]blood of the [A]Lamb,
[D]Now in the [G]Spirit I [D]am a God-[A]man!
[D]Halle[G]lujah! [D]Halle[A]luj[D]ah!

  [D]Ha[G]llel[D]uj[A]ah! [D]Halle[G]lujah! [D]Hallelu[A]jah!
  [D]Ha[G]llel[D]uj[A]ah! [D]Halle[G]lujah! [D]Halle[A]lu[D]jah!

2
Father, You knew me a long time ago,
In Your foreknowledge,
Your mercy to show;
You foreordained me Your glory to know,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

3
Son, in Your blood, the most precious of all,
I have been purchased
And saved from the fall.
Your resurrection's my reason to call,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

4
Spirit, You came and You sanctified me.
You gave me faith
When my eyes couldn't see;
Now You're the Spirit of life within me,
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!

5
You are my Father and I am Your seed!
I have been purchased
And I am redeemed!
